ReviewTitle: Very bad bluetooth and poor volume
ReviewBody: I got mine for free with the S10 and figured I would write this review to warn others. The volume is very soft. I have mine on max all the time and if a soft video or song comes on I can't hear it. The worst thing that makes it unusable is the Bluetooth. They lose contact if any part of my body comes between my phone and it. I was mowing the lawn and realized that every time my leg passed under my arm the music cut out which is really annoying. Also if you eat with these in, they fall out immediately. Sad because they could have had a really good product but failed at some of the most basic things you need. I pretty much use these to workout now. For 100+ dollars I would be really angry if I bought these.

Maybe I am doing it wrong but I bought these headphones to work with my Galaxy phone but I find that I have to put it up to the highest volumes to hear out of them especially when I am walking the streets of NYC or riding the subway.  I also find that the microphone quality is very poor and I can't use them to speak on the phone.  After watching all these Apple folks walk around chatting wirelessly, I find this very annoying.  For the price I would not buy again - get it right Samsung please!
Very impressed. Wear these all the time

Very disappointed in these buds. The left earbud is about 90% quieter than the right one. No amount of troubleshooting, researching or updating was able to fix it. It appears many other people have this issue. Stay away!
Good noise cancelling for a earbud. Earbuds have their own volume control. Touch features are handy
I like them they stay in my ear while jogging

I've been wanting wireless ear buds/headphones for years now. I just didn't trust the tech yet, or everything was way over priced. These are a decent price and are fantastic. They are not huge buds that stick out of your head making you look...special; and they are not like those small white ones that drip down and can only be held in place by ear wax. These have small rubber rims that hold them in place very well.

The sound quality is better than I was expecting. They are wireless, so you'll never get the quality of the regular overhead headphones, but they are as good as, or better than many wired earbuds I've used.

They connect to multiple devices without issue, which makes me so unbelievably happy! I can use these with my cell phone as well as my music device and it only takes seconds to switch back and forth.

I was a little put off by how easy it is to activate the touch controls - every time I stuck them in my ears or took them out, I turned on or off whatever I wanted to/had been listening to. But I have actually gotten used to this and now know how to put in and take them out without activating anything.

I've done a few calls with these as well and they are great. No issues with sound (from either end) or connection. They work better than anything else I've used in the past.

The wireless charger and charging are fantastic. I've never had them run out of battery, even though I use them most of the day at work to keep out office sounds. I don't know how many hours I use them, but maybe between 3 and 4? I've yet to run out of battery with regular daily use.

If you've been on the sidelines, unsure about buying wireless earbuds because of price or quality, these are (so far) a great product to get you started. I'm very pleased with them.
my sister has the airpods and we sound tested both and agreed the Samsung buds sound better, and have better noise cancellation and now shes sad that I got the better product :)
If they are not at 100% charge, or your phone is moving, they cut out.  This causes problems on a jog/walk, otherwise they are good.
Good

ReviewTitle: Easy to use, easy to lose
ReviewBody:
Sound quality is great. I love that I can pop one or both out of the case, into my ears, and immediately pick back up my audio where I last left off.

What also happens rather easily is dropping the case a short distance, having the ear buds roll out, and then onto the floor.
The left ear piece lost about 75% sound after a few uses. Using the right i am not able to be heard during calls. Overall not at all pleased with an expensive product of poor quality

long battery, simple, small, and I love the auto shut off when it is not on your ears. clear sound and if you have samsung phone it have ambient sound which is perfect to talk to people while listening to music with your earphone in as long as you dont put it to max volume.

ReviewTitle: Great product with only one small issue.
ReviewBody: Amazing product with only one issue that I have found. The wingtips get a tad bit uncomfortable after a little while. But other than that everything else is great.

I enjoyed using them and they worked rather well. Just a heads up that Samsung does not offer any replacement parts for sale. So, if you're like me and you lose your charging case, Samsung support just tells you to buy another pair. Kind of a slap in the face but hey, my mistake for losing the case. So now my buds just sit there, unused.

ReviewTitle: They get the job done... But you still can't beat wired headphones for sound quality.
ReviewBody: Light weight, comfortable fit, decent isolation. Mic for phone calls is horrible. Sound quality is OK - fine for my commute, but I switch to other options when convenient when I want quality sound.
My buds are for personal use, sound is clear and excellent, lite and hardly know I'm wearing them.
They always fall out every second

I washed these buds in a large load of clothes, dried them, and am now listening to music.  The keep a charge, and sound almost  better than before I left them In my shorts pocket and washed the on permanent press cycle.

I've owned and tested the galaxy buds for about 3 weeks now and I love them! I've previously owned the jaybird x2's and jaybird freedom but these are my go-to headphones for working out! They fit well and dont fall out of the ear even during sternous exercises. They include different sizes of ear tips to ensure a proper fit for most ears. Connectivity was simple! If you have a newer samsung phone, all you need to do is flip the lid open to the galaxy bud case and the phone detects them itself and asks if youd like to connect. If you have an Apple phone, you have to go in to your settings and manually pair the ear buds after opening the case. The best part is, you can choose to use only 1 earbud at a time! The sound quality is good after being tweaked using Samsung's equalizer. So far, I haven't needed to charge my buds as the case charges them back to 100% everytime I put them in. All in all I think these are a step above the icon X buds. These were given to me at a discounted price to review.
So worth  it  for  the  money

ReviewTitle: This is what i have experienced
ReviewBody:
They have connection problems
not as loud as some of the others
Works perfectly

To date there is not a single thing I can complain about these headphones, aside from a few rare technical difficulties that would occur. Like random times when it takes a few attempts to sync with the phone but this may only happen once out of a hundred uses. Also, sometimes the quality of my voice seems to make people have a hard time hearing me but this is only when I am in a noisy environment so take that as you will. Besides that, these offer an awesome sound that provide amazing noice canceling that I have not experienced before with in ear headphones. From mowing the lawn to vacuuming inside the house, I could barely hear either noise when using these. You also have the feature to allow ambient noise to hear your surroundings while enjoying these headphones which was a nice plus when you're jogging or are in an area where hearing your surroundings is important. All in all, the convenience of being able to pull these out of there case and simply put them into your ear to activate the bluetooth feature is a luxury I can not go without now. 5/5

ReviewTitle: This is the bluetooth headphone I've been waiting over a decade for.
ReviewBody:
I always liked the concept of bluetooth headphones and was an early adopter, in like 2006 or 7 when the only option was the Motorolla HT820, which made you look like Princess Leah.  Then a year or two later S9 came out and that was better, then S10. for many years.  Then other various models, my last one were the Jaybird X3.  They all fit in ear, but were connected by wires that wrapped around your head.

What I always wanted and yearned for were small wireless buds that you can just put in your ears and have powerful sound.  And I'd say these galaxy buds are equivalent in sound to Jaybird X3.  I want the buds discreet.  And we have them with the galaxy buds.  While Apple may have been in the right direction, with two pods directly in ears with no wires, that tampon string looking thing sticking out is a dealbreaker.  (Yeah I know there have been higher priced or lower priced buds out for years.)  But I like the small size and the price of the galaxy buds, the $130 price is the same I paid for my Jaybird X3 last year.

I don't think you could wear both buds all the time, because you could have problems hearing people.  It's too good in blocking out outside noise and the ambient sound feature does amplify sounds, but too much as you can hear the ruffling of your clothes, and voices seem computerized.  So I just have wear one earbud all the time and leave the other one in my pocket when I'm not listening to music.

Hopefully Samsung version two will just get better, maybe 10 percent smaller, and peach color to be even more discreet.

Very good right off the bat!  They sit comfortably in your ear but wont come out if you shake your head or anything like that.  Would recommend for anyone looking for ear buds.  Call quality is also amazing from anyone whom I have spoken with.
Cuando se envía un voice o un mensaje de voz se escucha muy bajo, capta todos los otros sonidos menos la voz que está a menos de 5cm de los auriculares.. el sonido bueno pero el micrófono deficiente.

Amazing headphones and definitely an apple airpod killer! They are comfortable and I didn't have to change the tips or wings because out of the box it was perfect!

Like every new product there will be some issues. I have seen some issues with music cutting out here or thier for a slight second and it fixes it self. Samsung did just update them today which seems to have fixed Bluetooth issues but just know Samsung is working on fixing any issues we have with these.

This does feature ambient sound which is an awesome feature that just lacks a bit. I feel after a few updates this will be amazing and one of the best features!

Call quality on these have been good but have noticed slight cutting out every once in a while but could be due to service and we're I'm located. The people on the other end can hear me perfectly in door and out so that's always good.

Overall I would highly suggest getting them if you have Samsung or not because of the price and the awesome features it has already built in. Feel free to ask any questions and I'll be happy to respond!
Could be louder

ReviewTitle: Have been waiting for this from long time
ReviewBody: Best buds till date

I've has the Galaxy Buds for 2 months now and prior to purchasing them I was using the Jabra Elite 65t for my Note 8.  I also use the Buds with my Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 tablet.  When comparing the two, the Jabra has better Base when playing music and the sound quality for calls are so much greater.  The Galaxy Buds on the other hand has better Mids and depending on what songs you are playing the Base can be pretty good.  Other things I like about the Buds are it's quick-connect to my Note 8 as soon as I take it out of the case as well as it's disconnect once you take it out of your ear.  Also, the touch features to answer/hang up call, plus navigate through music selection and changing the volume.  If you turn the volume to about midway, then you get a sense of noise cancelling, but it's really just that you have the volume up to a point that you can hear anything else.  The battery life is okay compared to others and the call quality could use some more updates to improve it.

Overall, I really like and enjoy using the Buds.  From time to time I still use the Jabra Elite, but 90 percent of the time the Buds are my go to listening earbuds.  I would recommend the Galaxy Buds to anyone that has a compatible Samsung phone.

ReviewTitle: Awesome Features and sounds best of all never unpairs!
ReviewBody: I bought airpods before this and they kept unpairing and repairing giving me a huge headache. I got a replacement from Amazon and the airpods did the same thing. Finally, I tried these out and they do everything right the sound is better it has a lot more features like ambient sounds and best of yet it does not unpair!

ReviewTitle: Wanted to like, but had to return..
ReviewBody: The real issues had nothing to do with sound quality.  These ear buds had less than 4 feet of range when connected to my iphone, maybe just a defective pair, as every other bluetooth device works fine up to 30 feet. Second was the fit in my ears, I wanted to use them running, but they always fell out.  Tried all the different tip and collar options included with product.  Lastly, if you don't have an Android based phone, you cannot (at this time,) download the app.  If you want to change bass/treble control, you are out of luck with an iphone.
The ambient sound is poor. Otherwise, I'm fine with them.
Bought it because I like the style. I use an iPhone but can't deal with how the airpod looks. Overall, good sound, good battery, good features. Can't complain.

Alright, I have basically 0 complaints for this product, ive used 3 other wireless earbuds and all caused some degree of pain or discomfort because of the way they either fit my ears or the way the eartips/earbud was made (the jabra 65t, tranya t2, and the treblab N8 sports). These are extremely light and comfortable regardless of how many times you take them out and put them back in your ears.  The sound is great/good. The connection is distance is great and so is the size and look in public. The only 2 issues which i experience a couple times a day is first it gets some kind of interference as if your connection breaking up even tho its in your pocket. The second is that sometimes for whatever reason there will be latency between earbuds causing you to hear the same thing but like 200ms -1s apart. With that said id gladly take these over those other earbuds that didnt have these 2 issues.

As for wireless buds, they have very good sound quality, good job Samasung.

LG V20 does not recognize Galaxy buds as a HiFi device (analog out B&O Play certified in V20 built for wired out only.. ) , but the installed galaxy buds plugin from Samsung does very good job - just needed to play with its settings.

After reading about the Galaxy Buds I was intrigued by many of the features included. I found the features to be quite extensive and while I am aware of Samsung's quality I have to admit I was skeptical about some of the features. Now to get into my experience with the buds and what truly stood out for me. The biggest feature that I was amazed by how well it worked was the ambient mode, allowing you to shut out outside noise and even limit outside noise. The fit of these buds was fantastic and truly allowed me to experience the audio quality without worrying about the buds falling out of my ears.

Bluetooth signal cuts out when phone is just carried in pocket or when used with Galaxy watch. Though this may just be a problem with all Galaxy products. My S9 has some milar problems with other headphones, though not as bad. My previous Pixel phone did not have this issue, but it was also an issue with my Galaxy S6 as well.

I am not a "verified purchase" because I got these as a gift for my birthday a couple months ago. If I had actually paid for these, I would have returned them.

I have been using these earbuds almost everyday since I got them in April 2019. I generally use them while sitting at my desk without issue. If I start moving around, its another story. I can not move between floors (up or down) without losing connection/sound cutting out consistently. I can not walk down the street with my phone in my purse or my pocket (neither front nor back) without the sound cutting out consistently. Anytime I need to touch the earbud to adjust its position, the music pauses. This is because the earbuds themselves are touch screen and a single tap will pause or play the music. This feature is too sensitive when you're not intending to use it, and completely impossible to use when desired. You are also supposed to be able to skip or replay a song with double taps etc. but these features do not work consistently. I would prefer no touchscreen abilities at all, since I have to adjust them A LOT - these tend to slip and fall out of my ear (not constantly, but often).

The best thing about these earbuds is that they are comfortable (unlike the hard plastic air pods) and have adjustable sizes to accommodate a wider variety of users. They also don't look as awkward/goofy as air pods, they're more discrete. I mainly wanted these because of their function and reputable name brand. I am definitely disappointed since they barely function. I expected a lot more from Samsung & for this price.

ReviewTitle: They will forever change how you listen to music forever.
ReviewBody: I have quite a few pairs of headphones and these headphones are life changing great. The battery life is very long lasting and the re-charge is faster than the time it takes to listen to one song. Putting them in for the first time and listening will make all your other headphones sound like nails on a chalk board. No matter what your listening to these headphones take you to a concert that is in the perfect venue and played just for you. I recommend these to anyone that loves music and loves to be taken away to where only your imagination can go.

ReviewTitle: Great Sound, unless you want to be heard
ReviewBody:
The noise cancellation on this device is absolutely abysmal.

The sound is great and they're perfectly low profile, so I wanted so so badly for these to have a good mic.

But as soon as there is any level of background noise then that is all anybody can hear.

So I buy a lot of tech and I like to review things that I enjoy or hate. These earbuds are really good. Like REALLY good. The sound quality is great and those that are disappointed probably got a pair that had issues. Most new technology does so looking up reviews ahead of time and what’s been recalled can save you a lot of time and money. That being said they do sound great. The fit is really good as well. Snug in the ear and nothing to big or bulky jutting out from the side of your head. The call quality is a bit lack luster but I mean if you’re buying these for phone calls you’re buying them for the wrong reason. Here is the biggest issue with these. They are Samsung buds so they work best with Samsung products. Using with an iPhone or a google pixel phone will cause major degradation of sound, call and voice quality and you will experience latency issues. That thing where you watch a video and the sound is off from the people’s lips moving. So if you’re listening to music or podcasts it’s fine but for videos or movies it’s gonna lag, and lag hard. Also they don’t run Dolby atmos or dtx so keep that in mind as well.
Best purchase I’ve made in a while

Well a quick google search of the following "Galaxy Buds only connecting one side"... Will tell you all you need to know. Only one will work at a time... and if you are knowledgeable about electronics and the such like me contacting Samsung support will give you a nice little brain cancer.
Good over all not sure if it's just my model sometimes the sound will glitch out hope they fix it.

ReviewTitle: Very good audio clarity, comfortable to Wear
ReviewBody: They sound great, work well and are comfortable for light exercise. Battery life lasts about 5 hours or so with continuous use. They don't sit as well as the 1MORE earbuds and don't sound quite as good as the Jabra Active 65t but have much better functionality and gesture controls. Work very well for audiobooks. Will be buying a second pair for travel and home use.

These Galaxy Buds are my first wireless earbuds/headphone that I have owned. I am impressed how slick they are. Connecting them to ntu Galaxy S8 Plus was a breeze. The default earbhd piece makes the buds very comfortable in my ears. The TouchPad is a great touch. I like the customization that is offered in the Galaxy Wear app. I also tested the buds on my work iPad. The sound is great even when connected to iOS devices. I highly recommend these earbuds.

ReviewTitle: GREAT Improvements over the Iconx2018 buds
ReviewBody: They took what was awesome about the iconx 2018 earbuds and made them even better! Smaller case, better build quality, and longer battery life. Oh yeah and now the case can WIRELESS charge them. Great price point. I just picked these up and I love em. Wearables app allows easy customizing and equalizer. Slam dunk Samsung!

These are great devices. I didn't select the IconX because I am not wearing these at the gym for any cardio workouts. I only use the machines at a slow pace and my Bose over-the-ear were getting too sweaty. I also wear these for everything around the house and at work.
The sound output is really flat so I use the EQ with bass and sound boost. The output is not really loud so these are not good for working in a factory or mowing lawns. Also, If you add a 3rd party EQ, it will cause all kinds of issues at least with the Samsung Note 9. I suspect Galaxy Wear with it's own sound processing doesn't play well with other sound processing apps.
The ambient sound switch allows outside noise to amplified to hear things like other speaking if at the office. You can adjust the level to drown out the annoying people 10' away and only hear the person speaking to you.
The range is really good at least with a good charge. I believe the negative issues others have experienced with distance issues is due to a weak battery. Note rechargeable batteries have around 450 cycles before they loose 1/2 their capacity.
These are great earbuds but are not for every type of application. For my needs, "office, home use and light gym workouts" they are great.

ReviewTitle: Fantastic sound quality and super sleek design!
ReviewBody:
We'll all seen and read the positive reviews on the Galaxy Buds, and what can i say, they definitely live up to the hype. The first thing I noticed when I opened the box, is just how small they are. I've used wireless buds in the past, and they have always been bulky full of lights and gimmicks and brand logos and such. These are sleek black without a trace of excess. They blend right in to your style without standing out at all and that is exactly what I'm looking for.

The Sound
I have used cheaper wireless buds in the past, both from Sony and JLabs, and while those sound decent enough, these definitely blew them out of the water. The clarity and volume on these is fantastic. And paired with the equalizer settings, you can definitely really enjoy your music the way that you want. While they don't offer any active noise cancellation, they definitely fit well enough where they don't really require it. Sitting in a loud coffee shop isn't really a problem even at not so loud volumes.

The Look
As I mentioned, these are tiny and super sleek. All black all around with nary a trace of excess. They blend into your outfit, as any good technology should. You forget that they are there pretty much. But when you need them, they are a tap away.

Touch controls
It took maybe 10 minutes to get the touch controls to become intuitive. The touchpad gives you access to all of the controls pretty much, plus a programmable option for each earbud. The quick ambient sound option is by far the most useful for me, in which holding down on an earpad lowers the volume of your music temporarily and enhances the sound around you to better hear what is going on.

Overall
Coming from wired buds for most of my life, to more recently cheaper wireless buds, the Galaxy Buds are so far my favorite. And not just from a sound quality perspective, which is important obviously, but also from a usability and style perspective. I don't feel awkward wearing these and I'm not struggling to change a track or to pause my music. And they stay in place super well. When you first put them, you feel like maybe they won't stay in as they are so small. But an hour later, they haven't budged, even after heavy movement, such as the gym. I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a decently priced and high quality audio experience.
Buenos
It's everything they said it would be and more.

ReviewTitle: Love them! But make sure have another galaxy device

But i only had it for two weeks until it was stolen and apparently the only way to find it is with a app that can only be downloaded on a Samsung device (I have an iPhone) which is poor on Samsung behalf because it should’ve been where it could be tracked with the serial number. The minute I opened the case they started to pair with phone.  I got these because in Georgia we have a hands free law so i wanted something without wires hanging.  It took a bit to get the right size for my tiny ear but Samsung gave me 3 options in the box with 3 sizes of wings. That was a plus. When I listen to my audio book the volume is great and when I listen to music it's great too. The downfall starts here. I can not get the volume up loud enough when I get a call. They can hear me but I cannot hear them. It sounds like a low whisper. I have tried a couple of things but to no avail. I've tried them since I got them I guess I'm going to send them back so sad.

ReviewTitle: serial number on charging case rubs off easily, and is required for Samsung warranty!
ReviewBody:
I purchased a pair of galaxy buds from AT&T in early march for about $100. I don't have much prior experience with "true" wireless earbuds, but have owned a variety of mid-range wired headphones and earbuds and care about sound quality. I was impressed with the sound and fit, the touch controls are finicky, though generally I was most disappointed with the connection quality with my Pixel 2. Basically if I kept the phone in my pocket one of the earbuds would usually drop in and out, or they would get out a sync. They released a bunch of firmware updates all addressing connectivity, and it improved but still wasn't great. Overall it was usable, but just sort of annoying.

A few weeks ago I was using them at the gym on the treadmill and the left bud just stopped working entirely. Other than some sweat, I have never dropped or gotten the buds wet or anything. I contacted Samsung to do a warranty RMA as Samsung has a 1 year warranty. I spent a lot of time (3+ hours on chat and phone) working with Samsung support to try to be approved for an RMA, but they refused to approve it. I had the buds in the charging case, and the original box it came in, all accessories and documentation, a proof of purchase barcode from the retail box, and order emails and invoices from AT&T. Given all that, Samsung still refused to even create an RMA ticket as they required a serial number, and the only place the serial number is printed is in faint lettering on the bottom of the earbuds which had worn off in my pocket. Seriously, the serial number is very hard to read on BRAND NEW case, and handling them in your hand or in your pocket or in your gym bag, it will quickly become illegible. Samsung was just useless in this, though I am sure the agents were trying, they just refused to do anything without that serial number. Thankfully after talking with AT&T on the phone, they said to just take the buds into an official AT&T store. I was able to do this, and AT&T swapped them out with minimal questions (They at first said I should go through the manufacturer directly, but they have a policy in place where they replace anything for the first year which is awesome).

Finally, its worth noting that my newer buds, while indistinguishable from my old set, seem to have slightly better connectivity. You can still get drops if you cover the phone with your hand but they seem much more reliable from my normal use case which is the phone in my pocket. Not sure if its just slightly newer hardware or they changed something, but it is definitely a bit better. I probably would give these 4-5 stars, but with the reliability and customer support issues I really can't recommend them when there appears to be other options out there.

TL;DR If you buy these, MAKE SURE YOU TAKE A PHOTO OF THE BACK OF THE CHARGING CASE and record the serial number! You will need these to do an RMA with Samsung! Also consider getting a protective cover for the charging case as an additional precaution, there are several options on Amazon.

ReviewTitle: Works great indoors or inches from your head
ReviewBody: So I bought a pair of galaxy buds off Amazon after reading about them online. Nice design, small and simple. That's where the good ended for me. The Galaxy Buds worked fine on my Galaxy 9+ when I used them indoors; however, if I walked outside with them the buds would begin to stutter and the connection would go in and out. I took every step I could find online to fix the issue. I spoke with Samsung customer service; more solutions other than to exchange the items. I called Verizon and spent an hour and half with their support and ended up changing my phone for another Galaxy 9+ under the assumption the problem was my phone. Got the new phone... same problems. I then exchanged the Galaxy Buds through Amazon. Got the new Galaxy Buds today... and well the new buds don't work either. My other bluetooth earbuds work fine. I returned the Galaxy Buds today for a refund. There seems to be a problem with the Galaxy Bud design. Either way I was very disappointed my experience with these earbuds. I've heard that because of the size of the buds, there's a lot of interference going through my pants pocket and through me to the buds. Well, I bought a cheaper pair of bluetooth earbuds, of similar size, that work perfectly on the first pair. Compared to the two Galaxy Buds I tried. Plus you would think that the assumption would be that a person would carry their phone in their pocket or a some bag(either purse of satchel) not inches from their head; otherwise, it's just using your phone as normal.
That they is nothing to complain about

I'd been curious about wireless earbuds, but not inclined to spend the money until the spot where the audio jack goes into my phone stopped working.  I'm so glad I bought this pair - I'm loving them so far.  They work very well, come with a sensible charging case, and sound great.
One of my earbuds broke down after a couple of weeks.
Grat product, great sound, good lasting battery

The wireless music features and battery life are decent, but there are well documented issues with the microphone making phone call use unacceptable. These are not worth your money yet. Skip and look for some earbuds that work as intended on all fronts.  These are simply not a functioning product.

So, not a verified purchase because Amazon won't ship to Hawaii, but I bought locally because these seemed like they were the earbuds I needed. I used to have the Bose Soundsport, but they were just too big for me. The wing tips that they use are great, but the actual molded bit under the silicone was just too big for my little ears.

The Samsung Galaxy Buds however are awesome. With the smallest size covers, and medium wing tips they fit snuggly into my ear canal with a nice seal. They offer mild noise impedence, but also an ambient noise setting too if you want to wear them somewhere you need to be aware of your surroundings. Mostly though, I just can't get over how SMALL they are! The case is really pocketable and I love that it charges with a usb-c cable or wireless if you have a wireless charger.

I'm still getting used to the touch gestures to control the Buds, but they're very intuitive. I'm sure I'll get the hang of them soon. But, long and short, these are great earbuds if you have small ears!
I have owned several Bluetooth head phones over the years from LG to beats and even tic pods, and I have to say these are about the best I have owned

The tap features are a hit or miss mostly with the triple tap to go back to the previous track, if you press it to fast it will skip or pause, if you tap to slow it will skip or pause you would have to be a human metronome to get it right. The biggest disappointment is the microphone. ABSOLUTE TRASH!! your voice is inaudible over the phone and if you want hear your surroundings just take the earbuds off, you wont regret going the extra step that you didn't have to do if it was better. I also have the airpods 2 and I have done the comparison, sound quality the airpods win with a good balance of highs, mids and and acceptable standard of bass but just with ambient sound permanently on because of its design. The case has wireless charging and the pill design makes it compact and clean, opening the case requires 2 hands, not a joke. When closing it feels like a rusted door you have to apply some pressure and it makes a satisfying click imitating the airpods that do this with ease.

Overall just get these for convenience of wireless earbuds. Sound is ok so sure why not.

If you're an average user like myself I highly recommend these. Haven't had it disconnect once while wearing it paired to my phone (Galaxy S8+). Only time I noticed an intermittent disconnection was when I walked to the other side of my house to use the restroom. Never fell out from my ears while running either. Only thing I find useless is when I turn on background noise and voice because it doesn't really help but rather distorts the sound. Noise isolation is pretty decent but when using this during a redeye flight with a crying child a few rows away I still heard it. ReviewTitle: Not for Those with Sensitive Ears
ReviewBody: I've been a day one Airpod user so trying something new really intrigued me. Upon receiving the Galaxy Buds I was really excited, small earbuds, usb c/wireless charging, great sound quality, they seemed like the whole package. Unfortunately after using them for more than an hour I proceeded to get light headed. I thought, "Hey you're probably just tired." but after trying them out for a few days now the same thing happens each time I use them. I was reading up on it and apparently I fall into the small percentage of people who get motion sickness due to the noise isolation and in ear rubber tip. I wish these worked for me, I love the sound quality. Hopefully next round will be more suited for me.

ReviewTitle: Ordered US Version with Warranty and Seller fulfilled order with Paraguay Version
ReviewBody: The Seller substituted Garaniza Samsung Paraguay version ear buds for the US version. Even the Quick Start Guide was in foreign languages ONLY. The box and ear bugs had NO serial number, therefore I was unable to register my ear buds with Samsung for warranty. The Seller (CellularTech) representative told me to send the ear buds to them if any warranty work was required, offered me $8.00 (US) since I had received the Paraguay version from CellularTech. I had difficulty understanding the Seller Rep., but it appeared that he wanted me to deal only with them to resolve any issues. It's upsetting that the Seller substituted a non US version ear plugs, and then wanted me to arrange any warranty work through them...I thought that was "fishy" and contacted Amazon. They immediately told me that they would investigate this matter. My challenge is how to register the ear buds with Samsung for their warranty work-if necessary! I am confident that Amazon will resolve this matter and take appropriate actions. One STAR review is for Seller.

ReviewBody: Battery will last me two days with heavy use. The port is substantial. They feel good in the ear, and come with different tips/wings to suit your needs. They sound way better than I'd expect them to at their size. They have good base, but can be tinny on the higher end. The pairing process is seem less. Not really much to complain about. I heard from another user that the left earbud might stop working, but I haven't experienced this and will update if I do. I would and have recommended these to friends.
Battery life is good but not as loud as I'd like but still very good quality could use moe bass but stays in ear well and auto sync works great

ReviewTitle: Great earbuds for any smartphone ⁹
ReviewBody: Great battery life ...they sound amazing on my lg and they sound even better with my note 10+ ..never had the batteries die on me yet and love wireless charging and type c

This is my second pair. I really truly wanted for these to function properly. I have paired them with the Samsung Note 9. The sound features frequent crackling and even more frequent cutting in and out even with the phone in my pocket.. A lot of nice features but not worth much when they fail to connect reliably.
These are definitely worth the money!!!
Really good

These work great for wireless earbuds. Extra pieces are included which allows you to customize the Galaxy Buds to your ear. You have 12 different ear shape/size combinations! The ambient noise mode helps out, greatly, but it not very useful with your music turned all of the way up, which is expected.
One thing to note is that talking on the phone with heavy wind causes the person on the other end to hear it for sure, but that is expected with most bluetooth earpieces that do not have a foam cover on the microphone.
I love these earbuds!!!
I have sent 3 times for sound problems and ambient mode not working. Fighting to get a refund

ReviewTitle: Works great for my phone: S7, not so much
ReviewBody: Fit is great, but havent exercised with them yet. Didnt synch to my daughter's S7. Seemed glitchy (like the phone had a bug), and wouldnt load on her phone, even after several resets and powering down.

Out of the box, into my ears and the sound was TERRIBLE (like AM radio bad) Tinny and zero bass. They felt comfortable, so I did not pay attention to the eartip adapter size. I was ready to return them until I read someone else's post about using a larger adapter - I tried it and WOW, night and day difference! The sound quality is actually pretty good - not excellent, but pretty good. (I'm sure you can spend your way to excellent, but for the price these are decent). It's just strange that the bass "leaks out" if there is not a good seal in your ear.

For 130 dollars these ear buds should blow me away and i should have zero negatives. However, idk if my pair is defective or what but the sound is extremely low. The AKG wired headphones that came with my S8 are easily twice as loud as these. Is this normal of bluetooth buds? These buds were barely usable on an airplane and 100% unusable while mowing due to the low volume even when turned all the way up.  With my wired set, I could barely hear the mower.

I will say the sound quality is great, just wish I could hear it more.

I wanted these to be good, the features sounded so perfect, but man these suck. Especially for it being a Samsung product and being that price. I've tested much cheaper and they've been much better. The touch controls are great, very responsive. In ear detection works fine but will only work when both buds are removed which is annoying. Call quality is garbage, they were echoing the whole time so basically unusable. Ambient sound does absolutely nothing and is just a feature they promote to sell more earbuds. The case is cool, wireless charging is nice. They were pretty uncomfortable in my ears bud thats been the case with most of them of the same style. Think the stem ones are better for me. The worst part about these and the main deal breaker is the range. You basically have to keep your phone on you at all times to use these. I had my phone in the garage and walked down to get the mail and they cut out maybe 10-15 ft away. Was gonna test them out when I mowed the yard but unless my phone was in my pocket they would cut out if I got too far, even if there wasn't anything in the way and I had line of sight. Maybe if these were $40-50 they'd be worth it but I'll be returning these as they are 100% not worth the price.
Great product, sounds great. Noise cancellation isnt the best I've had but still great. Only downside is there is some digital distortion if you are are half in and half out of wifi range.
sound quality is great, comfortable to wear for hours, and I love how well it cancels out the outside noise.

ReviewTitle: Very comfortable, good sound quality but poor range.
ReviewBody: I use these buds primarily  for the gym and to watch television. I wish the range was a bit better. even when close ie: in bed, if the bud is blocked by a pillow sound cuts in and out.
Great earbuds.

ReviewTitle: Great purchase for first-time buyers and all-purpose users.
ReviewBody: I prefer the simple design of these truly wireless earbuds over the flashy style of AirPods and its knockoffs. Using the extra wing tips and ear buds that came in the package, I was able to get a great fit out of these earbuds. There are not a lot of bells and whistles for this product and the sound quality is good enough for chilling sessions, listening to podcasts, and taking calls.

ReviewTitle: Great headphones!!! You wont regret buying them
ReviewBody: I was not disappointed with this product. Item came fully charged and connected with my phone as soon as I opened them. Battery life is really great & they look very sleek. My only issue is that sometimes if I'm in an open area ppl claim they're not hearing me too well. Not sure if its cause of where the mike is situated

ReviewTitle: Only good for music.. sent mine back😔
ReviewBody: The music quality was amazing! But the person on the other end couldnt hear me . And when they could they said I sounded like I was in a tunnel. I was so disappointed.
I was hesitant to buy this. But I'm so glad I did. They are comfortable, sound proof and barely noticeable.

You can do anything with these in and once you have the wing tips on they NEVER come out. It's also good for work environments since you can use one at a time and once the battery on one gets low just put tmit in the case to charge and use the other, though if you want to use both it still has good battery life I'll say about 3-4 hrs if you like to blas your music. If you have small ears like me it'll still fit if you have big ears they'll fit like a glove. They also dont take that long to charge and the case doesn't take long to charge either.

Sound quality is good for earbuds that are 100% wireless.

I'll recommend these over earpods because they come with wing tips and the airpods doesn't.

Once paired with your device all you have to do to connect is turn on your Bluetooth and open the case.

The touch pad is pretty responsive.

If you watch videos on YouTube at x1.75 or x2 speed like myself I won't recommend it there's a huge delay, watching at normal speed is good though.
Carrying case is small enough to fit in almost any pocket and yes it'll fit in those tight pants you females love so much.

ReviewTitle: OK Sound with poor bluetooth connection
ReviewBody:
As a happy user of Samsung cell phones and tablets, I had hopes that these earbuds would function well.

The sound was clear but lacking in bass. I am not a bass hound but I found I had to push the earbuds well into my ear in order to get adequate bass with help from the telephone's equalizer.  I could have lived with this sound quality.
I tried Comply foam ear tips - there was better bass due to a wider opening to the tiny speaker grill on the earbuds, but then the earbuds would not fit in the charging case.

The major issue which is a common failure with bluetooth earbuds was the poor connectivity when I put my
Samsung S8 phone in my pant's pocket while walking outdoors.  Other reviewers have reported this issue. I don't like
to carry my phone in my shirt pocket where it seemed to work a little better.  The handy app did update the earbud's firmware, an update that was supposed to fix connection issues along with other problems.

To be fair, many other wireless earbuds have similar issues connecting with bluetooth.  I suspect that the space limitations inherent in earbuds makes it difficult to have powerful enough bluetooth circuitry.

So I am returning these today.  It's hit or miss with many earbuds, including far more expensive ones than these.
I liked the distance wireless
Worked better that I could have expected

ReviewTitle: Great over all with some flaws
ReviewBody:
They hold close to a six hour charge, they sound great (turn on Dynamic mode), play/pause controls are easy enough, calls sound fine, the case is pocketable, the buds are petite, and the fit is comfortably snug. I really love these things. But.....

The connection does otherwise suffer sometimes. I’ve had two sets of Galaxy Buds and used them with a few different phones. My biggest issue is an occasional lag where the earbuds will get out of sync with each other for a second (normally the left one), then sync back up. It’s jarring and seems to happen in crowded areas, possibly due to wireless interference.

voice calls are enhanced by a pair of microphones in each earbud that work to isolate your voice. The resulting audio is not what I’d call crystal clear, but callers could hear me.
muy bueno

ReviewTitle: Best in it's price class and stands on it's own in the Truly Wireless world
ReviewBody:
The Galaxy buds sound wise initially sound like your average 10 dollar earbuds but once you enable dynamic within the equalizer on the Samsung Wearables App, it really brings them to life and has good sound quality on all fronts from there on out. Bass Boost option seems to drown out music so staying in dynamic is recommended for balanced high, meds, and lows. So with that said, those with iOS may want to look elsewhere as without the Dynamic option in the Wearables App, these do sound flat.

Ear tips come in 3 sizes; basically small, medium, and large. The Buds are by default attached with medium but I switched them out the large tips which seemed to fit properly and isolated sound the best for optimal audio. Definitely try out each one for your preference as well as the ear fins.

One issue I seem to have and reason why this isn't 5 stars was when using these, they seem to have very brief audio cut outs if my phone is fixated in a certain angle in my pants pocket. I would readjust my phone in my pocket and it would seem to stop. It only happened about twice in a 45 minute session but was still a concern in regards to it's Bluetooth connection. Hoping it won't be a consistent issue in my day to day but that's to be discovered as I use them more.

For it's price point, you really can't beat these when it comes to sound, style, and ease of use in the Truly Wireless World

ReviewTitle: Pro Tip don't lose the Case Samsung doesn't sell it Solo
ReviewBody: The noise cancelling is good. I love the touch on the side which I never knew it had. I'm gonna put a link here for a extra case in case yall lose yours. I love these I have the complete setup Watch Earbuds Phone.

These are very convenient and I like having a wireless pair. Easy to go running with and to sleep with. The sound quality isnt bad but it isnt anything special. Its like the akg ones in the Samsung s9+ package. They are a little bulky but you can still sleep comfortably with some maneuvering.

The case is very nice and it charges them wirelessly. All you have to do is charge them inside the case once in a while. The battery life is pretty good, I use them pretty much everyday for exercising and before sleeping.

They are small and easy to fit in your pocket. Happy to not have to deal with tangled wires anymore in my pocket which makes it worth it. Also I don't have to deal with wires when I'm exercising.

They connect to your Samsung s9 almost instantly when you take them out of the case and put them in your ears. The single tap and double tap feature is very useful too. The noise cancellation is something I dont really need or use often. I like loud music when I'm exercising and I put the volume up to 80% of the max volume and that cancels my loud footsteps and breathing. I dont think I have noise cancellation on. The Samsung wearable Pp is pretty helpful too and I use it for the bass boost eq sometimes.

Overall I give it a 4.1 out of 5.

A mi m encantaron tiene muy buen sonido son muy cómodos
Perfecto ¡
Sound is fine if you hold your phone.  As soon as you put the phone in your pocket, the connection starts to waver.  Too much static, skipping, just unpleasant.

ReviewTitle: they are very small, not as noticable stealthy
ReviewBody: you cant really hear the mids or highs, instruments are blurry. You have to go with the wf sony 1000xm3 or the better sound quality the momemtum sennheiser but they are $299

ReviewTitle: brand new and less then three months for one of the earbuds to break
ReviewBody: I got the Samsung Galaxy Buds in March 21, 2019 and in May 10, 2019 the right earbud completely died I tried leaving it charging over night but it’s still dead the left earbud still works fine and still charges but only having them less then three months for one earbud to break for $160 brand new is not worth it

ReviewTitle: Galaxy Buds better than Beoplay E8
ReviewBody:
I lost my Beoplay e8 headphones and decided to get these instead of dropping another $300. So far I'm impressed the sound is on par if not a little better than the e8 and the it's not a clunky size compared to other brands, it really disappears into your ears.

The noise cancellation isn't the best but I found the comply foam I ordered for my e8 fits the buds, the only drawback is the case doesn't close all the way but the seal and bass is so much better with them installed. Just be warned you'll have to pop them of to charge.

Picture of comply tips on buds and example of how it sits in charging case with foam tips

Even though this is page is for the black buds I am writing my review for the white earphones here as the current matching page looks a little shady. I have previously been using the Jabra Elite 65t and as such my review is mostly a comparison to those units. I have been using these to listen to music at the gym and on runs.

Pros:
+both smaller and lighter than 65ts
+pairing was as easy as opening the case, phone recognized immediately
+Speaking of the case, it also is smaller and lighter than the Jabras.
+Gear app works great and appears quite polished.
+Takes a little time to get used to the button location, but once you do they're easy to use and are responsive
+USB-C port
+Wireless charge from S10 phone

Cons:
-Sound is a little better on 65ts (both in bass and volume, although I have no business having volume that high)
-Would be nice if they included foam tips in addition to rubber.

All said I really enjoy these. Yes the sound is better with the Jabras but they are also more expensive and fall behind in every other category I can think of. I do really wish foam tips would be included as I prefer them to rubber. I noticed the size/weight difference on runs and only had to take out and dry off once. I did experience a few skips while at the gym but less so than the 65ts and figure this is just due to interference. I am curious as to their water resistance but seemed to stand the test of a few runs without issue.

Not sure how they pack so much technology into such a small item but these are as great as they are advertised.  I love headphones and have too many but these are in a league of their own.  You own be dis satisfied with them or feel bad after paying the price.  Anyone writing a 1 star is foolish.

ReviewTitle: Worth the wait once in stock.
ReviewBody: Stock Ran out from S10 pre-orders. The lowest priced earphone for both Usb C & wireless charging case, & premium sound quality.
Great sound! Using one at a time, they last a lot longer.

ReviewTitle: Adjust earbud volume before passing judgement!!!
ReviewBody: I love these earbuds.  They are not going to be the best sounding headphones you have ever heard, but they are very very good, especially for the price.  I absolutely love that you can use 1 earbud at a time.  I can listen to whatever I want as I move about the house and stay tuned in to what my kids are doing/need.  1 complaint is the factory setting for volume.  I very nearly returned these as they were simply not loud enough.  They automatically media volume sync with your phone(at least with my S7).  The earbuds are factory set to halfway, so if you leaved them synced with you phone, they will be half volume at most.  Un sync them, turn the volume all the way up and then re sync them to fix this.  I prefer leaving them unsynced personally.  Once I fixed that, they are awesome!!
These Galaxy Buds are used. The case has scratches on the case. The box was opened as well. I paid a good deal of money for these more then at the T-Mobile store. Other then that they are cool.
Ambient sound never worked

ReviewTitle: Not good to talk on the phone with.
ReviewBody: I bought them thinking I was going to have great access to have phone conversations. They work very well when listening to music and watching movies but not to have phone conversations.

I use these while I do yard work such as mowing the grass. Like many have said they dont get ridiculously loud. However, while mowing the grass I dont even hear my mower. They are also good for not listening to a cranky wife:) so buy!
I love the way it sounds it sucka that the volume is very little. You can't raise it up all the way you want then to go but the quality of the sound implacable

-Sound is great for the price.
-Easy to pair with devices.
-Long battery life.
-Very snug and comfortable
Perfect exactly what I wanted. Sound is great. Easy to use .
Loved everything about these headphones. Would buy them again and again.

ReviewTitle: Pretty good but could use some work
ReviewBody: Excellent quality earbuds. They sound great and have excellent battery life. They fit comfortably in the ears and can be used for sports. Only issues are: bluetooth connectivity is sometimes interrupted, and learning to double tap takes some time since you need to be slow but not too slow. I wish you could adjust the sensitivity of the double tap, other than that it's great. I made phone calls with it and the quantity is great. I'd recommend this if you want a basic bluetooth headphones with good sound and long battery life. I'd rate them 3.5/5 stars, because of price (too high), the bugs, and the quality (decent).
They fit well and sound great.  Very easy to use.

ReviewTitle: Picks up a lot of background noise
ReviewBody: Fits very snug and never falls out. Sound quality is great just wish the bass was a little better when listening to music. Call quality is where I have a issue. When I'm on the phone with someone they complain about how much they can literally hear everything in my background and it annoying to the point that they can barely hear what I'm saying. I have to sometimes take my buds out and put the phone to my ear or connect my wired ear buds for them to hear me clearly with no background noise. When I'm in a completely quiet area it's fine but people said they can tell if I'm using my wired headset or my wireless buds. If they're is a setting it the wearable app that can fix this that would help a lot but I'm giving this 4 stars because of that one issue
Great product

ReviewTitle: Great sound and comfort, straight out of the box.
ReviewBody:
These earphones possess excellent sound quality, and deliver a well balanced sound. They were easy to set up and pair with my phone and tablet, and are extremely comfortable right out of the box.

Five stars.

I don't make phone calls with these earbuds so I do not know the quality of sound.  However, they are awesome for music quality.  You can use one earbuds while the other is charging in the case.  That case has an internal battery that you can charge and whenever you put your earphone away they will charge with the built in battery that's in the case.  The case has two LED lights.  One light is internal and the other is external.  The LED colors are green, yellow and red.  I also love the size of the case.  I thought the earbuds would hurt my ears after hours of use but they are comfortable and they do not fall off.  If you happen to misplace your earbuds the app on your phone, "Galaxy Wearable" can find your earbuds.  The earbuds make a chirping sound to locate your misplaced earbuds.  You can also charge these earbuds with, "Wireless Powershare" with your phone or any other wireless charging device.  I've had these for about three weeks and they work great.
They're not like the Icon X, you cannot store your music on them.
I didn't like the connection
I love how these war buds automatically pair and unpair.
They are perfect in every way.  Except the loudness could go a tad higher.
I dislike that it disconnects itself and have to reconnect
My censor stop working, cant answer the phone or skip music no more
They are comfortable and sound great for the price.
Works great

ReviewTitle: I paid for something that I can't use!!!
ReviewBody: My voice is coming through as being muffled. I've gotten so many complaints when I'm trying to have a conversation with people. My time has ran out so I can't return them. Money down the drain, because I didn't use them right away, and my time ran out.

I like how comfortable the galaxy gear buds are they fit into my ear and they don't bulge in my ear. I bought a pair for my wife and she has been raving about them,  so I gave them a try. I must say that I'm impressed by the sound that they put out very clean and clear. I even have good bass also now that my wife showed me the different ear buds.
The touch tap sensor thing is not as consistent as Apple's. Everything else is better. Epic choice if you're using them as a work phone primary, and a music secondary.
Battery life is okay if you use one at a time so you can change it when it goes dead. Otherwise great.
Enjoying them very much!

ReviewTitle: A little disappointed, but they work good
ReviewBody: Was expecting better sound quality but they work good

I absolutely love these ear buds and have no regrets. That being said after only owning them for a month or so I am having a issue with my left bud disconnecting and not being able to be reconnected for a few hours even when fully charged. I'll be calling Samsung soon to see if they can help.
Had to be sent back due to static and going in and out of sound.
Great fit and good sound - love the small charging case. Use this all the time for music and phone calls - a few complaints that it picks up to much background noise when talking on the phone.

ReviewTitle: Do not buy these these to work with!
ReviewBody: Thought these would be great especially when hot out instead of over ear type. They work awesome as long as you're standing still. If you are moving your head in any way (turn from side to side, looking down, etc) they cut out constantly.  Sometimes for minutes and sometimes for seconds.  Very Very irritating!!!  Do not recommend if your going to be turning your head or leaning over at all. Trust me you will hate them. Other than that they are great. Paired with a Samsung S10e phone. I love Samsung Products but not a fan of these. And it's like they are set up to shut down at a certain angle as well. (They just stop working when on knees and working in the garden until i lift my head up and they start working again).  Very frustrated with them. Not worth the price. Hopefully someday they will have new software that will resolve these issues.

My ear holes are very open and basically any earbud or regular earphone would fall very easily but this was another thing, I have walked, went biking and working with these and they never felt. Also, I’m an iPhone user and the connect right when I take them out of the tiny tiny battery box. Haven’t have any issues with them except for the noise cancellation, I would love to have an ambient sound option on like when you have android, but GREAT overall.

One of my friends has these, but he uses a Samsung Galaxy phone. I really liked them so I figured I'd try them with my iPhone. Glad I did. They pair very quickly and easily, sound quality is great, and I haven't had an issue with any phone conversations so far. And they're much more secure feeling and noise cancelling than iPods, which I used before these, especially when exercising.
Use it with my Samsung Note 10 phone. Works grest together, very easy to set up and use. Stays im my ear very well, better than i was expecting.
Best on the market

I've had the white Galaxy Buds for about a week now and they have caused a change in my normal routine. I now take these ear buds everywhere. Out to work, put them in my pocket. Yard work, shopping, house work and I put them in my pocket. I use these most of the day and charge them at night. Use them at work, I just place the case on my wireless charger. When I'm finished with them for awhile I put them in for a quick top up. If I need to pay attention to my surroundings, I turn on Ambient Sound. If I want to ignore my coworkers I turn Ambient Sound off and crank up the volume on some music. No more tangled wires or bulky headsets. I would highly recommend these for any level of user for a high quality, no hassle audio listening experience for your phone or computer.

I bought a black pair for my wife and a white pair for my self. I also have the first generation air pods. Comparing the two, Samsungs galaxy buds are better in every way. Especially design, the secure fit by far the best feature. I swear I fell like I am in a special ops unit when I where these. I am satisfied with the fit compared to air pods. The only down side that I didn't realize is the white ones look like hearing aids when they are worn. The black ones look far better in the ear. Like a cool fashion accessory. As far as the sound they are better sounding compared to the air pods. Only due to the fact that they are designed far better. Meaning they are actually sealed in your ear canal. I love the extensive engineering put into these little things.

ReviewTitle: Unreliable connection and issues with battery.
ReviewBody: Very poor connection and battery draining issues. After about 30 minutes of playback the connection has blips every 10 seconds or so that are annoying. Didn't have this issues in my jaybirds. Also the right earbuds drains batter even when in the case so the case loses battery quickly. The TouchPad is unreliable as well. I hope this is a lemon I got because I desperately wanted to like them

ReviewTitle: Wonderful all around but room for improvement
ReviewBody:
They are super easy to use, I had to use the other ear tips that were provided with these to find the perfect fit and they sound great.

Pros:
 -Fit well and stays in place all day
 -The noise cancellation
 -The sound quality from the buds and microphones
 -Battery life and keeping charged

Cons
 -Not alot of customization on tapping on the buds for other features
 -Sometimes it doesnt recognize it being tapped
Awesome product. Very happy.

ReviewTitle: Tap control is horrible and frustrating to the point of hate.
ReviewBody: Sound is very good, they seal your ears better than airpods, BUT...  the tap function is horrible.  Frustrating to the point I hate them.  The taps register maybe half the time, when you try and double tap to advance to next song, it single taps and pauses and vice versa.  I would not buy again.

So, I came from the Gear Icon X 2018 models to the Galaxy Buds. Worth the upgrade? Yes and no.

Likes:

Smaller
Fits Iin  ear more comfortablely
Sounds great
Less time to connect to phone
Super easy pairing
Gear Wearable app features are great!
More battery time!!

Dislikes:
Touch controls are a little more touchy than old pair
Wireless charging pretty slow

Overall, I like these better. For me, removing the on board storage was a good thing. I never use these without my phone, so it was a wasted feature for me. Good thing about it is that the buds no longer wait for your to interact with the online storage, THEN set to control the phone. Now, straight to phone control.

The case goes not have a lock latch. You can decide of that is good for bad, but I miss it.

Touch controls. I'm REALLY used to the touch controls and dont have an issue with using them. However, on the buds, I almost have to learn again. The responsiveness isn't there. Most times, double tap is registered as single. Triple taps are harder. Might just need to get used to less sensitivity? Who knows.

The wearables app has some new shiny things to it with these over the Icons. Better placement of settings and an EQ!! Ambient sound, which I LOVE has some more improvements. Better controls on which sounds get more priority.

Sound. Everyone wants to k ow about the sound quality. Honestly, I love these. Little more volume and clarity with these. In-call is really nice. I'm not an Audiophile, so might want to read a more in-depth review on this part from someone else. Im VERY happy with the sound quality.

I would give these 5 star, but the touch controls. Maybe it's me. I'll come back and revisit this part.

ReviewTitle: Exactly what I wanted in true WIRELESS. Top 5 Purchase of 2019.
ReviewBody: I love these. Works seamlessly with my Note 8 or 9. No stuttering connection. Very good sound. Ultra comfortable. You can use one while the other is charging. The touchpad controls work very well. It let's you change ambient sound and volume usage by using the app when you hold pad. Bluetooth 5.0 shows no latency issues on Amazon prime or any other vids you watch. One of my top 5 purchases of the year.

ReviewTitle: I'm not sure the price is worth it
ReviewBody: It's impossible to move while using this buds, you will lose connection constantly.

Very disappointed with this produce. Not only does it have a short battery life, it also has some type of connection problem with left bud. Now, I cant use either because the left bud got so hot in my ear,  it stopped working. And now its beyond my return date, so I'm stuck with defective buds. If you are going to spend this type of money, get the expensive ones. Maybe they will work better and longer.

I love them! They are the best purchase I've made all year for sure. They cancel out the sound so well that when they are in people have to text me to get my attention. The sound quality is great they fit perfectly and they have yet to die on me. The best product on the market for sure.
These are terrible people can't understand me when I am using them. I don't recommend these.

ReviewTitle: DONT BUT THESE OR ANY SAMSUNG HEADPHONES! JUNK!!
ReviewBody: Garbage!! Dont waste you're money! Half the time one year piece will not charge! It's like throwing you're money away or sitting it on fire! Samsung dropped the ball on this one. I didnt even return them just threw them away. Like I said GARBAGE!!

Galaxy buds will definitely become my daily earphones no doubt. I was hesitant on wireless and loved having the headphone jack, but the Galaxy buds are changing my opinion. The quick connect as soon as I open the case works flawlessly to have me listening right away. Ambient noise was way better than I expected. You must change the settings to have it turn on while holding on to the button. Not only can I hear my surroundings, the interior mic picks up your own voice clearly as well! There is no volume change function on the device but you can use voice assistant (google, alexa, bixby) to change volume. Overall I thoroughly enjoy the device and would recommend to everyone.
Work great, pair fast.

I use these with my Samsung Galaxy Note 9 while exercising, working in a noisy office environment, or just chilling. Great sound quality, nice range of treble and bass, full crisp and clean tones.

I love the fact that they charge in their case, and with customizable plugs it was easy to find a good fit for my ears. Battery life is very good, I am not sure what it is exactly but that's because I charge them nightly.

Noise cancelling is solid. Unlike some other reviews I read, I have zero issues with sound quality on inbound or outbound phone calls with these in and I usually talk while walking outdoors. People on the other end say I sound like I am on a LAN line it's so clear.

The ONLY issue I have that prevents me from giving it 5 stars is I like my music dangerously loud and these just get to loud. But I guess that's probably a good thing since I don't want tinnitus some day.

The sound quality for media playback is great, and the pairing process is a breeze.  That being said the quality of sound in phone calls is just absolutely horrible.  It also will not pair to multiple devices.  I carry a work phone and a personal phone and this feature of connecting to multiple devices is important to me.  I returned them after one day.  I'll be using my jaybird x3 headset until I find a better truly wireless headset
way better than the nock off earbuds I had. Battie last all day and sound quality are amazing. I even have find my earphone feature, unlike the others.

These buds have decent sound and fit securely in my ears. On full charge, the tend to last around 4 hours. They pair fairly easily with my OnePlus 7 Pro. All in all, I'd say they are the best buds I've tried so far...with one glaring problem: you can't manually power them off without the case. The only way to turn them off is to put them back in the case. They don't turn off automatically after you stop playing audio. They don't turn off automatically if you turn off bluetooth completely. They just sit there and drain and drain and drain. So unless you carry the case with you AT ALL TIMES, the clock is constantly ticking on your battery life whether you are using them or not.

ReviewBody:
listen music they are fine, nothing great as airpods but it is fine. battery life amazing. but for calls nothing good. people talikg with me start to complain about my calls but I use to listen them very well. once i swapped with other guy and tried to understand the calls when he was using my samsung earbuds. terrible sound impossible to clear understand what he was talking about, it is like a relay or a little noise echo.
