ReviewTitle: Great for working out, not so good for calls
ReviewBody: So I disappointed with these for their call quality.  Maybe mine are defective by others on the call report everything I say being "muffled" unless I yell and of course in most business situations you don't want to be yelling as loud as you can.  Also, others on calls report hearing every single background noise so I'm constantly being asked to go on mute.  i did expect better!  They work great as headphones to listen to music while working out so they will definetly fill that role.  Very solid when it comes to staying in my ears which is another plus.  Just sad about the weakness of using the phone with these buds.
Love these. Great battery. Great fit in your pocket. No wires to worry about. Connects to my phone immediately after putting it in my ear.

I liked the way they fit in n my ear as well. It canceled out a lot of vibration noise.

Phone calls are not the greatest quality for the other person on the other end of the call.
Very nice ear buds. Good sound and comfortable to wear. Interfacing with the Samsung S8+ is good.

These buds have changed my work and workout routine. I work mostly on the phone during my day and then go to the gym to workout. Popping these in and out is super simple and no messy cables to deal with while lifting weights!
The small comforting ear buds are perfect for on the go listeners. The adjustable ear wings make it work for the small ear and the large ear music junkies

These were the first truly wireless earbuds I was genuinely excited to try because of the size as well as the compatibility with my Galaxy Note8. The first thing I noticed about these was how small the carrying case actually is. Just holding the case feels good in my hand. My wife commented that it looked sort of like a Kinder Egg that my daughter loves.

Pairing was a breeze. I honestly think downloading the app took longer than actually pairing the earbuds to my phone. The app is very intuitive and walked me through the setup easily. After updating the firmware, I put the earbuds in and was surprised how comfortable they are in my ears. I've tried many earbuds and none were all that comfortable but these are great. Other earbuds actually hurt my ears but these fit like a glove.

The sound quality is very good but I wish they had more bass to them. I like my music with a bit of low end. When watching videos, there was a slight delay between the picture and the audio but not terrible.

Overall, I really like the Samsung Galaxy Buds. I'm excited to use them a lot more.
Love em, use them all the time with my s10.

Audio: Not punchy bass like airpods, Overall sound quality is very very good for the average music listener.
Material: Solid build quality, metal mesh inside the earpiece. Case is solid and holds the buds in place.
Look Fit: includes different tips and are very comfy. Have ran about 8 miles with them and had 0 issues with them getting loose or falling out.
Connection: The only issue i found was when my phone was juggling between these and my car's bluetooth. 0 problems with them in my pocket. You can get at least 25 feet from the phone without any connection degrade.
Instantly pairs when you open the case. Open the case, throw them in and tap the side and boom: wireless music.

Overall: I highly recommend if you are looking for some awesome wireless buds whether its for working out or casual use, these buds are sleek, last a long time and sound great and work well. 9/10

Note: these are my first wireless headphones ( other than AKG N60 or whatever). I used a friend's airpods for about 30 seconds as a comparison before i had my GBs
I like the wireless earbuds i was concerned about them being wireless if they would be as good as the ones with the wires i think i will use them more than the other ones
Cool just if i put extra grip it wont close
Love these buds, even bought my wife some for Mom's Day from our boys.
Product description says US version but I recieved one made in Vietnam so I cant register because it says purchased outside of US

ReviewTitle: Great pair of premium wireless headphones
ReviewBody: Been using the Samsung Galaxy Buds since early march when the S10+ was released. Have had some time to get familiar with all the features and functions. I use them every day at work, GYM and at home. The adaptive dual microphone feature is great at work, if I have someone talk to me while I’m listing to music, or if my desk phone rings I can still hear it. The battery has lasted me roughly 5 hours of straight usage, mixed talk, and music. The charging case will re-charge them, but since I remove them here and there and dock them the battery can last closer to the advertised 10-11hours. Plus owning a Samsung S10+ with reverse charging I can give them a boost of power while on the go if necessary. These have to be some of the best sounding headphones I have ever owned, I used to think my AKG over the hear headset was the best, but they are bulky and not work, or GYM friendly. The should quality when wearing both is immersive, and can make you forget you're in a loud office or loud GYM. Bass and Treble are balanced and offer great voice and music capability.  Often use them after work at the GYM, and having them be sweat resistant is great! Plus, they don’t fall out or feel obtrusive in my hear during running or cardio. My old AKG wires headphones would prevent me from enjoying my work out with cords to adjust. Using them is simple enough, just make sure to select the right size earpiece, I found the default one it ships with fits perfectly. But there are optional S, L in the box. Controlling the Buds is done with your finger via touch, you can take calls, end them, change tracks, turn up or down the volume. And if you remove them it will pause the music which is great so you don’t ever miss a beat. To pair them to my S10, all you have to do is open the case, and the Phone UI will detect them and display the Galaxy Buds on screen with name, and battery level. So, pairing them takes but a few seconds. I was able to also use them on my iPhone Xr, different setup process, but simple none the less. Fist make sure they are not currently synced to Android by turning off Bluetooth on Android device, the open the clamshell case and have iOS search for Bluetooth devices, it will show up as Galaxy Buds (####). Select the corresponding Buds and pair. Once paired they will work like any other Bluetooth headset for iOS. The only downside to iOS is that firmware updates will not work, you will need to re-sync them to Android via the Gear App for them to check and keep to up to date. Overall these earbuds are some of the best I have ever owned, and you will not be disappointed, they come in Black, White and Yellow to match any personality and mood.

i used to have the ticpods before this for my samsung (which i loved) and these are also great. they pair easily, sound great and have a lot of options to customize the way they sound. they fit in my ears great too.

These things are my babies. I love their size, shape, sound quality, build quality, and it's features. The only things I would change about this item is adding a keychain attachment, and making the case out of something that isnt plastic. It scratches too easily but they still look good

The features of the buds are great especially if you have an S10+ like I do. However the sound quality is mediocre at best. Make sure you go in the app immediately, touchpad, change touch pad controls to volume and turn the volume all the way up so you can use the volume on your phone.  They are set to 50% out the box.

ReviewTitle: Great noise cancellation, big battery and cool design
ReviewBody: The noise cancellation is almost too good. I cant hear almost anything even with the ambient sound option (especially voices from long distances). I like the sound quality but it could use a bit more bass. Overall the biggest appeal is its design. Not having to deal with a wire is amazing and for the quality and affordable price these are some of the best wireless buds on the market.
I love this headphones. Samsung is the Best

I really wanted to like these headphones. Paired with my Galaxy S10, they sounded good (though not Bose quality, which I'm a bit biased towards anyway), they connected easily, and felt comfortable. It was great having no wires to worry about at all. However, this whole experience is CRIPPLED by the fact that these buds suck on any other device that's not made by Samsung. I often use my home computer and work computer to listen to music, videos, etc. And these headphones sound TERRIBLE on those devices, both Windows computers. Sure, I can download an equalizer to improve this, but I shouldn't have to. And there's no official Samsung Windows app either, so I can't adjust anything that I would be able to adjust on my phone. They could at least make it so that the headphones remember the settings from your phone. My previous Bose Soundsport Wireless sounded the same on every device, no downloading or adjusting the equalizer or anything. Now, if you just use these with your Galaxy and no other device, they're fine. But this limited functionality is just lame, and it's a shame that Airpods work and sound better on other devices compared to these, right out of the box. Really disappointed.

ReviewTitle: Average, a bit pricey, quality not so great.
ReviewBody:
*****RETURNED SHORTLY AFTER 30 DAYS*******

*I purchased my buds on the 27th of August. About a month and a week later, people couldn't hear me clearly, I had connection issues and the left ear bud stopped functioning altogether.

Now, I called Amazon, (past my 30 days etc... )they got in touch with samsung and they agreed to send me another pair. I sent my pair in on the 15th Of October and I just received my exchange on 22th of October. I have not tried my new pair out. I just opened the box yesterday.*

Okay now for the review.

Battery
They last roughly around 5 hours instead of 6. It does depend on volume and the ambient sound feature. For comfort, they are solid. In my opinion could be better but it isn't the worst.

Comfort
They have winglets and buds for multiple ear sizes. They don't feel too heavy or awkward. Which is what you'd expect. If I could rate this area it would be a solid 4.5 I love how convenient they are and feel when I have them on.

Charging and connectivity
The charging process is a bit slow, and it is slower than I expected. Now that isn't a serious issue, it is more of want than a need. You can give a quick charge from what the manual says and it does give some juice for a bit so like I said, it isn't a serious issue.

 I usually just give it a 30 minute or 1 hour charge so I don't have to worry about running out of battery again before my work shift is over.

They connected every time when I first got them. I had zero issues with connections. They give you good range when you are far from your phone. It wasn't until later on when I began to have issues with connections.

Volume and Quality
I used them everyday. They don't get so loud that the person beside you can hear clearly what you're listening to, as they shouldn't. So the volume is fine for me. The noise cancellation is great and with the proper fitments on the bud you won't hear a thing.

The call volume is fine as well. I hear people clearly and they did hear me at times until I started having issues. The wearables app gives you a few settings for your preferences on how you want things to sound so that gives you options. The ambient feature is decent on this device. It does what it is intended to do.

The quality is where it hurts it in my opinion. I feel like the materials are well made but the software and electronics could be better. At times I might get a strange (zip or zap) sound when i'm listening to music when my phone is in my pocket or far away.

When the ambient is on,  it picks up sharp sounds and amplifies them so that can be a bit uncomfortable if you have sensitive hearing.

The touch pad/screen feature is nice. I like it a lot but it doesn't seem to work as well as I thought it should have. You can configure your tap options but it did feel more of a chore to pause them versus just taking one ear bud out. That is more of me wanting instead of needing again. It isn't THAT bad but I would like a more responsive touch pad.

Overall I think it is a solid buy. Amazon and Samsung took care of me so I can't be upset. The price is standard for the segment but I recommend getting a refurbished pair or a pair on a discount.

To me they aren't worth 100 plus dollars. I think they are worth a fair 70 at best because of what I mentioned above.
Other than the sound being a little low, they are very nice buds with a ton of features.
These are literally the best

ReviewTitle: These Galaxy Buds are purely amazing.
ReviewBody:
This is my first review, and I apologize for the length. If you read it, you may gain some insight on the Galaxy Buds :) I was compelled to do this review because of how Amazon’s customer service > Samsung’s “customer service” and for how great this product truly is. I preordered my S10+ only to be one of the many who were unlucky enough to not get it included with the phone, and would subsequently have to wait "15 days for the promotional $130 gift card only for usage on Samsung.com” ..not sure if I will receive that or not because the promotional support is extremely subpar for such a revolutionizing smart phone like the Samsung Galaxy S10+; so, I decided to order it on Amazon and will use the $130 for a Micro SD or some other accessories, if I get it.
Amazon... you continue to amaze me :) I ordered these Galaxy Buds on Wednesday, 03/13/19 with a an originally scheduled delivery range from 04/05/19-04/29/19. THESE BUDS ARRIVED 3 DAYS LATER ON Saturday, 03/16/19. WHAAATT?? Thank you, Amazon!!! Now THAT is quality service for these quality Galaxy Buds!
The new 2019 Galaxy Buds are purely amazing.
The highs are great; I personally have the sound toggled to "Bass Boost" on the Galaxy Wearable app and the sound is utter bliss. I have a pair of "noise-canceling" Bose QuietComfort 35 II, and the sound quality on these Galaxy Buds definitely compare with “elite” brands because of its quality. I find these Buds to be on an even keel as far as sound quality with a variety of genres in the “Bass Boost” mode: rap, rock, country, reggaeton, opera, and even classical all sound great with these Buds. Trust me, I have songs in my playlist that have different ranged bass lines, I managed to fit 2 12” Rockford Fosgate subwoofers in my Subaru BRZ, and these Buds’ sound quality did not diminish and did not distort even with the heavy bass line usage. I normally use headphones to listen to classical music while I am studying, doing a project for work, or just like everyone else- shell off from the outer world. As a test, the Buds were able to "cancel" the screech of the BART cars when I was riding BART earlier while the volume was at 75% to full volume, something the Bose QC 35 II sadly could not do despite its "noise-canceling” capabilities. (BART is an extremely loud, outdated train transit system in the SF Bay Area).
Not sure why the finish on the exposed part of the Buds is glossy, it would have been better off as a matte finish because it is bound to get oily fingerprints all over it. The “Touchpad” is not as responsive and comfortable as I would like. It is going to take some time to get used to because when one taps on the touchpad, to play/pause/skip it kind of drives the silicone padding into your ear drum- and is somewhat deafening with the taps. The touchpads can be customized to do voice command, quickly adjust ambient sound, or volume up/down with a touch and hold gesture. The ambient sound is an interesting feature to use, especially when someone needs to be alert with their surroundings.
In sum, the delivery was just like ordering anything with Amazon Prime, despite the projected delivery being 3-6 weeks from now. The Galaxy Buds can compare with “noise-canceling” rated headphone despite not being rated to cancel out noise. The sound quality is purely amazing with great highs and lows that do not distort no matter how heavy the bass line is. The finish is glossy, but who cares it’s going to be in your ears! The Touchpad
GET THESE BUDS NOW!!!!
These are good ear buds but they are not easy to get the equalizer and ambient noise to sync without having an issue. Voices are garbled or really low.

ReviewTitle: Mic is very very very very poor
ReviewBody:
I got this from a different site for a cheaper price, but immediately returned it. The mic quality is quite horrendous. "you sound garbled and sounds like you are standing in a down pour". when i spoke to my dad from my office, he could hear me, but very muffled.

On the pro side, the buds were super super comfortable. i barely felt it on my ear, but what good is comfort if you cannot use it. the comfort level is the reason this got 2 stars.

After 5 minutes and several calls later, i had not choice but switch to my Bose sound touch sport. not as comfortable as the galaxy bud, but my family on the other side could actually hear me.

ReviewTitle: Good sound and comfortable. Easy to connect.
ReviewBody: Sound great. Hassle free blue tooth connection. I absolutely love these earbuds. I was skeptical about the earpieces staying in my ears during workouts but so far(about a month) I have zero issues with that.

This may be my first Amazon review but I had to say something...

These headphones are basically useless.

1) Phone Calls - you simply cannot use them for phone calls. Audio alternates buds non stop, sounds very choppy, and literally every single time I've tried to use them for a phone call, people have told me that I sound really faint and muddy. I was hoping to replace my AirPods with these (I have the S10) but instead go back to the AirPods every single time.

2) Music - the sound is garbage unless using the equalizer and turning the volume to the max. At that point, they sound OKAY. I have similar connection issues when listening to music too - alternating buds, the songs actually skipping...they're just a mess.

I'm returning these, they are literally useless. Samsung had a huge opportunity to put out a quality product and dethrone Apple. These things don't even feel like a beta product, they feel like they are in early development phase of the product cycle.

Very disappointing.

Good sound. Don't get really loud, but I guess that's a good thing so you don't damage ears. Good sound quality. Very comfortable. Don't even know you're wearing them. Main problem is they have Bluetooth issues. If you put your phone in your pocket, the sound becomes choppy. Maybe it'll be 5 star when they fix that. I already exchanged them for a second pair and had same exact issue. Did all updates and troubleshooting for hours. Rediculous. Visited forums and a lot of people having same issue. Samsung support has no idea what's wrong.

ReviewTitle: Great...Except it's causing an issue with youtube
ReviewBody:
I love the way the earbuds are built.  Good Quality.  However, I have a serious problem and I'm wondering if anyone else has this issue.

Situation:
I use these earbuds daily while I run.  I stream youtube videos in the background while running.  I've done this for years with other wireless earbuds.  For some reason, after 10 minutes, the video stops playing.  I have to stop my run, pull out my phone, and press play.  The earbuds wont let me restart the video by pressing the button on the earbud.  I have to manually restart the video every time on my phone.

The same issue will have happen again approximately 10 minutes later and then randomly throughout my run.  It's happened every single time I've run with these headphones.

Is anyone else experiencing the same issue?

I would definitely recommend these to anyone. I love it

ReviewTitle: Greet comfort, sleek styling,  decent sound
ReviewBody:
I've been looking for a good pair of wireless earbuds for the gym for a while.  I tried the B&O's and though they sounded great they were extremely uncomfortable and stuck out of my ears  way too far.

I'm happy to say that the Samsung's are very comfortable and sleek.  I can wear these for 90 minutes plus with very little discomfort.  They stay in my ears while working out too!  Once in a while I have to twist them back into place but not too often.

The sound quality is ok.  It's definitely not as good as the B&O but those are more than twice the price.  These are tuned to favor the highs for sure, and at first sounded too harsh.  But either I got used to them or they are now broken in, they don't bother my ears anymore.

As far as connectivity goes they have yet to drop out or disconnect.  They pair up quickly with my phone and laptop, and the app is easy to use.

Overall I'm happy with my purchase and if you're on the fence or thinking of getting these, I recommend that you try them.

The buds sound fine, and after adjusting the rubber seal they do not hurt to have in my hear for extended periods of time. However, using my Pixel 3, the connectivity is fairly poor. Leaving my phone in my front pocket, if i swing my hand in front of the line-of-sight between the phone and the buds, my music losses connection.

Might return them for something with a larger Bluetooth antenna,

ReviewTitle: Day 10: Amazing sound quality, Sleek, and Fun features
ReviewBody:
Update 5/16/2019, Day 10: the headphones are working seamlessly now. I believe it was due to a few software updates for the driver's. I'm not sure but they work great now. I'm glad I did rush to return them. I have using them and sound quality is great.

Update 5/8/2019, Day 2: I did some trouble shooting. Reset my Earbuds and reinstalled app. I found if you continuously tap on the Device Name, which you will find if you click on About Earbuds in the Wearables app, you can test the headphones to see if they are functioning properly. I placed the headphones on my phone and started test. Test came out as Passing on all data. Now when you place the Earbuds in your ear it will state that the Proximity L and Proximity R FAIL which happens only when they are in your ear and means you need to take them off to get an accurate test. So far so good. Will possibly give 5 stars and may not return after all. Glad I tried trouble shooting.

Day 1: Just received the Galaxy Buds today. I love Samsung products. Usually very trusting of them. Sadly I got a defective pair. Very disappointing. The left earbud makes no indication of being placed in ear. I believe it's a sensor defect. The right earbud does make a sound when placed in ear. The app also shows me that ambient sound is not possible since both are not in my ear when they definitely are. I looked at both to make sure examine differences and their seems to be no visual differences. Looks like the sensor is defective one the left ear for my pair. Hopefully can receive a different pair that's not totally defective.
Great buds!! Good battery life. No issues with updates. EQ software is ok (Bass boost doesn't really give it a punch). Ambient sound pass through is great on the train.

Overall good buds but, I wear them very often during the day for long periods of time (hours) and my ears are starting to feel soar and getting some redness (irritation) around the place were the buds sit. Not sure if it's just the way they sit on my ears or what not but that's my only complaint.

So I was very hyped when I bought these, the reviews were good and the headphones just seemed amazing. But when they arrived at my house... I couldn't open the box itself, of all problems, the box really??? There were black marks on the box that looked it has been wiped, there was a fingerprint on the bottom. The original seal was ripped and there was another seal on top of it that doesn't look like the original. I couldn't get the box to open no matter what, some of the sides were glued shut when I tried getting my fingers in, the only way to open it was to cut it open. It seemed like someone used it and returned it. I decided not to open it and just return the thing itself. BEWARE: The seller was Amazon. If you are buying this I wouldn't buy it with Amazon as the seller, in fact just go on to the Samsung website and buy it unless you have prime. I'm reordering these and will update my review when I get them.

ReviewTitle: Poor Bluetooth Connection and Average Sound Quality
ReviewBody:
I was really looking forward to my purchase of Galaxy Buds to pair with my S10e. I was quite confident in this purchase after seeing all the positive feedback on these and witnessing how great the technology of the new S10 phones are.

CONS

¤After using the Galaxy Buds for two weeks, they have completely stopped working on me while having plenty of battery life left. This has happened 3 times now. Every time I have this problem I have to put the buds back in their charging case, close the lid, and leave them for 5 minutes. After that they are perfectly fine. (I guess this is like a reset button for the buds when they start glitching.. They definitely shouldn't be having this problem at all though considering how much I paid for them).

¤At one point the left bud completely stopped playing any sound from my phone and made a constant ringing noise that wouldn't stop. The ringing even continued on after I had disconnected the bud from my phone's bluetooth. This was also "fixed" by putting the bud back into it's case for 5 minutes to reset it.

¤Along with this, the sound quality is quite average in comparison with countless other earbuds I have used in the past. The price is definitely not worth the quality of sound these have. It's not terrible, but it isn't impressive either.

¤I've also had what seems like connection issues. Whenever I'm sitting down or busy doing things around the house (phone in pocket), my music cuts out and gets choppy every so often. It's gotten so bad that every song I'd play would start cutting out for no apparent reason.

PROS

¤A few great things that I love about these is the touchpad on the buds has come very convenient for me (especially while driving and at work).

¤I also love the "find your earbuds" feature for these on the Galaxy Wearable app. It's saved me from loosing one or both of my buds a few times already.

¤The ambient sound option (which is also on the Galaxy Wearable app) has been convenient at times.

¤The battery life typically lasts 7-8 hours.

¤They fit nicely.

¤I can monitor how much battery life is remaining in each bud using the Galaxy Wearable app, which has been very useful.

Overall I found that the cons outweigh the pros, which is why I will be returning my Galaxy Buds. I do not believe the price is worth the quality I have received.

ReviewTitle: Perfect! Just as described. Would purchase again.
ReviewBody: Purchased for my husband who loves these headphones! He has not had one single complaint. Great quality! I know the noise cancellation is great cause he can’t hear things around him. Would absolutely recommend.

The Samsung Galaxy buds are the best. The sound quality and it built is great. My only problem is the audio cutting out between the earbud. It only last about a sec or 2 but it really annoying. Everything else is Great.

I think the ambience is super helpful when I'm talking to someone and trying to listen to my music (and the fact that it's optional is even better). I also love the convinience of the touch pads on the actual pods. I would argue that these are better quality than airpods.. and these don't fall out either! The only issue I have is with the Bluetooth connection (it gets spotty if I turn my head the wrong way), but that happens with every Bluetooth device simply because my phone is old. Definitely worth the purchase!

I LOVE the battery life on these! I use them all day and only charge them in the case for about 30 minutes each day. My only complaint is that they seem quite but I think I might not be getting a good seal so I am going to keep fiddling with the different size ends that come with them and find what fits best. Maybe this will solve my issue.

The ambient sound passthrough is not effective enough to make a difference. I was hoping to be able to wear these and be aware if someone was trying to get my attention, but they dont even pick up the ringing of my phone.

The other issue is a little more serious and that is the connection will sometime drop out of one of the buds. I have to remove the bud, place in the case and then try again. Its 50/50 on whether or not it works.
Great fit and seal, they block ambient sound really well. Unfortunately, even with this they are just too quiet for my taste. Even my cheap 10 dollar buds get louder than these.

I work 12hr days, 6 days a week, and the majority of the time I need my phone but I need my hands too. The only downside is that the battery dies kind of quickly and it cause my phone to glitch out a little when I try and give it a command but I'm sure that's only a UI issue. ReviewTitle: Good sound. Not for small ears. Noticeable video delay. Disappointing experience
ReviewBody:
Pros: Price. Sound quality. Design and look. Style and compact size.
Cons: Uncomfortable fit. Noticeable latency in video/audio sync. Missing features with iPhone. Easy to mistakenly activate touch features.

I really wanted to like these. I did extensive research before settling on these. I read most review articles and watched many of the available pre-release video reviews on Youtube. I was comfortable dealing with the iPhone compatibility limitation but was ultimately disappointed with the discomfort of the fit. I tried to deal with it for a few weeks but decided to return them in the end.

The fit wasn't the only issue. The latency/delay of audio with video was too much to deal with. I mostly use Youtube, and while on my commute, my viewing experience was unenjoyable. Anything involving precise action or comedic punchline was virtually unwatchable. I had a $6 pair of Bluetooth in-ear headphones that had better latency than these, so I was very disappointed.

Using an iPhone significantly limits your experience. Upon researching, I was willing to try these with the missing features, but it seems crazy that with all the available apps, Samsung couldn't come up with an iPhone app to allow you at least some of the features (at the time of purchase there was nothing available - not sure what the current app features may be).  Because of this, I can't speak to the functionality of the ambient noise control feature.

Another annoyance was the touch controls. The earbuds are very small (a good thing), so there is limited space for you to handle them. Half the time I was handling them to put them in my ear, I would activate something by accident. Or if I needed to reposition or adjust placement in my ear, it was activate something unintentionally.

If you have bigger ears and a Samsung/Android phone, you'll probably love these. As an iPhone user with small ears, these were no good.

I decided to go with the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air earphones. They kind of look like Airpods, but with soft buds. They fit comfortably and have great battery life for almost half the price. I recommend these as an alternative.

ReviewTitle: Wireless charging stopped working within 2 months. Warranty does not cover replacement.
ReviewBody:
I bought these earphones on April 3, 2019. The wireless charging case stopped charging the earbuds in July 2019. These earbuds are used for the office to block out noise so there was very little wear and tear on the unit. I called Samsung customer care since it was within 1 year of purchase. Samsung sent me a wall plug and a charging cable...

After receiving the wall plug and charge cable, I called Samsung to ask why a wireless charging case was not sent out as discussed with the previous customer representative. The second customer rep apologized and told me that the one year Samsung warranty for the wireless earbuds does not cover the wireless case. My only option is to buy the entire set. I can't just buy the charging case.

Did I mention that I bought these wireless earbuds on April 3, 2019 and they stopped working July 2019? Great warranty Samsung. I should have bought a Jabra elite 65t instead. Really disappointed with this purchase and will never buy another Samsung mobile accessory again.

Awesome.....exactly what I wanted!

Soooo great on the bike .....and work as well.
The left ear continues to lose sound. The charge on the buds last maybe an hour and people telling me they can't hear me

Saying that these are the equivalent for Android as the AirPods are for Apple would be taking away form the Galaxy Buds. I've owned both, and would pick these anyday of the week over AirPods. The sound quality is superior, and the aesthetics (personal opinion) are much better. They stay in without issue and can be worn for hours without any discomfort. I would recommend trying the different sized tips included. When testing them, leave them in for at least 10/15 minutes to get a good idea, also shake your head around and make sure they are secure.

Overall, the only complaint I would have is the the battery, but with wireless charging and the ability of the Galaxy S10+ to PowerShare, that's no problem.
Great pair of headphones and at an amazing price point.

ReviewTitle: Wireless earbuds that have good sound quality
ReviewBody:
Had been using the Galaxy Buds for few weeks now, and they are good. Having the wireless charging is a best option as now there is no need for charger for the earbuds when they can be wirelessly charged by the Samsung S10+.

The Wearable app gives much further control into seeing the sound Equalizer types and Ambient Sound options and Touchpad controls on the Buds with an option to set a custom control.

Setup of buds is quite simple and easy to setup, just opening the case near a Samsung Phone prompts user to set up the Galaxy Buds.

Good feature is that each bud can be used independent of the other which is always good when working at office where one headphone suffices.

But upon talking about what is missing, there is no option to see how much charge the case holds at a moment so it would be all guesswork as to when to charge the case.

Upon frequent use, noticed that each bud lasts for about hour and a half or so, and case charges them 2-3 times.

Size of the Galaxy Buds remains as same as the Gear Icon X, but the features have improved a lot, including the connectivity and charge time. Also the white color is really good. Earbuds are detected as put in and instantly shows the Connected message on phone and shows the previous volume level that was set.

When updating software on earbuds, it still requires both earbuds to be connected and it takes over 2 monites to update 1mb and earbuds are useless during that time so was disappointed in that.

All in all, a really good earbud with good Equalizer options and easy control trackpad

Pros:
Compact size
Individual earbud usage
Wireless Charging

Cons:
No option to check Case battery
Long update times

I love these wireless earbuds! I've tried so many others but they all had various issues and the worst being people did not understand me when I was speaking on the phone especially when the batteries were low.  I love that you can use these as a pair or use thr right or left ear bud by itself. You can take them in and out of your ear without disconnecting the call. The sound quality is good but I wish it was a little louder but this would possibly damage your hearing so where it is works. It also has a nice feature that alerts you when thr battery is low and needs to be charged. The charging cradle does a fine job of giving you additional power on the run. The cradle also has a longer charging cable than all the others I've tried. There's also a handy app that you install for these earbuds that also lets you know the battery life in percentages. Another thing I love is the ease of paring these and the ease of them connecting with Bluetooth whether it is on a mobile device or with the hands-free module in my car. Finally, the earbuds are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. They have a little wing that helps them stay put while they are in your ear.

ReviewTitle: Work great, just not with my Gear Fit 2
ReviewBody: I wanted to use these with my Gear Fit 2 when running like I did with the last model of Samsung true wireless earbuds(which died). Probably about 85% of the time they worked fine but each time I'd get into patches of interruption where the sound would cut out or momentarily be louder in one earbud. I'm not sure what the interference is. For reference this is through a suburban neighborhood. I tried it several times with the same result. I then tried the same route but using them paired with my Note 8 phone and I don't recall it dropping even once, so it's something between these buds and the Gear Fit 2. Both items have the latest updates. Aside from that trouble the sound is great and they're even more comfortable than Samsung's last true wireless earbud model (which felt great). I recommend changing the functions through the Gear app so one bud is volume up and one volume down. This is off by default. Bottom line, I'm happy they work but disappointed they're intermittent with my Gear Fit 2, while my last earbuds weren't.

ReviewTitle: NO ambient sound when using just one bud
ReviewBody:
PROS:
-Improved battery life, form factor and sound over iconX 2018
-Can use one bud at at time while charging the other
-Case charges while open
-Can pair without case
-Comfortable fit
-Wireless charging case

CONS:
-Limited controls compared to iconX (can't have ambient/volume controls at the same time)
-No noise cancelling, but this wasn't expected
-Worse water/dust resistance
-Can't use ambient mode with just one bud

Improved some features over iconX 2018 like battery life, charging while case is open, ability to use just one bud, form factor.

Lost some features like touch pad controls of iconX where you had more controls. You could control volume by swiping up/down in addition to the tap and tap+hold features. With the buds, you only get tap and tap+hold. For tap+hold you can ONLY choose assistant, ambient modes or volume controls. If you choose volume controls then you can't do the other modes.

Glad to see they carried over the notifications function where it can read the full notification or summary. I'd like to be able to hear my full notifications without having to glance at my watch or phone. I want to be able to keep one bud in for this, but you can't use ambient mode with just one bud at a time.
Really like these!

ReviewTitle: Overall great service in terms of delivery speed and even better product.
ReviewBody: Great product, so loving my galaxy buds. Fast delivery as well.

It's fair to say that the most satisfying thing about a new pair of wireless earbuds shouldn't be the process of charging the battery. However, for Galaxy Buds owners who also own one of the variants of Galaxy S10, that may well be the case. I’m not talking about plugging in the USB-C cable, rather the moment you find yourself short of juice, take your S10+, flip it over, place the Galaxy Buds case on to the rear of the phone, and watch the Buds’ charging light ping to life. Now *that* is a feeling of deep satisfaction. It’s important to note, wirelessly charging your Galaxy Buds from your phone isn’t just a party trick, nor is it incredibly useful in a pinch, but it’s also an indication that Samsung is thinking of its product line as an entire ecosystem, rather than siloed products. This may seem like an unusual place to begin a review, but it feels like Samsung’s wireless earbud line have finally achieved truly wireless status, which is an important landmark. As an owner of both previous generations of their earbuds, the Galaxy Buds feel like everything learnt with the previous generations has been applied. Bluetooth connectivity, a little sketchy on previous models, has been improved to the point that in 3 weeks I’ve experienced no issues whatsoever. Other more subtle improvements have been made, such as a more compact pocket-friendly case, and its ‘push-button open’ mechanism (which failed after three weeks on a previous model) has been replaced with a simple foolproof prise-open design. Where they have learnt from issues of earbuds past, they’ve also understood and retained the strengths of previous generations, such as the touch-sensitive shell that allows you to control your music without having to rummage around for your phone. The design, too, is subtle. While a certain Cupertino-based competitor has a design that is ugly but unmistakably ‘them’, Samsung is content to make the Galaxy Buds almost invisible, which for me, is exactly what I’m looking for. Finally, and most importantly, when it comes to audio quality the clarity and depth of tone and bass is fantastic, and again, a further improvement over the already stellar experiences of previous generations. The only drawback is related to the microphone, which falls short of the high bar set by every other aspect of these buds – feedback I’ve had is the mic quality is ‘fine’, but when every other aspect of the Buds is ‘great’, it leaves something for Samsung to improve for the Galaxy Buds 2.
Very good product 👌

ReviewTitle: Not a great earbud.  Disappointed in Samsung with this product!
ReviewBody: These were great for music, but disconnected without warning and calls would drop alot.  Returned and bought the Samsung UCircle.

Got these for my sons 14th birthday present (which he requested) and he loves them!  He's had them for 2 months now. I actually borrow them from him sometimes when I go walking. They are so comfortable!!! I have never been able to find comfortable ear buds before, or ones that actually stay in, but these do! Seriously thinking of buying myself a pair!

I've been using these for three days at work (paired to my Pixel 2 XL) and I'm pretty impressed with them. I've never used "true" wireless earbuds before but after some research I decided to get these and I think I made the right choice.

The sound quality is pretty good for what you spend, although the "dynamic" equalizer preset in the app is really the only one that's worth anything. Definitely use that and you'll have the best experience. I've listened to a range of music from metal to indie folk to soundtracks, and these seem to handle it all just fine. The sound isn't the fullest, but does enough to be enjoyable to listen to.

I really, really struggle to find earbuds or IEMs that stay in my ears with any kind of reliability and these definitely do. They're VERY secure with the wing attachments in place, but with that configuration I do start to get some soreness at about 1.5-2 hours of constant use. It seems like they're missing a size in the three options they include, because they go from essentially no wing, to a fairly large one, to one with the same height plus some extra material towards the back. They should include a size between those first two where the wing itself is smaller. That said, for just sitting at my desk they actually do stay put with the "no wing" attachment, and it's much more comfortable for long periods like that, so it works out.

Just a word on connectivity as well, since I heard that without a Samsung device to connect to it can be a real pain. I've had no problems pairing these with my phone. I'll get a couple weird flickers here and there throughout a day of listening, but nothing that I wouldn't just expect from a wireless connection of anything really. That said, I'll be taking these on a plane trip this weekend so I'll definitely update this review if I encounter any issues when everybody else around me is also using wireless devices.

Overall, I've had a good experience with these.
Very nice , also a little expensive. But love them

ReviewTitle: They suck bad not loud and they hurt my ears with treble.
ReviewBody: Wow can you say way too much treble and not loud enough? Yes I am on an iPhone yes I know I don’t have EQ options or internal bid volume change ability but that’s not my fault that’s Samsung’s fault. All have been bluetooth, but none are close as good. Right out of the box, mine were fully charged. As soon as I took 1 bud out and placed in my ear, it was simple to connect to my Note 8. Sound quality is really good. It's not super loud, but loud enough. So far the call quality has been great. I can hear caller very well as well as they can hear me. Setting 1 dominant is as easy as putting one in your ear and touching the button to turn it on. I have been VERY skeptical about which buds to buy with all of the different options out there. ReviewTitle: Finally some airbuds I can recommend.
ReviewBody: I can't believe how many crappy products are out there with good reviews. Until now I haven't found anything that compares to the quality of the airpods. These are a great price, great sound a little more base then the airpods and I like the noise isolation. I was looking for some that I could wear in noisy places to block out sound. Even doing yard work with a mower or weed wacker going these are nice so you don't have to blast the music to drown out the outside noise. They're light and comfortable and the battery life is fantastic. I'm one who doesn't care about case battery life I want listening battery life. What good are buds that you can't listen to all day?  I haven't had an drops or that pain in the a$$ one ear bud drop while working out.  I'd recommend these to anyone who wants a great set of buds at a great price.

ReviewTitle: Overall great but sound quality is weak. Compare to Bose Soundsport wireless.
ReviewBody: I have owned Bose Soundsport Wireless buds for over a year.  I just got these Samsung Galaxy Buds.  These are my observations to compare the two.  The sound quality of the Galaxy Buds is weak in my view.  The details of the music are just not there.  The Bose just kill these when you listen to music.  You hear a lot more of the details of the music.  There is more volume , bass, treble with the Bose and you do not even have to mess around with the equalization in some app.  Phone communication is very good with the Galaxy buds.  I have had no complaints regarding clarity of voice on calls.  The Galaxy buds are also more discreet looking as some people have not even realized i had them in .  They sit in your ears and do not stick out like the BOSE.  However, both the BOSE and the Galaxy are very comfortable to wear for extended time.  I like the touch control on the Galaxy but you cannot control volume and ambience. YOu have to choose one or the other when you set it up.  So i have not really experimented much with the ambience to say whether it is any good or not.  I really like the wireless charging case for the galaxy buds.  However, i like the fact that i can attach my Bose case to a belt loop to carry them with me.  I do not have a lump in my pocket like with the Galaxy buds.  Having a cord connecting the 2 ends  of the BOSE is not really all a negative.  When you want to take them out of your ears, they hang around your neck.  The cord also makes it harder for you to lose them.  The cord is behind your neck so really you hardly know it is there.  When riding my bike i go with my BOSE as they are louder and if one did fall out of my ear then it is attached with the cord.  If a Galaxy bud fell out of my ear while riding, it would be history.  That said,  I think the Galaxy buds sit securely in my ears and they have not fallen out.  Overall, i like the Galaxy buds but the sound quality is a disappointment.  My real rating on these is probably 3 1/2 stars.  I mark it down from 4 only because of the sound quality.  Talk quality is great though.  If you do not use these for music and mostly talk or podcasts then these are a solid 4 to 5 star.

ReviewTitle: great product overall but noise cancellation is lacking

However, this is a minor issue as this type of headphone is not designed with this in mind.

ReviewTitle: FINALLY! A nice set of earbuds!!
ReviewBody:
My search for the best and most cost effective earbuds has not been a very easy or quick experience. I must have read literally HUNDREDS of reviews, saw many review videos, and tried and returned 7 different brands based on their recommendations, before I finally decided to go with the Galaxy earbuds. Honestly, I thought that I would never find a pair that sounded great with both phone and music, and had a decent battery life. You would think that the countless reviews on Amazon and other websites I looked at would make my decision easy, but this just wasn’t the case.

I actually found the reviews to be extremely unhelpful and so black and white that it made me completely confused. I would read 5 verified reviews praising a product for the exact same reason and then the next review would say that particular area of praise was shit. I mean really! Sometimes I think other brands have people do this to throw off potential buyers and if so it worked. But really, I just didn’t appreciate the sheer magnitude of this type of thing. It’s so frustrating as a potential customer to spend such a ridiculous amount of time trying to decipher which are true. We all have better things to do.

Ok so about these earbuds...This is everything you need to know without all the unnecessary crap.

These buds are extremely comfortable and come with several size rubber pieces to get a great fit.
Very reasonable price for such a great product.
They are the perfect size and not obtrusive at all. Also, the size of the case is very small so super easy to carry in a bag or your pocket.
You can touch gently to control your music, answer/hang up calls, etc.
They pair very easily to any Bluetooth and make a cool sound when they detect that they are in your ears. It’s automatic...
They have an app so if you have an Android you can download that allows you to customize your sound, ambient noise, and see any battery life remaining.
The sound for music is VERY good. They sound like you are in the front row of a concert. Rich, immersive, and not crazy base but definitely good base.
EVERYONE can hear me fine and not 1 person ever makes a comment or even knows I am on them. Also, I hear them great as well...Hallelujah! And you can use both (which gives the voice a stereo sound) OR you can just use one (either). If you take one out during a conversation the conversation keeps going without any disconnect.
They stay put when exercising, dancing, hanging upside down.
A voice says email or text when you get one.
The battery life is very good...I honestly haven’t counted the hours but I can wear them all day without any problem. I think I have maybe charged the case every few days or so...just depends on how long you are using them.

The ONLY negative for me is that they do seem to cut out for a second here and there when it’s windy outside. But for a very brief moment and that’s it. But really not a deal breaker at all, especially after I have experienced what else is out there.
Also, they might not be waterproof but they are sweat proof I think?

I hope this review has been helpful!

They are really nice earbuds. very comfortable in ears. Great sound quality for day to day music. Good call quality. Amazingly quick connectivity with my s9. When I finally got them to work again, they would constantly cut out with almost every step I took. It was so incredibly frustrating. Even just walking they would cut out with my phone in my pocket. The only time I would have a good experience with them is at work when I was sitting at my desk doing nothing.  Sound quality was horrible even when it worked. I would really not recommend these at all.

So, as I said on the title, they aren't the best probably, but for that price they are good enough for me, I'd buy again

ReviewTitle: Works better on iPhone than on Galaxy
ReviewBody:
I want to start out by saying I really like the overall physical design of these headphones.  They are really nice feeling and ergonomic in a way that my old AirPods just never were.  Also the sound quality is top notch when it comes to music or spoken-word audio.  The noice cancelling aspect works great which can be easily overridden with a feature that allows you to hear ambient sounds (a feature only usable on Android devices, unfortunately).

I purchased these as AirPod replacements.  I wanted something with some proper water resistance and good audio quality.  My AirPods had slipped out of my hands one day and fell right into a puddle.  They still work but at a significantly reduced sound quality.  After reading reviews on several different kinds of wireless earbuds, I eventually settled on these as a replacement set.  They worked very well on my iPhone, however a major downside to using these with an iOS device is you don't have access to the "Galaxy Wearable" App which allows you to adjust settings or use the ambient sound feature.  This doesn't make a lot of sense since there already is a Galaxy Watch app for iOS which allows you to use Samsung Galaxy watches on iPhone.  I feel like this App should be ported over, it could only mean more sales for Samsung if they did.  As they are now, for the basics of listening to music or other audio, making phone calls or talking to Siri, they work great.

Then I had another water-related mishap with my iPhone and I was forced to revert back to my old Samsung Galaxy S6.  On the S6 I've had a very mixed experience.  I can now use the App and now have a more feature-rich experience.  The different options inside the Wearable app are pretty neat and contain a lot more detail than what you could achieve with the AirPods running natively on iPhone.  However, one gigantic flaw that I experienced to a limited degree on iPhone began to become insurmountable on the Galaxy: the bluetooth connection.  These headphones have the most strange relationship with their connected device once you go outside.  If I understood better the different radio frequencies at play with WiFi and Bluetooth maybe I could go into detail about what must be going on here, but near as I can tell anytime you reach the edge of any given WiFi range, the signal between the phone and the headphones begins to distort.  So if you want to use your headphones to listen to music or something while jogging in the neighborhood, they are functionally useless since you are always in this dead-zone and distortion occurs.  The sound crackles and skips or just goes silent.  The audio is still playing on the device and once you get back in a distortion-free area you can hear it again, not paused or anything but having advanced normally as if you could hear the whole time.  There are some strange workarounds.  If I take the phone out of my pocket and hold it close to my head, the issue does not occur.  If I take my phone out and place it on a table outside, that also seems to work and I can hear fine while I stay within the normal Bluetooth range from the phone.

No, I am not streaming audio over Wifi, this happens regardless of whether the audio I'm listening to has been downloaded to the device or is being streamed.  I can turn WiFi off on my phone and it'll still happen.  Indoors I have almost never experienced this nor have I had it happen in my car.  It only seems to happen out of doors vaguely near buildings.  If I'm away from any buildings its fine.  This is why I am attributing it to a conflict between the WiFi signal and the bluetooth signal.  I don't have this issue with my AirPods or any other wireless headphones I've used over the years.  This is a massive pain and severely reduces their usability.  As such, they are very difficult to recommend.  If they can fix this with a future firmware update (which seems like something they should be able to do), then I can rate these higher.  The issue isn't as pronounced on iPhone.  However, without the app, there is no option to get updates and as such any issues you have will never get fixed.

EDIT 10/4/19: Several updates have come out since posting this and there have been some slight changes.  It seems like the problems I was having with distortion while out-of-doors have slightly improved.  The nature of the distortion has changed from an analog distortion sound to a digital distortion sound if that makes a any sense at all.  It distorts a little, little less than before, but it's almost unchanged.  They are still almost completely useless if you carry your phone in your pants pocket outside.  If you want to use them outside, you'll need to put your phone in a shirt pocket, hold it in your hand out at an angle, carry it in a purse so long as the bag doesn't hang below your hips, or use one of those armbands that were a thing back when people went jogging with their iPods.  I am a living/breathing sunk-cost fallacy so I will continue to use these headphones for at least another year to justify the cost, then I'm just hoping that whatever Apple is planning with their next release of the AirPods will include waterproofing and better audio.

Perfect ear buds unless I cover my pocket when at work then the music starts to cut out, but I've never used another pair of wireless buds so I'm not sure if that's just how they work. Overall I love these things and use them everyday.

The balanced sound had clear vocals and solid bass, I like the concept that you can maintain awareness of your surroundings. I tested it out while listening to TV, for example, you can hear the difference. I also like that I can answer calls I tested by making a few business calls to my client's offices and they seemed to have no problem hearing me. I could hear them clearly Overall, I am very happy and excited to use these! I LOVE being totally wire-free and the convenience and comfort of these. I do recommend these and I also would recommend as a user take a few extra minutes to adjust the right size and sound settings before making any final decisions or totally writing these off. I've never been so disappointment by a product in general and a Samsung high-tech product in particular. I've always held Samsung in high regard for many many years, as a user of their phones (myself and my entire family), as well as their monitors, and SSDs. This is their biggest failure so far: I used inexpensive bluetooth headphones for many years and I expected the buds to walk on water at this price. Instead, they were unusable with *all* the phones we have: two Galaxy S7, one Google Pixel and one Sony Xperia.  At best they simply did not connect at all (could not find them); at worst, it crashed the UI repeatedly.  According to the "Samsung Expert" (see here: https://us.community.samsung.com/t5/Galaxy-S-Phones/Galaxy-Buds-and-S6/td-p/561809), it's an incompatibility between Bluetooth 4 and Bluetooth 5. This is BS: Bluetooth 5 should be backward compatible with Bluetooth 4 unless the manufacturer screw up. And they did! Extremely disappointed!

ReviewTitle: Wireless ear buds that stay put!
ReviewBody: These are the best wireless earbuds I've ever had! They are truly wireless and yet they don't fall out of your ears. My ears are small and I was surprised they stayed in so well. The sound quality is great, and so is the battery life. One full charge gives you 6 hours of play time, and you can charge the ear buds and the case at the same time wirelessly, so I can use my S10 to charge them which is convenient and awesome! And everything you need to do is just a tap away. You tap to answer/end calls, change songs, turn volume up/down and to get help from Bixby or google. I absolutely love these!

ReviewTitle: Most underrated feature: ear size customization
ReviewBody:
I'll start with the headline...
The out of the box rubber fitting fit my ears great and for the last week I havent had any uncomfortably or issues. But this morning I decided to see how the other rubber fittings felt in my ears and WOW....

All 3 configurations 'fit' my ear; but I found that the medium inner ear and the small 'wing tip' piece fit my ears PERFECTLY. Wow I cant believe I was wearing them wrong this whole time...

Ratings:

Sound quality: #2
The sound quality is 2nd only to Bose, for $70 less.

Looks: #1
This is obviously opinion based but because of features like the case style, actual bud looks, and they dont have the douche-vibes that you get with wearing apple airpods thus making the Galaxy Buds the best option.

Customization: #1
If you have a galaxy phone...forget it man the customization of the first gen Galaxy Buds is already light years above the competition.

Features: #1
Wireless charging, touch pad on ear buds, command customization, sound customization, EAR PIECE CUSTOMIZATION

Value: #1
$70 less than Bose, $30 less than airpods and far more features.

-Galaxy Buds are the reason I FINALLY got rid of my LAST apple product, airpods 🤮🤮🗑🗑
About time...earbuds that actually work!!!

I mostly love these earbuds. I'm using them with an iPhone 8 Plus and there are some minor problems though. Can't get the app for customizing the buds, oh well. But I can't watch YouTube videos while using these as there is a significant latency issue, meaning the audio is out of sync with the video. So far that's the only time I've notice this as Netflix and such seem to be just fine. I can only change volume on my phone which isn't too bad as I can easily hit my volume buttons while my phone is still in my pocket. I've occasionally had an issue with them not connecting when I take them out and have to put them back in the case and out again but it's rare. But they have great audio quality, and they fit great thanks to the different wing and ear tip options that come with them. I like being able to have the touch options for pause/play, skip, back and even siri control with a press and hold. Despite the few negatives with these, they are still my favorite Bluetooth earbuds I've owned. Would definitely recommend unless you're only planning on watching YouTube on an iPhone.

But that is no issue since they recharge to full during my lunch hour!  I can not explain how happy I am with these.

ReviewTitle: Earbuds constantly go out of sync
ReviewBody:
Earbuds are comfortable and have decent battery life, sound quality is worse than what I was led to believe from some reviews here. But that was manageable - what is not is the earbuds constantly go out of sync with each other when using them on my laptop. The left earbud is about 0.5-1 second ahead of my right earbud, and happens without warning when I'm watching shows or youtube. They have no sync problems when I used them with my Galaxy s7 phone, but will go out of sync every few minutes on the laptop.

I'm using a new Dell laptop and have reinstalled drivers on my computer + tried resetting the earbuds, but the problem persists. Other truly wireless earbuds I've used had no problems (Jabra Elite 65t, Anker Soundcore, Master & Dynamic) so I know it's not my laptop. Googling the out-of-sync issue revealed that this is a pretty common problem too. So while I enjoyed these earbuds and had no problems with the not-great audio since the price was lower than most high-end earbuds, I can't recommmend these.

Good truly wireless earbuds with bluetooth 5.0, 6 hours of battery in the earbuds and usb c and wireless charging. Great truly wireless earbuds for samsung android phone or any android phone for that matter!!!

I have swapped ears with these, connected to different devices, run updates on my phone and on the earbuds, reset the earbuds, unpaired/re-paired.... ReviewTitle: Best bluetooth earbuds I've owned to date
ReviewBody: Right out of the box and paired very easily with my Note 9 and had a quick update. Very comfortable for long periods of wear with no fatigue or discomfort. Battery life was great, lasted for over 6 hours before recharging and had 15% left. Callers could hear me with no issues or the too far from mic complaints. Customizable touch pad is nice for answering/ending calls, music playback and more. Really like that I could use either bud individually to listen to podcasts or answer calls. Ambient noise function is nice but really didn't get a chance to use often and will need to use more to get better idea of how well it works.

UPDATE: About 6 months after purchase the right side ear bud no longer plays volume equal to the left side. It is working and is paired. You can hear sound if you pull the left one out, but it is to quiet to use. Pretty disappointed.

I bought these hoping they would be exactly what they are. Excellent quality earbuds for the price. They can be just a little glitchy from time to time but the updates seem to be improving this issue. The app is great, they pair well, noise canceling is excellent. I have not had luck getting buds to stay in my ears and these do the trick. They combine a nice in ear fit with a small light weight size that does not fall out while exercising. Buy with confidence.

tl;dr These are a better fit than the Jabra Elite Actives and have better audio quality than Airpods when used with the larger silicone earbud tip. If you use these for the office and gym like me they are a good value. If you have an iPhone it likely won't work as well without the app so I wouldn't recommend these for Apple devices (I have a samsung personal phone and an apple work phone).

I've most recently tried out the Jabra Elite Active 65t headphones. They we pretty good and actually great when it came to call quality. However, they could never quite fit comfortably in my ear and so I couldn't use them for more than 10 minutes at a time without taking them out because my ear started hurting. I heard bad things about call quality and audio quality with the Galaxy Buds. I haven't used them for calling yet but compared to other headphones, they don't have the array of microphones so I can see why these would not be best suited for calls. This isn't an issue for me as I don't call a ton throughout the day. The audio quality is really similar to Jabras and perfect for casual listeners when used with a larger earbud tip. I thought this would be a bad compromise and hurt my ears for better sound quality but haven't had any comfort issues. These are the lightest while being the most secure headphones I've had. Definitely the best Bluetooth headphones I've bought yet and I have only had them a day. I have a Galaxy Note 9 so the app for these is a must.

ReviewTitle: It's all about the fit for your ears
ReviewBody:
I bought a pair of Jabra Elite Active 65t first.  They kept falling out of my ears.  I replaced them with these and the Galaxy Buds fit much better.  I still prefer the fit of Bose "Stayhears," but the little fins on these are pretty good!

I was surprised to find that even though the overall weight of these and the Jabras are very close, it is distributed differently.  I tried many different aftermarket tips but these just work better for me and I feel less fatigue/irritation. It all depends on the fit for your ears.

The sound quality is decent once you find the right tips that isolate the sound in your ear canal.  Not nearly as good as wired earbuds.  My bose QC30s blueooth buds have significantly better sound but they require you wear the collar. These are much less constraining.

The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the very limited flexibility in what the earpads do when you tap them. You can't change the built-in function for single, double and triple taps.  All you can set is what happens when you touch and hold each earpad.

I wanted to be able to adjust volume up and down plus have a way to access Google Assistant/Siri.  Unfortunately, you can't do them all. If you pick volume up for one of the volume controls, the other is automatically set to volume down.  If you choose Siri, you can't do volume with the other ear, it has to be set to affect ambient sound, which isn't useful for me.

All in all, nice wireless earbuds at a better price than the Jabras.

ReviewBody:

Going to the Better Business Bureau, this is basically theft.  Poor product , even worse customer service steer clear of Samsung**

I use these every. single. day.

They are just fantastic. They replaced my Jabra Elite 65t's for a handful of reasons I will explain below.

1. They are smaller and lighter: Maaaaan they are so much smaller and lighter. The Jabra's are like little onion bulbs in my ear. Now don't get me wrong, the Jabra's fit my ears wonderfully, they get great points for ergonomics, but the Jabra's are just too heavy, and they are on the large side. They don't fit small persons ears (i've tested it on friends and family with small ears and they are a no.) These Galaxy Buds on the other hand, are suuuper lightweight, and their "pyramid" shape is very ergonomic to the ear (at least mine, YMMV as always!) The other thing about the Jabra's are that one earbud is sliiiiightly heavier than the other, and man oh man, I could feel it all the time. It always felt like the heavier earbud was pulling on itself. The Galaxy Buds do not suffer from that issue, as they both are feather light and comfy AF.

2. Independent usage and control versatility: The earbuds controls are on both sides, and you can use EITHER earbud by itself. This is such a damn problem with 99% of earbuds out there. Other than some obscure Chinese OEM that may have that feature (which are mostly garbage), the only mainstream brand earbuds that share this same feature are the Apple Airpods. Being able to use either earbud by itself is super important to me. Be it walking around and being aware of my surroundings, or having one in while working. There are many situations where I use just one bud, and having the option of either side is wonderful. The added thing that many don't think of is that if you are going to be listening for a particularly long time (say to an audiobook/podcast all day long) then you can get continuous usage until you use up all the juice in the charging case. If you have one in and it gets low, just swap it out and let the dead one charge. You can't do that with all the earbuds that have a "master/slave" configuration where one bud is dependent on the other bud. Having the same controls on both sides (minus the tap-hold if you choose to use it for volume) is equally important in that regard, so you don't have to pull out your phone or use a smartwatch to do functions like pause and next and previous. ALL TRUE WIRELESS EARBUDS SHOULD BE ABLE TO FUNCTION INDEPENDENTLY.

3. Modern charging standards: USB C and Qi charging. Enough said. Everything is going C or Qi, so thank you Samsung for making it modern. The less cables I have to carry and/or buy, the better. Micro USB was a standard, but it's time has passed, and it needs to die gracefully. Don't even get me started on that one company's proprietary cables that they force down peoples throats and wallets...

4. Svelte charging case, "pocket-ergonomic": the only other earbuds worth a piss on the market that have a svelte and small charging case are (of course) the Apple AIrPods. They are still the king on the pocket-able size and shape of their product. Samsung is damn close though with the Galaxy Buds. They are very svelte, and their feeling in the pocket is just as good (as in, you hardly notice they are there) as the AirPods. Yes, some other earbud cases are "squatter" and some are "skinnier" but the other's don't get the shape right, so they always end up feeling like a fat stone in your pocket. The Galaxy Buds case melts into your leg and you don't even notice it's there (unless maybe your partial to skinny jeans. My experience is with standard jeans and slacks)

All in all, these hit all the sweet spots for price, style (no more toothbrushes thanks,) function, ergonomics, sound quality (better than AirPods, about on par with Jabra's. Don't expect B&O sound quality) and features. I don't think there is a better set of true wireless earbuds under $200. And to be honest, the concessions that some of the over $200 ones make you suffer is a dealbreaker.

If you want great wireless buds, these are the ones.

I have high end headphones and IEMS (Sennheiser, Beyerdynamic, AKG, Mrspeakers, etc.) but I wanted something small and unobtrusive for exercising.

 Because of the reviews (which so often just are repetitions without real personal discernment) I was expecting great comfort/practicality and bad sound. I remember thinking: “why AKG would put a bad driver here when even their cheaper headphones are so good for the price? Why Samsung, using bluetooth 5.0, wouldn’t put a decent sound?"

 Well, either some reviewers (I mean Youtubers and web reviewers) are deaf, or the latest software update changed radically this TWE, because the sound is good! (as usual, just finding a good seal with the correct eartip size).

 This is a pleasant surprise, it exceeded my expectations and reminded me that “reviewers” often just convince themselves and others with preconceived notions. Give this a try and decide by yourself.

Worth noting that these are the first headphones/earbuds/anything I've used while mowing my lawn and it actually cancels out the noise enough to enjoy what I'm listening too. ReviewTitle: I was hoping for something better.
ReviewBody:
I had a lot of hope in these earbuds. As a previous owner of the Iconx 2018, I was expecting some of the same feature passed down. For instance, on the Iconx 2018, you could set the main earbud to left or right. This was handy when running with my Garmin. Connection issues happen when the main earbud is set to the opposite ear of the arm your watch is own. So the watch is on your left arm and main bud is in your eight ear. This causes the connection to drop out continuously. This is something great the Iconx had. You could change it to any ear. This feature is lost to the Galaxy Buds. I have to change the watch to my opposite arm to combat this, and it's quite awkward

The biggest let down was they had no internal storage. This was very disappointing, as this was my favorite feature on the Iconx. I understand they wanted to cut the size down but they took away what made the Iconx so great.

I haven't decided whether I want to return them or not. If someone can tell me how to set the main earbud or get around this, I'll change my review. This doesn't mean telling me to move my watch to the other arm.

Good wireless earbuds perfect for Samsung, the touch is very sensitive so you will stop your music alot if your laying down or if you have your hand around your ear and accidentally tap it, it will stop the music. Comfortably is a good 8/10 could be a little more comfortable they do start hurting your ears a little when you have them in for a while other than that i love em.

I have to admit, I was a little worried based on some of the negative reviews, but so far they have been great. Samsung has updated the software twice in the last week. Gets plenty loud without blaring and I love the fact I can use one bud if I want instead of both. I have been wearing one under my headset at work  and it has been comfortable throughout the day. Nobody knows I have it in! 😁

Battery life has been great for me running them at about 70% max volume. All in all I am quite pleased. Should also mention I've gotten no complaints on my sound quality during the calls I've taken on them.

Better than airpods. Works well with my ipad pro and with my galaxy s9 plus. An amazing product with good design and great battery life. Unlike airpods, this one is waterproof... yeah, you can swim with them.

Usually I ignore 5 star and 1 star reviews, but the 1 star reviews for this item were right!

The sound is fine, but if you are moving, the sound drops out and/or the two earphones can get out of time with each other.  I bought these for working in the yard, and the were fine when I was stationary, but if I was walking, the sound was spotty and I even lost connection.  The problem is not with my phone.  I have used some CHEAP ($20) bluetooth earbuds with no problems.
Also, these are proprietary for Samsung - you even have to download an app.  One minor inconvenience is that it is really hard to time the "double tap" to skip tracks...I either tapped too fast for it to register, or too slow, which just does a pause/restart.
I will be returning this item.

ReviewTitle: They do their job very very well
ReviewBody: Great compatibility with my S8. Not to mention great sound.
Great product
People didnt hear me
Amazing everything but damn these connection problems make it so I can barely get through a full song wth

These headphones are great. The ambient feature is ok...sounds like your listening through a paper towel roll but its new so no harm their. Sound quality is pretty good and the wireless is VERY helpful to not get wires in the way af anything. I am dissapointed about the amazon shipping box though. The box seemed to be ripped open and messed with and i looked inside but my headphones were still their, so thankful for that. But i am deffinitally using these headphones when i can.
for music, low is lack.  Other feature turn out pretty good.  But, I have not made phone call with them on, not going to judge on it.

ReviewTitle: They Messed up greatly with the Mic
ReviewBody:
I been expecting these since they were announced and was super excited about them. I have everything smart at home and feels awesome holding my bud to give commands.

While I love pretty much everything about these gotta say they honestly messed up with the mic. I tried everything, I changed all the tips and wings trying to have them at different angles to see if the mic would improve but no. I spend hours on the phone everyday day and everyone told me I sounded muffled. I have an Anker Bluetooth that I use all day long and never had this issue.

It is extremely annoying having to repeat everything because people can NOT understand you at all. This issue gets worse when there's noice. For music listen they are great but for the main thing that is talking on the phone they are pretty much absolutely useless.

No good
