ReviewTitle: Great accessory to a Samsung phone
ReviewBody: Great product at a discount from other competition. Sound quality is above average, and I like the equalizer from the app. It has a nice thumpy base compared to most other wireless earbuds. The battery could be better but no one actually wears earbuds for 5 hours straight.
lovely ear buds they are balanced with mids and lows with a enough bass just nice

I love these earbuds .They are very light and comfortable,.I sometimes forget they are in my ears until  it dies on me .I wish the listening time was longer but overall  I love them and recommend it to anyone. Good job Samsung.
Amazing product but really easy to lose or get stolen. I lost mine only having it for two weeks. (Update) I found the earbuds but now I'm extra careful where I put them.
Love them. So far last a long time cancel noise very well and IT SUPPORTS DOBLY ATMOS! Which is awesome!
It was a graduation gift for my grandson

ReviewTitle: does not work for phone calls
ReviewBody: tried to use these galaxy buds for a phone call and i was told it sounded like i was under water while i talked. for the amount that these cost phone calls should be crystal clear. also it would be nice if the volume would go a little louder i tried everything to fix this issue but nothing worked

ReviewTitle: Great gift if you don’t want to talk to your boyfriend again!
ReviewBody: This is the worst purchase I’ve made, total regret! I got these as a gift for my boyfriend and he loves them! So much so that he almost always has them in! He falls asleep listening to them, and he never hears me when I’m talking so I know they work great for noise canceling! They also last all day, he is a nerd so he’s always listening to nerd books on audible. They are great! Absolutely amazing if you never wanna talk to your loved ones! Wouldn’t recommend to any girlfriends out there who want to hold a conversation with their boyfriend again! I’m glad he loves them, I truly am! It’s just frustrating to tell a 10 minute story just to find out he didn’t hear a singe word and has no idea I was ever talking to him to begin with! Lol ugh!
It is the best wireless headphones I have ever bought!
Very comfortable, I forget I am wearing them. Sound quality is excellent, comparable to wired isolating AKGs. Pairing with phone is super easy and reliable. I love these!

I purchased the Galaxy Buds on the Samsung website the day they came out, and received them in 4 days, first thing I did was open the package and I was thinking the case would look bigger then it was based off videos and comments I saw from other people, the case is not big at all, it's very small, compact and perfect for on the go traveling.

Second thing I did was charge these bad boys, and how did I do it? Through wireless charging of course, it didn't take more then an hour to charge, and once charged you actually get more then the 7 hour recharge on the case, more like 10 hours. So that's a plus. And the battery life on the buds themselves is the 6 hours that Samsung has claimed.

I've seen lots of people online saying the volume doesn't get very loud, or the bass isn't very good, but to be honest those people don't understand that Samsung phones has a built in sound optimizer. (This will not work for iPhone users). If you go into your phone settings you can make a sound profile specific to your ears, and you can turn on Dolby Atmos which makes these earbuds really shine. The bass isn't breathtaking, but it is definitely there if you listen to the right songs. The same goes for the volume, it is so loud that my parents were yelling to get my attention because I honestly couldn't hear them, and they were no more then 12 feet away, in a house at that.

I got worried when I purchased these earbuds and saw all the reviews online talking about their cons, like connectivity issues, and the mic sucking, but those aren't true either. Sure the mic isn't the best, but it's not as bad as some people are saying, it's as good as a landline phone if not better. As for the Bluetooth connection, I was 3 rooms away in my house without a single drop out, over 25ft with walls in-between.

My tip is if you have a Samsung phone, definitely get these, it's worth the price. If you have an iPhone, get them, but don't expect the same experience on your iPhone.

ReviewTitle: Break after a month of use
ReviewBody:
I would like to reccomend these headphones, but both pairs I have used broke after a about a month of regular use.

After about a month, one of the buds becomes extremely quiet and unusable. I tried all recommended actions to fix it, but nothing did. Amazon was able to replace this original pair after having me return the broken set.

The replacement pair broke similarly, but I was outside the return window for Amazon, and Samsung only gave me directions to go and get it fixed myself at a repair store.

These would have been my favorite pair of earbuds I've ever used, except for how easily they break and how you are given no solutions to resolve it.

These are by far the most inconsistent and just flat out irritating headphones I've ever had the displeasure of wasting my money on. Samsung has little support in firmware updates and cannot seem to give a good answer on their website for the various flaws in this product. They disconnect constantly and my right earbud plays at about half the volume as the left, and there seems to be no fix for either of these problems. Regardless of their "support" and "updates". Trash. Waste of money. Do not buy these.

ReviewTitle: Funcionan muy bien con el iPhone!
ReviewBody: Están muy buenos!

SAMSUNG has done it again. These buds are boss. You can connect to multiple devices and the sound quality is crisp and clear.  They are light weight and not too noticeable in your ear.  And they ambient sound is a big help when in a conversation.  This is a purchase that every SAMSUNG owner should pick up.

ReviewTitle: They do not work with iPhones
ReviewBody: They don’t work with iPhones
Left earbud stopped working after over a month of use.
Amazing sound quality

Very poor - almost useless mic. worthless for calls.
Touch operation pads on buds, sometimes too sensitive. just adjusting the ear position can wreak havoc.
sometimes, doesn't work at all.
i'm returning them after a few days of poor experience.

Some things to note that I didn't see emphasized in other feedback before my purchase:

I didn't really expect it to be so difficult to hear people talking to me. You can turn on the ambient sound booster but it hisses. So you can't just wear them while you are in a social environment (or at the office). My solution was to wear just one.

The audio quality when playing music seems a little dull. The quality is on par with or below regular old cheapo earbuds. Perhaps I don't have them seated properly.

Sadly, one of the reasons I got these was for mobile gaming/media. Unfortunately, the latency is garbage. Audio is at least a half second delayed.

These aren't terrible or perfect, but there doesn't seem to be a useful fit for them in my life apart from hands free calling while driving. Also brain cancer?

ReviewTitle: Samsung hits a Homerun once again
ReviewBody: First off I opened the presentation is perfect. I opened the ear bud case and my Galaxy S9 immediately notified me of a new set of buds in the area. Connection could not have been smoother. The only setting I had to change was the long hold initially set to activate Bixby. Thru the galaxy wear app I could change it to control volume. left side down, right side up. The fact that the buds are touch sensitive and not buttons is a huge selling point. A prior set had buttons which would have to be pressed firmly for up to 5 seconds to activate menus. these are just a light press or tap.  They are so light. hardly noticeable that they are even in with the exception of the music that is blasting out of them by personal preference.
Overall a very good set of earbuds. Sound is good. Very comfy for wearing long periods. Only downside is using it for calls. You can hear perfect but the other end has a hard time hearing your voice.

bought with high expectations three months back. Previously i have another one only 16$ worth online shopping that was much better than these expensive ones.
Pros: Brand name
smart case
Cons:
Limited battery life, average sound quality
I have to connect to my PC in my office EVER DAY. It take almost 30 minutes every morning to install and re-install. No matter what ever I tried to avoid this hassle.
phone connection is relatively straight forward.
Amazing product, sounds quality its almost perfect.

Cannot access any functions from the wearable app like EQ, find my buds, etc. Keeps repeating the setup screen.  Cant install update to buds. Deeply dissatisfied. Tech support not helpful. Will return if I don't find a solution.

I received this latest Samsung Galaxy Buds on time. It is very light weight and fit in my ears very comfortably. It is as advertised, they will not fall out your ears in any active. I did a couple of 10k runs and it stays in place. There is however one annoying issue with this buds, BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITY. I own a Samsung S8, so I should be connected properly. Not even 20 feet away from my phone and it starts to skip. Even when running with the phone on me it skips. SAMSUNG NEEDS TO FIX THIS. I USED CHEAPER NON BRAND NAME BUDS WITH NO ISSUES LIKE THIS. I AM DISAPPOINTED.
These earbuds are amazing, they are comfortable and the sound quality is amazing. 110% noise cancellation unless using ambient sound and amazing battery life.

I was really excited when Samsung announced these headphones. I liked the size and really was in the market for some headphones that could fit in my pocket for quick use. My current can headphones (Bose) are phenomenal and really was just looking for a size reduction. I was skeptical at first of the sound quality and battery life of these when I first got them in my hand because who can really make great sounding headphones that lasted a decent amount of time for this price? Boy was I impressed. These sound great and the battery lasts longer than I initially thought. I have noticed myself turinging to these to wear instead of my cone headphones. I like that Samsung included different size adapters for different ear sizes. I can honestly say that anyone that gets these will not be disappointed.

They sound good, but when I checked the charging case, I noticed that some sort of fluid is leaking from it. Called Amazon to request a replacement right away. I'm just unlucky to get a defective item.

Will update once I get the replacement.

Honestly wayyyy better than airpods in my opinion . The sound quality of these little things are amazing . I've tried airpods but these are much better . The only complaint I have is that while I'm am out and about doing yard work and such I put my phone in my pocket and the music starts to get chopy . I don't much care for that , other than that these are great .

This is my second round with purchasing these galaxy buds and all I have to say is that good job Samsung. The have listened to everything everyone has been saying and made a better product. The buds are smaller and don’t stick out as much. The holder is smaller and is more compact. The fit is a lot better and is a bit more snug which is great but they still have to work on quality and ease of use and connection. Other products have a simple, easy, and fast setup.

Great job Samsung and I can’t wait to see what’s next!

ReviewBody: I like these better than any apple headphones. the pause and play feature is cool but was confusing to figure out. sleek look. love the charging case. overall good product gets the job done.

ReviewTitle: Underwhelming, unacceptable given the price point
ReviewBody:
I know $120 is pretty cheap given the general price points of true wireless earbuds st the moment, but given the brand and the official reviews, I expected better. This is from someone who has an iPhone, so maybe the app makes all the difference, in which case, Samsung is missing out on a huge chunk of their potential market by not having an iOS app.

First of all — the earbuds are heavy. This is going to happen, since unlike wired earbuds, they have to have the battery, etc. I was able to mostly forget about them, but after a while my ears began to ache. They provide you with alternative fins and buds, and I swapped through all of them trying to find a comfortable fit. I thought I had, and went to compare to my current (5€) earbuds — nope. The difference is stark and uncomfortable.

The sounds were flat at best, muffled at worst. I played around with the Spotify EQ for over two hours trying to get something that resembled reasonable sound. This is apparently where the app shines through, well. I’m not an audiophile by any means. I listen to music/podcasts 9 hours of my day, however, and this just doesn’t cut it. I

If these were 50$ buds, I’d give 4 stars. At more than double that, this doesn’t cut it. I’m bummed, as I hate AirPods and was hoping to find an Alternative.
Product works great!
very happy with these and they are so much better than head phones with wires. I use these regularly when I work out they are easy to wear.
Noise cancelling sucks. Mine wont stay paired to my note 8. ICON X are better. They are not very loud either. VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED
Love this product! Another Samsung winner. Great fit, great battery life, crisp and clear sound, seamlessly goes from music to taking calls, and the sound is amazing.
Awesome buds.
Good sound quality. Amazing Ambient sound.
Love it, excellent product
The volume is fine if you turn it u using headphones, not the phone.

music sounds great but call quality is garbage. No one can hear me, but they can hear all my background noise and static. It's like the noise cancellation is backward, just my voice is filtered out. I've tried all the fixes Samsung has listed and after visiting a number of forums and websites it appears this is a known issue with no fix. Don't waste your money.
Sound quality is great, wish they fit a little better but still very pleased with the purchase. I would recommend to anyone with a Samsung device.

ReviewTitle: Sounded great, too bad they can't stay connected.
ReviewBody: I liked the idea of these.  A lot.  The features, the comfort, and the functionality while sitting at my desk was exactly what I was looking for.  Audio quality wasn't 5 stars level but do you expect that for the price? I think they sounded very good, but wouldn't say excellent.  The problem is when I used these outdoors.  My galaxy s9+ sits in my right pocket, and with that the left ear cuts out dramatically.  Could not maintain a connection unless I held my phone in my hand at reading height.  I'm in tech for a living so I tried to see if there was something I could do to make these work right, but unfortunately even going into developer options on the phone and changing a bunch of settings there did not resolve the connectivity issues.  Reading online reviews, it appears I am not alone.  I am sad to see this, these had potential.  Returned.
Loving my ear buds. They stay in my ear, no matter how much I shake my head

ReviewTitle: Great wireless earbuds for Samsung device
ReviewBody:
Recently needed a new pair of headphones for the gym, found these on Samsung's website and got them immediately to pair with my Note 8, the setup process is straight forward after downloading the Samsung App just clicked a button and they were paired. It came with 3 wing tips and 3 different sized ear tips making for the perfect fit in your ear.

The sound quality isn't anything to brag about but for wireless earbuds I'd say they are up there with the best, noise cancellation isn't too bad either it keeps just enough of the outside away but leaving a little bit to hear,  and if that isn't enough you can turn on a setting in the app that allows outside noises to passthrough the ear buds mic. Overall the headphones are a solid purchase if you need a reliable pair of headphones for your samsung device, I stress the samsung device because you won't have as "fluid" of an experience without one.

I like these buds, I had the iconx 2018 before and these definitely have better sound but I have experienced a little bit of interference making my audio a bit choppy when I'm outside, the only way I've managed to reduce it is walking with my phone in my hand in a clear line of site, in my pocket it made more chopping. The touchpads on the side work well but personally I would've preferred the touch controls on the iconx which for me make interacting with the earphones easier. Overall there solid earphones but if you want a really secure fit with all wireless earphones the iconx 2018 may be a better option.

ReviewTitle: Worst earbuds I have ever owned!
ReviewBody: Sometimes the sound isn't very loud sometimes it fine. Biggest complaint is if you are in a loud room you cannot hear the person you are talking too and they cannot hear you. 1st. pair died within two weeks the second pair just after the Amazon return window. Luckily I purchased the extended warranty for them. Save yourself the hassle, go check out the new Jabra elite, because I think that will be my next purchase!
Wanted wireless ... got it!

The sound is decent if they stay connected. There is an echo that happens as well normally when using them when talking on the phone. Paired with a Galaxy S10+. I was willing to overlook the disconnecting. Even the echo as it normally stops after 15 to 30 seconds. But losing sound in one side is just bad. I could still hear the chime if I pushed the touchpad and the earbud was connected as it could still control the music. It would just stop playing the music out of one earbud. I would not reccomend unless you plan on using one earbud at a time. Then it might be ok although you will lose the ambient sound feature.
Absolute best Bluetooth earbuds. Don't waste your time with anything else. I've bought 100 things on Amazon. These are the first things I thought deserved a review.

The sound quality and almost everything is perfect. But the left earbud after a few weeks slowly lower in volume permenently until you cant hear nothing. No fixes had to send them back got a new pair and it happened within the month.

They are comfortable and stay in my ears. They ate fine for listening to music. However, for phone calls people often say that I sound fuzzy and they can't understand me. I bought these to use for work and I'm not able to. I'm very disappointed.

These are very good when they work. Sound isolation is surprisingly good. The fit is great
They sound well, however they worked perfectly for the first month now their just extremely glitchy to the point of unusable. Samsung customer service is a nightmare. Buy at your own risk you've been warn.
So happy
Good sound quality, and absolutely soundproof. It lacks in bluetooth strength what it makes up in the prior. But maybe thats just my case (ive dropped the pods quite a bit)
I have mine for 5 months without any problems. I jog 8 to 12 miles per day everyday and aprove it.

ReviewTitle: Amazon might had sold me a refurbished headphones at full price
ReviewBody:
Please save yourself the headache and purchase these galaxy buds from the actual Samsung website. The quality of these had phones are the worse. My friends are always telling me that they can't hear me and that I sound muffled. I just thought maybe Samsung did not do a good job in developing these buds.

However, I lost one ear piece last week and decided to buy a different pair. This time, I bought my second Samsung Galaxy Buds from Samsung . com AND it was major different. The sound quality and the battery life is different! My friends no longer complain how muffled I sound. Each bud also last me 7 hours compared to the 3 hours of the Galaxy Buds from Amazon.

Not so happy and won't be buying any expensive product on Amazon anymore.

ReviewTitle: This is an under rated product. They are the best.
ReviewBody: Best fit and best price.

ReviewTitle: Exactly What I Expect and Happy About It
ReviewBody: Honestly for $130 bucks it's exactly what I expected. Of course there are cheaper wireless earbuds out in the market but for the most part, they will only last you a good 5 months before they die. While the pair of wireless earbud I had from Samsung last year are still going strong. The quality  sounds of the earbuds are good, but that also depends on how deaf you are cause some might disagree with how loud they get. The noise cancelling is already good and that should help with sound quality already. Also don't expect an amazing bass cause it definitely doesn't have it. They fit great in my ear and look great to while wearing them and they also come with other ear pieces to fit your ear. Overall they are exactly what I wanted and expected. Wish they had more bass in them but I'll look forward to they're next version.

Audio quality on the other end is terrible. People say I sound muffled or sound extremely far away. They can't even understand me. I had a 35 dollar Bluetooth headset before this one that worked 10 times better. If you Google it, you will see many people are talking about this issue, and Samsung has no fix.

ReviewTitle: Noise cancellation is the best I've experienced
ReviewBody:
OK now these aren't like Bose headphones or anything, but the noise cancellation on these are better than I expected!
I have these in on the subway to work and home playing music not even at max volume. The other day, there was an argument in the car next to mine, not even 20 feet away that involved the police once the train had stopped, and I DIDN'T EVEN NOTICE BECAUSE OF HOW WELL THE NOISE CANCELLATION WAS. I only noticed since people were looking back and we hadn't moved, once I press and held to turn on ambient noise mode I could hear yelling. I took out my buds and chaos to my ears. I was standing there as this lady was screaming at the police and remember being super impressed at how I didn't hear anything going on with these in.

I've never had wireless buds before so I was scared of them falling out but they haven't and it's a snug but comfortable fit. I'm really impressed by the touch technology and I like how my music/videos will pause if I take them out of my ears. Battery life of the case is ok to me. Disclaimer: I have a shell on my case, it doesn't come pink!

When I first got these headphones I was so impressed! It had everything I wanted in a wireless headphone. But as soon as I changed my phone they don't work anymore unless the phone is right up to the headphones. Am I the only one experiencing this? I have to actually hold the phone up while I walk because if I don't it will be so choppy and in and out sound. Anyway get warranty folks cause you never know when a product will stop working :( I'm so mad I didn't get warranty :(

ReviewTitle: These won't fall out your ear, even if you tried.
ReviewBody:
Got these to use at the gym, after checking out all the other popular brands, these appeared to be the smallest.  That was a key factor in my choosing. The sound quality is very good given its size, if you are looking for heavy bass this is not for you.
I use mines  jus for 2 hrs at the gym, 5 consecutive days without charging, so battery is no problem for this. It also holds up to heavy perspiration very well.
 They are the most comfortable headset i have ever used, period. Normally I cant keep anything in my ear very long. This seems to be the only exception. Won't be trading this for anything else.
 These have no branding on them, no flashing lights, or anything like that they are as discreet as they come.
The left ear bud will suddenly buzz and not stop until you reset them rendering them completely useless. I exchanged my first set for a second set and the same thing occurs.
The sound quality was fine, but it was uncomfortable for my ears
Way better than Airpods

I got these this morning, charged the  up, connected to my phone and download the software update. Then I disconnected from my phone and paired with my Galaxy Watch 46mm LTE and set out for a walk. The moment I went outside, the audio started cutting in and out. The only way the audio stays clear is if I hold the watch under my chin. (This does not happen with the same watch and my older pair of airpods) The moment I drop my hand, it's like someone is trying to communicate to me frantically in muted Morse Code. Buyers remorse like a mf at the moment. I called Samsung for help and they told me to try and clean them. They are hours old. Then I was referred back to Amazon. I've looked everywhere online, and this seems to be a big problem with no fix.

I bought Samsung earbuds when I decided to upgrade from $27 no-name earbuds but I've been disappointed that the audio from the no-names is so much better than from the Samsung.  I have never before been disappointed with the sound from an audio product but then I bought these.  The sound from the Samsung earbuds is flat, music is not worth listening to with them.

ReviewTitle: Slightly buggy software, overall im pretty satisfied with my purchase
ReviewBody:
Software is still a bit buggy, but that can be worked on over time.

The light indicators on the case are weird, make sure to read the manual
good option

ReviewTitle: NO REPLACEMENT EAR OR WING TIPS
ReviewBody: Don't lose or break the rubber ear tips. There are no replacements. Customer support will not send you extra even though it says they will on their website.

So I have had the earbuds for about 3 months and they still work like new! Amazing crisp sound and deep bass. Definetly great buy for any device.
Its ok but bot not worth what you pay for

ReviewTitle: Good wireless buds, worth the purchase
ReviewBody:
A good ol' pro and cons list always gets the job done.

Pros:
- Pretty good sound quality overall
- Responsive touch controls
- Comfortable in ear for a decent amount of time
- Discreate design

Cons:

ReviewTitle: Dont waste your money on these
ReviewBody: The worst headphones I ever had.. sound quality is terrible, call quality is even worse. Noone can hear you scream. Touch button doesn't read you half the time. Even the smallest ear piece is uncomfortable. Does not have sound cancelling at all.
Love it

I love just about everything about these headphones. They sit in my ear and it looks much better than some other brands that protrude. The case is very small and easy to fit in a woman's pocket (very important). Charging is very easy, I use these everyday at work and I've yet to run out of battery. Just pop them back in the case when you're not using the, and you won't either. There are no buttons, everything is touch activated which makes for easy song changes and pauses. My only qualm is that you can't adjust the volume using the headphones. I would rather have volume access than Siri access.
WORK GREAT

Loved the fit feel and adjustability. Loved the controls and the talk function, the ease of connection. So many things to love. Just did not like that the right ear sound went down in about a month or so, more or less.

I've got a iPhone SE, but hate the look and sound quality of the Apple wired earbuds, and since the wireless ones have the same concept, i opted for these instead. I use earbuds for the gym, listen to music and watch video's while working out, so i wanted something that had noise cancelling.. these do that, sorta.. it comes with 3 different size gel tips..i had to put in the large ones, and even then, i have a difficult time getting a seal..so i moisten them before inserting which kinda helps..inserting and removing these are kinda difficult too, since they're 'rounded'..making it hard to grasp with the fingers..once in the ear though, you don't feel them at all! It's quite remarkable..and they stay put very well too. I have had connection issues though even though they are Bluetooth 5.0 and my phone is always in my pocket or no more than 2 feet from me at all times.. i have to go to Bluetooth settings and 'disconnect' them after each use or to reset them while in use, which is a pain in the butt.. the case is smooth and rounded, making it difficult to grasp when in a gym bag.. the battery life is superb though..kudos Samsung for that.. however, there is only one LED to indicate if the earbuds are 'set' in the cases cradle..i'd prefer two LED's, one for each ear bud... how do i know they're both being charged with only one LED? My biggest complain, and something no reviewer addressed (and i watched a ton of video reviews before purchase), is that there is no iOS app for these.. I can't see battery status, change EQ settings, or anything that the Android app can do. Why release a product for one format but not the other? I was assured they are working on one, but couldn't guarantee when it will be available.. I registered them on the Samsung site, indicating my OS in hopes of an alert when the app is available..i was told to keep checking back on the website..Really? For a tech company, that seems pretty prehistoric to me.. without the app, you're get pretty decent sound, although my $19 Anker soundbuds sound better..been a musician my whole life so sound quality is pretty important.. music and quality sound can inspire .. these kinda just are "Meh"...
Had to return because of left ear device randomly started to make a high pitch screeching sound. Hasn't made it again but something is faulty. But I'm returning to get a brand new set.
Very convenient. Easy to use
Good sound quality for the price and the battery life is very impressive.
I would use them for phone and couldn't hear me on the other end.
Worked as advertised.  Worked even better after updates for samsung buds. Price was a little high.

ReviewTitle: Don't buy if you plan on using them to talk on the phone
ReviewBody: I bought these so I can talk on the phone and use them in the gym. I was extremely disappointed at the volume which they produced. And as far as talking on the phone they are absolute garbage. I am very loyal to the Samsung brand. My phone is a Samsung the other Bluetooth headphones I have are also Samsung. I thought these would be a whole lot better than what they turned out to be. I had a $50 pair of cheap earbuds that worked just about the same as these do but the cheap ones were louder.

I've been looking for a nice pair of wireless headphones for the past few months and I believe I have just found the pair I've been looking for. The Galaxy Buds come in a nice sleek case that also acts as the charger, the case feels good in your hands and has a satisfying snap to it when you open and close it. The buds themselves are a good size and feature a removable wing tip to help them stay in your ear. The buds come with 3 different sized tips and two different sized wings as well as an option for no wing to fit your comfort. The actual sound of the earbuds is very good, with my work I have to scrutinize audio a lot so I'm always analyzing the sound of my headphones. The sound isn't perfect, but it is very good for its price point. Some drawbacks to the audio are that the base doesn't kick in fully unless you turn up the audio to near full and at times the audio can sound a little tinny. But again these are very small complaints, overall I am more than happy with these headphones and they are exactly what I've been looking for in a portable wireless pair. On the outside of each bud is also a touch panel allowing you to Play/Pause, Skip and Repeat tracks and also set up custom actions. The pairing process couldn't be easier for them. All you have to do is open up the Samsung Wearable app and it immediately recognizes that they are nearby and assists with the pairing. The app itself is also very handy having some sound equalizer options. Overall I am very happy with my purchase and will definitely be recommending them to my friends.
Received them completely opened and rattling around in the box. Wasn't new and the samsung galaxy buds box was beaten to hell. Dissapointed and confused.

ReviewTitle: The Bluetooth connection is very weak.
ReviewBody:
I purchased these for the sole purpose of wearing them while walking outside.  They work great in the house while your phone is out on a table or in your hand.  While walking, I like to have my phone in my pocket.  These buds lose the connection as soon as they are in your pocket.  If you take the phone out of your pocket and carry it in your hand they work wonderful.  I also called Samsung and talked to them about this issue.  They didn't have a good reason this is happening other than it should'nt do that.
They feel great in your ears and relatively easy to get linked to your phone.
If you have intentions of playing music on them while your phone is completely in your shorts pocket, I WOULD NOT PURCHASE THESE.  YOU WILL BE VERY DISAPPOINTED AS I WAS.  I will be returning them Monday.
Like it a lot.High quality!
Decent fit, and served its purpose.

ReviewTitle: Great size, shape, & fit - poor connection and call quality
ReviewBody:
The good
-These fit great in your ears, do not fall out,  have nice sound for small ear buds, and battery life is pretty good, especially considering the added charge time with the case.

The bad
-Frequent sound breakage between the two ear buds,  terrible call quality. Several people told me it sounds like I'm speaking in to a tin can with a sock in my mouth. Unfortunately software upgrades and tweaking settings in the app did not help this at all. I also frequently encountered the dreaded 'robo-voice' along with poor connection quality with the buds.

Was excited for these things,  however, I had to return them as I kept running in to issues with sound and call quality.

These are great for listening to music but the call quality has some problems. It works a lot of the time but every now and then the call will cut out and the left and right ear buds will become unsynced. I will hear the other person talk in the left ear, then the right ear.

ReviewTitle: Amazing fit, stays in ear, looks both discreet and great
ReviewBody:
Buy these from Samsung's site.

I tried the Jabra Elite and the Apple Airpods, and this is hands down the best. I am frequently stopped on the street and people ask what brand my earbuds are. The Jabra did too good a job of noise cancellation, to the point that it felt so buried into my ear that they started hurting after 2+ hours in. The Airpods just fell right out.

The noise cancellation is okay, and the Hear Through ambient noise is a joke and I never use it.

The case is so small and a joy to hold.

By far these are the best looking, like futuristic bulbs in your ear. I opted for white so it was obvious to others that I had earbuds in. Also so I could easily find them.
awesome earbuds..!!!
I have lots of Bluetooth, I wanted to hear how these would sound, beautiful

ReviewTitle: Great battery life and great for every day use.
ReviewBody: When the galaxy buds debuted I was interested in purchasing them because I was looking to upgrade my current head phones as they were not meeting my everyday needs. Since my phone and smart watch are Samsung products I wanted my new headphones to be the same brand because of simplicity and compatibility. What I mainly use my earbuds for. 1.) Working out 2.) Listing to music 3.) Watching shows on my tablet 4.) Running or walking I’ve had many problems with previous headphones being in my way while working out. Thanks to the galaxy buds I don’t have to worry about annoying cords being in my way. This is a huge plus for me while I work out. The sound quality of the galaxy buds are amazing and don’t have any problems with clarity and also it is very easy to navigate through my music without any problems. While connected to my phone or tablet to watch TV shows and movies they are easily paired to both devices with out to much of a hassle. Another important quality that I look forward to in headphones is the ability to stay in my ear while I go out for a run or jog. They are very comfortable and don’t really cause my ears to hurt or feel any discomfort while I wear them. The Galaxy Buds are a great addition to anyone looking to upgrade there current headphones because I feel that they are a truly remarkable piece of technology that makes certain routines that much better.

ReviewTitle: DONT BUY IF YOU LIVE IN NYC
ReviewBody: They work great inside, but if you are outside or in a place with a lot of wireless signals (NYC/ Train stations) connection sucks to the point where it is unusable.

These were super easy to connect to my galaxy phone and watch. Sound quality is excellent. They look very discreet. The touchpad is neat. The charging case seems to do a very good job of keeping the buds charged.

ReviewTitle: You Will Not Regret Buying These
ReviewBody: When I got these earbuds, they had a few issues. I was considering exchanging them, but samsung is very active with troubleshooting/bug fixes and any issues you might be experiencing will be resolved before you know it. Sound quality is amazing, even at incredibly loud volumes, battery is more than I could use in one sitting, and noise cancellation is decent. With the customization on the app, they've become one of my favorite ways to listen to music ever.

ReviewTitle: They fit and they sound fantastic
ReviewBody:
Tried several different styles of wireless ear buds over time, and I'd just about given up on them as a viable technology. They either fall out of my ears, or sound horrible with static and popping, or both.

The Samsung Galaxy buds have three different size rubber fittings for two different parts of the devices - the ear tips and wings, ensuring that you can find the correct fit so they won't fall out. The sound quality is amazing, with five different equalizer settings. No scratching, popping, or snapping at all.

Add to that they are very small, no more looking like the Star Trek Communications officer with a monster thing sticking out of your ear. Touchpads are configurable, allowing you to turn volume up and down or use voice commands, for example.

All in all, these are amazing devices and the first pair I've had actually worth owning.
Game changing headphones for the Samsung world!! Love em!

ReviewTitle: Ignoring your kids has never been easier
ReviewBody: These are great! My kids will talk to me, and I see their mouths move but I hear NOTHING ! 10/10 would buy again.

I've been using them for over a month now and I use them everyday and I'm a electrician and use them as ear plugs. They last for around 4-6 hours. I notice that the volume will go up if I use different apps while I'm listening to music or books.
Excelente producto! No era muy fan de estos dispositivos, pero en las dos semanas que tengo usándolos, me encantan! Tengo un S10+ y funcionan muy bien!

ReviewTitle: Ok for calls really good battery and sound
ReviewBody: When in a call, I've been told at time that my voice sounds muffled when near or around loud noises. Other than that for music and battery life is really good.
I love them all the way around very comfortable to wear sound is amazing easy to use and i use mine every day ..

ReviewTitle: Good for the price, leaves room for improvement
ReviewBody:
I have had these for a while now, and I also have a pair of the Bose Soundsport Free. If someone could find a way to merge these two products, I would be much happier.

The good:
-Battery life is actually quite good. I have yet to have the battery level warn me it was low, despite heavy use.
-You can use either headphone solo or together. A limitation of the Bose Soundsport Free is you need to use the right headphone, but cannot use the left headphone solo. The Samsung wins on that one feature.
- The charging case is small, easy to toss in a pocket and not notice. The case charges the headphones quickly.
-The "find my earbud" feature is excellent. It makes a loud chirping sound that is easy to hear across the room. The only way to improve it would be to add a sharp finish to the sound  at the end to help your ear focus on location.
-The profile when wearing it is the best I have seen on a completely wireless headphones. They fit snugly and have lots of sizing options.

The Bad
-They have an very limited range. Maybe 15' with clear line of sight.  Putting my phone in my left pocket while using only the right earbud leads to a choppy signal, at best. With the Bose, I can go 35' away with walls between my phone and the earbud and have clear, crisp sound. The shorter distance with the reception is probably something that helps the battery life on the Samsung over the Bose, but can be irritating.
-The sound quality is mediocre. Especially compared to the Bose. Acceptable for the gym and most activities, but if you are an audiophile, you will be frustrated with the sound quality.

Summary-
Solid package. I use them more than the Bose. The case is smaller, the individual earbuds can be used independently of the other, and the battery life if much better. The earphone block noise well, are intuitive, and fit well. The signal strength leaves A LOT to be desired. It is my biggest gripe, but not a deal breaker.

I love the look and feel to the Galaxy Buds. Definitely lasts way longer than the airpods I had which die within an hour and a half of use. These are perfect for what I need and look a lot better than the airpods.

ReviewTitle: Audio quality is pretty good, but mic quality is horrible.
ReviewBody:
I got these soon after my purchase of my Samsung Galaxy S10+, and while the audio quality of the ear buds is pretty good, the voice microphone quality is terrible.  I bought these to do conference calls while mobile and unless I'm in listen-only mode, these would be a total failure.

I haven't used them since.

ReviewTitle: Doesn't work properly with iPhone. Buggy
ReviewBody:
My first ever wireless earbuds. Will be returning them and buying maybe trying another wireless ear bud set next. I charged them fully. Been using them for almost 4 hours now with my iPhone Xs Max. I know they're made for Samsung devices, but they're also advertised as being iOS compatible. 3 times now the left ear bud would stop working and play this constant loud buzzing sound like some mutant roided mosquito buzzing in your ear and it won't stop until I put them back in the wireless charging case for a minute or two. Not an instant fix. Just had them on for a 2.5 hour work out at the gym. It happened there twice, and again since getting home. Seems to happen on occasion, all 3 times, when a text message or Facebook messenger notification comes in.

Not acceptable. Will return them. I will say this though. The sound quality is nice, and my paranoia about them falling out of my ear has been squashed. I at first almost tried to get them to fall out, but they wouldn't! haha. Leaning over to the side for a minute. Hanging upside down for 30 seconds at the gym. 4 minute planks. I can feel the gentle tug of gravity on the buds as I got in various positions, but they didn't fall out. Not even once! I hope this helps!

It seems like I'll be returning them, HOWEVER....I use both the iPhone Xs Max, and Galaxy Note 8. Maybe I'll keep them for another 2-4 days and see if this same bug, with the loud buzzing happens on my Galaxy Note 8. If not....I MIGHT keep them for the long haul as I'll be upgrading to the Galaxy Note 10 where I can wireless charge them with that device. :)

So far, big thumbs down from my usage with my iOS device. I'll e-mail Samsung about the problem and see what they have to say.

Update. Got these on May 12 2019. Today, June 27th 2019, they no longer work properly. Super quiet in the right ear bud.
These are the perfect ear buds. They have great quality sound. The battery lasts with no charge needed for an entire day. Works well for music and talking on the phone.
These fit great, sound great, and have great battery life.  Also, people often do not even notice that they are there.  Not nearly as obnoxious looking as other wireless bluetooth headphones.

I'm not going to talk about audio in this review as I'm sure someone has given a more detailed explanation, I'll just say they sound much better than JVC gummy buds, I never knew you could get so much bass in something so small, just make sure you activate the wearable boost, with that said I'll just talk about areas that need improvement:

No dedicated volume control -no two ears are the same, but I think they could've put a small sensitive button on top edge of each bud so you could change the volume. This makes sense at least with my ears.

Charging case lid is sharp -at first you don't really notice it until you start to see little rough patches on your thumb, I had to sand down the lid to deal with this, so the next version make the edge softer

Find my buds - This feature flawed, if anything touches the bud's "in-ear dectors" it will refuse to beep, which made it impossible to find the buds using this feature when they got lost in my blanket. I get that it's a safety feature, but you should be able to force it after being warned.

The Samsung Galaxy Buds are a great set of ear buds. They offer solid sound while keeping them small and compact. They charge in a wonderful little black case. The case also charges wireless which works great with the Samsung wireless charger I use on my desk already. You can use one at a time or both. So far I've tried them listening to music and placing some phone calls, both sound great and clear. I tried the music and the calls using one ear bud and both. The ear buds over all are pretty comfortable in the ear and aren't terribly noticeable. The first time i used them i thought the volume was very quite, even with my phone volume completely turned up. I found these have an internal volume and just needed to be turned up. There is a nice app you can use to configure the buds to how you want them. I configured the touch button on the ear bud to adjust volume and simply just turned it up. The touch button can be used to play/pause music, answer/hang up phone calls, and skip and go back on music tracks, all in addition to the volume control i mentioned above. The pair with the phone was very simply. All i did was open up the app and tell it I had some ear buds. I can't wait to try these at different opportunities coming up this summer. So far i give the product a 5 star review as i haven't found anything negative about them.
I like the sound
All around best wireless earphones I have ever owned, for a great price! Much better than the Apple Airpods, no question!
I am still in debate about keeping them. Some of my calls don't come out so clear on the right side but I love Samsung.

DISCLAIMER: I purchased the headset outside of Amazon.

Pros:
None

Cons:
- Very hard to fit, unlike the other headsets. I have a copycat headset of Huawaie (copy of Apple ones) and they fit perfectly and quickly. With this one, it takes 10 seconds-20 seconds to fit them and on top of that they don't fit in the ear
- the app is useless of no value
- The price is way overpriced. There are several headsets that are cheaper and better

Random buzzing. Need to reset. Sound quality is similar to the $35 soundpeats I had when the buds aren't buzzing.

People I talk with now complain about all the background noise these transmit. Not good for phone calls.

The app has zero regard for personal privacy. It's obscene. That's something you find out after the purchase.

Annoyingly takes over your music app. App resets not remembering it was setup. Need to reaffirm the lack of privacy or nothing works.

I'd like to return them.

The sound isn't bad for truly wireless earbuds.
My earbuds have pretty annoying connectivity issues with the Bluetooth dongle I have for my PC, but I'm going to try a different dongle before I judge them on that.
If your planning on watching many TV/Movies with them I would pass. They have some of the highest latency of all the wireless earbuds at 320ms and they don't feature the aptX low latency audio codec (unless you're exclusively streaming from a Samsung phone which apparently uses a lower latency audio codec). This translates to a very noticeable delay between peoples lips and the actual sound.
The earbuds are relatively comfortable. After 4-5 hours of having them in I do sometimes experience enough discomfort that it's obnoxious. Oddly enough, smiling or laughing while they're in can be pretty uncomfortable.

I would only recommend these if you're planning on using them exclusively (or at least mainly) for music during a workout or listening to podcasts around the house.

You definitely need to get an equalizer on your phone and break down for a premium song servive with HD streaming. That is when you will know how bad ass these buds are. You have to download the  Samsung wear app to control the volume through the buds. I have full volume on the watch and can't turn it down. So if you have any device that you can't control the volume on and can't download the app these are not for you. I had to send mine back.

They were comfortable enough once I got the right size fittings on them, but I returned them due to sound issues.

ReviewTitle: Samsung Galaxy Buds vs Bose SoundSport Free vs Jabra Elite Active 65t
ReviewBody:
I tried these 3 sets of buds side by side.
The decision really boiled down to one key feature for me: fit.

Jabra:
These simply would not stay in my ear.  Ive got friends that swear by them, but the left bud just kept falling out (Im sure the unique shape of everyone's ears has a big role to play here).  I really wanted to like these buds as they were the highest rated based on my research, but if they can't stay in, their purpose is defeated.
I liked the app, the different sound modes, and the ability to customize how much ambient noise was let through.
Their controls, however, were by far the most fiddly to work with: I found myself pressing down very hard on the right bud (to the point of hurting my ear) trying to find the button.
If Jabra made a wingtip attachment for these, they would be SO much better.

Bose:
Bose's unique wingtips give a comfortable fit, but cause the buds to protrude from the ear far more from the other 2.  They also don't sit as deep into the ear canal as the other 2.  As a result, they let in FAR more ambient noise.  As I'd be using these primarily when doing outdoor yard work, sound isolation was important and these just didnt work for me.
Buttons were better than the Jabra's, but I found I had to grab the entire right bud to stabilize it when trying to push a button.

Samsung:
These were the perfect combination of what I was looking for.  A bud that fit deep in the ear canal to provide good sound isolation, but also came with wingtips to provide a secure fit.  I actually really like the touch controls: you can't perform quite as many functions as you could with the controls of the other brands, but I found it met my needs.

I didn't do a side by side comparison of sound quality because the fit essentially made my decision for me.

The charging case is small enough to carry around in your pocket and the battery life is good enough.

Microphone is okay. But not good.

ReviewTitle: You have to pick volume up down or voice assistant
ReviewBody: Very good product how ever you have to choose  between voice assistant  or being able to control your volume up and down

ReviewTitle: Better off with Airpods or Bose
ReviewBody: After using these earbuds for a few days I am severely disappointed. The sound volume is ok at best but varies if you are listening to pandora or itunes. The sound quality is poor, it has issues with static sound randomly, no bass, and loses connection momentarily even though the phone is 2 feet away. Id spend the extra money and just go with the Airpods or Bose wireless ear buds
My 14 year old bought these with his birthday money and loves them! They sound and cancel background noise great! He doesn't have to listen to his 3 year old brother throwing a fit anymore!

ReviewTitle: Definitely will buy again if need be.
ReviewBody: Got this for my our Son for his 12th bday and hasn't taken them off since . He was ecstatic to get these . Great quality and cute in size
The sound quality is good but not loud enough.  I bought it to use it during workouts and I can hear my surroundings all the time. And the Samsung bud application inst available for iOS.

ReviewTitle: For indoor use only. Connectivity issues.
ReviewBody: I own two pairs of the Galaxy buds. Indoors, the are acceptable, probably because the bluetooth signal bounces around. However, if you plan to use these outdoors and you don't want to duct tape your phone next to your ear, these WILL cut out...constantly. Both pair work identically.  I thought it might be because of their most recent software update, so on the second pair I didn't let it update until after I tested with them. They worked the same disappointing way. I put my S10+ in developer mode and tried every Bluetooth codec available. They went from bad to worse, sometimes cutting out so long I thought my music paused. I previously paid around $25 for a cheap Chinese no-name in-ear wireless headset and they almost never cut out. Shame on you Samsung!

I know is entirely subjective, but I have had an enormously difficult time getting these earbuds to consistently stay in my ear. I've tried each of the different rubber molds that comes with them, but they all end up loose and I find myself constantly pushing them back into my ear.
The sound quality is good and I haven't had any battery life issues. The only other issue I've had, and seems to be rather common for some folks, is having to repair the left earbud occasionally. The left ear bud will cease to link to my phone, and I've had to jump through a few hoops to re-link it.

ReviewTitle: This product is a MUST buy
ReviewBody: Love these earbuds!!!! They're great for work, when I hit the gym, and whenever I want to just zone out and listen to my favorite tunes

I'm always hesitant when it comes to buying earbuds and headphones over $100 but I got these in the mail today and they are definitely worth the price. I've been using my Level U for like two years but I've finally lost all of the rubber earbud covers and they're falling apart anyways so I decided it was time to buy some new ones.

It was decidedly easy to buy these as they are some of the cheapest truly wireless earbuds by a major technologies company out there (I've had mixed success buying off-brand earbuds) and I already have a Samsung phone so I thought it would just work out better. FYI It did!

It's so great to not mess with wires anymore but the one earbud at a time feature is another plus. I know that one of the major complaints is the sound quality, but I haven't seen many issues with it. For $130 the sound is incredible with decent bass. I think some people may expect Harman Kardon or Sennheiser level quality but then go out and buy one of their products then!

You will definitely notice these sit in your ear but with the different sized rubber rings and earpieces, it shouldn't be uncomfortable. That's the tradeoff for the tight fitting secure fit I guess. It does an amazing job canceling out external sound when both are in. One note is that the ambient sound feature does sound tinny in a smaller room because it picks up everything and does leave something to be desired.

Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and can't wait to try them out on a run now that the weather is nice again.
They look sleek and they sound amazing

These are amazing. Great sound quality (especially since i use them with a galaxy phone), battery  lasts all day, durable, and the charging case is feels durable. At first it was a but uncomfortable  but i did get used to them and now they feel good and don't usually fall out. I've tried all three of the fins that came with the earbuds but i went back to the medium size fins. In cases when I have lost track on them, I can find them thanks to a feature where the earbuds make a loud chirping sound (I think its only  accessible with a Samsung device but I am not sure)

overall, great earbuds, took some getting used to, battery life long enough to last me all day (with some charging in the case) and will usually stay in my ear.

Sadly the product does not work as advertised on my one+ 6t,which is an android phone. They worked well the first time I connected them, but after that the sound doesn't pass from the phone to the earphones. Buggy software, but not acceptable from someone like Samsung nowadays. And I was so excited about these, that's why I'm so deeply dissapointed.

As soon as they were opened, earbuds synced with phone. Works very well. Great sound quality and excellent better life.
However, I took off one star because you can't control the volume from the buds themselves.

Pros great earbuds and nice features if you have a samsung galaxy and excellent noise cancellation and bass is punchy.

Cons not waterproof really wish they were though.
Great

When used for phone calls, the sound quality for the other party is so horrible that they ask me to not use the earbuds when on a phone call with them.
The earbuds also lack the software codec necessary for low latency when used for the audio when watching shows on a smart television, which means the dialogue does not match with the actors' mouth movements.
great quality

ReviewTitle: Better iOS support will make these earbuds 6 stars!
ReviewBody: The Samsung Galaxy Earbuds are everything wonderful as advertised.  However, I feel like the red headed stepchild left out of all the really helpful and useful information constantly referred to as the Samsung Wearable App for the Galaxy Earbuds.  Unavailable for the iPhone, so all of that is simply unavailable for us disadvantaged iPhone users.  Having said that pairing was simple and uncomplicated.  But what is that pesky, constantly recurring tone I keep hearing in the left earbud even when 100% charged.  Impossible to get answers from Samsung because, you guessed it, their knowledge base is an impenetrable Chinese firewall when it comes to iOS.  I'll continue to enjoy using these since they are heads above the Apple AirPods.  Maybe Apple will get with it and come up with something like these.

ReviewTitle: Several bugs that need to be ironed out, save your money.
ReviewBody: The battery life last quite awhile. Unfortunately the only plus I can give these. The sensitivity to tap the buds to have them go back and forward in songs can get difficult. Also, if you have your phone in your pocket when taking a call or especially working out at the gym, your call and music are filled with static, disruptions & constant skipping. I'm now regretting my purchase as there are several issues that I could've waited a few generations for Samsung to iron out. Save your money.

ReviewTitle: Very nice wireless buds; not sure they are better than the IconX buds
ReviewBody:
So let me set the scene, I have both the IconX(2018) and just got my new black Galaxy Buds yesterday. I have had the IconX's for about a year now. So let me run though my list.

1. This is easily the best part of these buds: they are SUPER COMFORTABLE! I almost can't even tell they are there. I have been wearing them for hours (part of that time with a beanie on and part without). They are simply a joy to wear. A big upgrade from the IconX comfort which plenty to be desired. Also the fit on these exceed the IconX. I have a weird left ear canal and shape and never could get the IconX's quite right but the galaxy buds work perfectly. So if fit and comfort are the most important things to you then I highly recommend these.

2. Sound Quality - It's about the same as the IconX's despite being "tuned" by AKG. Volume is roughly the same. If the IconX's volume got an 8, I would say the galaxy buds get to 7.75. Bass is good enough as is treble. The mids are alright too; I'm not a huge audiophile but they sound very nice.

3. Noise Isolation - top notch; they filter out sound quite well. I will say the ambient sound feature on them is CRAP compared to the IconX's; the IconX's ambient sound was much better. If you care about that sort of thing.

4. Touch Response - its very touchy. If you press too quick it'll only register the first tap. So you have to slow down a bit and I don't like that cause the IconX's didn't need that. Plus remember that they removed the swipe up/down for volume controls (which I hate that they did that) so you are stuck with a tap and hold (right bud does volume up and left does volume down and NOPE you cannot remap this).

5. Software - IconX is winner here. They removed the tap and hold and it would cycle through your list of available options (like ambient sound on/off, voice command, start workout, etc) but as mentioned above they removed the swipe for volume. This is a huge step back Samsung.

6. Connectivity - I keep my phone in my front left pocket and my IconX's would very rarely disconnect/crackle for a moment or two. The Galaxy buds do it every single time I turn my head in any direction. I moved my phone to my jacket pocket and that essentially fixed it. That isn't viable for year round though; I hope Samsung fixes this with a software update as this is crap.

7. Battery - it's fine; but overall the IconX's would last longer in the long run as its case held more of a charge. However, the wireless charging case is nice. But I was fine with just the wired USB-C charging of the IconX's.

8. Long term frustrations - I cannot say as I haven't had the buds very long however the IconX's had this super annoying problem where ear wax would sneak its way into the canal of the bud and block most sound. You had to take off the screen, clean the canal, and replace with a new screen (thankfully supplied by Samsung in abundance). I don't think the GB's will have this issue but that remains to be seen. They don't include a repair kit with these so I'm assuming they don't expect it to happen.

9. They removed the internal 4gb of storage. Why Samsung, I used the heck out of that. I love going out for a run/jog and not have to take my phone OR smartwatch. I would pay for that; I think others would too.

With the removal of the volume swipe, the tap and hold scroll through list, lesser battery and sound that isn't any better than last year's model I'd have a hard time recommending these over the IconX model. The comfort, fit, smaller size, wireless charging case, and multiple color options are about the only things the new buds have going for them. I love Samsung products but this one isn't as good as I hoped it would be. It isn't bad either. YMMV.

ReviewBody:
I'm so upset, I wish I could give zero stars. I don't usually write reviews but I have to warn purple about this.

When I ordered this product something happened and Amazon told me the product was damaged so it couldn't be delivered. I reordered the product, and it came through overnight shipping for free. That was kind of weird at first but I was just excited to have own earbuds.

Two days after buying this product the left earbuds started making a terrible screeching sound and it didn't stop. It made that sound until it apparently died off. Right now only the right earbuds works. I am so upset right now. PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT

ReviewTitle: I wish I could rate the actual product
ReviewBody: I've had a horrible migraine since I opened this amazon box last night at 7PM. As of writing this, its noon the next day. For whatever reason, this product was doused in cheap cologne. My eyes literally watered when I opened this package, I had to take the entire box and set it outside on my deck. I can STILL smell it. Imagine missing work because you bought earbuds on amazon. ReviewTitle: Never fall out of my ears.
ReviewBody: Never fall out and sound awesome.

With my Samsung Galaxy S8+ they work seamlessly(they are airpods but for the galaxy). Also they do have really good noise cancelling. I enjoy listening music on the way to and back from work on subway and bus.  Good enough sound cancellation (if you are using the right tips). ReviewBody:
Overall from design and sound perspective even up to the charging case these have great fit and function. However when you try to make a phone call half the time folks say you sound too distant or muffled.

I bought these hoping they would be a good upgrade from my beats headset but the microphone just doesn't work as well as it should.

Maybe overime through software they can fix the issue.

ReviewTitle: Great But... The Battery Life Is Problematic
ReviewBody: I love the ear buds. They're good quality, good noise blocking, and super comfortable in my ears with lots of customizable features... but unfortunately after only about a month, the right bud has an issue with the battery draining to nothing while the left remains at 100%. The charging case itself also has some power issues and constantly needs plugged in or placed on a charging pad because it can't produce its own charging power to the buds. Regardless, I could have it plugged in for hours and the right bud won't get above 50% while the left is full. Customer service just wants to pass my problem around from representative to representative without even knowing what to do to fix it. Great product save the battery issue... I assume they've worked on it with the newer models but regardless, buying through Amazon has been less than ideal as Samsung would have honored the replacement warranty without question or handing off my concern to the next person if I had ordered through fire directly. After only a little over a single month I'm less than impressed.

ReviewTitle: Fit really good and stay put,sounded good but just now my left bud quit working.
ReviewBody: I bought these back in April. I use mainly when I am riding my rode bike on long rides. I normally put one in and leave one out for safety reasons. I also wear these at work at times. Just recently my left ear bub has completely quit working. Hopefully I can get it warrantied and this is just a one time issue. I was ready to give these a 5 star rating but I cannot now.

ReviewTitle: Awesome wireless headphones, a must for Galaxy phone users!
ReviewBody: I did a lot of research before purchasing these and was torn between these and the Jabra Elite 65t. I have to say I am very happy with my decision, these things are awesome! Great sound quality (highly recommend switching them to Dynamic sound in the app). I wear that at work in an office and can wander all over with my phone on my desk and still have clear crisp music. Love that you can just wear one if you need to. Great noise cancellation! Tap controls are nice and easy once you get the hang of them, and love that they are customizable. Only thing that isn't as good as I expected is the ambient sound... I can hear it quiet down some when I talk but not as much as I thought it would... I just tap my earbud to pause my music if I need to talk to someone though, not that big of a deal. Great product and I highly recommend them if you have a Samsung Galaxy phone!
Love that you can alternate between both sides one at a time!

I never even turn my volume over half way up because of my past experiences. I seriously want another pair but I am very nervous to spend my money again on something that will just stop working after a few days. Really disappointed with these.

The main con I can think of is that I wish they were a bit louder. ReviewTitle: Can you hear your music now? NO!
ReviewBody: Worse speakers EVER. That's right. I have bought cheap 5 dollar headphones that blow this out of the water. The range of bluetooth is terrible.  If you are more then a few feet away the thing skips out. Oh and what ever you do don't have your phone in your pocket cause it will disconnect and lag out. The amazing feature of hearing ambient noise is garbage! They still have to yell for these things to pick them up. One full day of use and these are better in the garbage than in anyone's ear. I had the first generation of Samsung buds. They were amazing and loved them. They broke. So i figured I would stick with same brand. But instead of a upgrade I got downgraded. So save your money and buy a cheap set of earbuds cause they will be a 100 times better then this weak sauce
I have had problems with other tws earbuds. But these have been able to exceed my expectations.

ReviewTitle: I enjoy 'em, but there are plenty of other options
ReviewBody: Comes with multiple tips that allow you to change sizes of inner and outer ear.  Problem is, I'm between the largest and 2nd largest one, so it's either too tight, or slightly loose on my ear.  For the most part, they sound amazing.  I can barely hear the office around me at work, which is great.  Downside, occasionally there is interference, or a glitch type sound where volume seems to jump up and down for a split second, and sounds kinda digital.  Also, as far as sound quality goes, the dynamic pass through is crap, still have to pop em out to talk to coworkers.  Phone call quality is great, but it picks up A LOT of wind.  Wife kept complaining about it, but I couldn't hear the wind on my end.  They also have a matte finish that tends to show earwax, and dust/crumbs, whatever the heck gets on them when you put them down.  Lots of stuff sticks to them, and you'll start seeing earwax in your charge case as well. even if you wipe them off briefly before returning them to their case.  The real value with these buds is obviously using them with other  Galaxy products.  when i open the case, instantly pairs to my phone, same with my wife's phone, seamless.  App is really simple to use, and very informative.  One improvement would be if the app showed the actual charge of the case as well as the buds.  At the moment it only shows the charge of the buds themselves, case is shown by a light that turns on when you close it (green yellow or red).  Also connects to my Windows 10 laptop seamlessly, but has a little sound lag on videos.  Very hard to notice.  All in all, I like em, but look into other options if you really need pass through, or don't have a Galaxy phone.

These Samsung Galaxy Buds produce an amazing sound despite being battery powered. The charge lasts all day for me and the volume is really strong. I am also a huge fan of the noise cancellation and the voice booster technology. I wore them in a crowded noisy poker room and they eliminated the background noise while highlighting the voices in around the table. I felt like a spy ;). The case is nice and small and also acts as a charger, so you can recharge your buds on the go. It fits nicely in any pants pocket and doesn't stick out. These easily pair with any bluetooth device. I am using them not only with my phone, but also laptops and my desktop PC. They are very attractive looking and I had a couple people ask me about them since they don't look like the regular apple buds. All in all, these are a 5 star product and I am very happy with my purchase.
Amazing! Waaay better fit than the 2018 model. Saved a lot of money buying from you guys!!! Thank you for the great product
