As we all know, the Galaxy Buds are generally for the convenience. Right out of the box, they hook up via Bluetooth to your smartphone right away.

The build quality is great, the convenience to connect is great, but the main draw back to these is the sound quality. The max volume is very low and the sound quality opposed to the pricing of $130, well, not so great.

If you're generally buying these in hopes of the sound quality being amazing due to the price tag, then move on and find something else. The sound quality on these is on par with a wired $30 skull Candy earbuds. Not impressed at all. Will be returning for my money back.

ReviewTitle: Unusable for calling, decent sound for music
ReviewBody: Call quality is unbearably bad. People cannot hear me even when I'm in a quiet, isolated room. Additionally, the person I'm calling's voice is choppy. Lately the headphones are not even connecting to my phone automatically. The software was the reason I got the Samsung product for my Samsung phone... Unacceptable.

At every purchase, I look for a reason to dismiss Amazon because of the fact that they have hit or miss customer service. 1. Amazon did not dissapoint on delivery.  2. The buds were a gamble. 3. After updating the software and fitting the buds, I can't complain.

At first, I was sceptical on the low range of sound, but honestly they're just good.

The mid and high are great off the rip.

Bass took boost from the wear app, but it is genuinely solid. We tried some Dr. Dre, some Clint Mansell, Halsey, Madonna, and GoT theme.

Fitted and ready, these are very nice.  They aren't going to blow out your skull, though.

My wife and I paired them almost simultaneously without hiccups and also sang together without a hitch.

The very best completely wireless headset we have experienced.
I purchased my earbuds they worked great for a while but they just stopped working not sure what the issue is.

ReviewTitle: Call Quality need to be improved, but fixed all gear iconX 2018 problems.
ReviewBody: Overall better than any of the buds on market(airpods standards best)

I love these! Battery lasts me longer than expected, loving the touch feature and how I can have one on while one charges or I need one ear open. If you think they sound very low just go to touch pad, and edit settings to increase the volume on them separately from your device! Thought they were broken but it was jut volume settings! Love them and can't get enough of them. Not a single complaint or issue either! I've had them for 2 weeks now and still can't get enough of them! Recommended!!!
Great in ear wireless ear buds.  Great sound with great options.  Easy to set up and easy to pair with phone.  Comes with multiple size ear pieces so the fit snugly and comfortably.

ReviewTitle: Good if they were cheaper. For the price I can't recommend them.
ReviewBody: They can do the job but for the price, you can get much better.
This are amazing and I love them. The only issues i have with these is that when i got samsung.com to register them, the serial number says it's invalid and I can't register them.....

These are awful. An abomination to the Samsung line. I should have paid attention to the negative reviews

The things everyone was right about:
Terrible sound
Incredibly low volume
Awful microphone

No one could hear me on these and I could not dial them up enough to drown out noise.

Two things few people complained about was falling out of their ears (which happened to me within 30 minutes of working out), and having to install software. The software wants access to everything on your phone (contacts, GPS, network, messaging, call log) everytime I disconnected bluetooth and reconnected without having first put the buds back in the case, my S10+ would auto redownload the software. WHHHYYYYYY??!!!! I dont have to do that with any other bluetooth headphones.

The only positive is that these can be charged wirelessly from your phone.

For $150 you can grab some off brand Amazon buds and a pair of Powerbeats 3.

Avoid this product at all costs and save your money

(NOTE: Bought from BestBuy and not Amazon)

ReviewTitle: Connects to only one device at a time.
ReviewBody: I had no problem connecting to my Samsung Note 8; however connecting to my Ipod 6 was a problem. With the help from Geek Squad we found that the buds would work only if Bluetooth was disconnected on the phone. I haven't tried to connect to my tablets yet. Hope this helps.

These Galaxy Buds are everything!! I currently use Beats corded ear buds that constantly fall out of my ears. These Galaxy buds fit so snug and comfy. The sound quality is stellar and these buds are super easy to use. The Galaxy Wearable app is easy to use to set your bud preferences. You can volume up/down, change songs, answer phone calls and I especially like the ambient sound option, I use this at work so I can still hear my office phone ring or hear someone calling my name while listening to music. I have my left bud set to volume down and the right bud set up for volume up. The "find my earbuds" option is super helpful if your buds find themselves lost....on the app you can click this and the buds will start chirping like a lost baby birdie, and gradually gets louder. Even though these buds pair well with my Google Pixel 2XL ,unfortunately I don't have the type of phone for wireless charging but for now I will charge these buds the old fashioned way, with the charging cord :)
Product works great. Love the speed it connect to the phone. The sound quality is great for the price as well.

ReviewTitle: Very good quality, only a few cons
ReviewBody:
Pros:
Don't stick out of ear much at all
Good sound quality (using Galaxy S8)
Good battery life in both buds & case

Cons:
Mic is low quality and muffled (as I expected anyways) according to people I have talked to while using them
Earbuds sound low quality and each bud sounds incorrectly synced together when I connect them to my Asus laptop

ReviewTitle: Save your money, do your research and I wish you goodluck.
ReviewBody:
2 Tin cans on a string!😫

I tried to like these but the sound quality made it difficult to listen and follow along with my podcasts and still focus my work and other tasks.

Next time I'm trying thr Sennheiser Momentum Earbuds.  Sound is supposed to be amazing!

ReviewTitle: Great for short flights or limited use.  Comfort undesirable for full battery life use.
ReviewBody: Lacks in-ear comfort.  But are compact, have good battery life, and integrate almost seamlessly with Samsung phone and watch.
Love the fit. Love being able to walk away from my phone and continue to listen to music. Phone call listening is good, although the people I'm calling say I sound funny.

These earbuds are garbage.. I bought into the hype.. Sound quality is garbage. Music has no bass. Call quality is subpar to say the lease. Several people told me I sounded like I was talking underwater... Samsung needs to cut ties with AKG.... Gonna put these up on offerup
This is good with s10+ but when I speak to someone they cant hear me very well
I have noise cancelling headphones.  I have corded earbuds.  These dont even compare.  If you have any shortcomings with any other listening experiences toss em out and give these a try.
Great product
Absolutely FANTASTIC. I wasnt going to leave a review, but Amazon wouldnt stop bugging me on every platform possible, so here you go.
I've had people complain they cant hear me when there is a lot of back ground noise. Other than that there great.
Great quality audio and very comfortable
Super sound quality I just wish the battery lasted longer, and the microphone has a hard time picking up my voice when I'm outside on the phone.
They sound great on my end. When I talk to other people on the phone they complain that it sounds like a chainsaw in the background.. maybe just my pair.

ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for.
ReviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. People who say they're not loud enough must be doing something wrong. Paired with my note 9 flawlessly.

ReviewTitle: Good sound quality, but really awful connectivity.
ReviewBody:
Although I have not purchased my buds through Amazon, I believe it's necessary to write a review so I can warm customers.

You see, I got two pairs.  One came with my pre-order of the Galaxy S10+. The second pair were purchased after I thought I had lost my buds.

Both have some annoying connectivity issues. I swear they are terrible for a brand like Samsung and for the price of 130 dollars.  The sound is alright, the noise cancellation is ok, but only because the buds are thick enough and they are not open ended.  Meaning noise doesn't really leak.

Moreover, microphone quality is awful. Passable sometimes, but terrible when in a noisy environment.

Lastly, hear me out.  You don't want to get this buds.  They have horrible connectivity issues.  I mean horrible to the point of sound stuttering even when my phone is in my pocket.  I can't even go out for a walk without the audio cutting every minute.

The device has received multiple firmware updates. But so far the issues have not been solved.

For that reason, I would not adviced people to get these earbuds.
Excellent

I tested the new Samsung Galaxy Buds for an extensive period. I wanted to test the functionality of the headphones at home, work, and in between. I was really surprised at the sound quality. I did not expect such a broad range of sound from such a little device. The paring process was really simple while using the Galaxy S10. My phone recognized the buds as soon as I opened the charging case. Then I opened the Galaxy Wearable app and I was notified of an update for the buds immediately. I must say that the Galaxy buds are comfortable and stay in ear while walking, jogging or running. I didn’t experience the normal ear soreness from extended usage as with some other headphones. While listening to music, the Galaxy buds did a good job of removing background noise. I couldn’t hear much of my surroundings at all. Then, I tested the Ambient Aware feature while at work, and this was really useful. Most people did not recognize that I even had headphones in. The Ambient Aware feature allowed me to hear my surroundings by using the built in mic on the headphones. Portability is also a big plus. Being able to pop the Galaxy buds in and out and having a charging case is a useful tool to have. The charging case is vital at work too. I can get about 5 hours of music listening before having to charge the buds. The coolest feature is having the ability to charge the case and the Galaxy buds. I can get through a whole 9 hour office day having to charge the buds for a few minutes a day. Overall, I recommend the Galaxy Buds for anyone who wants a premium sound from affordable headphones.
Sound good. They are so light weight, Barely notice them in ear.
If you have a Samsung phone, buy these buds... You won't regret it!

ReviewTitle: Very practical headphones, bad sound quality
ReviewBody: they are very nice and practical headphones! very comfortable to wear and look cool, sound quality and volume is pretty bad honestly, battery life is so so
Work great with Samsung phone.  Really liked the earbuds when I first tried them.  Then I swapped out the tips with another pair in the box and got even better audio quality.

ReviewTitle: I didn’t care for them and returned them.
ReviewBody:
Disclaimer: I like my Apple Air Pods.
There are definite minuses to both the Apple and Samsung ear pods. But I can live with the shortcomings of the Air Pods over these.

Things I did not like:

Fit: you have to twist them into your ear to get a solid fit, then there is the irritation (for me at least) of having something closing off your ear canal.

Sound: Was decent but not as good as I was expecting from pods that seal off your ear. I messed with all the sound settings and couldn’t get what I wanted.

Functions: The ambient surrounding setting did not work. Once music was playing I couldn’t hear anything around me. Music off you could tell the microphones were picking up sounds from around you but that seemed more like I had hearing aids in than anything.

I really wanted these pods to work for me, I had an open mind due to the feature of being able to charge wirelessly, hear things around you and they look sleek. In the end they didn’t hit all the marks to warrant the price tag.  Maybe in rev 2

After reading the reviews of this product, I  honestly don't think a lot of people understand the difference between wireless earbuds and full over-ear wireless cans. Huge difference. Having said that, these wireless buds are a "best of breed" product. I have a Samsung S10 and these pair perfectly with that phone. The app is great. Very easy to set up and use. They are extremely comfortable and can be worn for extended periods of listening. The sound quality is really, very good. I listen to a variety of music - admittedly not hip hop, and the depth of these buds is excellent. Bass is good - not thumping. Mids are spot on and the highs are clear without being shrill or tinny. Volume is loud. The maximum level will not make your ears bleed, but it's plenty loud. Noise cancelling is good - not great, but good is still "good". They do not compare to high end, over-ear head phones. They cost way less than high end head phones. So my verdict is; this is a great earbud for the price and a "must have" if you own one of the new Samsung smartphones.

ReviewTitle: Perfect for music, really bad for calls
ReviewBody: GREAT sound quality for music, and they stay firmly in place during runs. HORRIBLE microphone quality, after several people complained about me sounding low/muffled I recorded myself in a quiet setting and it sounded as if I was talking from a microphone I had placed on the other side of the room.

It is the best to use under the motorcycle helmet as it doesn't go outside the ears so it doesn't obstruct the helmet sliding on the head, also the sound is very good and it can be used with iPhone without any issues.
I enjoyed using it while riding my motorcycle.
The real deal

I like the design and ease of use overall, I like the fact that they're a Samsung accessory so the ease of connectivity and interaction is great. I like the TouchPad taps in order to answer/hang up or reject a call as well as raise or lower the volume.

They're great aside from one major flaw that Samsung can't seem to fix. I got mine about a month ago as a gift from my wife. About a little over a week later I started getting complaints from people I'd be talking to that they couldn't hear me over this weird loud chopping noise as per Samsung pro tech, so called 'electrical glitch"... Software was updated they had been reset, nothing helped. So I sent those back to Samsung, I got a replacement it was awesome to have people hear me decently well again... Until about a week later when these new replacements started doing this same thing, and apparently there's no software fix yet but unfortunately I'm not going to be sticking around for who knows how long to find out if they can get their shit together and fix the electrical glitch problem.

So all in all cool ear buds but this particular issue makes them pretty much worthless (when people on the phone can't hear you) if it happens to most of them. Therefore these  get a solid and generous 2 stars.
Great for a bike ride or run.

ReviewTitle: Great Samsung Product. They did it again.
ReviewBody: These make airpods sound like headphones with strings
I have been using these for a few days and they are by far the best ear phones I have ever owned. Very very pleased
Is great

The design, look, feel, and touch are 5 star. They are nice and slick. They don't fall out of your ear. They only connect with an app on a Galaxy. The feature where you can choose to hear people talking to you while playing music is nice. However, he volume is very low compared to what I am used to on he Beats by Dre. Since I use these to work out, I like high volume and these do not have a good volume. I tried multiple different songs and apps that play music. I gave it 2 stars because of the volume which I think is the most important part of head phones.
It's great
They work really well. I use them for every day use.
You get what you pay for.

Had problems from the get go. They have terrible connectivity problems. Whenever I would have them on inside a building and walk outside the connection would drop almost immediately and I would have to have my phone out infront of me for them to work again (Galaxy S9+). I sent them in to be replaced, which took twice as long as what was stated, and the new pair had the same issues. The sound and feel are great if you never go outside but if you have to go anywhere expect bad connection constantly. Save yourself the hassle and shell out $20 more to buy Airpods, they work with android and they have apps that make them as good as the buds.
they are the best
Sound awesome
It was great

ReviewTitle: Great sound quality and play hours.
ReviewBody: These earbuds are fantastic. I have others but they weren't giving me the quality I wanted. The Galaxys provided the right amount of clarity and tune and I find them my go to set when working out or just relaxing at home. Great product.
Nice

ReviewTitle: Very good in sound has a bit more base to it
ReviewBody: Good overall way better than AirPods for sure only thing I dislike but not a major issue is switching songs through the earphones it’s not as easy it’s the previous model of this one but overall love that they hide well and cancel noise around me

ReviewTitle: Very good but some issues need to be concerned
ReviewBody: What I like about this product is that it fits in my ears quite good and it does not hurts even when I use it for a long time, another thing to consider is its battery life which is so long and I am very satisfied with this. But, there are some drawbacks, one of them is the touch controls in the buds, they are not that accurate when I try to touch them twice and triple times they do not respond to this precisely. However, a single touch pause or starts the buds accurately as well as the long touch ones. My own opinion about the sound quality is that it needs to be better, the noise cancellation is just as like you are wearing the AKG wired earphones that comes with a samsung mobile, absolutely the buds sound better but with this matter it is just the same. At the end I did not expect the product's box to be unsealed, I do not know what was the reason but this does not let me feel comfortable concerning the packaging process. The delivery timing was excellent and my overall review is very good.
Like New, Couldn't even tell that they were refurbished.

These are absolutely incredible! They sound amazing, the setup is very easy, and the battery life is perfect! These also get very loud so if you love blasting music these are perfect. Definitely a must buy if you listen to music on your Samsung.

ReviewTitle: Very comfortable, but there must be a direct line of site between phone and buds
ReviewBody: Sound is ok, comfort is very good. But you can't keep your phone in your pocket because despite the fact that I've updated the software twice, there has to be an uninterrupted path between the phone and the earbuds. If I have to hold the phone or strap it to my arm it's easier to use wired earbuds.

I love how they provide you with a fancy case, extra rubber spacers, and a long cord. The sound is fairly loud even with loud ambient sounds going on. The set up was easy as I already have a samsung phone. Very easy!

The sound quality totally sucks but if you mess around with the settings a bit you can find a good sound for you. All around they're good. I was pushed into my swimming pool with these in and they were perfectly fine when I got out. Probably not worth $125 but... $75 maybe.

Not that loud.

ReviewBody: Se escucha mucho ruido y no se le escucha bien lo que me estan hablando se escucha bien la musica pero cuando estoy en una llamada no se escucha claro .

They work pretty well on iOS devices but flawless on Android. On iOS devices there’s a small delay on videos like YouTube, Netflix etc. You’ll get use to it but once you start paying attention to mouth movements, it will throw you off. Other than that, they work flawless with music. Tap to pause, double tap to skip, triple tap to go back a track. They fit nicely in the ear however if you yawn, they might get loose and pop out a bit. (I have stretched lobes so that may be a contributing reason)

ReviewBody: Doesnt work properly after 2 weeks dont buy, whenever i call my wife is makes a super loud obnoxious noise and she cant handle listening to it this was a horrible purchase. The mic is just gone on this thing in just 2 weeks and i kept it in perfect shape.

ReviewTitle: Don't waste your money, Samsung doesn't do enough testing.
ReviewBody: Within a week of use the right ear has significantly less volume than the left, tried all options for cleaning, resetting ECT. Not even worth sending them back for a refund, if my review can save others money than that's all that matters. They aren't bad, but the connection to my S8+ is pretty laughable, I find myself resorting to corded headphones as I thought these $130 headphones would have fit every aspect but they have fallen very short. Even the battery life isn't all that great.

I listened to many reviews and considered other options.  In the end I'm glad that I purchased the Samsung Galaxy Buds.  Excellent value!  Battery life has truly amazed me and it is the top feature that I was concerned about.  I work 10-hour days and most of the time I only have the right ear bud in my ear.  I listen to music etc off and on all day.  I make it through the day without having to recharge using the case.  Of course results vary depending on how much you use the buds but I am truly glad I purchased these.

ReviewTitle: Once you get them to work, they are everything you are looking for...
ReviewBody: Omg, I purchased these and imediately realized the sound was very low. Then after a few months the left ear became apc. 30% less loud than the other). I loved the fit, the features, but ......where was the sound?? I purchased the Jabra Elite 65t, incredible sound, but horrible confort and functionality. My Samsung ear buds, how I missed them.....well, after looking around on line, turns out these came with some ridiculus miniature replacement screens ( which I put aside, since who would need sucha thing). So I replace the screens and whaaaooo!!! Perfect.  ;)  bad Samsung!!! For making such a weird design......... really???
These ear buds are the best I've had by far!
Great sound.
Definitely giving airpods a run for their money

ReviewTitle: If I didn't get these for free, they would have been returned within 24 hours
ReviewBody:
I can't be too mad since these were included as a pre order bonus, but here's the issue so far.  You can't have your phone in your pocket or a running belt and not have choppy audio.  Audio quality itself is very poor: very tinny and kinda hissy in nature.  It almost sounds like these are clipping at any volume level which makes listening to anything pretty annoying.  The passive noise cancellation nature is somewhat nice unless you want to do something like walk or run.  The internal sounds of your body get amplified so when your foot strikes the ground, you'll hear it very clearly.

I'll stick with my other wireless ear buds but I expect these would be nice for flights.
Need to return as it appears the ones i received are not working. Low volume when listening to see and cant be heard on calls.

ReviewTitle: Good package overall but lacking bass & horrible mic quality.
ReviewBody: I like the form factor. I disliked the overhyped sound quality, and I extremely dislike the lack of quality when chatting with people on the phone. Lookup the review by the Verge. They nail it and are super honest. Other youtube reviewers have overhyped this product, leading to disappointment. A $20 pair of wired Skullcandy earbuds will have much better bass response.

The sound quality is ok, not the best, I would say like the AirPods. The call quality is where you might get frustrated and throw them away, it just sound like you’re talking over a tunnel with the other person not understanding you whatsoever, or at least what I’ve been told tooo l’ont times, over all for music they’re a bit better than average, but for call just stay away period. I watched so many YouTube reviews and most people said the same but still wanted to try them myself. Every other thing like controls and battery are best described as good, I would still rather have three charges out of the case since it’s neither bigger nor smaller than AirPod case, but you get what you pay for, they are a little cheaper, and supposedly smaller”not really”,
Worst headphones I've ever had. Every person I spoke to hated them and I had to turn them off. They fell out of my ears when I bent down.  Total crap. I returned mine.

I wasn't expecting these buds to be this good. They sound really good and they're loud enough (at least for me - I prefer a lower volume). The charge holds pretty well. The wireless charging feature is a must!

They could've been better just a little better. 4 stars is for the product itself for not having a deeper base and a higher sound volume.(yes I did use the volume media sync option from the bluetooth option to make it go all the way up) still for the price I think Samsung nails it with this one. Thanks Samsung for finnaly delivering some great earbuds)

Much better than expected. plenty of bass. way loud when u need it. lightweight
Better and cheaper earphones than airpods,the noise isolation is pretty cool and how you can manage its settings is pretty nice

If you’re purchasing these to replace your uncomfortable AirPods you are going to be unhappy. Sound quality for listening is great. Trying to use them with an iPhone X is next to impossible. The other person can’t make out anything you’re saying most of the time.
The music listening experience is great. Pod casts, no problems. Movies, videos and what not are all great. Using them for phone calls is a horrible experience.

It has a great sound Quality and the different configurations that you can use are pretty easy to setup and use! ReviewTitle: Unusable in less than a month
ReviewBody: Left pod broke in less than a month. Multiple people are having this issue do not buy these. Just get airpods. Horrible sound quality for the price.

ReviewTitle: Great Battery and decent everything else.
ReviewBody: Sound quality is pretty good on these especially for the size, cost, and being wireless. Not for a true audiophile. However, in my usage the battery life on these things are amazing. I use these things all the time and basically charge them once a week or so then use my S10 for lil top-offs. Touch commands are great and customization. Having phone conversations outside is not great either.
In ear fit needs improvement.  Battery life needs improvement. Find my headphones feature needs to be louder.

So I put 3 stars for the noise quality because when you make phone calls they have a hard time hearing you.
You can hear them perfectly and hear music perfectly. However if you watch videos there is a  noticeable delay so their lips don’t match up with their voice.
The battery life is 7 hours  roughly per headphones. I don’t use them together cause I got them for work so I can listen to music  discreetly.
But I must admit it really frustrating that when making a phone call the other side can’t hear me and I need to be hands free without speaker phone.
Great sound quality and battery life and quick charging of the buds themselves while in the case. Something of note, they don't have astounding Bass but for my porpoises I don't really mind

Overall, the galaxy buds are very nice looking and will be flushed into your ears when you wear them. Connectivity is sometimes an issue as it will suddenly cut off from time to time. Also, it is quite troublesome to connect to multiple devices (when switching use from one to the other) as it doesn't have a function to change device manually.
My husband loves it! It does everything the Apple AirPods does and has a great sound quality

Had bought the jabra elite 65t before. The mic broke on them, bad sound quality, and no usb C charging. The galaxy buds fix all of these problems while also being much more intuitive with connecting and controls. The base is good enough, has great features such as find my earbuds. Works well in samsung ecosystem such as with smartwatch.

I received my Samsung Buds yesterday. They charged super fast. Music sounds great. Ambient mode is super helpful. They are sleek and compact. Calls sound crystal clear. Super easy to setup and pair with my phone. Comfortable to wear.

I absolutely loved the Samsung galaxy buds, they were everything I wanted them to be and more. I own a pair of sennheisers pxc550s and these seems very close to an ear bud experience to that. The only issue I had was that water damaged my buds and so mine broke. However, they still work really well to the point where I might buy another if I have enough before school starts.

ReviewTitle: Not loud enough but easy to use
ReviewBody: Function and convenience

So far these earbuds are living up to their expectations. Sound quality, ease of use, & style are great attributes. The initial setup was a bit tricky with the pairing instructions, but was figured out within a couple of days. Fabulous product!

Great truly wireless earbuds. I have been wanting wireless earbuds for a while, at a reasonable price, and these came out at the perfect time. Glad they came in black, the touch capability is convenient, and the noise cancellation is amazing. I would recommend to any phone user. These also have the ability to wirelessly charge, and they also have an indicator showing how much approximate charge is left. The 'wearable' app is also handy in slight modifications and shortcuts. The sound quality is also great. Not crazy bass but it sounds crisp and get pretty loud.

ReviewTitle: Great Buds DONT LEAVE IN WASHER
ReviewBody:
Great buds. Noise cancellation is not all too great, but once you turn the music loud enough, noise will be blocked. When these first arrived, my right ear would feel fatigue after about 10 min. After 2 days of constant use, my ears got used to them. The only issue I am now facing is random cutoff of sound. Sound sometimes will start to mess up when phone is in pocket. Another bad thing if you take out one bud and don't put it back in the case, then the sound will cut off from the bud in your ear. Overall, these are great for the price.

UPDATE: A day after I wrote this review, they ended up in the washer. On Friday the 13th. What a coincidence. Left bud is completely toast. Case is fine, but the right bud get hot when charged and the sound is muffled. The battery is also messed up. Please don't forget to take them out of your pocket.

Not as loud as my corded Samsung earphones. Sound quality is good, had to play with the settings on my phone. Easy to use & operate. Long battery life.  I only usually wear one at a time so I can keep an ear open to what's going on around me.

Great for the price! Sound quality is good. Material used is great. Battery life good too. Only gripe i have is after using my S10 to power share on it 1 time. It stopped charging wirelessly!! My phone charges but my buds will not wirelessly charge. I tried power sharing repeatedly with my S10 but it will not work. I can still use a cable but that defeats the purpose! I am not a cave man, so i am not going back to those flinstone times. Sending in as defective.

Update: 2nd set of ear buds now drop calls whenever they feel like it. Going to return and ask for ANOTHER pair. I am still holding onto my faith for Samsung. I hope 3rd times the charm....hopefully

Update: 3rd times the charm. Although it has dropped a call one time. I think i am just paranoid since my first two experiences.  Great quality, love the size. I could wear them at work and no one would be the wiser. Thanks Samsung! Faith restored.
Small case is awesome. Hold charge well and connect automatically once paired. Sound is ok.

ReviewTitle: Very good product but some flaws...
ReviewBody:
These are one of the best wireless ear buds I have had to date, there are some flaws I well get to it later.....

Sound quality is fantastic, but it can be subjective since I am not an audiophile everyone has different opinions. But in all honesty, they sound great, make sure you download the Galaxy wearable app that way you can tune the quality to your liking, I am a bass head so I have it on Bass Boost...

Bluetooth is solid, really good has incredible range, literally, I walked at least 50 close to 70 feet away from my phone and the connection remained strong, it started cutting out when I went further than that. So yes most of the effort definitely went for Bluetooth connectivity very reliable even with phone in pocket, and as soon as you open your pill case they start connecting immediately, not bad Samsung not bad at all....

so why only three stars you ask?

 Let me start off by saying that this review is not meant to sway you off your purchase, these are great you do get your money's worth, but, don't rely on it for phone calls. Phone calls are a hit and miss some people hear me nice and clear others have told me that i'm either too quiet or it sounds slur-ish, it works best in quiet places especially with both earbuds, the earbuds can work independently as well so you can use either the right ear bud only or the left it really doesn't matter. Voice assistant works too, if you say ok/hey google it will pop up, however, it doesn't always work and sometimes it cannot understand you, I find it best if you just change the tap-hold button for assistant but again sometimes it wont understand what you are trying to say to it, either bad mic quality or earbud design ...

But then here comes my second gripe, the touch controls on these are pretty frustrating, they are very sensitive for sure, single tap and tap-hold work just fine but double tap and triple tap are very annoying at times, they would register some times as a single tap, or a triple tap it gets confused, most of the time I just end up whipping out my phone to change tracks. I'm pretty sure this can be fixed with an update, you can change tap-hold to something else and you can also lock out the touch controls, but it locks out all of them, why? why not just lockout some of them not all of them at once? Also give us the ability to modify our tap controls any way we want, why is it limited to only tap-hold? it makes no sense Samsung, get on this man....

Overall, if you don't mind changing tracks with your phone, and you just want to listen to music these work great you wont be disappointed, but these small bugs need to be fixed, never tested the wireless charging ability since I do not have a wireless charging pad but I assume it works....
Does not make phone calls

At first glance these appear no different from last years Galaxy buds.....wrong. Greatly improved design for sure. Much better fit and amazingly light weight. No discomfort after long term use. Which brings me to the point that long term use is possible with not only amazing battery life but the multiple convenient charging options. From the additional charge ability of the case itself, to wireless charging off your phone or pad, to simply plugging it in to the same usb C your phone uses. Sound quality is quite impressive for the compact size. Easy to adjust EQ levels create a great sound of your preference. Bass comes thru great without sacrificing clarity like other earbuds might. Call quality has been the most impressive. My callers cant even tell I'm using a headset. The noise cancelling has definitely improved in this model. "Quick Ambient" is probably my favorite new feature. with just a touch of one ear you can engage external mic and hear all around you. such a simple yet handy feature. Not only did they improve this product but the price got even better. Win Win! Highly recommend
Best earbuds out there.

ReviewTitle: I like these better than the Jabra Elite 65t
ReviewBody:
I've had the Jabra Elite 65t ear buds for several months and I feel the Galaxy buds are better for a number reasons:

PROs
1) Does not stick out of the ears as much because they are more compact
2) Fit, at least for me is better than the Jabra's and by no-means were the 65t's a bad fit and that impacts sound quality and noise cancellation
3) Sound Quality I think is slightly better than the 65t's mainly because of the better fit. Bass is more than adequate and highs are clear.
4) USB C is a plus in my book
5) wireless charging is another plus
6) case is more compact than the 65t's
7) cheaper than the 65t

CONs
1) The app for the Galaxy Buds are not quite as good as the Jabra's. As it doesn't have a granular equalizer
2) Galaxy buds battery life is not quite as good as the 65t

Overall, the PROs out weigh the CONs, so I consider these ear buds better than the 65t. The 65t are still great ear buds and cutting edge for 2 years ago. However, today given the price, sound, fit and features, the Galaxy buds are better.
The best earbuds I've ever owned

I contacted Samsung, they told me to contact Amazon and request a new pair, I contacted Amazon and Amazon contacted me back to Samsung, where Samsung told me to send them the pair for repair, I sent it to them only to get them back exactly the same that I had it. This is the worst experience I have had with Samsung (and Samsung is typically good) and Amazon.

The new Galaxy buds are a big improvement over the IconX. They sound much better and I actually can't handle full volume, in addition to that the battery life is longer although I have not worn them until they died to get a full run time. I recommend everyone by themselves a pair as opposed to the air pods. There are so many ways you can adjust the sound and the battery life is amazing.

Fundamentally a set of wireless headphones need to only do a couple of things: maintain a stable connection to the phone, take calls, and play music. Thinks like noise cancellation (which these don't actually do), isolation (which they do well), ambient noise passthrough, good battery life, and the like? Those are just nice to have.

The Galaxy Buds do a lot of those nice-to-have things, but they don't do the basics especially well.

Pros:
+ Great sound isolation (note: they don't have active noise cancelling)
+ Great battery life
+ Some fancy advanced features like ambient noise, equalizer, touch controls that work well, etc.

Cons:
- Connection quality is poor. If I keep my phone (a Note 9; another Samsung product) in my left pocket, and turn my head to the right, they will cut out. The connection is often static-filled even when the phone is sitting on my desk, five feet away, with a clear line of sight.
- Microphone stops working after a while. I have a lot of conference calls for work, where I'm often sitting on mute. If I need to speak later on in the call, I'll take the phone off mute, but the microphone has stopped working. I can disconnect the buds and use the phone speaker fine.
- Microphone quality is poor. I've had a number of complaints about my voice quality while using the Galaxy Buds. That didn't happen with my Airpods.

ReviewTitle: Total misrepresentation, waste of time and money
ReviewBody: It took getting a customer service rep to figure out how to get these useless buds to pair. No instruction manual or directions came with them. Ridiculous. When the rep finally got them to pair (after over an hour), the sound was brassy and tinny - terrible. Most of the features that had been represented for the product, which was why I got duped into buying them, were not there. The service representative was never able to find any owners manual, nor were they in the "Quick Start Guide," which was all the service rep could find. He was never able to find a user manual for them and got as frustrated as I am. Don't waste time or money on these, they are total JUNK. We are going back to i-Phones and Skullcandy sound products. Life is too short for anymore of Samsung's nonstop inferior junk products and total lack of concern for customers. I don't know how they stay in business. They won't get anymore of mine, or anyone I else I can warn first. The picture is the only thing the rep could ever find - totally inadequate and incomplete.

Great sound, great fit, great sound isolation. Are they perfect, or the best? No, but considering their price, they're pretty awesome little Buds. Haven't had any connection or battery issues, which seem to be the bane of cheaper models from other brands.
Best bang for the buck buy this if you want perfect fit and reliability works with any phone but Samsung is easier than you will ever see in any product! awesome!

Anyone who says these are lacking sound or Bass must not be using them right or with the right equipment. I have a Samsung Note 9 and these Galaxy Buds complement this phone flawlessly. When I place 1 or both buds in my ear(s) even if bluetooth isn't enabled Samsung technology working in true tandem pops up with that Galaxy Buds notification to ask Connect or Cancel. When paired you can use individually Left, Right or both at the same time. When you use the correct rubber ear peices included in the packaging they sound great. It does take a moment to place them and get them in that comfortable position in the ear but that's because these are so tiny and lightweight. Once they are in I forget they are in! The bass is strong, I don't know how you could expect more bass in a ear bud like this, I mean I love bass, I have 2 12" Memphis subs in my car so I know bass. These have a great balance between bass and treble, just an all around quality sound. These are 100,000x better than those AKG wires headphones that come with Samsung phones like the NOTE 9 and other others. The sound may not be up to BOSE standard but it definitely sounds just like a quality movie theater to me. Quite loud too, I like my music loud and these deliver... maybe a little too well, will be trying to leave these below full volume for my ears sake. Also, the phone calling use with these buds is great. I work in the air on telephone poles and now I can seamlessly switch between music and phone calls with minimal effort. The people on the other end say they hear me great even though it is always windy and blowing right on these ear buds. I can see how if it was noisy like in a large city or event where thousands of people are all yelling around you these may pick up a lot of those voices but like I said it seems like it takes a lot to make phone call quality lack with these. If people like to whisper on the phone or attempt to make a call in a library without disrupting anyone, that might be a little tough because there is a certain low decibel level (normal indoor voice talking volume) these are tuned to work at. I am definitely pleased with these.

My 2 gripes:
1. The case itself is just plastic and I dropped it once, that was it scratched the case right up. Now I have paired this with the araree silicone bean sleeve and I'm good to go for work.

2. These cancel sound so well for tiny ear buds! Which can be a pro or con depending on what you use these for. People used to using Air Pods by Apple might have a tough time adapting to these if they decided to finally do the right thing and switch, lol. Air Pods are a pod style earphone which allows passive sounds to get into your ear along with the music. That open air gap between Air Pod and ear drum can be good and bad. Good if you're using at work and someone comes up behind you and tries to have a full conversation with you while you don't even see they are there. Galaxy Buds cancel outside sounds which can ruin the overall theater-like sound experience when watching movies or listening to music, but obviously makes it tough to hear anyone unless you leave ambient sound on. Ambient sound is a great feature to help with this issue but I think it could still use some improvement.

Overall worth the price and I am very pleased!

Worth every penny

I got the Samsung Buds as the promotional offer with the Galaxy S10 so I'm a little thankful that they were free and I didn't shell out $130 for them. Knowing what Samsung is capable of and the high price tag, I did expect much more in terms of quality.

PROS:

Comfort - The buds fit extremely well in the ear and just twist right into your ear canal. I wear them when working out and after a while you almost forget they're in your ear.
Preface, make sure you figure out which size ear tips works best for your ear, it'll make a huge difference in fit and sound quality

Battery Life - The buds themselves last relatively long, about 5 - 6 hours on their own, and then the charging case holds a strong charge to juice up the buds. They recharge pretty quickly and the indicator lights on the inside and outside of the case are useful for determining when the case is charging, the buds are charging, when fully charged, and when low on battery.

Set Up & Pairing - Similar to Airpods, these were designed to pair well with their parents company's phone. So when using a Galaxy phone, the buds pair extremely well. As soon as you open the case and plug the buds into your ear, your phone should pair with them immediately (even if bluetooth is off). You can start playing music or make a phone call immediately. Initial set up was quick and even with an update, took about 5 min.

Sound Isolation - When listening to music, I can barely hear anything going on around me. Even at the gym, I can't hear the music that's blasted through their speakers.
There's an "Ambient Sound" mode to help you hear things around you, but I tried it in my office and it didn't work too well. Cool concept though.

CONS:

Audio Quality - Even with the dynamic sound tuning you can adjust in the Galaxy Wearables app, the sound isn't as rich and full as I've gotten from other headphones... My $20 JVC marshmallow headphones sound much better to be honest. Bass is pretty neutral though. This is where I expected the most in terms of quality and unfortunately it's not the greatest listening experience for $130. It's not terrible at all, but it's not amazing either

Connectivity - I'm using these on a Galaxy S10 so I'm running the most modern, up-to-date version of Bluetooth connectivity and I was relatively disappointed in how volatile the connection was.
I was doing a floor exercise at the gym and my phone got pushed up to my leg briefly, during which the audio cut out and scratched as if I had damaged something.
It's only happened once so far, but during a phone call, the earbuds desynced after a few minutes so the receiving voice on the phone echoed for me. I had to hang up and call again to have the buds sync the audio again. The phone was right next to me as well.
I'd say you can go about 20ish feet away safely from your phone before the Bluetooth connection starts to get really volatile and unreliable.

Glitchy - Ever so randomly, the sound will get completely distorted like a bad dubstep song... Not sure if it's a software issue or a Bluetooth issue but I've had it happen a few times just sitting listening to music with my phone right next to me.
Additionally, the equalizer tuning or volume of the music will change randomly sometimes.

Touchpad - The touchpad controls take some getting used to because they can be super sensitive or the exact opposite. Once while I was on the phone, I had to scratch my ear; I accidentally touched the side of the earbud and it ended the phone call. Conversely, I'll tap the bud twice multiple times to advance a song, but it won't register. So I'll have to put more pressure on the buds to make it work. A simplified way to do volume adjustments and have voice assistants work simultaneously would have been nice, but you can only choose to have one or the other.

In-Ear Recognition - One of the cool things about other wireless earbuds is that they'll recognize when they are in your ear and they will pause or continue music depending on the action. The Galaxy buds recognize when they're in your ear, but there is no option to pause if you take one of the buds out of your ear or to restart music when you put them both back in. Don't know if that can be added with a software update but it's a nice feature to have.

OVERALL:

The Galaxy buds will get the job done and they're cheaper than most other higher end wireless earbuds. But they could definitely be much better. Hopefully with continued software updates they'll improve over time. But if you're looking to spend $130+ on wireless headphones, I'd shop around, especially if you don't have a Galaxy phone.

ReviewTitle: They're alright, if you can get them not to cut out
ReviewBody:
I believe the major issue with this specific product is that it doesn't take much for the signal to cut out. Regardless if you're using a samsung device or not. If you're using a samsung device the likelihood of sync issue goes away, but you still have connection issues.

I cannot go ~20 minutes before my stationary head at work starts to experience audio skips. I don't move when it start happens and it eventually resolves itself. You can force this to happen by covering both of your ears with your hands and the left should go out. So, when you think about how much of your body is in between your right ear and a phone in your left pocket and you're out of luck. Simply unusable for any amount of time.

if the device is not a samsung device the issue happens and has sync issues. It'll be small at first, you'll hear one clip in the audio and all of a sudden the left earbud is a full second behind so you hear double the audio. There is no way to fix this without taking out both earbuds and placing them back in the case, closing it, waiting 5 seconds, opening it, waiting for it to pair, realize it doesn't automatically pair and you have to delete the previous paring and repair it, then place them back in your ears only to have it happen a couple hours later or the next day. Overall a very bad experience and don't know why this product has such a high rating.

My experience has been using a Surface, Note 8, and Macbook, they all experience the same issue regardless of distance to the buds, even being in line of sight of the device & within 2 ft.

Edit: The replacements suffer the same problem and the update released within the past day (1.35) doesn't fix the issue. It actually made the issue worse. I'm still using my Macbook and the ear (closer to the macbook) will lag and delay itself to make the music in phase. Love it! Now when I cover both of my ears with my hands they both cut out and make awful crackling and static noises that would deafen me if I didn't remove my hands.

Returning my pair and going with a product that at least can play music for more than 5 minutes and of a greater distance than 2 feet.

Yes the sound is not the same, but so far but going back to beats or Sony or Bose.

But the sound quality is sufficiently good enough for me while working out(gym, running, etc..), in and around the office and when going for a walk somewhere.

ReviewTitle: Good if you stand perfectly still! (Not really, but kinda)
ReviewBody:
The buds are a pretty good package and offer mid tier sound quality with respectable noice cancellation and ambient sound detection.
However, I have to knock 3 stars off because of one glaring issue.
I purchased these specifically to be used while working out, and as long as your phone is not moving and you are not moving, they work fine. As soon as you begin to move (with the phone in your pocket), walking/running/cycling immediately you will experience issues with the buds desperately trying to disconnect from the phone. Not only with you have consistent issues with the sound cutting out or having weird compression sounds. But literally as soon as I stop moving and get the phone out of my pocket, the sound returns at full quality.
After my most recent run, my left earbud ended up disconnecting entirely and only my right earbud was connected.

There are cheaper options that work better and have better sound quality, such as the mPow Cheetah (or similar products) which makes it very hard to recommend this product.
I've had these for about a week now, they have performed flawlessly. I thought they would be louder, but they do perform loud enough.

Ok so I was a little nervous purchasing these because the GearX was a huge disappointment but Samsung really fixed things with these. They come with 3 different size tips and I went up one size just to make sure they were totally snug and cancelled out noise. I travel frequently so these are perfect on planes especially. I am impressed with the battery life and unlike the previous version I can charge these and wear one then whenever it dies the other one is still fully charged and the case still will completely recharge the other one....The battery doesnt drain when not in use and that's a huge factor for me. Great price, well worth it. The only con I have that I wish the sound could go up a little louder and also would be perfect if you could adjust the sound on the actually bud....You can only adjust sound on your device its linked to. But other than that I love them!
I loveeee the ambient mode! Just wish the ambient mode on the left side on my ear was better sounding but it's very good! Recommended 100%

I bought these mainly to use at work and I need to hear outside noise so I can talk to customers and coworkers. The ambient noise feature is a must for me.  Got these delivered and installed the app to test them out aaaand.....the ambient sound feature didn't work. The proximity sensor in the left bud doesn't work so it thinks that only one bud is in and the ambient feature is disabled unless both buds are in your ears.  Huge deal breaker. I've placed an order for a replacement and will update the review accordingly, but after a quick Google search it looks like this is an extremely common problem with no solution.

Sound quality is great and they are very comfortable so far.

UPDATE:  Got the second pair and the proximity sensor works on this pair.  However, the ambient sound feature leaves much to be desired.  It doesn't work well and almost impossible to make out what others around you are saying with it turned on.  I do like them, but they don't work for what I was hoping to use them for.

Day 1 of using these wireless buds.
These are my first pair of truly wireless headphones. $130 is not little for me so I have watched every video review and read every article out there.  I was very skeptical because of the bad microphone reviews everybody gave it, as my MAIN USE for it is phone calls. Did multiple calls through out the day with no problems with sound or the other party not hearing me. There was weird static in the buds while connected to the laptop, none of that while connected to the phone tho. So that might be from my laptop idk. Again ive had these for only one day so far.
Initial impression is so far so good. Very impressive noise cancellation and GOOD sound quality. Very light in the ear, can wear them for extended amount of time with no fatigue. Glad they had replacement "wings" as what comes on by default didnt sit good with my ear so those come handy. Case is very small and easy to carry around. Stay posted for update in a month.

These are pretty much perfect. The setup was more involved than a simple pair of bluetooth headphones, however it is understandable considering the features and tech that is packed into them. They are linked to the Galaxy Wearable app which controls different features including noise cancelling, the touchpad buttons, the equalizer, and the find my earbuds feature. They fit in my ear very well and come with adjustable ear insert thingies to fit different ear shapes/sizes. They case/box they come in also double as a charger which can charge wirelessly. I have been vigilant of other wireless earbud wearers and these seem to be fairly low profile in comparison. The sound quality is pretty good. Good highs, ok lows, and a dynamic mode on the equalizer that is a good balance of sound. I thought the sound quality would be just a little better but still great for the price. The battery life seems great, no complaints. Overall I think they are a fantastic value.

ReviewTitle: Held back only by the limitations of Bluetooth
ReviewBody: I initially gave these Samsung Galaxy Buds 2-stars due to Bluetooth audio constantly dropping in & out of each ear. I came to realize this is just a limitation of the technology (Bluetooth 5.0 and older), and *not* of these Buds. When used outside in an open area with the phone more than several feet away (hitting golf balls) and with no nearby walls to bounce off and redirect en route to the Buds, the BT signal can essentially get lost into the air. This ultimately happened with *all* BT headsets I tried under these conditions. But overall, these Samsung Galaxy Buds offer great, rich sound, clarity & bass, and fit nicely in my ears without falling out while weight training or running. Features like noise-cancelling and the ability to program the buttons (in a limited capacity) using the Samsung Wearables app, make these the best BT earbuds I have tried.
Not that great of a sound npr8ce should be cheaper Samsung.

ReviewTitle: Ok battery terrible microphone to talk to someone with.
ReviewBody: I like the earbuds as a wireless speaker but as a hands-free device to talk to other people, it is one of the worst pairs I have ever come across yet. To increase this rating would require Samsung to make it where it does not sounds like you are across a very big room and pickup ever background besides your voice. If you even think you are going to talk to someone with this device don't buy it. If you want to just listen to music and that is it then they will do the job.

Connectivity is great.  App is great. Battery life is great. Sound quality is great......for the person wearing them. Sound quality is bad for whoever you are on the phone with. I think that unless your bluetooth comes with a boom that sits directly in front of your mouth and/or you're in a very quiet place, it's not going to sound great to your callers.

I've tried many different wireless ear buds. This is my first totally wireless pair though. That part I love! The Galaxy Ear Buds connect very easily, have nice software features and work great with my Note 9.
They are almost perfect!
However, I still have the same problem with these as I've had with all wireless buds... little disconnects and stutters. It seems if you hold your head still and look straight forward, these keep a great connection but if you turn your head or look down much, it seems they break up some. I've been trying to pinpoint it but have yet to find a pattern.
While they work almost flawlessly, the sound and comfort of these are fantastic! My only complaint is the losing signal part. It doesn't happen a lot but enough to be annoying.
So, if you've had that problem in the past with ear buds or wireless in general, I don't think you will find these much different. The big difference in these is the easy setup with the phone, the instant connection when you pull them out and put them in and the sounds quality which I find to be pretty dang good. I think the price is pretty good too.  I just wish someone could tame the disconnect/stutter beast with wireless!

ReviewTitle: Great Sound and Low Profile, but Battery and Range sucks

The range is extremely poor and the battery life is mediocre, but the sound is nice and the touch controls are easy to work with. I also really like the customizability (Apple are you blind or something) of the Buds through the app, just like all Android things. Really hope the range and battery life is better in the new ones.

ReviewTitle: Don't buy them, they are horrible.
ReviewBody: I really wanted to like these headphones, but 2 HUGE issues prevent these headphones from being even tolerable.  The first is that the sound stutters a lot if your phone is not out in the open.  Ie if you have your phone in your pocket, you'll experience "skipping" audio.  What's the point of wireless headphones if you have to hold your phone?  The second issue was the sound quality people experienced on the other end of my calls.  I was told often that I could not be heard or that there was a loud jackhammer sound.  On my end the sound quality was decent and I did not hear any of these jackhammers noises, but it was reported by multiple people on multiple days, so it wasn't a one off situation.  If you go and google these problems you will see they are being reported by a lot of people.  I tried all of the troubleshooting steps suggested, like resetting the buds, making sure the software was up to date, etc, but nothing worked.  Just don't buy these!!!!!!
Bought these for the hubby for his bday. He was thrilled. Sound quality and ease of use made him even happier.

ReviewBody:
I received my Galaxy Buds for free with my Galaxy S10+. They come with a charging case, extra rubber earbud tips, and a Type-C USB cable. I love the modern look of the Galaxy Buds, and the charging case is super portable. The touch sensors allow you to pause/skip songs, end phone calls, and more. My biggest issues with the Galaxy Buds are the sound quality and comfort. The bass levels are a joke. I have $20 headphones with better bass than the Galaxy Buds. Also, I notice that these earbuds hurt my inner ears after wearing them for over half a hour. I've tried swapping out the rubber tips, with no luck. If these earbuds weren't included with my phone, I most likely would have went with another brand.

Pros:

Cons:

ReviewTitle: Poor connection stability and AV sync issues with Pixel 3
ReviewBody: I had high hopes for these earbuds, as they had all of the features I wanted and good enough sound quality in a portable package. The connection seemed fine at first, but once I took a walk outside with them connected to my Pixel 3 the connection became unstable and music would frequently skip. ReviewTitle: Very good choice for Galaxy Phone owners
ReviewBody:
This is my first pair of true wireless headphones. I own a Galaxy S9 and have tried my friends airpods but they immediately fall out of my ears. I was choosing between these and the Jabras as other high rated pairs (Bose, BO, Sennheiser) are too expensive for me to justify buying.

These have very good sound quality, the bass could be slightly more pronounced but is more than good enough with the largest ear tips (I am waiting for comply to release some foam eartips for these). With my Galaxy S9, I have minimal connection issues (skipping or synchronization problems do happen but rarely, I think this is pretty much an unavoidable problem for bluetooth earbuds. However, when using them with my laptop I do experience occasional connectivity issues, twitch in particular seems to leave cause the audio to desynchronize though this seems to have improved over the last few updates. They are reasonably comfortable, though it did take my ears almost a week to adjust and stop hurting, the smallest wings helped with this. Although this wasn't a problem for me, I have seen many users complaining about very quiet audio because they did not realize the buds have independent volume, this could be clarified on Samsungs part. When my volume is shared between my phone and buds, they are way more than loud enough, however, for some reason, the volume scale is not linear, if I lower the volume past a certain point, it drops drastically making find adjustments in this range harder. If I set the buds to have independent volume, this problem goes away. Battery life is very good, and my case does not appear to appreciably drain when left unused. The battery indicators on the case could be improved.

Overall, the main deciding feature for me choosing this over the Jabras is USB-C, unifying my phone, headphones, and laptop charging, and the size of the case. From what I understand, the buds do not work as well with non-galaxy phones (different codec and connectivity) so if I had another phone I might have still chosen the Jabras. However, these earphones are comfortable, convenient, sound great, and IMO worth the $130 price tag.

Edit:
A software touchpad has greatly improved the touchpad responsiveness and added a toggled option for ambient mode. This toggle is a great addition as one gripe I had was having to frequently launch the app to re enabled ambient mode. Overall, still really like these,  they are a 4.5 / 5 for me

ReviewTitle: iPhone Users Don’t Fear, These Are Perfect.
ReviewBody:
First off, I have the IPhone X, but I had no interest in AirPods because of their terrible lack of sound isolation  and silly design. So I researched and bought a handful of other true wireless earbuds, all being extremely uncomfortable.

Fast forward to a few returns later, I stumble upon these Galaxy Buds. I was really skeptical about using them on IPhones because they are clearly meant for Samsung, but I bought them anyway. I am blown away by these little things.

They have excellent noise cancellation, so much so that I wear only one if I need to hear anything around me. Yes, you can just wear one bud with the other in the case (big plus). The size is small and comfortable with 3 sets of tips and fins to make it fit anyone. And the sound is great, despite not being able to use the EQ settings only available on Android. This hasn’t been a problem since Apple Music has even more EQ settings already.

So, if you have an IPhone but you don’t want AirPods, these will not let you down. Even the touch controls are better than AirPods. Take the leap and try these Galaxy Buds!

ReviewTitle: Convenient, but connection could be better
ReviewBody:
I bought these for use with my iPhone X because AirPods and other earbud style headphones don’t stay in my ears.

I particularly like the fit, as the in-ear design both keeps them secure and blocks out noise. They’re also very light which means you can wear them for long periods of time without worrying about discomfort. The small size means they also don’t look odd shoved in your ears like some competitors.

Sound quality is decent, but won’t blow anyone away. My biggest issue, however, is that I consistently have connection problems while walking. I can use these without issue while working out but if I use them while walking on my lunch break (in a city) I’m met with lots of dropouts and interference. I have to hold my phone above my waist for a consistent connection. Thus far I haven’t figured out what causes the interference as it doesn’t happen in other situations (gym, home, airplanes/airports, etc.)

Still, despite the issues while walking I’m generally happy with these.

EDIT: After a recent firmware update I’ve had far fewer connection issues so my biggest issue has pretty much been taken care of. I’ve adjusted my review to 4 stars as a result.

ReviewTitle: Not for small ears + Ambient mode is a hassle
ReviewBody:
I'll start this off by saying that I really want to like these. When I heard about them and read the reviews, I thought they were exactly what I was looking for. Small, good battery life, and high quality sound. While it is each of those things, they unfortunately do not fit. The three sizes of ear tips that come with the buds are all around the same size, and it was actually difficult to tell the smalls from the mediums at first glance. The problem stems from the size of the speaker under the tip. It alone is about 5 mm, which when the tips are put on, results in it being a very tight fit. My ear holes are very narrow and after about 1/2 hour wearing these, they start to ache. At one point I left them in for about 2 hours and hadn't adjusted them, and when I went to take them out my ears were extremely sore and it felt like someone was pinching them with pliers. I tried comply foam tips, but the rubber "core" was still big enough to be putting an uncomfortable amount of pressure on my ears. This likely doesn't apply to a lot of people, but if you have small ears, you should probably look elsewhere.

The sound quality is pretty good, although the bass seems a little weak given the price. Also, I don't love that they are so dependent on the equalizer in the app to sound good. The sound without the equalizer on is honestly pitiful. I have an android, so for use with my phone it's alright, but it's just a hassle. The headphones shouldn't be so dependent on an app.

The software also has some other annoying problems, like the fact that the ambient sound mode automatically turns off upon removing 1 bud. I like to have the ambient mode on so I can hear if someone comes to talk to me at work, but I am not going to leave them while speaking to the person. If I take even one bud out, the ambient mode get turned off, and I need to go back into the app to turn it on again. That's another thing: the hold to turn on ambient mode only triggers a temporary ambient mode. I would have much rather had it be a toggle of the ambient mode, or at least have the option. Also, having ambient mode on adds a constant static sound, making me wish there was a way to set a threshold for how loud something has to be to come through. Overall the ambient mode seems very poorly integrated, almost like it was added as an after thought.

Something that I do like that you don't see that often is that there is no main bud. I can alternate between the buds at will and put one back on to charge. They are also very attractive and I like they way they look when I'm wearing them.

As a whole, I don't see these being worth the $130 as is. If you can get them for <$90, and you don't have very small ears, I'd say they are probably worth the purchase. For me though, they just don't seem worth it. One of the points in getting wireless buds is to have a seamless experience, and having to take them out every 20 minutes to let my ears rest, and then needing to turn ambient mod back on completely defeats the purpose.

ReviewTitle: Good sound and easy to use. Outstanding user experience
ReviewBody: Good sound, simple pairing and easy to use. The more I use them the more I enjoy them. When I initially received them I was disappointed but then I learned how properly insert for a good fit and the sound quality improved. Insert pointing slightly up then push in and twist back. I purchased Comply foam tips and these improved fit, sound and keep out ear wax. I enjoy these as much as my $300.00 noise canceling headphones. Samsung did their homework to create an outstanding user experience.

These hold a connection very well. They work well with the galaxy s8, which for a phone has terrible Bluetooth performance (I don't know why, but Samsung is terrible with Bluetooth on most of their phones, like they really don't know what they're doing... luckily, a different part of Samsung makes this high quality Bluetooth headphone!) The buds never drop a connection, you can use either one at a time (an oft requested feature of many buds), they make a good seal with the ear and block ambient noise well. They auto turn on and off as you remove from or place them in their case. The case is top notch, and tiny enough to fit in your pocket. Basically its slightly larger than a car key fob. So 5 stars for case design and portability. A million times better than airpods. Oh, and it charges wirelessly! Pretty nice. The sound is good. I'm knocking a star for sound quality because bass response sucks - dont get me wrong, its in line with all other wireless buds, and sound quality is near the upper end of the spectrum of wireless buds, and that is no where near wired phones by a country mile. But the "equilizer" in the app is flat BS. Turning up the bass actually just turns DOWN the treble response, rofl (listen closely). I dont know who they're kidding with that joke of an equilizer. Also, taking calls on this works well, but you're not going to want to. When you talk, you're going to feel your voice vibrate your brain and reverberate in your skull due to the fit of the bud in your ear. It's just an unpleasant thing you won't want to do too often, but works in a pinch. In a nutshell these are for listening to music and not really for taking calls, and that's very fair. In sum, good buds with a secure fit, good seal (million times better than air pods), and good sound (not great sound. good for buds, that is)!

I don't think I dislike anything about these headphones.
The quality and noise cancellation are fantastic.
I don't typically like earbuds, but I love these.

ReviewTitle: work fine inside; random but regular disconnects running; poor outdoor call quality
ReviewBody:
this is a decent product within narrow bounds but as a warning to runners & cyclists, these WILL disconnect, it's just a question of when. i've had two pairs-- returned the first-- and the second is no better. walking with a phone (LG V30) can trigger the disconnect also btw. i prefer the Samsung over the Airpods for a # of reasons but let's face FACTS: the Apple bluetooth connection is MUCH better (and yes, I use the Galaxy App etc) and there's no comparison wrt to call quality, the Apple destroys it. I'd live with that but the disconnects while running are unacceptable. For what it's worth, my first pair of buds come up as BC33 in my bluetooth settings and the second as C335; I was hopeful that the latter would be an improvement but so far it really isn't.

UPDATE: Outdoors, these connects regularly but randomly in both the crowded city and alone by the waterfront; also, the left and right buds, used separately, both disconnect, i.e. there's no improvement if one is "closer" to the phone, which is in my jacket pocket.

VERDICT: Unacceptable. Samsung has designed a good product but failed to deliver on its potential: stopping to reconnect three or four times in an hour is ridiculous and simply does NOT happen with Airpods, whether using Android or iPhone.
Worked great first 2-3 weeks but then the case stopped working and charging

ReviewTitle: Fits perfectly, great sound, and easy to connect right out of the box.
ReviewBody:
I bought these because I lost my Galaxy IconX (2018) buds, which I really loved.  I was preparing to buy another set, but realized that the new Earbuds had just been released.  As with the 2018 Iconx, they were really easy to connect without issue.

In comparison to the 2018 IconX, the chargin/carrying case is noticeably smaller & lighter, which i definitely appreciate when putting them into my pants pocket.  The case still feels very solid.  In addition to the case being smaller, it feels as if the actual earbuds are slightly smaller and lighter.  I don't notice them in my ear, and yet, they definitely feel secure (not as if they are going to fall out.  This wasn't an issue with the 2018 Iconx either).

The sound seems to be the same (excellent) with good bass and maybe a bit louder than the 2018.  I had found the 2018s were also really good at noise cancellation and so are these.  Note that to change the bass and treble options (as well as other options), you need to download the Galaxy Wear app to your phone.

Definitely happy with my purchase!

Even though the case is smaller, they managed to pack in wireless charging into it, which is very cool.
The sound quality is amazing...the talk through capabilities work fantastic...in the gym if your working out keep phone in visual range...otherwise never a connection issue...

I love AKG headphones because of the fit and the sound quality; for me nothing beats them, so it's great they are used for these bluetooth headphones. What's also great is that I can use my galaxy s9 plus charger to charge these; that's what comes in the packaging, a small galaxy s9 charger. So now I have two, which is a wonderful bonus. And they come with multiple ear buds so you can see which fits your ear the best. The only con to these bluetooth headphones is that I wish they did fit my ears better because they do loosen easily and fall out at times.

Overall, I like them better.

ReviewTitle: Worth the upgrade from IconX? YES, unless…
ReviewBody:
I had IconX 2018 for about 1.5 years and got new Samsung Galaxy Buds a week ago. Here is my first impression: The size and weight of S-Buds are about 30% smaller, while the battery life is about 1 hour longer and AKG did a great job on tuning the sound. No doubt, the sound quality of Buds is superior to IconX. The bass level and volume are about the same, but Buds are much cleaner, crisper, and more balanced. When compared side by side, IconX sounded muffled and dull. Based on those criteria, it’s certainly worth to upgrade to S-Buds or have them both for different purposes, see below.

HOWEVER, if you use IconX for sports and don’t want to carry your phone around, Buds don’t support this functionality: 1) No build-in storage, that is no autonomous MP3 listening, only Bluetooth streaming through a connected phone 2) No sports functions such as fitness tracking, guidance, etc.

When the Galaxy Buds were announced I couldn't wait to get my hands on them and now that I have them I feel extremely disappointed.... let's be honest these are intended to be used with our phone's and what are our phones for? PHONE CALLS! these buds are horrible for phone calls unless you are at home laying in your bed with zero noise around you!

The "dual mic technology" is useless you will never be able to have 10 seconds on a call if you are at a store, a restaurant, at the gym, etc. I know some people will say there is a time and place for phone calls but some of us have calls we need to take at any time any place and these are not reliable for that. My brother uses Airpods and I can hear him 10x better than these.

Next is the audio, what can I say it's ok at best. The volume levels are below average and always leave me wanting more. Bass is acceptable, the mids are ok, and highs are ok. I dont really get the clarity I like and the bass is too messy for my taste. I do own several high end IEMs and headphones so I am extremely picky.... not to mention audio is extremely subjective.

Battery is amazing.

Ergonomically these are good.

Unfortunately due to the microphone quality and volume levels I can not reccomend these, if the microphone issues can be resolved with a firmware update I would give then a pass until then I would say skip them unless you really want buds for an Android.
