ReviewTitle: Works individually, seamless setup, great battery
ReviewBody:
WORKS INDIVIDUALLY: this was very important for me. They dont seem to have a "master bud" like some sets do, you can just take out 1 and use that one and then take out the other when the first ones battery dies. When you just use 1 bud then the long press volume only does what that bud is programmed to do, for example if I just use the left bud the long press will only turn the volume down and if I use the right bud the long press will turn the volume up. When using just 1 bud your media pauses when you take it out, if you use both then you have to take both out for it pause, or just tap once on the touchpad of either bud. Doesnt automatically play when you put them back in, you have to tap the touchpad to play.
MAKE SURE HAVE THE RIGHT TIPS IN AND HAVE THEM AS DEEP AS POSSIBLE FOR OPTIMAL SOUND QUALITY
SUPER EASY SETUP: on my s9+, just make sure you have the samsung wearables app. Auto connects when case opens if you have bluetooth on.
 AMBIENT NOISE: mode is kind of weird, probably not best in class but could be improved through software update. But you could definitley hear cars and loud voices if you have ambient mode turned up (only works when you have both buds in ears) There is an update you need to install when you connect for the first time that takes about 2 minutes.
3 different size buds and fins included. Wireless charging works on highpower and low power charging mats not just on the back of an s10 device, usbC charging also available.
Tiny wireless charging case, weak magnets hold the buds in and guide them to the charging pins, you can shake the buds out if you have the case open, stronger magnets hold the case closed in your pocket, good and solid clicky case, satisfying to open and close.
 CUSTOMIZATION: You can customize the "long press" on the touch pads to turn volume up and down, turn on ambient mode or activate the digital assistant of your choice.
UI: No buttons, just a touch pad that is very responsive and it has sensors to know if they are in your ear and the touchpad doesnt work unless they are in your ear so you wont accidentally change your music when you take them out. Touchpad can be impeaded by hair over your ear. These buds and the case are tiny, you could probably hide them if you have long hair. Be sure you like tight fitting in-ear buds, everyones ears are different.
SOUND: If you arent an audiophile they are great, I personally dont see much of a difference in any earbuds no matter the price, they do sound alot better the deeper into your ear you can put them. They dont seem to get ear bursting loud but they do get very loud, good bass punch.
No onboard storage like the iconx.
BATTERY: I have not ran them to their limits yet but while using just one bud I listened to 5.5 hours of podcast (mostly voice) at about 35% volume and after the 5.5 hours the bud still had 40% battery left. When that ones battery runs out you can switch to the other by just picking it up and putting the other one in the case to charge.
INSTANT PAIRING: when you open the case and have bluetooth on they connect in less than 10 seconds, I have not had the little pop up window show up like in the ads but they instantly connect when you have bluetooth on.
Great purchase if you like in-ear style buds, kind of like ear plugs. Most features only available on Android, Samsung phones apparently work best though, Iphone works with basic features and siri.
Connection problems with PC bluetooth. Not loud enough for lectures

ReviewTitle: Works best with Samsung Galaxy phones! Be warned!
ReviewBody: I'm using these earbuds with a Samsung Galaxy Note 8 and they work great! No connection issues or loss of connection when at the gym, walking around, or anything. The sound isolation is great; however, the ambient sound mode is a bit finicky. I was able to hear people if they were speaking on the same side as the earbuds AND if my music was at a medium volume (instead of being loud enough to drown everything out). If my music was too loud, I can't hear anything, even when ambient sound is put to max WITH voice amplifier. Furthermore, this product works best with Samsung phones. I used them on my MacBook bro and the sound got kind of choppy when watching Hulu. All in all, they work with any sort of device, but they work best (with no issues) if used with Samsung products.

ReviewTitle: Galaxy Buds: Easy Enough and Great Features
ReviewBody:
The Galaxy Buds are great and easy to use. The two biggest pros of the Buds are the truly wireless nature of the Buds and the in-ear perfect fit. The idea of not having to worry about cables is an obvious feature of the Buds and boy is it great! That fact plus the comfortableness of the Buds makes this a good investment.

Pro: Feel. The fit/feel of the Buds is very comfortable and comes with adjustable parts to change the wingtip or eartip size. Upon first trying on the Buds the wingtip clips into your ear so that they do not fall out easily. The wingtip edge makes sure that it fits snug into your ear- perfect for working out or if you are nervous about the Buds falling out. If you are not comfortable with the feel of the Buds, you can simply change the sizing with the interchangeable eartips and wingtip- or if you don’t want the wingtip there are tips without the wings.

Pro: Simple Use. After pairing the Galaxy Buds and using them for a while, one of the coolest features of the Buds is the touch navigation of the Buds. Tapping once on the Buds will pause whatever you are listening to. Other navigational options are: Play, volume control, and answering calls. Also, the Buds can sense when you take them out of your ear and they automatically pause and will resume upon placing back into your ear. If you don’t like the settings for the touch menu it can be changed on the app. The other simple use is the charging. It uses the same USBC charger as the newer Samsung phones and is compatible with wireless charging pads. I haven’t had to charge them much- the battery life has lasted me pretty long stretches.

Pro: Easy Pairing. The Galaxy Buds are Bluetooth enabled and paired with my Samsung Galaxy phone easily. It is set up through the Galaxy Wearable app, (which was recently updated to include a hub area for the headphones). This is the same app that connects to the Gear watch, so if you already have it then great. If not, you can easily download it from the app store. Through the Galaxy Wearable app you can check the battery percentage of the Buds, adjust the sound through an equalizer, change what the touchpad responses are, manage notifications, a “find my earbuds option, and (my favorite) the ambient sound option. The ambient sound option allows you to hear your surrounding while you play audio through the Buds. This is perfect for situations where you want to listen to music but may need to hear your surroundings- like going on a run outside but wanting to hear your surroundings for safety reasons.

Con: Although the ambient sound option is a convenient mode to use it has its cons. The ambient sounds option makes the volume low and turning up the volume all the way does not seem to help. Also, during days when it is windy, you hear the wind more than you hear the music. The ambient sound mode is a great option to use but Samsung needs to improve the sound quality.

Pro: Good Use For library. I primarily used the Buds in the library, and they are perfect for college students looking to tune out their surroundings during studying. The ambient sound mode actually worked great here. I was able to concentrate on studying while having the volume low and still being able to hear my surroundings.

Overall, the Galaxy Buds have a great feel, are easy to use and pair, and have quite a lot of customization options. I recommend for the price!
Not able to make volume loud enough to hear better

Two double clicks is difficult to control at best. Three clicks is nearly impossible. Sometimes the headphones don't differentiate from a long press or a single tap. The battery life is really good, but that is about it. If I was buying new headphones, I would go back to Beats.

ReviewTitle: These earbuds are the best I've tried
ReviewBody: I gave these earbuds a 4, but when you take everything into consideration they are by far the best I've tried.  I tried a bargain brand $40 dollar set, and couple others around the same price range made by other name brands.  In my opinion the Jabre Elite 65t had the best ambient sound functionality as well as while playing music, but they were not very comfortable for me.  On the other hand the Samsungs are sooo comfortable and they sound good as well.  That includes music and phone calls.  Everyone I ask while on calls say it sounds good.  They are small compared to the others I tried and I could literally leave these in my ears all day with no problem if I wanted to.

ReviewTitle: Poor Battery Life. Still buggy after multiple updates. Still potential to be an Outstanding product.
ReviewBody:
Overall:
This is our family's SECOND pair of Galaxy Buds using Samsung Galaxy S9+ and LG G7 ThinQ).  Both pair of Galaxy Buds have been in regular use on two different flagship phones. The first set of Galaxy Buds was purchased through Costco and the second pair were from Amazon.
We are relatively disappointed in Galaxy Buds vs PowerBeats 3.
Sound:
Music (especially bass) with Galaxy Buds is not nearly as good as PowerBeats 3.  If you are using Galaxy Buds for movies, phone calls, voice audio or do not prefer much bass, they may be a good option.
Reliability & Ambient Sound:
Galaxy Buds have had multiple updates in the few weeks that I've used them and they are still VERY buggy.
"Ambient Sound" is a significant reason why I purchased Galaxy Buds in order to gain some safety and awareness while exercising outdoors.
After multiple updates, the Ambient feature will still randomly turn itself off and require the Galaxy Wear app to be opened on the phone and the feature re-enabled. This is not always an easy fix while in the middle of an intense workout.
Ambient Sound automatically turns off when either bud is removed from your ear and it does NOT turn back on until it is enabled MANUALLY, EVERY TIME from the Galaxy Wear app on the phone.  This becomes very annoying, very quickly.
Another shortcoming of Ambient Sound is that the loudness of the Ambient Sound is configured from the Galaxy Wear app but the Ambient Sound volume does not increase with the volume of music or other content. So the result is that we are only able to hear ambient sounds around us when the volume of music or content is Very low.  I usually increase the volume a bit during workouts and any benefit of ambient sound around me is immediately lost.  This should be easily fixed via software update but remains an outstanding issue.
Buggy:
There are still occasions when Galaxy Buds will produce digital "static" as if they were too far from the phone but the phone will be sitting unobstructed and within arms reach.
Galaxy Buds Bluetooth distance is a few steps away from the phone vs 30' or more with PowerBeats.
Fit:
Galaxy Buds fit is very good while exercising, cycling, running, etc.  I have never felt like they would fall out while sweaty and moving vigorously.
The in-ear Galaxy Buds are a better solution than my over-the-ear PowerBeats (especially when wearing glasses).  Both options are comfortable for hours, however the Galaxy Buds battery will die LONG before your ears have an opportunity to become uncomfortable.
Touch Interface:
The touch interface on each Galaxy Bud has been rock solid.  The buds easily discern between 1, 2, 3 and touch & hold commands.  At times my fingers were covered in something that I did not want the buds to be covered in (cooking, cleaning, etc.), I have used my wrist and even my forearm to pause the audio and the Galaxy Buds have accurately interpreted my wish Every time.
Bottom Line:
With some further development and software updates, Galaxy Buds could easily become an absolutely Amazing product.  Unfortunately, considering the higher cost of Galaxy Buds vs my PowerBeats 3 wireless buds - which easily have 3-4 times longer battery life (real life experience vs marketing claims) and far superior sound (bass) - the Galaxy Buds leave us feeling disappointed.  I would fully expect that Samsung will work out these issues prior to the next version of Galaxy Buds and will deliver a truly innovative product.
For now, I keep my PowerBeats 3 wireless buds charged and ready for action.
All the Best!

ReviewTitle: Great sound, build, fit—range, not so much
ReviewBody: These earbuds are great! They fit snugly and sounds quality is amazing. Noise cancellation is also great. I love that I can use my wireless pad to charge them, it’s super easy and convenient. I love that its case is small and portable, not too bulky. The touch controls are very easy to learn as well. It can be a little annoying at times if you accidentally touch them, but if you consciously try to avoid it it shouldn’t be a problem. The reason it isn’t getting five stars from me is because the range isn’t all that great. I have a pair of $50 wireless buds that have more range than these do—and at $130, that should not be happening.

ReviewTitle: Did not get new Galaxy buds, despite paying for them.
ReviewBody: Just got the Galaxy buds, specifically bought them new for the full price. Cable and tips are all new (I think) but the inside of the charging case has numerous small scuff marks which will not rub out. The buds do not have any scratches or anything, but I see no reason why only the case would be used, not the buds.

Get ready for a pretty detailed review fellas.

The pros:
- Decent sound quality; you can switch the codec to scalable in the dev options and it makes somewhat of a difference. as for sound and noise, people say that it is too quiet, don't believe them, they don't know how to work it. You have to change the touch options to when you hold down it will make the volume up, as the headphones have a separate volume than the phone does.
- Excellent noice cancelling; when you put them in your ears, you cant hear people talking around you, especially when music is playing. I have to take them out to talk to people because of how good it is. I've asked people around me if they can hear my blasting music and they say they can't hear a thing so that's good.

In the middle:
- The fit; they have adjustable earpieces in them and you can change them according to your ear size. after a while you start to feel the effect of the wing, but after getting used to wearing them for a day, they don't hurt like they did. I can now wear them for long periods of time without anything hurting. it's just a matter of getting used to it. they also have great bass isolation, just adding that in there.
- The look; I have a small head and I was really sceptical about getting these considering how big they actually are. I got them, and they don't look half bad. they look like they has a price on them when you wear them, like airpods do. They fit in my ears without me looking rediculise.

The cons:
- The only thing I have found to dislike about them is that you can feel that your wearing them. I had a pair of Bose soundsport and when you wear them, you couldnt feel them and it was like it was playing around you but then you'd look and no one was jamming to the music! 10/10 recommend those btw but keep in mind they hurt your ears lot after (it's worth the pain for the sound quality). Sorry went of on a tangent.. The buds let you know how heavy they are (not a lot,but more than others).

out of all I give them about a 8/10. Hope this helps your purchase!

~~~ Your Friendly Neighborhood Spidy ~~~

Great for commutes, exercising, running, and just want to listen to a podcast. It's not ideal for dedicated music consumption. There are alternatives such as the soundpeats that offer much better audio quality, however with any other smaller brands they're limited in functionality or practicality.

Like the Airpods, these buds allow for single side use and gestures. Cheaper alternatives require some awkward fumbling to pause the music or worse pushing a button on the ear piece--this drives the ear piece into your ear and needless to say, it kind of hurts/uncomfortable.

Using this with Spotify premium (Android), I had to tweak the equalizer settings to get a comfortable listening experience without cracking the highs and the lows were kind of muted. Regardless, it's underwhelming coming from a wired experience.

Who would I recommend this to? If you like Airpods but you use an android device... Better yet if you own a Samsung device, without a doubt this provides the best listening experience. I'm not sure if it's intentional or not, it sounds and works twice as good/well than on my Pixel 3 XL.

If you're conscious of spending or on a budget, the aftermarket alternatives will do you a solid that will be hard to beat.

Somewhat durable, I've dropped mine once or twice with no issues.

Overall a good choice.

ReviewTitle: Don't buy this if you're looking for a Blutooth headset for calls
ReviewBody:
My cat was on my galaxy buds... but here's one thing: it will not say I'm verified because I brought mine from the shop Samsung app. See the image for proof. But anyways:

Here is my rating:

Sound quality: 4/5: even though these sounds great and are pretty decent, it lacks bass, and if you set your EQ setting to bass, you'll notice you'll lose some clarity. So I'd recommend Dynamic.

Noise cancelling: 4/5: it's not like you can't hear anything, but they're great when someone is talking to you and you won't hear them. As for vehicles, yes, these are very decent in noise cancelling.

Battery life: Nothing bad to say at all actually.

Now the bad part:

Calling people: 1/5: these earbuds' inner microphone technology actually gets muffled by your ears. And because of this, the other people on the call will not hear you clearly at all. This was the very reason I gave these away to my little brother. I cannot handle the muffled sound complaints from my clients while on the phone... especially if its important.
This is not what I was expecting when I bought a new pair of headphones. Hopefully this will be made right.

At first I really liked these. They sound pretty good, though high on treble, no pun intended. I like the ambient sound option - i feel safe working in lab or walking outdoors while wearing these. The equalizer barely makes a difference and the on board controls are somewhst clunky, but for pure listening they work(ed) quite well enough for me.

HOWEVER, after the first time I paired with a device other than my phone, I started having random disconnection problems between Amazon Music and the buds. BT still works, but the song goes on pause and the buds are no longer connected. This happened about 5 times in 10 minutes, very annoying. If i can't fix it soon, I'm returning them. The online suggestions  about sleeping apps don't apply as they are specific to Android 9 issues. I'm running Android 8 on an S7. Also, this problem didn't occur once until after the first disconnect/reconnect event.
I am an apple person, but these are good earbuds

Now that I've been using them daily for a few months I decided it was time to leave a review. The sound quality is very good for an ear bud. While it cannot match the bass and overall sound of a large over ear style headphone, these buds do a great job in a small package. As far as comfort, I have no complaints. They sit nicely in your ear and come with a few size options for the little wing tip that locks it in place. Even while sweating a lot at the gym and moving around a lot I have never had them fall out. The battery life is great, I haven't actually had them die on me yet because any time I'm not using them I put them back in their charging case and they get charged back up to full battery very quickly. I try to remember to charge the case for a little while every day and that has been enough to support using them for a few hours each day at work and also at the gym. The case is small and convenient to carry around, but a little slippery so I have accidentally dropped it or had it fall out of my pocket while grabbing my keys a couple times (and everything still works fine). The only reason I would not recommend these to someone would be if their primary use will be for calls. It seems like the other person has a little trouble hearing me when I talk, but I really don't make many calls with them so that is a not a priority for me. The ambient noise feature works decently if your music is at low volume. It is enough to hear your surroundings while walking indoors, but not great to have a full conversation and if you are outside, it picks up a lot of wind sound making it rather useless. Overall I would definitely recommend these ear buds to anyone with a Samsung phone.

ReviewTitle: Great features and function but overpriced hype. Phone Call Audio is the Worst!
ReviewBody:
Overall rating: 6/10
Here's the thing, if you're looking for an Airpod replacement for the Android world this will fit the bill.The cost is in line with the other big brands, the quality and functionality is all on par. As a professional in the financial industry I constantly find myself on conference calls and really wanted something to work as well as the Airpods for phone calls, these fail miserably. Let's break this down:

Pros - Rating 9/10
  * Connectivity 10/10
The Bluetooth connectivity on these buds is first class. Connected first time every time. Left bud solo, check. Right bud solo, check. Both buds, check. Back and forth quick switching, check. These were just amazing, faster and more reliable than my Airpods.
* Design 9/10
The storage case is sleek and compact, nearly identical in girth to the Airpods. They slide into my pocket and are virtually unnoticeable.
 * Comfort 9/10
The in ear fit is far away and above the fit of Airpods. Phenomenal fit and extremely comfortable. This was the number one reason why I held on to these for so long, haven't found a better fitting earbud yet.
 * Noise Cancellation (Passive) 8/10
The noise isolation (passive noise cancellation) was very very good with nearly zero outside noise pollution. This allowed for good quality audio when listening to music or videos.
 * Software 8/10
The accompanying app allows for altering the audio EQ, albeit limited selections, but better than what's on the market right now. The app also gives the user the option to change what your touches do left bud vs right bud.
 * Special Features 8/10
Ambient sound was a favorite feature, I found myself turning this on rather than removing my bud to speak to those around me (i.e. at the gym, quick interactions at the register, etc.) Very cool feature that prevents you from constantly pulling your bud out just to make a quick response.
 * Charging Features 10/10
USB C charging! So great to only need one cord to charge multiple devices now. and the charge time was fairly quick. These also support wireless charging and, should you have the newer Galaxy phone, you can charge them with your phone sans wireless. How cool is that! (keep reading, you might be doing this more than you think)

Cons - Rating 4.5/10
 * Call Audio 3/10
Call audio deserves the top spot on this list. The quality is atrocious! With the latest firmware update the background noise cancellation is so terrible that is garbles your voice so badly you will be constantly repeating yourself. Even in a quiet room the frequency range in the software is calibrated such that the high pitched noise pressure is cut out making you sound muffled and dense. Considering my unique need to be on phone calls for majority of my day, occasionally needing to speak to clients, these were a bust. At this price, you can do WAAAAY better if your just looking for workout buds or occasional music listening buds.
 * Sound EQ Quality 7/10
Bass response is weak on the buds. I wasn't expecting anything amazing but when calling out a specialized audio tuning (AKG) I expected more. Music sounded great no doubt, but I was left wanting. You do have a few fixed EQ settings, but you cannot modify the frequencies like a normal EQ. Still something is better than nothing.
 * Battery 6/10
Battery life was OK but not great. The sleek nature of the case apparently prevented Samsung from including a large battery in the case. I would get maybe 2 days until the case would be depleted after a few hours of use each day (mostly music as phone calls were just terrible and I was fearful to use them in case I had to speak). I feel this is a little on the lower end of battery life, but the case is very small.
 * Magnets 5/10
Weak magnets hold the buds in the case, I had multiple instances of the buds falling out in the beginning as I put too much faith in the strength of the magnets. The slightest jolt with the lid open will unseat the buds. I had one instance where the right bud wasn't seated correctly and didn't charge while in the case. That was odd.
 * Price 5/10
Price is a bit high for what is offered. This is my personal bias as I feel I lost 50% of the functional usage of these buds. When I resorted to using them strictly for music I felt frustrated every time I thought of the cost. The fit was perfect, the touch control and connectivity was tops, but music listening was not my top priority with these.

If you are itching to spend a cool Benjamin+, are an avid gym rat, love music and have a Galaxy phone, these are for you. If you ever want to use them for phone calls, or have enough sense to know there are better priced buds out there for similar functionality, I'd look elsewhere.

ReviewTitle: Great headphones, bad amazon service experience.
ReviewBody:
So after reading lots of good and bad reviews, I gave them a try for myself. I've had them got A day and so far I'm pretty impressed honestly. I didn't have the gear iconx or whatever the predecessors to these were. I went for a decent length walk yesterday with Lots of stuff in my pockets along with my phone and had minimal sputtering, by that I mean once. The buds never came out of sync with one another fortunately as I had also read.
These buds are super immersive with their sound and I really like the quality of the sound, very full but the bass could be a little fuller, but its still pretty good, especially for wireless headphones.
The call quality for me was fine, not stellar, but when I got a call yesterday on my walk, I answered the call with my buds and left the phone in my pocket and kept walking and the call went smoothly. I was walking along a busy street and the person on the other end had no issues hearing me.
The down side wasn't on part of the buds, but amazon really. I didn't appreciate this, "free one day shipping" then my package didn't get to me causing me to have to go to the post office the next day and the told me that the package had just come in right before I got there. Amazon told me that my Apt wasn't accessable and told me that's why my package wasn't delivered. If it's really two day shipping, just say that.

Great Price and fits snug in ears without it being too bulky. Good sound for music and movies. Ambient noise option is good, could be better. I liked that I can wear just one ear piece without having to adjust any settings. Great for running and hiking.

Cons:
Biggest issue is the call quality. The main reason to have the bluetooth is to make calls while keeping my hands free to multitask BUT almost every call the other person says there is too much noise.  They cannot hear me clearly. Some have said it sounds extremely windy or like I'm under water. It is very frustrating wish this problem could be fixed through a software update.

ReviewTitle: Great for music. Terrible for talking.
ReviewBody:
The sound quality in terms of listening to music or whatever is very good.  The auto pairing and case are pretty cool too.
However, the audio quality in terms of talking is so bad they are unusable for a conversation.  They should just remove the microphone altogether.  I received constant complaints that my voice was unintelligible even when in quiet environments.  Also, the lack of a mute button should have been a clue these weren't designed for phone calls.

ReviewTitle: I am so glad that I bought these
ReviewBody: These are now my new favorite headphones. The headphones have amazing sound quality. I would hands down choose these over any other headphones. The battery last for a long time and are charged in the case when you are not using them. You can just charge the case over night. When I use these my ears do not get sore unlike some other headphones after longer periods of time. I would recommend this to anyone who is on the fence or are just looking to get good headphones.
Wish the ambient feature was better but overall great buds!
Excelente son

ReviewTitle: Quality at a semi modest price!
ReviewBody: Only complaint i have is the case feels like its gonna crush the earbuds when its closed. Connects to my phone great(Galaxy S9), sound is crisp, bass is nice, and the fact you can use 1 at a time is awesome for me. Compared to other brands ive seen for much more $, for the price these seem very reasonable.
Me encantan se escuchan muy bien

ReviewTitle: Upgrade worthy? No. But still decent.
ReviewBody:
Pros:
-Nice function for the case to be wireless charge-capable
-Earbuds are comfortable, have other size options if necessary
-Earbuds themselves turn on when in your ear, making them quite efficient for battery
-Easy connectivity with phone (using Samsung S9+)

Cons:
-Sound quality leaves much to be desired - using the equalizer in the Galaxy Wearable app is a must
-Lack of much customization for custom user commands with the long press
-Not waterproof (I bought another pair of wireless headphones for about $40 that were great and water resistant)
-Ambient Sound mode is a bit tough to really see the potential for at first (personal thing).

I like these headphones quite a bit. I've been a Samsung fella for some time, so I'm going to use these for longer and make an update later. These are mainly first impressions. However, if you're considering upgrading from another headset, I wouldn't really recommend it much unless you feel an actual need for the little quirks (ambient sound mode, touchpad instead of a button for functions).
excellent gits perfect sound is awesome. one touch button features makes it totally wireless and hands free.

Fits great in my ear, making it good for exercise. Sound quality is amazing for wireless earbuds, making it good for casual listening in public. I've never had the battery run out on me as I was using them, and I only charge the case every 3rd day while using the buds frequently.
Great

ReviewTitle: You cant go wrong with these buds!
ReviewBody: Great product.  Sound quality is excellent the wear app is a great.  Several customizable features that have gotten my air pods friends to switch

I love these little things! I’m 100% and apple user. But I just can’t stand the apple pods since they’re so uncomfortable. So I got these and I definitely don’t regret it. The case is small and cute.  Comes with different size rubber pieces. People hear me when I talk with them. Only thing I really struggle with is the whole tapping thing. Tap once to pause, tap twice to skip. It only works half the time. I’ll tap twice to skip my song and it only registers one tap so my music will stop. Really bugs me, but I have an Apple Watch so I can just skip my songs that way no big deal

Very disappointed. I can not use it with phone calls. The microphone is very bad. Nobody understands what i saying when we talk.
It is ok to hear music.
Wasn't impressed,returned.not good for calls
This buds are really something. I have options for the different equalizers and it easy to use on call or music.
They were great until the charging case stopped working

Exceeds expectations!
Once you find right ear size adaptor (all included)
It's great for noise cancellation, deep bass, and overall good sound. Use dynamic mode on Galaxy S10 gear app for best experience!
Only thing slightly negative is call quality but Samsung continues to push software updates on improvement so it's not being ignored. Still 5/5 for me.

Lost my first pair...but they were impressive enough for me to purchase another pair. THIS time I got a case that has a clip that i can attach to my keyring or book bag and it goes on the charging case!

I had to return them. The left ear bud kept going static and not resetting. Eventually it cut out all together and wouldn’t turn on. I really wanted to like these. They started out strong and I had a lot of hope.

Overall these are fantastic headphones.  The build quality is very nice.  The small case that also acts as a charger makes sure that your headphones never die. The sound quality is superb however the ambient noise feature doesn't work to well.  for battery life i use them for 7 hours straight before i have to charge them.  The touch pad on the side is honestly atrocious.  Whenever i double tap to skip a song most of the time it doesnt even work.  Its very rare that i can skip three songs in a row without it pausing and unpausing five times, maybe im not doing it right.  So because of the bad touchpad and the ambient noise feature not working well i give it a rating of 4 stars.
I love them small nice sound stylish
I have many blue tooth ear bud' this is my favorite so far.
Love the the music projection, puts you into a state of live music! You don't even feel the earbuds...

Do not purchase these if you’re going to use them on an iPhone. The buds feel great in ear and are comfortable but the AirPods have a much better sound quality. I was very disappointed with the buds. For the same price, I recommend buying the AirPods if you care about sound quality. You may have a different sound experience if you have an android phone but you seriously don’t want to use them on apple products. They sound just as bad if not worse than cheap $10 headphones.
The volume doesnt get as loud as I would like during use.

ReviewTitle: Works for iPhone 7 and tiny ears!
ReviewBody: I have very tiny ears and these fit nicely into them. I use them constantly (at least one at a time) and the battery lasts at least 2 days. I am a night shift nurse and I use an ear bud to listen to my TV in the ear that I am not laying on in order to drown out people mowing their lawn, garbage trucks, or the neighbors dogs barking. Works great! I use mine with an apple iPhone 7, so I can’t use the special controls to increase sound quality, but they sound just fine. Sometimes I just they were louder.
The right side has a problem there is an annoying hammering feedback for the caller
buds  not working
One of the best buds Samsung is killing it with this product
nice
Fantastic product. Great quality.

The product was delivered to the wrong house by Amazon. I am lucky the people in that house are honest and took the time to come to my house to deliver the product. Now regarding the product, it works perfectly with my Galaxy Note 8. It's comfortable to wear even for extended period of time.
Fit perfect and great battery life

ReviewTitle: They're fine, not worth the price
ReviewBody: These are ok, they get the job done. The battery life is great and they're easy to pair. However, the sound is really low for some songs (I listen to a variety of genres from classical to hard rock) and decent for others. I live in NY and use these for my commute on the bus/train, and there are just some songs I straight up cant hear. Im new to the wireless buds game, and these were not really a great intro.
DEMASIADO BUENOS

The Samsung Galaxy Buds are a pleasant surprise and improves on the previous-generation Icon X in many ways.

Tuned by AKG, these Galaxy Buds are long-lasting and well balanced. I was able to get close to 6 hours of play time before recharging. The carrying case has the ability to quickly recharge the earphones and was very convenient to carry. Wireless charging is a big plus for this case as well.

To my delight, the sound was evenly balanced without too much bass or treble. Although, there is an app available if you do want to make sound adjustments.

The buds are pretty forgettable when inserted in your ear. Meaning that the weight is not an issue. Built-in gesture controls were super convenient in controlling my music without needing to reach for my phone. Thankfully, there are a myriad of included bud and positioning tip sizes for every ear type. I was able to mix-and-match my tips until I found one that was comfortable for me.

My favorite feature of this wireless earphone was the ambient sound mode, which allowed me to listen into what’s going on around me while listening to my music privately. Great for those open office situations or if you’re walking in public.

And when I get a phone call while I’m listening to music, the person on the other side could hear me loud and clear with the embedded microphones.

Overall, the Samsung Galaxy Buds blew away my expectations for wireless earphones and I highly recommend it.
Great sound quality, fit in my ears perfectly also. I use them at work for at least 5-6 hours a day and never worry about battery life

They have different earpieces so that you can find your right fit, I use them mostly for phone calls and I have not gotten any complaints on the other end about not being able to be heard.  As I use them for phone calls I generally use one at a time so I can wear it all day long with out a whole lot of battery drain.

I enjoy every aspect of these earbuds except the very poor connection strength. I feel something was sacrificed to allow the miniscule 45mah batteries to powet these buds for 6 whole hours. I'm not sure but I suspect they sacrificed signal strength. Simply putting the phone under my leg whem sitting will kill the signal. Same with back pocket and ,more often that I can ignore, it skips and stutters when in my pocket. I have to be practically holding the phone for a good signal. Fix this issue and they'll easily be one of the best buds around.
Love them

ReviewTitle: Opening the charge case puts it in pairing mode. Fully charge on first use.
ReviewBody:
I've owned the previous Gear IconX and can safely say the sound quality which has been tuned by their AKG subsidiary has definitely improved it.

Bluetooth 5.0 gives it a snappy connection speed.

It fits more snuggly in my ear, it also comes with 3 different sized ear tips, and two different size wingtips.

The size of them will almost leave you in awe, the charging case is smaller and the buds are smaller.

The Touch controls still feel the same compared to the last one, albeit somewhat a bit more responsive - just a tiny bit.

Only cons are that it is NOT going to last long in water, I mean you can assume so from other reviews. It IS sweat resistant, of course.

Oh, and also it doesn't have on-board storage.

Other than that, it's an overall improvement.
Overall very satisfied with the buds.
Sound quality is awesome but goes out of sync regularly; major downside.

ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
ReviewBody:
TL,DR;
-Fit my tiny ears, comfortably
-Can be used together or independently
-Happy I've spent the money for the quality

I have gotten some cheap earbuds over the years, bought a different set and returned them the next day due to not fitting at all just before getting these. Granted the tech has improved as a function of time. These are worth every dollar so far.
I have small ears, finding buds that will fit is very hard (even using the smallest options). These are the most comfortable and secure I've ever tried.
Being able to use each bud independent of the other was a huge factor in deciding on these over the more expensive ones I was eyeing. I'm still getting used to the touch aspect, I like it though. You don't need to mash them into your ear to get the button to engage. The set-up was super easy and I like that there's an app for further control/customization.
It's a bit disappointing that the case dosn't have a bigger battery for more charges. That's a small gripe though since I tend to only use one at a time.
These aren't for hard audiophiles, from what I've seen so far. If that's a deal-breaker; go drop on some corded-over ear monitors.
So happy I took the plunge on these.

ReviewTitle: Sounds good, great connection and extremely high quality!
ReviewBody: Got these from my work place for $80 brand new, and for the price it's absolutely mind-blowing good!

ReviewTitle: Great but wish for one more thing
ReviewBody: These earbuds are great. They fit well in the ears and block out a considerable amount of sound. Battery life on a single charge is good with 6 hours of playtime. The only thing I wish was that the case held at least 2 charges instead of one.

ReviewTitle: The ambient sound could be a little louder. Other than, that it's a great feature to have.
ReviewBody: I just received mine today and they are fantastic! Really worth the money!
Very good quality.. But sound can be improved. (bass specially)
Blows the cheap Chinese earbuds out of the water.
I love the concealment of these compared to the pods that have a down stem.  Bad thing.... looks like a hearing aid.

ReviewTitle: Good sound quality and good buy.
ReviewBody: Good purchase. Everything about the ear buds were as described. And they say in place. Although, I'm still trying to learn how to turn down then volume using the ear buds without using my phone buttons. I'm sure I'll get the hang of it soon enough.
One wouldn't charge, and connection would be lost from time to time. Samsung should make Galaxy Buds2, with better software and improve on small bugs

ReviewTitle: Buy them. And keep them close.
ReviewBody:
They're awesome.....but I left mine in my pocket when I did the wash.....now I'm sad.

10/10 would buy again even if I knew I would ruin them.

Sonido ambiental

ReviewTitle: I have an iPhone, but I am not a CRAZY Apple person!
ReviewBody:
First, a quick summary.  I had these earbuds for 2 days and returned them. The only thing I like about them is the battery life and the in-ear design.  Music quality sucks, phone conversations blow, and the hand gestures need work.  Okay, that is the summary.

Like you, I was in the market for wireless earbuds and I had narrowed it down to Samsung or the Airpods.  I am not a big fan of the Airpods "boom mic" design, so I read a few reviews of the Samsung earbuds, and they sound legit.  BOY were they wrong.  Lets start with sound quality, or better put, the lack there of.  I am not some music snob and can't quote any thing fancy about the sound.  I would just describe it as flat and weak. The bass does not exist. For any music (country, POP, R&B, ect)  The sound reminds you of the free handout earbuds you get on an airplane.  Yes, I know with an iphone you don't have assess to the  app with the eq, but the app I use to stream music has an eq in it and none of the adjustments made this sound any better.  I tried to convince myself it wasn't that bad, but it is.  I really wanted to like them. Next is phone calls.  In a quiet room, phone calls are fine. I meant TOTALLY quiet room. Any situation with background noise call quality is terrible.  I made several attempts in my car, walking the streets, in a doctor's office.  All had the same result.  People wee using context clues to piece together the conversation.  I really wanted to like these, but they suck!
Excelente producto, 100% recomendable.

I can not believe how great these are. Better then the i phone ear buds. They do not fall out the sound quality is so amazing. I bout a pair and my son was so impressed he ordered a pair the next day. Pairs easily and has a battery life of 7 plus hours.

ReviewTitle: These are a great airpods for Android
ReviewBody: Everything is great but the left earphone cuts in and out when Quick Ambience is on

ReviewTitle: Best ear buds for the price
ReviewBody: Great ear buds with great sound quality

ReviewTitle: One bud stopped on 2 different orders
ReviewBody: Initial purchase was as a gift for my son. Paired easily and worked fine for a couple of weeks then one of the buds stopped working.  Had seen multiple reviews with same issue. Returned and purchased second pair through Amazon without hassle.  Second set lasted longer but about 4 months in same issue, one bud stopped working. Now outside of return window and only one working ear bud. Would like to return again but afraid issue will persist.  All other aspects of ear buds were great while they worked. I guess will be looking for an alternative.

Bought this item to replace a pair of Rowkin Micro Touch earbuds which failed too soon. Out of the box, connecting to power, my phone, etc... was extremely easy. I don't have a Samsung phone, so I cannot comment on that aspect. Charges quickly. Noise cancellation depends on your location. In a noisy gym, the noise cancellation works well.
One thing I dont like is how I cant have my phone in my pocket with out the signal dropping everyonce in a while
Great earbuds.
Love my buds
buds would disconnect at random.

ReviewTitle: These earbuds are great for the price , no need to look further
ReviewBody:
Just got my Galaxy Buds in after hearing weeks of the hype of how good these buds were ,finally after 1 week.  I opened the box and immediately it was synced.  That was the first amazing thing. Secondly was putting them on and the snug fit. Next I tried listening to a quality song on YouTube.  And I was blown away at the quality of the sound. It was amazing.  I could hear different debts of the instruments in the songs.  I had been trying to upgrade from wired earphones for awile but didn't want to waste money and time on the wrong upgrade.  Man, was this rewarding.  Now I have been telling my friends about this every since I have been having them.  They are definitely worth the money.  I'm very happy with these now. I don't see myself ordering more earbuds . These are a keeper. Sound is amazing.
Comfortable to wear.  Many things to discover. Another fine Samsung product.

⚠️ I've always had good quality products from Amazon. This one is NOT one of them.

I'd like to start off by saying the Samsung Galaxy Buds functionality review is #2 here and is separate from the main point.

#1: Nastiest package from Amazon ever. These buds came Very USED condition with oils and ear wax crusted to the device and charge container. Bought to use before going on a trip making it pointless to return at the time. Should have paid considerably less for having to sanitize them. Minor scratches on package after finding items were scattered, fully apart, thrown around in large shipping box.
Possibly the most disappointed I've been for conditions of a shipment in years. (4k picture uploaded, apologies for grossness)

#2: Samsung Galaxy Buds functionality: Still quite the upgrade from the first bluetooth set produced from Samsung. The size is perfect for small ears and has sizing to adjust for larger. Range is massive, best upgraded feature imo aside from size reduction.

Will update if new opinions.
Thanks for reading 🙂

I could never find an adjustment that made them comfortable in my ears for longer than fifteen minutes. Also, I got interference often. My robot vacuum, my microwave, really any appliance caused my music or podcast to stutter. The fifty dollar wireless buds I got worked way better than this. Overall, I'd say these are not worth the money, especially if you have small ears.

I absolutely love the galaxy buds. I gave the buds a 5 star because the are perfect small portable and last a long time between charges I'm averaging around 12-13 hours total play back and that's insane for how small these things are. The are able to be charged either with a charging cable or wirelessly and both work well.. the size and weight of the actual earbud is perfect it's super light so once it in the ear its almost unnoticeable they do cancel most noise and do offer an ambient sound setting to help keep you alert to your surroundings but I have found that feature is not as good as I was expecting. The sound from these is good for an earbud but it's just not fair to compare these to a pair of high quality/studio headphones. The bass is impressive for the size but unfortunately the ear buds do not seem to get super loud even turned up the entire way they are loud but not deafening I am using these on my galaxy s10+ as well as my Acer Laptop with all eq settings to off.

ReviewTitle: Quality does not justify the price
ReviewBody:
I have no quibble with the battery life or charging time. Both are very good. I do have a problem paying over $100 for buds that will not stay connected. They constantly cut out. It's very annoying. The other problem is I have to have volume at max on my phone to hear my music over the ambient noise.
Seriously, these are no better than the ones on Amazon for $39.00.

Love these. My ear canal has typically been too small for in ear headphones, but I tried out the Jabra elite 65t and they had that problem, my ear was too small. So I tried Galaxy buds and they are perfect. Only a small amount of discomfort which I may get used to, it has only been one day. Very impressed, especially since it is much cheaper than airpods.

These are so well made. The sound isn't the best out there, but since they cancel noise so well (too well) quality of sound seems amazing because of this. Connectivity with Android is amazing. I don't believe that the battery life is that great, but because you keep them charging in the case, you actually never run low. Fit is great, it will be hard for me to return to Beats.
I couldn’t hear from the Bluetooth

Honestly, these buds mesh prefectly with my Galaxy Note 9.  They run like don't have any connection issues.  The sound quality is excellent for the price.  You are not going to get ultra high end earbud sound quality out of them, but you are definitely going to get high quality sound.  I love the size of the case and how it slips into your pocket easy enough to forget about it being there.  My only gripe is the magnets that hold the earbuds in the case are a bit weak.  BE VERY CAREFUL with this when opening the case while walking on the street or other places.  The buds may have a tendency to fall out if they receive enough of a shake with the case open, which can really suck if they fall on pavement.

What a fantastic product from Samsung. These are insanely comfortable - I rarely have problems even after wearing these for literally 12+ hours a day. I can sleep with these in and not even notice they're there.

Excellent comfort aside, the sound quality is pretty good, definitely on the level of Airpods and probably a step above. Bass is definitely not as good as it could be, but it's more than fine and mids/highs are clear and defined. The perfect product for my needs, and a great choice for most people, especially if you don't want to support Apple and its predatory business practices.
Best buds ever!!
Never leave home without them.

ReviewTitle: Volume very low. Sound quality sucks. Great for phone calls, not so great for music.
ReviewBody: These are good buds. But the gear iconx were great. I'm pretty torn between these and the iconx. IconX were a lot louder and better sound quality IMO. Also had better bass. But it was hard to use them for phone calls in the car or with TV on. Anybody I was on the phone with could hear every bit of environmental noise and claimed it drowned out my own voice sometimes because of the built in microphones being placed on the outside of the buds (not great if u drive an older land rover that has a lot of road noise). These new galaxy buds placed 1 set of the microphones on the inside of the buds and makes for better phone calls. Also, the gear iconx uses paper material mesh screens that block the noise if they get moist at all and then sound wont come through and u have to replace them. They come with 12 replacement screens, but there is absolutely NO wAY to order more! Samsung doesnt even carry them so I had to send mine back and then it took 2-3 months to replace them, but they didnt have any iconx any more so I decided to try the galaxy buds instead of the refund. I've only had them 1 day, and I dont like them as much as the icon x. Only thing I like better is the phone call quality is better and they use metal mesh screens that u can clean instead of those stupid paper mesh ones that get ruined everytime u work out with them. Bixby is even harder to work on galaxy buds. And they dont have the on board storage either which isn't too big of a deciding factor for me, but definitely was more convenient. However, I have my phone with me everywhere so the onboarding storage didnt matter too much. But they got rid of it and could have improved sound quality or something atleast.

Absolute junk. Either the mic or blue tooth sync screwes up after a two months and samsungs support is obnoxious, so just out 130 bucks now. I've owned a large multitude of blue tooth devices and never had one sound like a helicopter over the other end which is apparently not uncommon with these. Samsung made it a nightmare to exchange them on top of it which just makes matters more annoying.
i got these i thought they would be good but there okay my friend let me try on airpods and the bass and sound quality was better disappointed i really thought these would be better.

Purchase this a few weeks ago due to the price, value, and brand name reputation. Paired this with an iPhone 8+ and thus far has had few instances of sound muffling and lost connections. This is frustrating when using it in the gym. The battery light is finicky and often unreliable or does not display. I knew that I could not download the Buds app with an iPhone and I was ok with that when purchasing. For $130, there are better options out there.

ReviewTitle: Best wireless headphones for the money for sure
ReviewBody: Good sound fits well in ear and priced right

Couldn't always get phone reception while walking around the house on the phone. These earbuds are awesome for that. The battery life is impressive and the charging case exceeded my expectations. Well done.
I use it for 3 days and I already see the results.

I have used wireless headphones before, but these are the first wireless earbuds I've ever used. After doing some research I decided to get these. It was a fabulous choice. The sound quality is well balanced and the sound cancellation is very good as well, thanks to the way the buds fit in your ear. Additionally the touchpad on the side works well and the customization is handy. The charging case is a convenient USB C and charges quickly. I used these buds with a Google pixel 3 and the Bluetooth connection has worked well. They connect automatically when you put them in your ear, after initial pairing.
Me encantaron

ReviewTitle: Great for athletes, stay in your ears!
ReviewBody: I do a lot of running and working out at the gym and was tired of earphones with a cord that draped around my neck.  I had bought some cheaper $40 dollar no name brand from Amazon earlier and they were okay, but these are far superior, in how they sound AND staying put in your ears.  Sweat is no bother either as these are water resistant.

ReviewTitle: Not a lot of bass, very little but comfortable, poor touch pad accuracy
ReviewBody: They stay in the ear, but minimal noise cancelation and all tinny trebles, not much bass, further I am having a hard timing getting the touchpads to work, at all. I have to remove each bud, replace it in my ear and then the pad might work.
Not the loudest one’s but they do their job and stays on my ears

The sound quality is 10/10 for me. It might take a couple of tries to find the right size of buds to attach so that they fit snugly in your ear though. But once you do, it blocks out a lot of the sound, and I NEVER put the volume past the "unsafe levels" and I like my music LOUD. Its loud enough that I can only hear my music when jogging, its great.

Speaking of jogging, these things have never once popped out during any strenuous activities/exercise either. Sometimes I'll be upside down for ab exercises and they've never fallen out.

I had tried the Bose wireless headphones before, way too big and clunky, fell out who knows how many times in the 1 week I had them before I returned them. AND the biggest thing that made me return them was because when on a phone call/discord/skype only ONE bud would work. These headphones work together or separately, they're 10/10.

The battery life is great too, I charge them for maybe 30 minutes every couple of days. But I'm not too sure on how long the battery life lasts in total, I generally use them at the gym for 2 hours a day, and a couple hours whenever I'm out of the house for shopping.

If you have android, it automatically connects to your phone the moment you close the case and pop them into your ears. Not too sure about iphone since I don't have one.

I need to get another pair for my mother, hook it up, Samsung!
Product works like advertised these ear buds are awesome
Love these :-)
These are good earbuds.  They are very convenient.  I like these earbuds.

I used to have a samsung gear circle, which lasted almost 12,13 hr on one time charge i was skeptical about buds battery life beofre buying it, but working at customer service It last more than 15 hr on one time charge, standby time is awesome as well. perfect fit for working.

I bought these for use solely at the gym because I was tired of the cord for my other buds getting in the way.
Sounds quality is important to me.  When I'm at home or on a plane, I use an older pair of Monster over ear noise cancelling headphones.  They're not Sennheisers, but they sound good and way better than any buds.
Functionally, the Galaxy Buds work great.  I've read about Bluetooth issues when they first came out, but those seem to have been fixed in an earlier update.  I've had no problems with connectivity or the app.  They stay nicely in my ears and I'm not worried about them falling out.  I love the low profile and the buttons work fine.
However, the sound quality is pretty much garbage.  Specifically, there is no low end.  There is a bass boost option in the app but it it doesn't boost bass at all.  I also turned on the eq in Spotify and turned the bass up there and that made it so that at least I can tell there is a bass guitar in the mix, but really no low end.  I even listened to Les Claypool. Also, when I've used these to make phone calls I've been told it sounds ok but not great.  One call that was made outside in light wind apparently sounded terrible.  I had to disconnect the pods and use the handset.
At first I was set on getting Airpods but I use Android, so when these came out I read some reviews and the marketing hype about how these were tuned by audio professionals so I took a chance.  My friend says his Airpods have decent bass and now I wish I got those.

ReviewTitle: I love Samsung's Galaxy Bluetooth Earphones! Super Sound and Battery Life.
ReviewBody: I ordered my Samsung Galaxy Earphones to be Surprisingly Satisfied. I feel Samsung has finally beat out the Apple Earpod. I find the case just the right size and still packs enough battery for several recharges. The ear phones themselves are excellent, great shape that locks into my ear and allows me to lie on a pillow without hurting my ear. I love that I can choose to where one st a time which only extends the battery life that much longer. Its nice that you can charge these wirelessly,  which I'm use to since my last 4 phones from Samsung have had that ability,  but when I upgrade to the Newest Note this Summer 2019 my phone will wirelessly recharge the earphone case if I'm somewhere without a plug. I just can't say enough about these except if your debating between Samsung's Galaxy Earphones and Apples Earpods Samsung Galaxy WINs!

I just got my Galaxy Buds yesterday, so I will update the review if the issue is resolved.

I'll start off with the positives. The battery life is great, lasting the whole work day and well into the night on a single charge (with occasionally putting them in the case to charge during meetings). They're relatively comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The case is decent quality and offers the option of wireless charging and USB-C charging.

Now on to the bad I've experienced. When walking with my phone in my pocket (S8), listening to Spotify, the music constantly cuts out, occasionally echos, and gets distorted. I thought it might have been a bad data connection so I tried playing some music that I had stored on my phone, but experienced the same results. I was hoping to use this when working out, going for a run, etc., but if I can't even walk down the street without connectivity issues, I can only imagine what vigorous work would do to it.

The case construction itself leaves much to be desired. It's made out of a cheap plastic and I could see the lid easily breaking off if my three year old gets ahold of it.

Bottom line: The Galaxy Buds are not for everyone. I would recommend them to those who are relatively staionary and don't have little kids. If you live any kind of active lifestyle, you should stay away until they update the issues they're currently having.
The silver looks super nice. No bugs that I've encountered.

Samsung’s roster includes three color options for the buds -- they come in your basic black and white but also in a really bright yellow for all you flashy folks out there.

The #GalaxyBuds have about 13 total hours of battery life and I’ve pretty much been able to match or exceed those hours with basic use at work and at home while testing them out. And the best part is they charge SUPER fast. The Buds last about 6 solid hours on a single charge and then another 7-8 hours after a quick charge from the cradle/case, which charges them wirelessly!

The dual microphones and Ambient mode build in both earbuds has great voice quality during phone calls. I am pretty impressed. Ambient mode allows just the right amount of noise cancelling you can adjust to fit your surroundings. If you’re living or working in the big city you can adjust the sound.

If you’re a Samsung junkie you are familiar with the control features, like turning up the volume with a single touch or skipping to the next track with a tap. And if you’re new to Samsung’s lineup of premium sound headphones, you are in for a treat!

When I first received the Buds I was expecting them to be much bigger but to my surprise they are a perfect size and nice and lightweight. Samsung also included several different sizes of wingtips (or fins as I call them) and eartips sizes to find your exact fit for your ears to maximize comfort.

Pros

--Easy pairing/connecting to your devices.
--Battery life is pretty decent and the buds charge fast.
--Stylish, lightweight and comfortable.
--Premium sounds quality from AKG.
--Great for active wears. No falling out or shifting.
--Custom wingtips and eartips for comfort.
--Noise cancelling.

Cons

--Sound is slightly too low in ambient mode.
--In-ear sounds.
--Had to re-pair the buds after the left bud randomly stopped playing music.
--No way to clip case to keys or a chain.

These Galaxy Buds are top quality earbuds for those with an active lifestyle or just want to have comfortable buds to listen to music in the office. Call quality is a plus -- the calls are crystal clear and the dual microphones keeps a great balance of your voice for the caller. The battery life is great and the bud can charge to almost 2 hours in 15 minutes if you are in a rush. I think my favorite feature is the premium AKG sound quality for music and the built-in equalizer settings in the Samsung Wearables app. I am super happy to have these #GalaxyBuds in my arsenal for Samsung wearables.

ReviewTitle: Finally; truly wireless earbuds that fit me.
ReviewBody: I've spent a tiny fortune trying to find truly wireless earphones that work for me. I live in the Apple-sphere, so of course I've been trying to use Airpods. Good sound, but they just don't stay in my ears. A few others had other problems. But, I came across a review for the Samsung Galaxy Earbuds from a trusted source, and decided I'd try once more. Well, they not only fit, but the sound quality is pretty good and they don't look like bended Qtips hanging off my ears (as a mature woman, that's important). Thanks, Samsung.

I just got these and I was NOT expecting them to be this good. I have my hair parted to the side and that means I can use one of them at a time and listen to music at work without anyone noticing at all because my hair covers my right ear. The sound quality really is good. Definitely not like stock earphones at all. Not as great as a full on headset, but you hardly notice any dip in quality and you get amazing portability with it. I can't comment on the battery life just yet but I will likely update this with that info after a week, although I have a portable charger just in case. Also, it ships with a USB-C cable in the box so don't worry about purchasing that seperately. Very satisfied with my purchase.

EDIT: May 20th; The battery life actually isn't that bad. I haven't had to recharge them with my portable charger even once. They charge in the case about 3 1/2 times for me and they each lasted about 5 hours, although I do only use one sometimes.

I usually dislike ear buds, but these are great! They're very comfortable, and you hardly feel them in your ears. They're a perfect fit, so they don't fall out. I was worried about losing them since there isn't a cord attached, but there is a convenient locator in the Galaxy buds app. There's also an ambient sound setting that allows you to hear what's around you since they are noise cancelling. Each bud has a touch pad that allows you to pause/skip song/previous song/etc. My only gripe is the touch pads are sensitive, so you can accidentally push it if you're not careful. It's not a negative though, as you get use to it. There's also a setting to lock the touchpad so you won't. I use these for sleeping and ASMR mostly, and I have to say they're the most comfortable I've tried so far. (I'm a side sleeper) I highly recommend them to anyone interested.

This review is based on my experience using these buds at work with my brand new Samsung Galaxy S10 Plus (and the Wearables App).

I've had every Galaxy S phone since the S7, but this is the first pair of Samsung wireless buds I've ever owned. Previously, I'd just buy a $20 pair of bluetooth headphones on Amazon, which would last about a year before needing to be replaced. Those $20 headphones never had half the issues I've had in the past week with these!

My main issue with these buds is that everyday they disconnect and reconnect about 20x. Sometimes they'll say that they're connected and then I go to play music and they'll disconnect and reconnect, but still not play anything. I usually have to turn bluetooth off and on to get them to reconnect properly, and even that sometimes doesn't work, so I'll pull out the charging case, put them in, close the case, and re-open it. Eventually, they'll connect properly, but playing music shouldn't be a 10 step procedure. I have the stupid wearables app, and everything, the buds have a full charge, and they just don't want to connect properly. It's maddening, ding, ding, in your ear every time it decides to drop and reconnect because you tried to play a song.

My next issue is the call quality, I use these at work, where I take at least 10 calls a day. About 4 times now, I've heard myself echoing back at me, which is incredibly distracting when you're trying to have a conversation. It'll just start out of nowhere too, mid call. Other times, the mic is just really bad, people complain that they can't hear me and I have to speak up. It does nothing to cancel out background noise. I've been told to put myself on mute several times during conference calls with these buds (in the same office where my $20 buds had no issues).

Lastly, the wireless charging seems to be pretty spotty. It'll be charging and then all of a sudden lose connection, and need to be re-positioned on the charger.

At this point, I don't know if the issues I described are due to a defect, or issues with the Galaxy S 10 Plus, or what, but it's just unacceptable. A $1000 phone and a $120 pair of buds that can't seem to work right together just goes to show that Samsung doesn't know what they're doing. I'm sending back the buds, and looking into replacing the S10+ with a Google Pixel 3a XL.
Can't say anything bad about these, just buy them you'll love them

ReviewTitle: iPhone user. These are worth the buy! (Pro/Cons)
ReviewBody:
I am always VERY skeptical and do lots of research before ordering a new pair of headphones. I saw a lot of great reviews and a lot of bad reviews on these.

I was looking to get a pair of Samsung headphones to connect to my TV, since  Samsung SmartTV’s only allow you to connect Samsung Bluetooth headphones, no other brands. I have an iPhone (and a lot of other Apple devices), so I didn’t want to spend this much money on something that would ONLY work with my TV, but not my phone. Luckily, they work on any device and sound great!

*These are just my personal opinions, but I’m going to break down some pros and cons:

Pros
-They sounds great
-They work with any device
-They’re extremely comfortable in my ears, which is a first for me with any earbuds (AirPods are absolutely impossible for me to wear because they hurt so badly and fall right out)
-They come with several different options for the little tips that go on them to make them more comfortable in-ear
-They’re small, but not so small that I would lose them easily
-They stay in when I’m walking, running, etc.
-They will cancel out just about ANY sound around you
-There’s Touch Pads on each bud that allow you to pause, play, play next track, play previous track, and activate Siri/Bixby
-Battery life on the buds is actually pretty great, and the charging case will charge them completely a few times before needing charged itself

Cons
-Connecting to devices that are NOT Samsung devices can be tedious at times (especially if you want to connect to a specific device but have connected them to several already, or if you’re connecting them to a new device)
-The Ambient Aware Mode, Equalizer, and Auto-sync features are AMAZING, but ONLY available on Android-based devices!
-Same with being able to change what the touchpad does on each bud. Being able to change long-press on the touchpad from Siri to Volume Up/Down is also an exclusive to Android-based devices, which really bothers me because I’d LOVE to be able to turn the volume up/down from the buds!
(I tested these Samsung-exclusive features out on my mom’s Samsung S9+ and I have to say that these features are absolutely amazing and it’s VERY disappointing that they have them locked!)

As you can see, my pros list far outnumbers my cons. Although the cons are minimal, they are pretty big cons for me. The Ambient Aware Mode and other Samsung/Android-exclusive features are incredible. Really wish they’d allow other devices to use those features, but these earbuds are 100% worth the price tag to me, even without those features.

I guess it’s just a personal preference, but I never thought I’d find a pair of headphones/earbuds I liked more than my trusty old Bose SoundSport headphones. I was wrong. I can’t even wear my Bose ones anymore because I’m so used to how comfortable these are, the sound quality, and how great the noise-cancelling is!

Hopefully this helps a little bit if you research a lot too!
very good

ReviewTitle: By far the best option if you have a Samsung phone
ReviewBody:
I chose these to go with my Samsung Galaxy S8 over Apple's AirPods with the hopes that same-brand connectivity and functionality was worth any compromises in design, quality, and battery life.

In terms of design, they far exceeded my expectations.  At about $30 cheaper than AirPods, I actually prefer the design of the case and earbuds Samsung offers.  The soft rim and earpiece come in 3 sizes each, and I found that after swapping to the smallest, they fit snug but are comfortable for hours. I have run in them without any need to adjust them at all, a first for me with any headphone or earbud.  The touchpads on the earbuds are easy to use and one function is programmable.  The case is tiny... smaller than the AirPod case or any I have ever seen.  The bottom allows for wireless charging, a nice feature, but they do come with a high quality USB-C charger.  The earbuds rest in the case with magnets securely.

In terms of quality, the fit & finish is comparable to every Apple product I have ever purchased - high praise for sure.  The earbuds are very light, but sturdy.  They connect automatically after one seamless setup process (much easier than any other Bluetooth experience I've had) once you take them out of the case.

Regarding battery life, Samsung claims 6 hours, but I haven't had to push it nearly that far.  I have found after 3+ hours half-volume listening from full charge the earbuds are generally around 60%.  I firmly believe the battery life drawback is a sacrifice for the smaller case, which I'd rather lose personally.

All things considered, these are excellent "truly wireless" earbuds, I highly recommend them, especially if you have a Samsung phone.  If you travel often or want to put them in your pocket, these have the smallest case yet. Battery life is reasonable but not near first-class, and the overall design and build quality are excellent.
