ReviewTitle: Not as good as hyped up to be
ReviewBody:
I was very excited to get these when they came out. I ordered them as soon as I could. But after having them for a week I am not as impressed as I hoped I would be. That being said I will be keeping them.

Pros
- Comfort,  these are extremely comfortable in my ears.
- Sound quality,  these buds sound great and have good bass. I love how they seal in my ears to block out other sounds when I really want to jam out
- Battery life/charging case,  they seem to live up to the 6 hour life and i like that i can put them back in the case to get some extra charge.
- Wearable app,  easy to navigate and like i can change some of the tap gestures.

Cons
- The ear buds occasionally have gone out of sync requiring me to remove one bud and putting it back  my ear so they are synced together.
- Ambiant sound mode automatically turns off when you remove one ear bud and you have to go back into the app to turn it back on. I have the long tap gesture set to volume so I can't turn it back on that way.
- I expected more out of ambiant sound mode. I bought these for going to the gym hoping that I could have a conversation with my wife and still listen to music. I can do this without having to remove a bud but do have to pause my music to hear her.
-  Blue tooth,  this issue I think is with my Galaxy S8 but cannot confirm. When I am outside I cannot put my phone in my pocket or swing my arms when walking as the connection drops in and out.

Overall I am happy enough with them to keep them but for $130 I expected a lot more from them and am kind of disappointed. Hopefully some of these issues can be fixed with firmware updates.

The Buds were great, Black Wireless with Charging Case Official. But, they are easy to lose if you have a fast pace life. I put one of them down somewhere and lost it. Now I have to order them again. Boo!
Great value for the price.

ReviewTitle: Broke within a month, Samsung customer support terrible
ReviewBody: One earbud broke within a month of ordering. Tried to get either a refund or replacement only to be strung along by countless Samsung customer care representatives, each forwarding me to another just as useless as the last. still waiting for a phone call I was supposed to receive last week
That's how I received my package no earbuds

ReviewTitle: Pros outweigh cons, best with Samsung phones
ReviewBody:
Great headphones, work extremely well with Samsung phones. They block noise very well which is a pro for workouts and noisy offices but a con for situational awareness. Battery life is amazing.

The case is super slick, like fall out of your pocket slick.

Sound quality is.... Interesting.... If you jam the things in your ears, like uncomfortably so, then they sound good. If you try to let them hang out a bit so they are more comfortable and you can hear around you better, then the sound quality drops significantly. Bass is the most affected, but honestly the pros far outweigh the cons.

I have a lot of bluetooth headsets and these are the best on balance. However I'd like to stress that if you are going to wear them long term, like all day at work, then airpods are much better. After a few hours with these in they start to really hurt my ears.

I wish they'd have a smaller eartip than what's included like the old Moto Hint from back in the day.
I bought these as a gift for my brother. He likes them and he’s pretty picky, so they have to be good.

Works as advertised, I had tried several other earbuds brands these just work and batteries last a long time I haven't run them out yet I go to the Club 4 days a week and usually spend 2 to 4 hours per day using them and plug in the case on Friday night so I know they last at least 4 hours sound quality is good

ReviewTitle: Needs more bass, but worth every penny
ReviewBody: Like how convient it was to connect with my s9 plus, wished it had more bass but other than that the quality sounds crispy clean, case is surprisingly small and the battery is actually really good, I listen to a lot of music so these buds really do last a whole day of normal use.

I hate to leave negative reviews. I'll only leave a negative review if I feel that people should know about a serious issue with a product. Especially a product over $100.

These Galaxy Buds are cool except for a few things that I could just not accept. Having owned multiple Bluetooth headsets of different makes and models I have to say that this has been my least favorite. I've owned 2 different LG headsets, a Bose headset and these.

- These were uncomfortable in my ears, even after changing to the smaller size of the rubber fittings.

- The sound quality of music and podcasts by no means impressed me (not that it was bad, just wasn't great). The sound at max volume is quite low out of the box. This can be fixed though (after using Google to find the solution) by downloading the Galaxy Wearable app to increase the volume, which is a one and done resolution.

- MOST IMPORTANTLY, the phone call quality is horrible. I called several people while wearing these to find out that people could barely hear me at all. This could be because the microphones (which are on both buds) are all the way back by your ear. But it's 2019 so I wouldn't think this should be an issue. After searching on Google to find a solution I just came across pages and pages of Samsung's community forums of people searching for the same answers I was with no solutions.

I know Samsung is a good brand, I expected better.
I like it. So far so good. It fits snug in my ear.

First of all i had my hopes up in the sky for these, since theyre airpods first competitor.
But theyre far from airpods!
First i had an issue with the right bud microphone,  than the sound got disrupted and it made me hate some songs!
Now both of the microphones have problems!
And i got the May 2nd ! So its been like a week of using them!
Honest opinion dont spend your money on these !
The bluetooth connection is a joke. Everytime I out my phone in my pocket the sound cuts out. Especially when I try to walk around. Plus the sound quality is pretty crappy for 125 bucks.

These are actually good name brand wireless headphones. Before I got these I kept trying out cheaper ones like one called iKanzi and I tried THREE different ones and all of them when walking (with the phone with you in your pocket) would keep loosing connection and not playing it. These headphones ALWAYS keep connection when I'm walking and even if my phone is stationary and i'm moving around. These are actual named brand headphones from Samsung. I feel that these or the usual Airbuds are your only good wireless ones. The cheap ones are not worth it. The sound quality is also good on them. You may not get anything that's extreme theater sounding (If you want that then get the huge wired ones), but it's good for wireless standards.
It is also very comfortable and don't even have to struggle to get them in place in your ears!
All around great headphones that I would strongly recommend!

In March, I bought two Samsung Galaxy Buds headphones, one for my own use and one for my wife. From the experience of using them, I feel that the sound quality is good and standby time is acceptable, but sometimes it is easy to fall off. Compared with airpods, the noise reduction performance is better, and other shortcomings, I hope the next generation will be better.

ReviewTitle: Good sound quality, bad mic quality
ReviewBody: the sound quality isnt bad, but the mic quality is literally the worst. for a product that is trying to rival the airpods, the airpod mic is soooo much better. do not get this if you plan on making phone calls or anything cause its so bad.
These don't fall out of your ears and actually stay in and the sound is good and the software too I use it everyday only charging it every two days so great battery too

I so badly wanted to like this pair for wireless earbuds, but they just keep cutting out whenever I would place my phone (Google Pixel 3) in my pocket, even more so when I have my hand in my pocket along with my phone. Would also cut out when I turned my head the opposite direction from the side the pocket my phone was in. I thought I just had a defective pair the first time, so I got a warranty replacement, same for the second pair. Oh well. Maybe I'll try Galaxy Bud 2 when they release that.
Good ear buds that work great.
Good

ReviewTitle: Big Sound in a Small Package
ReviewBody:
As the saying goes, "good things come in small packages", this certainly holds true for the Samsung Buds. These sleek and compact in-ear earbuds are great for music and phone calls in any situation. The convenient carrying and charging case ensures that the buds are charged and protected while not in use. A great feature of the case is that it can be wirelessly charged using a Samsung wireless charging pad. Charging is quite fast and the battery life lasts a long time. The option to connect via USB-C is available as well.

Connecting to a Samsung phone such as a Galaxy Note9 was very easy. The buds were detected and setup was completed in the Galaxy Wearable app and the buds are configured from within. Once the buds are paired, when the case is opened this automatically establishes a connection to the phone. The battery life indicator shows battery level for both the left and right buds as well as options for configuring the number of taps for various functions. The Equalizer has five modes (Bass boost, Soft, Dynamic, Clear, and Treble boost). There was some noticeable difference between these but nothing that was groundbreaking. A nice feature of the Galaxy Wear app is "Find My Earbuds". When initiated, each bud makes an audible noise that sounds like birds chirping but makes it relatively easy to find them if they're misplaced.

For the small form factor, these produce clear highs and some deep lows. The bass isn't deep enough to rattle any windows but it's good for the size. The active noise cancelling (ANC) does an OK job of blocking out background noise as long as the volume is turned up to about 60%. This was in an office setting where conversations at normal talking levels are occurring.

All in all, these are very well designed wireless earbuds which produce fantastic sound for all occasions. This fits well with the Samsung brand and is a home run in a small package.
Great product
Good fit and excellent sound. Eady to set up.

I have ordered already twice the product and both of the time , left ear bud was ,asking noise while talking on the phone , my friends keep telling me about that and complaint about that . I think for this price Samsung can do better .
Waiting for my second replacement .

ReviewTitle: You get what you paid for.
ReviewBody: I used wireless headphones but only xt headphones which at times could be frustrating but ut was nice to listen to music while doing homework but as for work no good. Its provides me decent enough battery time for both if you charge it properly even though u get a hour and half off 15 minutes.
For years I have purchased cheap earbuds. No longer, these are worth every penny. Sound is very good and love all of the features. My favorite is the case/battery + wireless charging.

ReviewTitle: Totally worth it for a great price
ReviewBody:
So far I absolutely love these earbuds. They fit well and sound perfect to my simple ears. Ambient sound is a great addition, but you have to turn it on every time. The touch controls are going to take some getting used to, but they're not better or worse than any other set up. Also love that you can just use one without the other without any finagling. They look discreet in your ear and the case is small enough to fit in my pocket along with everything else.

Edit: if you're earbuds don't seem very loud switch the long press to volume and turn the volume up there, then control it with your phone. I found my volume wasn't synced and turning it up on the headphones separately made them much louder.

I'm quite picky when it comes to my audio. The quality needs to be good, with few compromises. The galaxy buds live up to their flagship name, and are an excellent accessory to any galaxy phone.

Now some important things you should know:
Without a galaxy phone I cant really justify purchasing these as theres simply too many features your losing out on.
Also, the earbuds are pretty quiet by default. You can change the touchpad on the earbuds to increase the EARBUD volume separately from the phone volume. Doing so makes them capable of being quite loud.

ReviewTitle: Great sound and comfort; shaky connection
ReviewBody: Sound quality, comfort and size are excellent. Pairing was super easy on a Galaxy S8. My main issue was with these sustaining their connection while in my pants pocket. The connection has not been seamless unless I hold the phone in my hand. I got these to workout and never had issues then, but if you're using these for everyday use it's one thing to consider (at least on an S8). A recent update helped significantly so I'm hopeful future software updates fix this completely.

When I first got my pair, I had some connection issues, specially when running. I was about to grade them a 3 star or less, but after firmware upgrades (there was a couple), connection is a lot more stable, and only in rare moments I got some noise, but no loss o connection, and both earpieces works in sync all of time. It's important to mention that call part is ok, no noise cancelling, so sometimes it could get a lot of noise on the other side of call. The noise isolation is really nice, even without active cancellation. I recommend!
Good product
Considering the price on these earbud, the  sound is fantastic.  They easily pair and the fit is also very good. I’m happy with my purchase & I would order these again.
Good for the gym

ReviewTitle: Really nice buds, glad I went for them.
ReviewBody: At first I was a little upset l, the left side wouldnt turn on. But then I fully charged them and they both work now. Did software updates and everything is good. Also changed out the ear tips and rings to the largest size. Usually I'm a medium fit with those things, but the are very comfortable and WOW they sealed up and sound great with the dynamic setting in the apps EQ.

The negative reviews are true. Garbage connection that constantly stutters. Unless your phone is inches from your head, expect poor connection. I expected so much better for $130. No wonder I quit Samsung phones for Apple. Beta products at top shelf prices? No thanks, you can have it back. Returning.

Spending like this, you know you should expect a quality product, especially from a top technology company of the world. But the results were still far beyond my expectations, with with experience with similar products, the audio quality, battery life, and ease of use, are all amazing. I can't hardly imagine life without my galaxy buds now.

ReviewTitle: True wireless headphones with amazing quality. Say goodbye to the wire-tangled life.
ReviewBody:
First and foremost, I'm a dedicated runner, getting in between 8-10 miles each day, 5 days  a week, at 9 mph constantly- not including the distances traveled while walking at work or running errands. The remaining 2 days are for limited hit-cardio, but even then, I'll squeeze 3 miles at an uncomfortable pace of 10.5 for that burn. These buds STAY INSIDE YOUR EARS no matter how much you move around. That doesn't mean go crazy and start headbanging, but their very resistant to high intensity workouts. Just be conscious of them. Both are incredibly light and there are different ear tips for the buds should they not fit well. Different topic- but ..sometimes your phone/smartwatch, will register the run, other times it'll register it as just walking...either which way you're still getting a wire-free experience.

Ambient sound can be a tad irritating, and the touch controls MIGHT not respond accurately, but this is purely situational.
Their comfortable, fit securely, and are easy to use. controlling them through the Samsung gear app is also convenient.
It allows you to check the charge level of each ear bud, the connectivity status, control the notifications preference for what apps can be controlled via touch on the buds, touch-pad preference, etc.
So overall usage is wonderful, UX from feedback was definitely taken into account, and the UI with simple to remember taps to skip a song, a few songs, a whole track, answer and decline calls based on what bud is tapped, and more is incorporated into these.
lo maximo en sonido
Does what its says. Can't hear anyone around, even up close.

They are a great idea, and they pair easily with my Galaxy Note 8. Battery life is fantastic and the little base provides extra charging. Fairly comfortable, stay in the ear ok, but they do start to feel heavy after an hour or so. But the sound quality leaves much to be desired. Not bad for rock/pop and working out at the gym, but classical and jazz sounds terrible. Very little bass even w/ the equalizer settings maximizing the bottom. I much prefer the sound quality of my Bose (wired) noice canceling in-ear phones. On the plus side, taking a phone call in them is pretty cool; they sound very clear and capture my voice amazingly well, considering there is no mouthpiece. Overall, a solid 3 stars.
I loved how it sounds. I hate how easy it is to lose them.
Good quality

ReviewTitle: Decent sound, good noise isolation, good features but many Bluetooth issues.
ReviewBody:
I need to mention that, whether or not it's something to do with Samsung or Amazon, regardless of that the buds arrived In an opened box, they didn't look used but the box was not factory sealed.

As far as the product itself, well, they're pretty great for what they're meant to do, especially, when you consider the fact that the Sennheiser and many other rivals cost twice as much (or more) without any real benefits because these sound amazing, the noise isolation is superb, they're comfortable and light. The battery lasts a long time and they're easy to use.
The only real issue is the fact that the Bluetooth seems to cut in and out, a lot, I tried to change the settings but it doesn't seem to have any impact on the issue. I'm going to wait for a few more days and then I'll exchange them or return them if the issue persists.

ReviewTitle: Ok, I Give Up On Wireless Headphones For Now
ReviewBody: I sampled the three top wireless headphones. They all fall short. This Samsung was the worst of them all. Sound quality was awful. There was NO bass! Half Mid, and the treble was so tinty that the ear speaker would make a cracking sound. Samsung, If you read this, please go back to the drawing board. All of these companies must take these off the market and start over again. It is not fare for consumers to pay this price to have very poor quality.

ReviewTitle: In ear style can cause discomfort if used for extended periods of time
ReviewBody: It's hard for people to hear me on the phone they can hear my background better than my voice but apart from that great product
My 13 year old loves these.  Touch options.  Rechargeable in case. Battery lasts awhile.  Easy to charge- love placing on charging pad.
Perfect Father's Day gift! My husband LOVES these ear buds. The have great sound and are comfortable to wear! Great battery life and sleek looking. Highly recommend!

ReviewBody: Very portable and inconspicuous.  Just scared of loosing it. I keep touching it to see if it is secure and in the process either cut the call off or start something else.

ReviewTitle: Buds connection tends to cut out when in pockets or a backpack outdoors.
ReviewBody: literally unusable outside. I try and wear these to run or bike home from work and they just cut in and out all the time. come inside and i can go rooms over and still have a connection, but mowing the lawn I can't have it in my pocket or it will cut in and out. Seems like a common problem after searching the internet. Updating the software is the "solution", however, mine are updated and still have this same issue. Really disappointing because every other aspect of these is great, and I would use them all the time if not for this issue. now I use them about 10% of the time I had planned on using them. the other 90% is still using the wired one I got with my phone.
First Samsung product bought. I love it.

ReviewTitle: Poor sound quality, nothing else makes up for it either
ReviewBody:
Tinny sound, the bass tries a little too hard (on dynamic). Sounds like knockoff beats.

We all know Android doesn't handle truly wireless earbuds as good as iOS, so there's that. There's a noticable right to left lag sometimes.

Build quality is pretty good, subtle design.

Overall I expected more from Samsung especially given this is an AKG product and I would not recommend to anyone even Samsung fan boys.

I love everything about these. They do a damn good job of shutting out noise, and have a really good feel in the ear. The sound quality is immaculate. The real kicker is that not only are they cheaper than airpods, but they also have a wireless charging case unlike the first gen airpods that apple released. Also, airpods are notoriously garbage at blocking sound, unlike these Galaxy Buds. They're worth your money.
Get these if you have the chance ...life changer

The only  downsides I've noticed is call sound in general and the adaptive sound. It really does work but not as good as the hype is said you will hear cars and surroundings but these sounds can sometimes be garbled if you have long hair make sure it does not cover your ears as depending on how thick your hear is you can hear it every time you adjust your hair or hat. Aside from these small things I adore these buds they fit the sounds great and it's simple instructions on setting up! Hope this helps anyone who considers buying

I use them together all the time. I use my phone to change music etc.. I don't use the buttons because I want to see if by me using the touch option on the buds could be the cause. I even went as far as to using the left bud to fast forward, rewind etc.. STILL the right one loses charge faster then the left bud. I've reset them at least 5x and still the same problem persists. Great set when they discharge correctly. But with the uneven discharging problem I'm gonna have to either return or exchange.

ReviewTitle: They aren't bad headphones, but for the price it's not really worth it.
ReviewBody: I just expected more, for the price at least. The headphones cut out while waking constantly, you can walk a good 100ft away from your phone and still use it so long as your skull isn't in the way, the noise cancelation works but the ambient voice option only works for about five feet so it's useless, the sound is fine, sometimes it says it's playing music but there's no sound, sometimes I have to pair both headphones, sometimes it refuses to play more than a few minutes unless my s10 remains unlocked, the sound it makes when it dies is exactly the same as the sound it makes when it shuts off for an update so that's confusing, they are slender so that's cool, my ears don't like these at much as my old 35$ pair, there's no flashing light so they are sneaky, they're shiny so not too sneaky, the touch pad is both too sensitive and also not sensitive enough (ie it's too easy to double click but also a single stand of hair can block your finger), the battery life isn't bad but it's not great either, wireless charging from my phone is pretty rad in a pinch, Bixby doesn't make a distinct enough sound when activated, honestly I had less complaints about my 35$ wireless headphones.

If these are your first  true wireless headphones and you have the latest Samsung phone to use with - they are OK. I have Google Pixel 3 - huge latency issue. Also I don't want to use my headphones only with my phone, but my PC and mac mini. Again - latency issue. I wanted to use these samsung buds as a replacement of my Airpods. But even apple AirPods have better connectivity to android phone, that galaxy buds

ReviewTitle: Good but..Not great for the price
ReviewBody: Call quality is not that good except when you are in a quiet room

ReviewTitle: Great for the price, great alternative to airpods
ReviewBody:
I have had these earbuds for over a month now, and I have been using them almost every single day. So far I have really enjoyed using these even over nicer Sony headphones.
Pros
The sound quality on these earbuds is pretty decent considering the fact that they are completely wireless.
The Samsung Wearables app has a simple and user friendly design with an equalizer for customized audio.
The connection strength is surprisingly good, I can leave my phone at the desk and walk around the house without connection issues.
The tips make a decent seal which provides ample noise isolation.
The included tips and wings fit extremely well for me and never fall out.
The battery life for these last around 8-10 hours for me (I usually play music relatively quietly)
Cons
I couldn't think of any
All in all, 5/5 stars

ReviewTitle: As good as Bluetooth earbuds can get
ReviewBody:
AKG makes some quality products, but it's important to remember, you're buying Bluetooth earbuds, these just aren't going to hold up against anything wired in terms of sound quality. And to be fair, these still sound great! But pale in comparison to the AKG's that come packaged with Samsung phones, particularly in the lower freqs.

That being said, the battery life is not bad; I can go all day using them on and off without needing to charge, the interchangable rubber pieces insure a perfect fit, and the connectivity features with the touch sensors are quite useful.

Final note; these earbuds are high quality for a fair price, but if you're an audiophile, you may be a little disappointed.
Great sound. No conection issues!!!!
They are very comfortable to wear, very stylish and low profile. I bought them for My wife and she likes them a lot

They sound great and fit perfectly in my ears (unlike AirPods which fall right out).

If you want to switch this between apple devices, you have to go to your bluetooth settings and forget the device before you can pair it to a new one. This is very annoying.

ReviewTitle: They fit very snug and sound quality is awesome
ReviewBody: I like how it connects right away Also you just have to tap and it ends a call

It's very nice
I love these earbuds. Thanks Amazon and Samsung.

ReviewTitle: Great "True Wireless" earphones.  but not there yet for phone calls
ReviewBody:
Had tried several true wireless earphones, this is by far one of the best ones next to Airpod and Jebra. Light, comfortable.  The AKG speaker with the combination of the seal creates a wonderful sound surrounding.  They become even better within the Samsung's eco system.  The touch controls and Samsungs app brings convenience to another level.

In comparison, Jebra lacks the convenience and comfort (Too Big), Airpod lacks the sealed sound.  But I will be returning these and keeping the Airpods due to the fact that call quality is still lacking.  People whom I called complain on the clarity in comparison to the Airpods and Jebra.  This is due to the fact that they have a mic stick closer to the mouth.  Its not Samsung's fault. Its just physics.  With the small form factor comes the price.  The mic is still clear enough in a not too noisy coffee shop. But if you are on the street and or on a windy day, the receiving end of the call will have problems hearing what you say.
Bottom Line :  Comfortable great sounding headphones.  and if listening to music is your priority, I'd get them.  But if calls are more important, this is not.

I work in a Insulation Plant where I’m required to use ear plugs all day due to all the machine noise but these earphones completely block all that out. Not to mention that I can use just one and keep the other one full charged so I can switch them out later. They kind of show in your ears so someone definitely will notice they’re not earplugs if they were looking for it but then again how often do you go up to someone and look straight at their ears. Bass on these are great and the treble is excellent. Definitely buying another one. One for work and one for home and gym.
Fit perfect and awesome sound

ReviewTitle: Just my opinions ( I love them so far )
ReviewBody:
The quality of the material used to make these buds is good. Yes it's plastic but it's nicely and professionally put together. Very light weight and comfortable to wear. Mine fit almost perfectly into my ears straight out of the box.
The sound quality actually was a pleasant surprise. I really wasn't expecting much from it sound quality wise, the actually sounded pretty good. I find that higher volumes is where seem to get the punchiness of the bass. Mids and top ends r clear (not the crispiest but crispy). So overall the sound quality was good enough for an over good experince. I must also add that i found them to provide good seal from out side noises ( i like that)

For me personally battery life was good

ReviewTitle: Samsung Galaxy Buds, Bluetooth True Wireless Earbuds
ReviewBody: I bought these for my son and he loves them.  The batteries last a long tiome and the sound quality for the price is excellent.  These were a vewry nice gift for my son.
I had a problem with my left side buds volume.

Sound pretty good for the price, they dont really get that loud which is a pro and a con at the same time. The ambient sound feature is nice at a low volume but doesn't really highlight voices very well even with the voice detection feature enabled. the touch pad on them is a great feature that makes them feel very quick and responsive. I like the battery design with the charging case very much. You never really have to worry about them dying unless you listen to music for 8 hours straight. they also charge completely in a very short time. The voice control feature is a nice feature as well and easy to use. Overall exactly what you'd expect from a Samsung device.

ReviewTitle: Lacks A Wearable App w/iPhone Support For Sound Adjustments
ReviewBody: I got these as a bday gift, and they seem pretty good. But unfortunately I found out that they are almost useless without the Galaxy Wearable App that is used to adjust sound and other settings. And sadly, there is no app support for any apple product. The wing tips that are meant to keep them from falling out will also not work if you have larger ear holes, so the only thing that holds them in is the part that's inserted in your ear canal.

These are pretty good. Automatically knows if u want to use 1 or both buds. Galaxy wearable app does everything. Sound pretty good, I can't use noise cancelling because I use at work and can only have 1 in, have to be able to hear. I own a few pair of wireless(truly) and these are the best.
They are amazing I like the sound proof setting it makes the sound a lot better but one of them started ringing if I did something wrong I would like to know what happened

ReviewTitle: Noise whys it's the best product
ReviewBody: Dont like it bad
Wish the audio was more powerful.  Also when you choose to let ambient sound in it always turns back off by itself. Overall I'm pretty satisfied.

These work exactly as advertised. I've had zero connection issues with my s8+, and the battery life is very decent. I found the sound quality to be very clear, and the bass to be good, but not strong. They sound better than airpods, and they cancel noise very well, plus they don't leak sound at all, which makes these great for use in quiet environments.
Overall, these deserve to be recognized as a great purchase for any Samsung user.
Great wireless headphones

ReviewTitle: Best option for Android phone/tablet. Still great for iPhone.
ReviewBody: For the price and ease to use/set up, these are the best true wireless headphones on the market. They look very sleek, are very comfortable. Have much better than expected noise cancellation. Only complaint is bass isn't pounding but you cant expect that for a package this small and sleek. Highly recommend.

ReviewTitle: A must have with other galaxy products

The battery life isn't the best but with wireless charge it's so simple to just plop them down and pick them up when you're ready to go that you will rarely ever be in danger of having them die. Plus with a newer galaxy phone you can power share in a pinch. The versatility and quality of these earphones are outstanding. This is a must have with other galaxy products.

ReviewTitle: No flaws, they are pretty much perfect
ReviewBody: When I read reviews of several different wireless earbuds there was a common theme. There was always something that was wrong with the.  Didn't feel comfortable, ra do lunch lose connection, short battery life, subpar sound, etc.  These ear buds really do not have anything that I saw that they were deficient in. The battery life is awesome, the sound great, they pair automatically, they feel awesome. I like everything about these earbuds. The sound quality is somewhat better than my beat xs. I made the switch because I wanted something that sounded good and it was truly wireless. These earbuds are great.

ReviewTitle: Earbuds work fine, but getting a good fit is very difficult.
ReviewBody: I recently returned my Jaybird XT earbuds thinking I would get better sound quality with the new Galaxy Buds (also just bought an S10+).  The sound is slightly worse with the Samsung product and it is really difficult to get a good fit with the options they provide in the box.  When worn, they feel slightly loose and I'm constantly worried they will fall out.

I love these headphones, best Bluetooth yet.  I never had luck with in-ears, they always fell off, these buds don't, and they stay snug! Amazing! All the features are ideal and easy to use. My only thing, the volume is a bit low from my Galaxy phone only, satisfactory but sometimes I like it loud.

Day 2 -
Connection: Unlike some other people, I haven't had problems with sound cutting out while the phone is in my pocket. I've even walked into another room and the earbuds work just fine.
Sound Quality: Good not great. If you've already got some fantastic in ear headphones then these will only serve as a convenience, not a replacement.
Ambient Feature: This is another feature that I liked for the convenience factor but the quality isn't that great. If you want to hear something while you have them in, you can activate this feature but it sounds like it's coming through a tin can.
Battery Life: I haven't used a full charge on these things yet. I checked their percentage periodically while in use and they seem to last a long time. I could probably get through a full work day with some breaks in between.
Comfort: You have to rotate the earbuds so that the fin is pointed up. I feel like the left one isnt as snug as the right but I've had that issue with earbuds before. Maybe my left ear canal is slightly bigger than my right. Overall they are very comfy and light.

I do want to complain about one thing though. The charging cable that comes with the case is plastic and maybe 3.5ft long. I think with the price you're paying they should at least offer a higher quality cable. I guess if they wanted to offer a competitive price to Air Pods they had to cut costs somewhere, right?
Sick

ReviewTitle: Don't listen to the haters! These buds survived 5+min swim in the deep end of my pool!
ReviewBody:
I'm a HUGE fan of Samsung in general. I discovered them over a decade ago and I've been with Samsung ever since. Some may say that fact alone renders my review to be biased. But they'd be wrong. Very wrong. I'm possibly more skeptical than anyone you know.
I've heard all kinds of claims about these buds barely being sweat resistant. Well, I've been using mine DAILY, sweating like crazy down in Houston Texas as well, and I'm amazed by the resilience of these crazy comfortable and light as a feather - great sounding {wireless} earbuds!!!!
Both the charging case and the buds fell into the deep end of my pool today by accident. Normally I would have dove right in to retrieve my precious tech. But all of those (false) claims of their water resistance told me to write them off and buy another pair.
It took me roughly 5 mins to grab the skimmer and scoop them out.
No one believes this next part, but I don't leave extremely positive reviews for the adrenaline rush! Lol.. I kid you NOT- whenever I grabbed the charging case out of the skimmer net (with the buds still inside mind you) THEY WERE STILL CHARGING!
THE INSIDE WAS A LITTLE WET, BUT IT MADE ZERO DIFFERENCE WHATSOEVER! IT'S BEEN ABOUT 3 HRS SINCE THE INCIDENT AND I'M STILL JAMMING MY FAVORITE PLAYLIST!
I'm completely amazed by the sound quality, battery life, connectivity, durability, style, options, etc.. of these very reasonably priced buds!
These earbuds have even saved me unknown amounts of money in terms of phone cases and screen protectors and deductibles for refurbishing or replacing broken screens, cases, protectors, etc.. seemingly everytime I would set my phone down after changing a song or whatever it may be because of the corded earbuds yanking my phone off the table and onto the floor.
In short, the true wireless feature alone, at least for me, is more than worth it because these have truly has paid for themselves a few times over by this point.

That being said... one would think, that with all the new advancements in protective coatings of late, that Samsung would have made the outside layer of the charging case FAR MORE scratch resistant than they are. After maybe 3 days of very limited and controlled careful use, I could barely make out the lettering on the top and bottom of the case.
In retrospect, my small complaint is just my skepticism finding anything possible to critique.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE TRULY WIRELESS EARBUDS TO ALL SAMSUNG GALAXY FANS ESPECIALLY. BUT ALSO TO ANYONE WHO WOULD RATHER SPEND LESS $ ON QUALITY EARBUDS.

Oh, and 1 more thang... this ain't no fake review.
Buy you some ninja.
They broke within six weeks of casual use. Wish I could get my money back.
Great quality earbuds for a marginally cheaper price than most others

Returned a pair of earbuds that were a different brand because of the lack of range, and battery life. Purchased these Galaxy Buds hoping they would be better, and holy moly these buds are beyond my expectations!!  Fantastic range; can walk all around my office without losing my music.  And the battery lasts from when I get in to work (8:30am) until I leave at 5:00!  LOVE THESE EARBUDS!

Overall a great set of wireless earbuds. They seal well for yard work and stay in for exercise. My chief and only complaint is that they don't get quite as loud as I would like.

Overall I'd recommend them.

ReviewTitle: I've tried them all, these are my favorite.
ReviewBody: These galaxy buds are the best all around wireless earbuds in my opinion. I've had the Jabra 65ts, the jaybird Vistas, beats x and the B & O E8's. I was on the hunt for the best wireless earbuds to use while I'm working in the office so I would buy a pair, use it for a couple of days, and then swap them out with a different pair to see what I liked the best. I listen to music or play movies in the background while I'm working. I want good sound quality, doesnt have to be audiophile sound but it needs to be clear and immersive. I tried the B&Os but the bluetooth connection was horrible. I frequently lost signal in 1 or both earbuds. The sound was good but it wasn't so good that I was willing to put up with dropped signals for the price I paid. Then I tried the Jaybird Vistas. The sound quality was awesome, I think they sounded better than the B&Os because the bass was deeper and more authentic feeling. That's the best way I know how to describe it. The problem I had with the Jaybirds was that there was no ambient sound pass through and they caused ear fatigue after an hour of use. From there I tried the Jabras. They sound almost the same as the Jaybirds except for the bass, which had less impact than the Jaybirds but was still very good. The Jabras also have ambient noise passthrough which is a feature I really like to have because I can use both earbuds in the office and still hear what's going on around me. What I didn't like about them is that they are a little big and to me they seemed goofy in my ears. The fit was secure and they felt comfortable but I just could not get past the part where I looked like a robot when I was wearing them. They were too distracting for the office. My last option was the galaxy buds and if they didnt work out, I was going to go back to my Beats x which sound good but they have that cord that ties them together and it's always getting in the way and pulling the buds out of my ears. The galaxy buds have all the specs I'm looking for, ambient sound pass through, customizable sound through the galaxy wearable app, discrete profile, comfort and most importantly, they sound great. I saved these for last because I thought I would have a better chance with the more expensive brands. However, I learned that a higher price tag does not always mean better performance. In my experience the Galaxy buds sound almost identical to the Jabra 65t's. They have a really clean and crisp sound, the bass is not as punchy as the Jaybirds but they have a nice impact to them which is perfectly fine for my office use.  Also, the ambient noise pass through seems to work a little better on the galaxy buds than the Jabras. For the price you pay, I was surprised at how great these buds performed in every task especially compared to the more expensive competition. The charging case has been working flawlessly and the wireless charging is a great feature that I personally use a lot. I haven't had any issue with the connection dropping out and I frequently walk away from my phone while I'm listening to music or movies. The galaxy buds are awesome and the price is very reasonable.
Love them

ReviewBody: Nice headphones with solid sound and noise cancellation. Battery life is perfect for me and having wireless charging saves me a lot of time. ReviewTitle: Massive improvement over Samsung Gear IconX
ReviewBody:
*PLEASE READ* - You NEED to increase the volume of the earbuds themselves (Separate from your phones volume) as they have their own built in volume control. This can be done by changing the hold touch action through the "Galaxy Wearable" application. You will no longer need to do this after doing it once.

These are a MASSIVE improvement over Samsung's previous line up of true wireless earbuds (Gear IconX). I have not yet run into a single issue relating to software like I did in the older models. Software updates are much easier to do now, and only take roughly 5 minutes.

Sound:
(Don't mess with EQ too much)
The sound quality is nice, but its obviously not a mind shattering audiophile experience. They sound best (to me) while using the phones flat equalizer with the "dynamic" equalizer in the "Galaxy Wearable" application. The bass response on the very low end is pretty impressive, but the volume of the bass is not going to get you the thud that normal wired earbuds do even if you attempt to crank the bass in EQ. The highs are surprisingly crisp and clear, but sometimes harsh when the volume is too high. The mids are perfect I have no complaints there.

Fit:
The ear buds are smaller than previous models, and don't stick out as much; however these may be uncomfortable to lay down with on your side depending on the size of your ears, but still a big improvement over the IconX. The ear tip is redesigned and allows for a fairly fiddle free fit in your ear. They press in very easily and can be twisted slightly back for a snug fit. The standard size tips, and wings fit my ears perfectly, and I never have to adjust them after initially putting them in. The ear tip sizing seems to be more dramatic on the small and large tips compared to previous models, but that's not a bad thing.

As with most people complaining about these, the bluetooth connection is horrible! If you back pocket your phone, you're guaranteed to have sound cut out issues! The sound is great, when it isn't cutting out! Get them fixed already Samsung!
Sound quality is just fine. it works perfectly with my Samsung phone!
Very good ear buds.  Very easy to use.  Better than the Airpods my wife had.  This ear buds works fine with my iPhone Xs

Although people still struggle to understand me when I use them, they are the best for me. I have one of those odds voices that are difficult to understand when used over a speaker or wireless device, so for people to be able to hear me on these is a huge plus. I also do not do well with wired earbuds, but these wireless earbuds manage to remain in my ears even when exercising which is another plus. Overall, I am extremely impressed. Wish the sound could be louder, but I guess it is much safer for the health of my ears for the volume to remain at a decent decimal.

ReviewTitle: Phenomenal if you have realistic expectations
ReviewBody:
I've spent a lot more time than I care to admit looking at different truly wireless earbuds, and in my opinion, these provide the most value for the cost, especially if you have a Samsung phone. It's important though to manage your expectations and to know what these earbuds are best suited for. It seems that these are meant to be Samsung's answer to Apple's Airpods, so they're mostly for casual listening while you're on the move with an emphasis on convenience. If you're expecting anything more out of these than what they were designed for, there's a good chance you'll be disappointed.

** Build Quality: The buds are made of plastic, but they seem sturdy enough. The case feels sturdy with a good heft to it to make it feel premium. The case is small enough to slip into a pocket without any problems, and the magnets in the case are strong enough to keep the buds in the case so you don't accidentally drop them.

** Comfort: I think one of the places these truly stand out is comfort. I've tried the Jabra 65t Elite earbuds, but they were a little too big for my ears and caused pain after about 30 mins of wearing them. The Galaxy Buds are considerably smaller and lighter. (See pictures to get an idea of size.) They create a great seal for sound isolation to keep your music in and your surroundings out. They fit securely and don't fall out of your ears easily like some other bigger earbuds, and I felt confident that they wouldn't fall out even when I went for a run with them. (Obviously, you might need to play around with the included ear tips and fits to ensure a good fit/seal.)

** Connectivity: I haven't had these for too long, but in my experience so far, the connection seems to be solid enough. The initial pairing process is especially easy if you have a Samsung phone. I have an S8+, and all I had to do was open the case and a notification popped up on my phone to pair and set everything up. Would've appreciated the ability to pair to multiple devices simultaneously, but that is sadly not present. (You can long press on touch buttons on both earbuds to enter pairing mode to switch between devices.) I'll update this review if I have problems with the connection in the future.

** Audio Quality: To be perfectly honest, my expectations for audio quality were pretty low, but these buds blew them out of the water. I'm not one of those audiophiles who has to have the higheset quality audio kit, but I do know how to appreciate good audio. At $130 and with a tiny physical footprint, the Galaxy Buds aren't meant to pump out mind-blowing audio quality, and if that's what you're looking for, you'll have have to look elsewhere (and there aren't any truly wireless earbuds that can stand up to high quality wired earbuds let alone proper over-ear headphones). I would say that these are on par with or maybe better than the Jabra 65t Elite earbuds in terms of audio quality. Out of the box, the quality is just alright, but once you turn on the Dynamic Mode in the EQ in the app, sounds phenomenal. Highs are clear, bass is ample and full, mids are smooth.

** Battery Life: Specs say 6 hrs with 7 more hrs in the case. Most sources say that this is accurate, but I haven't had these long enough to say for sure. If I find otherwise, I'll update this review.

** Cons: Not a whole lot. The one minor thing I've noticed so far is that the touch controls are finicky and it's difficult to adjust the volume directly from the earbuds. You can set it so that a long hold press on the left bud will do volume down, and a long hold press on the right bud will do volume up, but that's really not a very convenient way of doing all that.

Overall, I am incredibly happy with these earbuds. Sound quality exceeded my expectations, and they're super convenient. The only way you'd be really disappointed with these earbuds is if your expectations are unrealistically high.

I bought these for use in school, and just on the go. The sleek and small design makes them perfect for public use, and they cancel noise very well. I found myself using the microphones to listen to the people around me so I could hear when they were attempting to get my attention. The sound quality is good! It's not the best, but it certainly didn't leave me disappointed. The battery life also never got in my way. The case always kept my earbuds charged and ready to go. Rarely did I ever struggle with the case dying. Overall these are well worth the money and a great choice. (Used on Samsung Galaxy Note 9)

ReviewTitle: Workout and yard work ready. Great battery life, and multi-feature button is great.
ReviewBody:
I wanted headphones that I could wear to the gym and not need a wire attached to my phone or even around the back of my neck. A friend had these and I knew I had to try them.

They do not fall out. I can run, jump, accidentally hit myself in the head with a rake, they don't go anywhere. The battery lasts and lasts and they charge very quickly when it finally runs out. And the case is convenient to carry around without needing a ton of space.

As much as I enjoy trying to blow out my ear drums and ruin my hearing, these just don't quite do it but are plenty loud enough. The sound quality is quite good, but you won't get a whole lot of bass simply due to how small these things are.

The only word of caution I would give is for people with in-ear piercings. I have a daith, which sometimes gets a little uncomfortable with the earbud after several hours of wear, and that earbud will often discharge a little faster because it occasionally contacts the metal of my earring. But it's hardly enough to annoy me, they're great earbuds.

Sometimes people don't notice I'm wearing them, which can be fun when they start talking and it seems I'm ignoring them, but hey, the noise cancelling works really well!
They just did a update to fix the ambiance sound. These are amazing! Check out some review videos online if you are sceptical about spending your money here. Great buy!

Pros: easy pairing, just open case and Samsung Wearable app connects buds. Good sound quality for audiobooks. Good range, can be in next room before disconnects. Looks cool.
Cons: Same tinny sound quality as my $30 bluetooth headphones. You want bass in your music? Forget it with these earbuds.  Playback flags between left and right bud when the phone is in your pocket and youre walking. Zero noise cancellation, especially outside or on the train. In public places, you have to turn volume of audiobook up to max to hear properly. Poor voice quality during calls, especially outside, got to disconnect and use handset 50% of the time. And this is fully charged snd all available updates.

I really like these ear buds. I have never had something I bought instantly become a part of my "daily carry items". I never leave home without these things. They are so easy to pair to my phone, by the time the earbud is in my ear, it's connected to my phone and I can talk on the phone or listen to music.

I will say that sometimes there is issue with the connection quality if the phone is in your pocket, but given how darn awesome these things are, that's not an issue for me.  Sound quality is good all things considered, but I'm no audiophile so I would understand if some people might be disappointed. I also thing the noise cancelling is good considering is passive cancelling. Battery life hasn't been an issue.

My only complaint is that I usually can't wear these for more than an hour or so at a time. Any longer than that and they hurt my ear.

I own numerous BT audio gears from many different makers (Bose, Apple, Beats, Sennheiser, Logitech, etc.), so I know that some latency is to be expected on BT audio and connection can be choppy at busy environment. That said, Galaxy Buds' connection is just bad. Video is out of sync and you can notice it without really trying, and for some reason the audio pops and plays at mono for about 0.5 second for every 30 seconds or so. (Possibly a bandwidth problem?)

I also find it inconvenient that it does not have any physical buttons for BT pairing mode. The only way to engage the pairing mode is to open the case, and sometimes it just doesn't work. A button that could force the mode would've been great.

I like the sound quality and how they stay in my ears (unlike AirPods), but the connection problem ruins the whole experience. It is possible that I could've gotten a faulty unit, so I requested a refund for this item.

ReviewTitle: If you're new to the wireless earbud game, solid purchase! Upgrade worthy? Debatable.
ReviewBody:
I've been HYPED about these earbuds since they were announced during Samsung's Galaxy Unpacked Event, and now I have them! I also own the predecessor to these, the Gear Icon X 2018s. I also have a pair of Jabra Elite 65Ts as well, I threw in some photos of those for a size comparison. I like these earbuds. Sound is good, definitely marginally better than the previous generation. The Galaxy Buds look better, they feel better, they're smaller, and the case charges wirelessly which is actually SUPER useful.

Now, I'm a Samsung FanBoy through-and-through, that being said, I think Samsung took a couple of steps backwards on a few things comparatively. The gestures are essentially the same as the previous gen except they got rid of swiping up and down on the earbuds for volume control. It's not the biggest deal since you can still set up the earbuds to give you volume control (based on long presses of each earbud) but now you have to choose between being able to control the volume from the earbuds or triggering ambient sound or voice commands, you cannot do both (from the earbuds at least), and that's kinda lame. Additionally, it seems like they've weakened the capability of Ambient Sound? On the previous gen I REALLY felt like I could hear my surroundings, within at least a ~10-15ft radius when Ambient Sound was active. With the Galaxy Buds that listening-radius feels significantly abbreviated for some reason? Additionally, most likely in the interest of shrinking the form factor, the Galaxy Buds no longer have their own onboard storage, so you can not store music on the buds themselves. That feature was super useful when you wanted to go for a run or workout but didn't necessarily want to have to bring your phone, fortunately not having it isn't a deal-breaker by any means.

I feel like these decisions might have been driven by the desire for more people to download Samsung's Galaxy Wear app, which is fine as a companion app. I feel as though with the Gear Icon X 2018s the goal was to help you not have to rely on your phone very much, if at all, where as the Galaxy Buds definitely make your phone a bit more necessary.

In summation, they're awesome wireless earbuds! They sound great, they look great, they're compact, wirelessly chargeable, LOUD, comfortable, and not uber expensive! Personally, I love features and options. Even if I'm not particularly going to use something often, I still prefer to have the option just in case and I would say objectively speaking, compared to the Gear Icon X 2018s, your options are definitely a bit lessened with these guys.

Upgrade worthy? Ehhhh, if you're like me and prefer options and the Gear Icon X 2018s fit you comfortably then I would say you're not missing out on anything more than a slightly modified design. If that's worth an upgrade to you, go for it! If not, I think your Gear Icon X 2018s are worth hanging onto for a while longer! Lastly, if you're new to the wireless earbud game, for $130 these are definitely a solid contender, especially considering the competition. Would recommend!

The only reason I didn’t get air pods was because they don’t fit in my ear properly. Although the galaxy buds did fit fine and feel comfortable. I have an iPhone and at first it was a pain in the ass to connect to them, sometimes they would say connected but not play any sound or show proper signs of functioning. Galaxy buds also weren’t loud enough just by a little bit, and if you have an iPhone you do not yet have access to the app that allows you to change different settings and set them to the way you want them to work for you.

ReviewBody: Disappointed
Very good earbuds. Buy em..

First things first. These are very comfortable. Easily the most comfortable pair of true wireless buds that I've owned. It's just... the sound isn't really there. They're crazy quiet compared to my Jabra Elite Active 65Ts.

Now the sound quality I can get along without. I don't normally listen to music with buds. I use them for audio books and videos at work. They work fine for that.

The number one reason for the low review is the absolute travesty of a microphone they put in these. Tinny with way too much treble going through. They pick up everything around you and sharply magnify the sounds.

I got two of these by accident. I had one ordered through Walmart, but they said they were out of stock. Amazon did not have them at the time. I canceled my order with Walmart and got them through my carrier, but Walmart suddenly got a pair back in stock and shipped them anyway.

So I kept them and gave them to my girlfriend. Now, we like to use these when talking to each other, but her voice is so sharp it's painful. One of us always has to remove  them to talk, because it really hurts the ears. I have a squeaky door at work and whenever someone goes through, she gets a blast of sharp sound, and I'm in the other room from the door!

These are very disappointing for the price. My $40 Firacore pair had way better sound quality, microphone, and battery life. If you want a pair of buds to talk on the phone with, I'd look elsewhere.

The story turns sour when I discovered that I lost my charging case somewhere between home and the grocery store.
Why? Because when I contacted Samsung they told me that I could not buy a replacement case. I had to buy complete set, and there are no known plans of ever having parts replacement for it in the future.
Long story short: DON'T LOSE YOUR  BUDS or CASE! That is unless you are okay with buying the whole thing over again. So, buyer beware.

ReviewBody: Easy to lose one of the ear buds

I read as many reviews as I could before picking these up from ATT at a discount. Glad I did.

* These sound great. I tend to keep them on dynamic mode. Paired w/ a samsung galaxy s10 + they sound fantastic. Base is just fine, and everything sounds well balanced. I even noticed sounds in a movie that I hadn't before. I've connected them to my laptop, soundbar, phone and desktop. Everything worked great. #thumbsup
* Connectivity has been good. I've had a little bluetooth interruption once that I can remember. Hasn't been a consistent issue at all. I'd say 95% up time, so to speak. I have connected the buds to my samsung phone, my macbook, iMac, and my Sony HTst5000 soundbar without any issues. I haven't noticed losing connection due to distance ever.
* Super light and comfortable. I've had to play with the different ear rubber sizes. I'm starting to think each of my ears are a little differently sized. I've found if I put them in, and then back them out some it seals out the sound nicely. (Maybe I was putting them in too deep?)
* The app is great. A lot of folks have complained about ambient mode. It's worked pretty well for me.
* Battery life. I used them off and on for 4 days before I realized I needed to charge the case. Pretty good :)
* Touch controls. Any new touch control will take a minute to get used to, but I haven't had any issues at all. I just had to get used to it. I love that you can customize the touches to interact with your playlists, calls, and other things.
* The case is small, compact, and light. Its a little slippery in the hand, and you have to be intentional when you open it, but you get used to that. When you open the case, it connects to your phone before you can put buds in your ears. There's even a soft sound to indicate when the phone knows you have a bud in each ear. Nice touch.
* Wireless charging is responsive and quick. The case charges the buds pretty quickly, too.

All in all, these are supurb. I really like them, and glad that I got them. Pick 'em up.

ReviewTitle: Received a used device and an opened box when ordered a new device
ReviewBody: Received a used device and an opened box when ordered a new device

Ok, so as a consumer I try to stay very unbiased and try to not be brand loyal. So I'll give this review as unbiased as I can. Also, I'll include a summary at the end if you dont want to read my long review. Also, also, I'll be comparing them to airpods in many ways as they were made as a direct competitor.

So I'm going to break this down into materials and design, connectivity, sound, fit, and features.

Design and Materials:
Starting with design, this is subjective of course, but I personally really like how the buds look. Comparing them to the airpods, I think that the more subtle design paired with more colors is really appealing and will draw in more people. That said, airpods have become sort of a meme and their design has become very mainstream. The case is also well designed. It looks better than the airpod floss case, in my opinion, but it isn't as satisfying as the airpod case. That said it is easy to open and looks clean, especially the matte black. Now onto the build quality. The earbuds themselves are very light, but this is okay as you want to basically forget they are in your ear. That said, the buds dont feel cheap. The materials are very nice and they feel good in hand, and head. The case is a similar story. Light but substantial enough that it feels well made. Like I said, I also love the matte finish on the case.

Connectivity:
So much like the airpods, all you have to do, on Samsung Phones, is open the case and after a moment the buds pop up and boom, your connected. This remains the same after you first connect, just open the case and by the time their in your ears, you're connected. The range is okay. If you go more than about 15 feet, give or take, they start to break out. But if you have your phone on you, you're good. I also havent really had any stuttering or anything like that, just clear audio if you're in range.

Sound:
So this is possibly the most important category. Now I dont pretend to be an audiophile but I have listened and own a fair number of headphones. So with a package this small, I kept my expectations low. But when I got the buds, I was actually pleasantly surprised by the sound. Songs like Hotel California are really well balanced. Vocals are really clear and highs are also clear and clean. However, where the buds lack heavily is in bass. Rockstar sounds alright but if you need crazy bass, fully wireless earbuds are not for you. I mean, the driver is really small so you cant really expect earth shattering bass. But I know kany people love their bass, as i do too, and you may miss it with these. However, that isn't what these are for. The galaxy buds are made to be convenient, small earbuds, and as a result, audio suffers. That said, I think the audio will be very good for most people, as long as you can live without some bass. Again vocals are great and highs are clear and crisp.

Fit:
So possibly the best feature that the buds have that the airpods dont is the fit. This is because you get three different wing tips and ear tips in the box. This means that most people will be able to find a combination that fits them well and comfortably. Contrast that with the airpods which dont come with anything and the either fit or they dont. Another important difference between these and airpods in the in ear design. This means you get very good sound isolation which you will either like or not like. However, Samsung has included an ambient sound feature which works pretty well. The fit overall is superb, though. Once you get the right ear tips, you honestly forget that they are in your ear. They are also very good for working out because of how small they are and how well they fit, I mean, they wont come out of your ear, they go in your ear very well. Again, this is a mixes bag with airpods as if they dont fit you, they can easily fall out.

Features:
Wrapping up this review is features, and there are quite a few. So starting with controls, you have a touch capacitive panel on each earbud. The controls work well but I'm not a huge fan of the implementation. A single press only play pauses, a double press only skips, etc. The only customization you have is with the long hold. You can either have that trigger a voice assistant, volume or toggle ambient noise. I wish you could go deeper into controls and, for example, have play pause on the right with a single press, skip on the left with a single press, volume up and down by holding down on left and right, and ambient noise as a double tap. And who knows, software may change and make this possible. Another thing I dont really like is that, unlike the airpods, you cant take one bud out to pause the music and put it back in to resume it. Again, this could change with software. Speaking of software, the galaxy wearables app has a decent amount of customization, better than apple at least, and I hope to see Samsung continue to improve it. One thing that you can use with the app is the ambient noise toggle. I actually really like this feature and it works pretty well. The microphones do a pretty good job of amplifying voices and it works at a good distance too. The fact that they can charge wirelessly is also a big plus, especially for Galaxy S10 users with the reverse wireless charging. Other small features are USB-C, decent battery life, good quick charging (1.5 hours from 15 minutes of charging) and the overall convenience and size of the package.

So overall, the Galaxy Buds are made very well and look quite nice too. The pairing process is very solid, especially on Samsung and the range is good for mose people. The sound quality is pretty standard for this price range and lacks on bass but has clear mids and vocals as well as crisp clean highs. The customizability of the fit is amazing and means that the buds will fit most people. Finally, the buds' controls could be better but they have plenty of other great features like wireless charging. Overall, a very solid package and for $130, what are you waiting for?

ReviewTitle: HORRIBLE sound quality for the price
ReviewBody:
I got these from Costco and took them back 2 days later. In short, the sound quality is absolute garbage. I really can't believe how quiet these are. I am no audiophile, but I definitely like my music loud. I especially listen to music loud when I am lifting weights (which is what I purchased these for), BUT these are so darn quiet I can't believe anyone who appreciates music would be able to use these. For running they were ok since I don't turn up the music too loud for long durations.
The sound level probably gets to the point where medium would be on any other pair of average headphones- maybe a tad higher. It was REALLY ANNOYING. The actually audio quality was OK at best as well. Adjusting the equalizer resulted in very little difference in the muddled audio profile. DO NOT BUY. The build quality, comfort, ease of use all were good, but what's the point if the audio stinks??

ReviewTitle: Does not have an IOS app to customize your buds
ReviewBody:
If you are iPhone user, please note that there is no IOS app to customize the earbuds. It's going to be a plain Bluetooth earbuds with all the default settings. Shame on Samsung for this lame feature, you just lost another customer, and millions more.

Follow up review:
After several weeks, I realized that this earbuds have a major issue: when you make phone calls with earbuds, it’s kind of like you are in speaker mode on a phone. It’s fine by you if you are using the earbuds, but not so much for the other person who is on the other line. Because it’s like on speaker mode, the other person hear really well the environment noise, especially if you are in a noisy environment, it literally picks up all the noise, such as other people talking. Even if you are doing dishes and using the earbuds to talk at the same time, that dish washing noise get transfer very well through the earbuds, so that the other people could find a hard time to hear you clearly, or sometimes it’s very annoying to hear some sharp noise when you accidentally knock your dish to each other. It feels like you never know when it’s going to “shock” you with these sharp noise if you are on the other line.

ReviewTitle: Great earbuds, the best I've owned
ReviewBody: Coolest earbuds I've ever had. I'm going to be honest, the bass isn't what you'd imagine, it's more of a clean and solid punch. The audio is very clear, haven't tried calling anyone with them yet, but I've heard nothing but good things about it. Bixby is available. I recommend using them with Dolby Atmos turned on, it improves the quality and volume even more. Keep the setting on dynamic mode. The sound isn't overwhelming like some, they fit comfortably and will not fall out of your ears. The touch gestures were hard to get used to at first for me because I couldn't touch them directly, but once you learn where they're at it gets easier. Overall, I love these, they are extremely cool, have great sound quality, and allow you to be more hands free. Very reasonable pricing, and in my opinion, they are definitely worth the money.

I was also a fan of the more discreet design. After trying them for myself I absolutely love them. Everything was better than I thought it would be. They don't leak sound. They innately cancel noise thanks to the in ear design(I was buying larger Headphones with a ANC switch so this was important for me). I also learned that they are.. err.. water proof(I bet you can guess where they ended up for me to learn this lol). The battery life is excellent as well. You basically store them in the charging base. The sound itself is impressive. I was really impressed with the solid amount of base these put out.

If you are looking to go small(the Beats Era is over lol) these are a great choice.

ReviewTitle: They fit my wife’s ears perfectly, and sound better than my AirPods.
ReviewBody:
*Purchased in Amazon 4-Star Store*
I decided to purchase these for my wife after trying out the Jabra Elite 65t earbuds.

I originally purchased the Jabras for her since she liked my AirPods but since she doesn’t have an apple product she needed an alternative. The Jabras sounded only okay. I was surprised to find their sound was only mediocre.

The real problem though was the fact that the Jabras, no matter what ear bud size she tried, hurt her ears. That was a no go since she wanted to listen to her music in bed.

We tried out the Galaxy Buds and while the sound quality is still about a 4/5, they fit my wife’s ears and that’s what we needed.

I tried them out as well and they are actually very comfortable and provide a great deal of noise cancellation right out of the box. I tried out the EQ settings on her app as well and I prefer the higher bass setting, so after tweaking it to my liking I was impressed for sure.

For me, as an iPhone user, I thought the simplicity of AirPods would surpass other brands but I could certainly get by happily with Galaxy Buds, and the latter are about $40 cheaper.

If you buy these I doubt you’ll be disappointed.

ReviewTitle: Conversation isn't great with these bluetooth
ReviewBody: Dislike...... great for listening to podcast or music... but to hold a conversation with them I would have to give it 1 star.. but no buyers remorse

can't beat this for the price and form factor and quality, yes, and features!

I'm sure you know the features by now, so i won't bore you with them.

how does this compare with airpods? absolutely no contest! never had an issue with call quality. how many times do we answer the calls anyway? if you are having weird issues, echos etc, could be due to older firmware with ambient sound turned on. had mine updated to new firmware on first day of purchase.

considered getting sennheiser momentum true wireless and b&o beoplay e8 2.0 before but realised they were bluetooth 4.2 or with master and slave configuration, some hardware issues etc.

will this work well with other phones besides samsung? it won't sound as good. samsung phones have something called the scalable codec and this, their's, earbuds has support for it. upon connection to samsung phone, scalable codec will be selected by default. DO NOT CHANGE TO AAC. if you have poweramp, check audio -> hi-res output and you will notice it's using LDAC!! this could very well be the first TWS earbuds with LDAC! make sure in wearable app, set it to dynamic.

if you want the best sound, listen at home with a wired headset on your samsung phone!
Great earbuds.  The sound is great and I like the way they feel.
Out of the box and boom, works great with Samsung S7 Edge. Sad =  they do not work with Samsung Gear Fit 2. Not sure why but when I contacted Samsung, they confirmed the Buds would not connect.

I am so in love with these! I've been a true Galaxy/Samsung fan ever since the Galaxy S3, I'm now an owner of a Galaxy S10+. To start they connected instantly. No issues there at all. Very comfortable and they have several buds and wing options for different sized ears. Shouldn't be an issue finding a fit for you. Sound quality is awesome! They are way better sounding than Skullcandy earbuds or anything alike, satisfying bass along with the ambient mode so you can hear around you. Call quality is superb. Touch controls are nice and work fluidly. I've had absolutely no issues. I've read a lot of reviews of people having issues with sound. If they do not sound good at all, like I've been reading, return them and get a replacement! Also they do have a warranty!!!!

ReviewTitle: Ambient mode not great, connection drops and right microphone louder than left one.
ReviewBody: Lots of connection drops considering the price and that I had cheaper ones with ko connection drops whatsoever. Ambient mode was no great and the right microphone sounded louder than the left one. Returned it.

Operates  well indoors well on phone and /or connected to wearables.  Once  you  step outside the connectivity becomes intermittent.  In fact,  if wearing only the Galaxy Watch Active, there is virtually no connectivity to the buds.
I go running.
Nunca me Llegó el pedido por eso doy una estrella

Came open box. And I mean that literally; it came like the first pic, open, in the box. The buds were also clearly used by someone that doesn't value personal hygiene as much as I do.

The rating system is pretty mediocre so I'll leave it with what it deserves. Ever since I got my free pair of these with my S10+ I have cut the cord. This may vary depending on your particular situation but I use these at least 30hrs a week at my job and the convenience is impossible to beat. So this is where I'm coming from.

The sound quality, like, wow. Really impressed with these.

You can't beat a wired pair. You just can't. I have a pair of FH5's and Sure 846's. The extra power (amps, wattage) they can inherently provide beats out anything currently available. In the end they all use similar drivers; it's the execution and the end result that matters and for a truly wireless set, I'm waiting for something to beat these...

This, for me at least, is the beginning of the truly wireless age.
good

ReviewTitle: Samsung keeps pushing updates to improve connectivity and lag.
ReviewBody:
Pros:
As I'm not an audiophile, the sound is great for me although I understand that there are much better sounding buds out there - these are more than double the price. I'd say they sound somewhat better than Beats X bluetooth headphones if that helps.

Battery life is long and the charging case is compact enough to place in your small jean pocket.

Very comfortable and lightweight. I actually hurt my ears by using the smallest ear tips and pushing the buds right into my ears - dumb idea! The tipd just need to be placed in lightly and the earbuds hold firm which is great.

Cons:

Definitely the connectivity. The cutting out at first drove me insane but two updates in a week have seen a vast improvement in consistent connection; however, Samsung are still a couple of updates away from completely fixing this in my opinion.

The first day of owning them saw sound cutting out, echos and video lag. After two updates this had reduced significantly. If Samsung hadn't pushed out updates so quickly, I'd have returned them.

I'll hold onto them now as I believe they're working- and close to succeeding- with fixing the connectivity and lag.

Only then will they be a great product.

I use these to listen to music, podcasts and audio books while doing several activities throughout the day. The battery life is amazing for such small devices. The sound quality is incredible as well.

These headphones have been great! I could not ask for a better set! Connect every time automatically!! And the ambient sound feature is great giving me the capability to still be aware of my surroundings!
Big upgrades from iconx and iconx 2018
Great battery life but horrible for phone calls

ReviewTitle: voice and noise cancelling not good

Ok so I didnt buy them from Amazon but I got em from best buy, I've tried the ambient sound, tried the EQ tried everything, I've never found a more quiet set of headphones. I'm not deaf, I have perfectly good ears, I was cutting my grass and I had the volume all the way up, no matter what song I played I couldn't hear it, I tried e everything, I work with technology every day, I'm certain I can figure these out, but they're not loud at all, not even a little bit, like I would expect for $130 you'd be able to make your ears bleed, instead it sounds like my music is a whisper.
