ReviewTitle: The absolute best headphones for sitting perfectly still
ReviewBody:
These headphones are amazing, as long as you don't move or go outside, and keep them within one foot of the phone.

All of the functionality works great except for the Bluetooth connection which unfortunately is the most important thing.
If you only want them for inside the house and will have your phone close at all times these may be for you.
If you want to go outside though you will find them to be mostly unusable and worthless. It seems like everytime a gentle breeze comes along they crackle to the point you will just want to toss them away.

ReviewTitle: Great addition to samsung ecosystem, quality is not there
ReviewBody: I am part of the samsung ecosystem and have been for the past couple of years. I bought these about a month ago and have been sorely disappointed. The ease of connection and battery life are outstanding. Unfortunately that's where the good stops with these headphones. The sound quality is not much better than the AKGs that came with my S8. The fit is not the best for my ears even with the additional ear pieces I could not find a fit that would stay in place and maintain the quality of music while running. Finally at times the connection to my phone would be very choppy. $130 for these isn't bad. My suggestion would be hold off an extra paycheck and splurge the extra $70 for some more quality headphones.
Great product
Very good
They need better placement of the microphones. I have tried moving them around to different angles in my ears with no help. Cannot use for primary purpose, which was making phone calls.

I use this product every day for at least 8hrs a day. However the call quality on these are atrocious. Did take me quite some time to figure out how to raise the volume. But using them after so long at max volume they no longer sound as good as the first few days (lol maybe I've destroyed my ears)
It's a great design and doesn't come off on heavy workout as well.... And great sound quality as well..

I got these a while ago, and had issues with them at first. The Bluetooth connection was spotty and would cut out if I bent over, it was bad. HOWEVER, it turns out that it was just my set. I called Samsung, since they were still under warranty, and they sent me a new pair, perfectly functioning. They have, in my opinion, amazing battery life. I have only ever ran them all the way down once, and they last a day, guarantee for me.  That 6 hour battery life is legit. The call quality is pretty good. I've never had someone not understand me while using them for calls, and I have used them both inside and outside. As for fit, they do take a little getting used to. But if you do manage to find the right combo of wings and tips, then they seal your ear fairly well. I usually can't understand people talking to me if music is playing, and it is definitely muffle when there isn't music playing. The environmental awareness feature is ok, it really does just make stuff sound tinny, but for what it is intended for, it works. The touch controls are decent; sometimes if I don't tap enough towards the center of the touch pad, it won't read, but it is responsive once you get the hang of it. The wireless charging is absolutely ingenious. I have an ikea desk lamp with a wireless charger, and I just throw them on overnight, and that's that. There is a USB-C if that suits your fancy too. Finally, the sound quality. I think they are pretty good. I am no audiophile, so as long as you aren't OBSESSED with the sound quality, they will do just fine. They do have bass, contrary to popular belief, though it will not be bass you FEEL. What I mean is, you won't feel the bass as well as hear it, like with a sub-woofer or something. The "equalizer" in the wearable app does have a "dynamic" setting that provides the best balance in my opinion; the "bass boost" just lowers mids and trebles, so it isn't really great. Overall, they are an excellent set of headphones that I take literally anywhere, especially since they are so dang compact.
The best product of Samsung, i love it, i recommend 100%

ReviewTitle: Great buds for music. Awful for calls.
ReviewBody:
Because of the lack of call quality I can only rate this 3 stars. If you don't make calls or have no need to use the buds for calls, these buds are an excellent choice!

When looking at earbuds, I look at sound quality, comfort, convenience, battery life, and call quality. The galaxy buds hit it out of the park with all but call quality. For the size, convenience, and price the sound quality if good. The buds are very comfortable and I can wear it for long periods of time. I've never had issues with battery life and the case is small and light so carrying it around is not an issue.

The real issue is the call quality. I cannot use the buds for phone calls. While I can hear calls just fine, the microphone has terrible quality and people on the other end have real issues hearing me. Other wireless buds like the Jabra 65t do not have this issue. This is a real shame because these are the most comfortable ear buds I've ever work and I would use it exclusively if the call quality was average or better.

ReviewTitle: Not loud enough for my needs
ReviewBody: These earbuds are not very loud. If you're in a quiet room, they work very well. But, if you're walking where there is city noise they aren't very loud.
Best wireless earbuds I own currently.

These are my first pair of wireless buds and I'm very happy. First, the case and the buds themselves are sleek. The buds have a wing that makes for a perfect fit with no chance of them falling out even if exercising. The pairing is instant and the wearable app features an equalizer so that you can change the audio performance. The case is small enough that it's not bulky in the pocket of regular pants. Would recommend!

Hello Everyone, Having my Samsung Galaxy Ear Buds actually in my ears and in use while i write my review makes it so much easier to complete:)  With no issues whatsoever regarding pairing them with my Samsung Galaxy cellphone or my P.C., i was off to a quick start in getting them going. One of the first things to occur, was that i received a call from my friend who was using their cellphone at the time and the sound was clear on my end and they told me that it was clear on their end also! Next, i started playing music through the Buds from my cellphone and the sound was excellent in my view and as loud as i wished to make it. Obviously the premium sound provided by AKG for the Buds is top notch!! When i checked to see how depleted the charge had become on the Buds after several hours of use, it was much less than i expected it to be and the recharging time was negligible. Being able to converse with my friends, family and neighbors while i have the Buds in my ears is no problem at all. Also, once you get used to the touch controls on the Buds, it becomes second nature to operate them:) Two things happened to me, both inadvertent, both excellent positive review enhancers lol. First, when i opened the case outside to put the Buds back in before going upstairs, i dropped the open case on the sidewalk and it got a minor nick in it. I then went upstairs to check if it was OK and it and the Buds charged up flawlessly!!! As a retired machinist i noticed two things immediately. First, the case is made of what i believe to be aluminum, which makes it lightweight and second, it also makes it rust-proof:) Second thing to occur was that i was out walking the dog and got caught in a brief, but heavy rain shower, which soaked us and the Buds well, with no ill effects for us or the Buds:) I most definitely based on my usage and occurrences with my Samsung Galaxy Ear Buds recommend them highly! Thanks for taking the time to read my review.

However, what they don't tell potential "non-android" customers is that if your smartphone IS NOT A SAMSUNG...you are S.O.L.  You won't be able to take advantage of all the features this high ticket item can bring. These buds don't have a lot of volume and you can't adjust the high treble.  Instructions in the package DO NOT provide info for the NON-ANDROID user.  You have to search the web to find out how to update firmware and THAT IS ALL YOU CAN DO TO THE PRODUCT.  SHAME on Samsung! Provide an app for the non-android customer to access the features of your product!!! Gezzzz... Maybe even a computer app to make adjustments and turn on /off features. ReviewTitle: Not perfect, but seems to hit the marks in all the right places.
ReviewBody:
I have been searching for so long...

I had airpods before, loved them. However I found they were really easy to lose, which is exactly what happened. I lost them. Or maybe someone stole them? I'll never know.

So now I wanted new wireless headphones, but I didn't want to shell out over 150+ dollars just for some headphones. I admit the airpods are great, but are they worth over 150 dollars of my hard earned money for some wireless capabilities? I didn't think so.

So I tried the 30-50 dollar headphones, some were a hit or miss but most of them were a miss. If they had good sound quality, they had bad bluetooth connection. If they had good bluetooth connection, they had poor sound. You get where I am going with this.

So I decided to shell out a little bit more, and get the galaxy buds. This was the sweet spot that I was looking for.

The Pros:
-the sound quality is good-also in the app you can change the type of preset sound you want, such as soft, bass boosted, dynamic, higher treble, etc.
-they last a good while. The case charges them and they work seamlessly when you put them on and off. just like the airpods
-has wireless charging
-they are nicer looking than the airpods (in my opinion, because there's no awkward rod sticking out. Some people don't have the right ears for it and it looks really silly)
-and can fit ANY ear unlike the airpods
-they have noise cancellation. I turned it on and off with the app to see if it was true and it does have ACTUAL noise cancellation.
-decent price
-good touch commands(but this also can be a con)

Cons
-the commands arent really configurable or advanced. There's no swipe for volume or anything and you can only customize the long hold. The single, double and triple tap commands are locked in. Not a deal breaker but something to understand.
-build quality, although more expensive than the cheaper china-brand ones, seemed similar. There was not much glossy finish to make it look sexy(again not a deal breaker)

for those who want to just say they have the airpods for stature or want to show off to people, I'd say stick with the airpods. The airpods still I believe are the best tiny buds, in terms of SOUND QUALITY for music. However these buds are for those who want functionality, with practicality, at a reasonable price. I said the airpods didnt seem like they were worth the 150+ dollars spent. Galaxy buds however, are they worth the 100 dollars?...I'd say a solid yes

Wish I could return these. Whether I'm just going for a quick jog, bike ride , or a walk.. the dropouts, stutter, and lag when listening to a song is crazy. Maybe I just got a defective product. But it seems like this technology hasn't been perfected and isn't ready.
Better than AirPods in virtually every way. It either is the same or better. The case is slightly bigger, but the earbuds are more subtle than AirPods.

ReviewTitle: Older devices and connecting to Linux Operating System wasn't suited out of the box.
ReviewBody:
My first impression was the sound wasn't all that impressive as the reviewers lead me to believe; even on my old Memopad 7 (with the various settings tweaked out on the jetAudio Plus music app). Bass is definitely lacking, and the boost from the Galaxy Wearable app improved it ever so slightly. When paired to my Apple iPod 7th Gen, the volume levels are maxed out to a medium-low. And with the Galaxy Buds long tap right/left controls to raise/lower the volumes are all but non-functional. The problem also occurs when synced to my Ubuntu 18.04 Desktop OS. Installing the Galaxy Plugins didn't help either.
I'm almost positive that the Buds would have had excellent sound with the Nano and I would have decided to keep them for that reason alone. It's probably just a flick of a switch in the firmware to make it possible and keep more customers from returning their products. Hopefully, the firmware gods will hear my pleas.

I wish the case snapped closed. Otherwise,  I have no complaints.

These were awesome! While they were working... They worked for 2 days flawlessly after the updating them before use.  then the third day I started noticing drop outs when the transmitter or the headphones are covered by anything from a thin fabric to your hands.. by the 7th day just turning my head and the wind blowing cut reception. There have been no updates since that first one. My $15 off brand 5.0 wireless buds work perfectly.. thru walls... around corners... with no stupid app and no updates. What are we.. Beta testing these things?
On my first call to Samsung they denied all knowledge of the many purchasers that are having the same problem. I was like "Do you read your support forums?" They determined they were defective because resetting them thru galaxy wear didn't work. (Speaking of Galaxy wear.. It's kinda stupid. It only works when paired to your phone. Useless when using any other device.) 2nd call to Samsung (different rep) he acknowledged all the ongoing issues, and that he was tired of making excuses for them LOL then he recommended just returning them to Amazon instead of going thru Samsung's RMA process to obtain a working pair because of the difficulty and the amount of time it would take.  Hmmmm... Not the answer I was expecting from Samsung's customer service. They don't even want to deal with it anymore. Probably because they are overwhelmed with their own returns of these.
So disappointed. I loved them for 2 days..
3 gripes while they were working..
#1 - They can only connect to one device at a time. My $15 off brand headphones have that option and its so convenient. We don't listen to music solely on our phones.
#2 - The charging port isn't micro usb.
#3 - I was intrigued by the Ambient Aware. To be able to control how much surrounding noise you want. It's great until the wind blows really hard at a certain angle, which wasn't bad when walking even tho I live in the Windy city but I'm an avid cyclist and with the Ambient Aware on, at any volume level while riding at any speed, the wind noise is horrible with your head looking forward in a constant headwind. Turn your head to either side and it goes away but you can't ride like that.
Ambient Aware will only work were there's no wind.. like the moon I guess?

For those complaining about the max volume of the Galaxy buds, here is a small tip.

First time I used them I had the same feeling. The sound quality was good, but the volume was too low to listen on the street, even setting to max the phone volume. But if you configure them to increase/decrease the volume with the touchpad (by default is used for the voice assistant) you will be able to increase the volume a lot. Once you do it, you can set the touchpad configuration back to the default and control it from the phone.

In my opinion this is a big usability bug that Samsung should fix asap because many people/reviewers are not noticing it.

The reason I didn't give 5 star is because these have two microphones that are supposed to switch back and forth depending on the background noise while you're on a call but I find it switches and the person I'm talking to cant hear me and its very muffled. ReviewTitle: Garbage for phone calls...I can't believe all the positive reviews ignore this issue
ReviewBody: This device is absolute garbage for making phone calls...and I can't believe all the positive reviews ignore this glaring issue on a somewhat expensive pair of earbuds that are designed to handle calls... The speaker sound-quality itself is superb, and battery life is good, connectivity is excellent, and a TOTAL FAIL when it comes to the microphone. Everyone I speak with, and I mean everyone, hears all of the background noise in my area better than they can hear ME talking! It doesn't matter if its cars driving by, or the TV, or other people talking in the room several feet away from me... For example, a couple of friends were having a conversation in the same room as me, about 10 feet away, and they weren't talking loudly...and shockingly, my Dad told me that he could hear my friends talking better than he could he me talking to him while these lame earbuds were in my OWN ears!! I couldn't believe what all my friends were telling me until I game my friend my earbuds and my cell phone to use, and I took my friends cell phone and called myself, and I had a chat with my buddy using the Galaxy earbuds and my cell phone and its totally true...I can hear everything in the room going on as if it was a Batman type hearing aid to snoop on other people, and I could barely hear my friend who was wearing the earbuds and talking to me. Absolute garbage. I'm an IT engineer by profession so I worked through some basic diagnostics at this point. I tried to Google the issue for starters and shockingly the Samsung forums are plagued with reports of this same type of overly-sensitive microphone issue with no resolution other than Samsung forum moderators suggesting warranty replacements, for which many users tried to exchange their buds for another new pair and the issue persisted. On another website I found a user who suggested wiping your local cell phones Android call/phone/dial apps' cache and temp data (I tried it and it didnt work)... I even tried resetting and re-pairing my Samsung bugs to two other Android cell phones (a pixel and a sony) and the same overly-sensitive mic persisted. As a last resort, I was past my point of returning the buds, but my girlfriend wanted a pair of bluetooth earbuds so months after buying my own Galaxy Buds, I bought ANOTHER pair of Samsung Galaxy Buds for my girlfriend, and she had the same exact issue...this time I promptly returned the new/second pair of Galaxy Buds that I purchased. This is absolutely a design flaw, likely with the hardware itself, and I'm incredibly disappointed. This could have been an incredible product but the microphone is so sensitive that it makes all calling garbage and its even difficult for Google Assistant or Bixby to understand me in a room with low-noise but has a TV running for example. I love the audio quality, the battery life is good, the ergonomics are good, the storage/charging case is great, but the microphone is terrible and it keeps me from being able to use this device because I needed it for calls more than listening to music. I can't believe that Samsung does NOT care to remedy this issue or to issue refunds or something like that. I hope someone starts a class action lawsuit against Samsung over this obvious and common defect, as Samsung has been mute on this issue (if you dont believe me, search their forums and you'll see many, many people have this issue since product release and even recently with brand new devices). So if you want the Galaxy Buds PURELY for listening to music, they are great...but if you want the buds for any phone calls I would stay far, far away, even one-off occasional calls aren't worth making with these. Please take my word for it...if you need bluetooth headphones or buds for phone calls, this is NOT the product you are looking for. I am now researching and looking for another brand or model that will meet my basic needs of having a decent sounding call... Good luck.
I LOVE THE GALAXY BUDS, IT'S fantastic, ❤ The order was very well, with complain

Amazing for the gym and talking with them

Call Quality - 0 out of 5. These are not for hands free talking. You will be able to hear your caller just fine. The sound on your end is great. However, your caller will be able to hear every single sound and noise in your background including hearing you swallow if you take a drink. Lol. They will not be able to make out what you're saying. I have not had one successful call with these. I was walking around the mall, I answered my friend's call. She could instantly tell something was off and different. My friend asked me what kind of 2003 Bluetooth device did I get and that I should throw them in the trash. And she wasn't the only call I've answered and my caller was like "please disconnect me from your Bluetooth device". So... Not for hands free talking. At. All.

Sound Quality - The sound, 5 out of 5. Beautiful sound quality. There's an equalizer with different options. I love the bass. It's very easy to become immersed in what you are listening to.

Noise Cancellation - These are ONLY for listening and possibly noise cancellation if you need it. The noise cancellation is 5 out 5. It actually concerned me at first because I couldn't hear ANYTHING in my surroundings. The ambient option helps you to be aware of your surroundings, other than that, be careful and be alert.

Battery - no complaints. It has always later as long as I needed. And when I'm not using them, I put it back in the case and it's at 100% again. 5 out of 5.

Bluetooth Connection - 4 out of 5. I'm not sure if it's the range, the walls, or when the battery gets low, but it makes this awful digital scrambling sound when the Bluetooth connection is breaking up. My apartment is a little less than 800 sqft. My phone can be in the living room, if I walk in the closet, the sound will scramble. I rated it 4 and not 3 because of the effortless connection. Just open the case and it automatically pairs to the phone. I have a Note 8.

Charging case - 5 out of 5. It's very small. I have clumsy hands so I have dropped it and lost it several times. Lol. That's a me problem though. It has the same c-type USB charging port. Super convenient.

Other functions - 4 out of 5. If you drop an earbud and can't find it. Click on where's my earbud and it will begin to beep louder and louder. I wish it did that for the whole case. The tapping functions to turn volume up or answer call (it's customizable) are fine. No real issues.

Honestly, best decision I've made.

The case even has wireless charging so that I can keep it charged by just placing it down on my charging pad when I am not using the case with or without the buds inside. One of the coolest features is the Ambient Sound. When you are wearing the Galaxy Buds, normal sounds become muffled. The solution is Ambient Sound, you turn that feature on and you can hear everything around you! Even while listening to music you can have ambient sound on. It even has the ability to enhance people talking to help you hear people in loud environments. When using them to make phone calls, everyone can hear me clearly and the sound quality is amazing. Overall I would definitely recommend these to anyone looking to get wireless earbuds.

I'm not sure how the product compares versus others as far as what you get for the price, but I feel like every dollar I spent was worth it. They fit well, easy to use and configure, and the audio quality is superb.

If you’re using an iPhone (like me) be aware that the app to customize how these work is only available for Android. That means Apple users are stuck with the out-of-the-box configuration. This may pose a problem for some.

The good:
The controls are fairly straight forward. I’ve listened to music and made phone calls. All were great sounding and clear. I’ve had people tell me how great the mic sounds.
They are comfortable. They ship with different sizes of inserts for a good fit.
They are sweat “proof.” I’ve heard this claim before and had other earbuds ruined by sweat. So we’ll see how these hold up in the long run. Airpods are not even sweat resistant. So they wouldn’t be my first choice for workouts.
They can work independently. You don’t need both buds in. They have the same configs right out of the box. So you can use just one if you need and not have to have a different set of controls.

The not-so-good:
You’re stuck with the configuration. The tap controls are easy. Play/pause, skip/reverse, answer/decline, etc. are all just tap sequences. Press and hold activates Siri.
There is no volume control on the buds. That is, unless you have an Android and can change the config. But, since this is a review for iPhone users, there is no volume control on the buds.
The quick-start directions are great for Android users. The case needs to be open and the buds inside it for it to pair. Some may already know this from other types of buds, but these are my first... and I had to Google it.

Are they good? Yes. Would I like them to be more Apple friendly? Yes. I’m going to keep them and just suffer through the volume control thing. The sweat-proofing and sound are more important to me.
You make the call for you. I didn’t see many iPhone reviews or information. So I wanted to share with others who may be looking.

ReviewTitle: I wanted to love these but the negatives far surpass the positives
ReviewBody:
I SO wanted to love these Galaxy Buds. Unfortunately,  negatives far surpass the positives.

PROS:
Design - I love the design. They fit completely in the ear without any "extras" dangling down like the Airpods
Fit - Extremely comfortable & stayed in my ears during my run without any problem. I have small ear canals & ear buds often hurt my ears. These did not bother me at all even after a few hours of wear.
iPhone Connection - It was easy to connect the Galaxy Buds to my iPhone by selecting them in my iPhone's Blue Tooth settings
Charging Case - case is compact, sleek & easy to operate

CONS:
Sound Quality - If you're a sound connoisseur these are definitely not for you. I bought these solely for running & to replace my Plantronics Backbeat Fit 300. The sound quality of the Galaxy Buds was notably inferior to the BB Fit. I was willing to compromise on sound for complete wireless convenience, but...
Noise Canceling - Non-existent. So much ambient noise bleeds through it's unbelievable. I wore these in the airport & could barely hear the music playing on my iPhone despite having the volume turned up quite loud.
Connection Issues - As I mentioned above, I bought the Galaxy Buds primarily for running.  I took the Galaxy Buds on my first run & paired them to my Apple Watch. The entire 3.5 mile run the Galaxy Buds snapped, crackled & popped. I can only guess they were having trouble staying connected to my Apple Watch which was on my wrist no more than 2 feet away at any time. I never had this issue with the Plantronics Backbeat Fit ear buds. For me, this was the deal breaker. By the time I finished my first mile I wanted to tear the Galaxy Buds from my ears & throw them in a ditch. The constant popping was unbearable. I turned the music volume up which helped to mask some of the crackling sound & was grateful I had only gone out for a short run.

Sadly, I'll be returning these little guys.

ReviewTitle: Was a total Samsung junkie till this.
ReviewBody: I've owned everything Samsung. 3 Cell Phones in the past, Tab 10.5, Tab S, Tab View, Gear VR, Gear S3, on and on.  All of them have been great products. Building a new house, thought I'd put Samsung appliances in it due to my complete satisfaction with the brand name.  Then I ordered their Bluetooth earbuds($120+).  Sound is great, but what good is that if the Bluetooth to my Samsung cellphone cuts in and out non stop like a McDonald's drive through speaker. TERRIBLE.  My $20 Tao Bluetooth Headphones WAY out preform the this junk.  Samsung should be ashamed, There is no excuse for a electronics giant like Samsung to turn out trash like this.  Funny how one bad product can make you walk away from a brand.  But how can you trust the brand again.  By the way, just furnished the new house with Whirlpool appliances last weekend, fingers crossed.

Great

Not what i expected from a Samsung product..
works with a lot of static noice during phone calls..
It's a good buy. i use them for work and it completely cancels the noise around me. the sound quality is good. it also lasts me a whole work day.

These earbuds work very well for in-ear headphones. The sound quality is surprisingly good, and is adjustable. The ambient sound setting helps the isolation effect of earbuds. The bluetooth range is quite good.

Do not buy. There is a known issue of bad for phone calls. In my situation  the right earbud started sounding bad for callers on the other end. It's a hit and miss. You might get lucky and not have to get an exchange from Samsung. It all started 2 weeks of using them.  Update did not fix. Quality for music i Great though.

The Galaxy Ear Buds have several great features and several bad problems.  If I could take the best of the Jabra T65's and mix them with the Galaxy Buds, I'd have the best pair of true wireless headphones.

Overall:
1.  The comfort is the best on the market.  They sit in my ear without any pressure points.  They also come with other options to make them fit better in the ear.  I can't imagine someone not being able to work something out with the fit considering all the options.  They stay in my ears without any issues no matter what I'm doing.
2.  The sound isn't as loud as I would like but the quality is just fine.  If people are looking for the best sound quality, go ahead and pay twice the amount...just don't get on here and mislead people by saying the sound quality is poor.
3.  The app is just ok.  It's a couple of steps from a budget app done to make people think they are getting more for their dollar.
4.  Battery life is great.  Recharging from wireless is a huge plus.
5.  Bud holder is great!  Magnet really helps seat them properly.  Easy to open and stays closed when you want.

So why 2 stars?  Connection issues are terrible.  I tried everything I know.  The problem is so bad that I can touch my phone yet the music is skipping.  I've tried uninstalling the software, restarting the music, restarting the buds, updating the software, standing on one leg with my finger in the air, and tilting my head.  Nothing seemed to work.  I reached out to Samsung and let them know the problem and see if they had a fix.  They had me do the same thing over again except the tilt and finger thing.  The problem was no better.  I did some research and found out that Samsung knows of this issue.  Why on earth would they waste my time without telling me there is a known problem.  By the way, I have a new Samsung phone which should be a plus on the integration side of things.  I want the product to work as I love them.  Samsung, if you are listening, the team that designed the outside and the case did their job perfectly.  The group that designed the connection to the device should be fired.  I bought them to listen to music, not just wear in my ears like jewelry.
So happy I bought them

ReviewTitle: They cut out more than I think they should.
ReviewBody:
Was super excited to finally get some truly wireless earbuds. Wanted so much to like these. For the most part I do, with one overwhelming negative... they cutout. The more I use them the more I notice they cut out. Phone in your pocket and you lean over, cut out. Turn your head, cut out. Hand against your head, cut out. Any activity, except sitting at a desk, you can expect them to cut out. 83.5% of the time they stay connected, but that 16.5% drives me crazy. Maybe I'm expecting too much, maybe bluetooth technology isn't capable of meeting my expectations. I've tried every suggestion to improve this issue with no success. Have requested a replacement pair in hope that I got a bad set so will update review if those work out

ReviewTitle: Pleasantly surprised, nice upgrade from first generation
ReviewBody: In the short time I have had these earbuds, I have been pleasantly surprised. I have a pair of the previous version and was never really impressed with the sound quality. I found there to be frequent connection issues or sound would just cut out for a few seconds if I moved wrong. With the new version, I have not experienced any of connection issues and have thoroughly enjoyed the higher quality sound. The range is much bigger and actually included some low end. I have a broad collection of music and have tried everything from dubstep to classical. These really do have a pretty nice sound. As usual, there are several sizes of earpieces to help dial in the fit. I tried mine out while running a chop saw and found them to be able to block out enough of the sound to keep me comfortable. One new feature that I really liked is the quick ambient mode. With this, you can just touch and hold an earbud to allow ambient sound in but it turns off when you release your finger. They do still have the ability to turn on full ambient sound as well, I just liked this addition better. I feel like the new buds are definitely an upgrade from the previous version and certainly worth considering if you are interested in upgrading.

ReviewTitle: So far, these are incredible. Well done Samnsung.
ReviewBody:
EDIT: I am giving these an updated 4 star review. It happens randomly, but the Bluetooth connection gets choppy when only a couple feet away from the Buds. If I have my phone in my pocket and bend over or reach to grab something, the connection cuts in and out at random times. It has only happened a handful of times. So we'll see if it becomes a constant problem. The battery life is solid, however. I used them for 3 hours and still had 40% battery. I still stand by my initial review. They are great, but maybe need a couple bugs worked out still.

These things are amazing. I had purchased a $70 no name brand Bluetooth Airpod look alike. They were cheap garbage. They constantly lost signal and had terrible sound quality. They also didn't fit my ear and fell out multiple times. So I decided to drop the money on the Galaxy Buds. They have been well worth the money, at least so far. The difference is almost uncomparable. They came with the medium ear tip and wingtip installed. The Buds fit my ears perfectly right out of the box. The sound quality is insane and the connection is strong, with no loss of signal at all**see edit.

The ambient noise reduction is pretty damn impressive. The option to either turn on the ambient sound filter permanently or temporarily by holding the Bud is extremely useful. I have been using the Dynamic equalizer setting and have found it hard to hear certain sounds without the ambient sound option enabled. So I suggest experimenting with what sounds good to you so you don't have any safety issues. These things really do block a lot of sound.

They are incredibly easy to connect to a Galaxy device. Make sure to download the Galaxy Wearable app beforehand to make connecting even faster. After connecting and charging, I used them for over an hour straight and the battery was still at 90%. I will update on battery life in detail after more use. Overall, I am extremely happy with the purchase. If you are looking for new headphones and have the funds, I say buy a pair. I plan to update my review if anything drastic or alarming happens. But so far, I highly recommend the Galaxy Buds.

Worked very well but people heard static when talking to me during a call. When using ambient sound it worked well but now it shuts off one side of the bud. When in crowded areas it's difficult for people to hear me on the other line. On the plus side these are very good for the gym and jogging or even to watch a movie on your phone. No lag when using it on my note 9. Really good just needs better quality for conversation during calls.

The touch controls are simple and aren't finicky, but it will take some getting used to where on the earbuds you touch. Battery life is also pretty close to what is advertised.

The touch controls on the buds are very responsive, pause play volume up down etc. They're very comfortable to and sit deeper into your ear so they don't stick out to far. They have a galaxy wearable app in the play store make sure to download it, that's where you set the ambient noise to block or allow outside noise into the buds. Most importantly in the app set the equalizer to DYNAMIC, i repeat set it to DYNAMIC or music will be super flat. Lastly sound i would say it is average at best, maybe similar to the corded iPhone earbuds but the the price of going wireless you can't beat it.

ReviewTitle: They are very easy to set up and use.
ReviewBody: Listening to music and watching movies .

First and foremost, it's a pain trying to maintain consistent connection between these and my phone. I'm 6'5" and 270ish, I have a moderate gut and wide shoulders, which unfortunately makes it almost impossible to have my phone in my pocket *and* move around. When idle or when walking it's usually fine, but if I take these out for a run, or want to do chores around the house I have to fit my phone to a wrist mount or place it somewhere on high. They *definitely* sacrificed range on these.

That being said, the bass is nice and the highs and mids are crisp. Microphone works well, but seems to have intermittent connection issues for the above mentioned reasons. I didn't have to use any of the alternate sizes of earbud or wingtip to get a nice snug fit. You can tell them R&D'd the crap out of the twist-in design, you get a perfect seal everytime. The hear through function is basically necessary, even with only one earbud in, if you're gonna talk to someone. The use of touch controls is very welcome, as previous "true wireless" earbuds that had physical buttons always felt like plunging my ear whenever they were pressed. The tap is sometimes unresponsive, but you learn quickly that there's a sweet spot that needs to be hit. Still annoying that occasionally you have to try three or four times when out on a run, and it looks a little silly. I tend to use the pause and long press for assistant functions exclusively (it's not that hard to pull out your phone lol)

The fact that each bud can be used independently is really neat, but not without flaws. Occasionally when watching video one of the two buds will lag behind the other and there's a jarring distortion that you can't really ignore. Rarely, one of the buds will not connect when switching from single to dual, and won't respond until you put it back in the charging case and then take it back out. It's never persisted past that initial reset, so I'm not exactly taking any points off for that.

The battery life is adequate, the time to charge is not all that great but not at all bad. About 3 hours of nonstop use, at full volume; roughly an hour to charge the whole case, and roughly an hour to charge a bud back to full power. If you wanted to, it's perfectly feasible to use one at a time for ~12 hours of uninterrupted use. The "in ear, in use" sensor works fairly well, but lags quite a bit when taking the buds out before disabling the touch controls. It's more for battery preservation than anything else.

There's a lot of confusion online about the samsung app that goes along with these earbuds. *you do not need to install anything to get these to work*. The main reason one would *need* to install the samsung app is if you wanted to fine tune the use of the hear through function, which can be set once and then the app uninstalled.

at ~140 I'd put these a fair cut above the competition, Jabra's offerings are over priced and I dont even wanna start with apple earbuds (they're basically expensive trash by comparison). Despite the persistent issues I have with connection I wont be returning these, I consider that an unavoidable burden with tech this small. I would (and have) recommend(ed) these to a friend, but like it says in the title here, be aware if you are larger in frame.
Loved how easy they are to use

ReviewBody: I bought these direct from Samsung. Great feel. Great touch. Bad sound. Bad connection. Bad dropped calls. Bad microphones. Bad pairing to each ear. Not ready for prime time. I have jabra, bose and generic wirelrss buds that stomp these samsung units hands down.

Have Bose Soundsport with excellent sound quality but wanted something with no wire connection between buds to go with my Galaxy S9. Got these buds and regret the choice.  Absolutely no richness to music; sound quality is very thin. Adequate for phone conversation, but nothing else.  2 stars because battery life is good. Otherwise NOT RECOMMENDED.
Moved on to Bose Soundsport Free (no wire connection between buds) and listening to music is once again fabulous.
I love my Samsung Galaxy  buds
working very well, so far so god
Lite and comfortable to wear, also easy to pair. Really glad I purchased these.
Not made for phone conversations.

These earbuds are in my opinion worth it because you can wirelessly charge them and can charge it with the wire which gives you more time to listen to music and other things. The sound quality is pretty good and it doesn't fall off your ear, you download an app for it custom your setting for how you like it. The setting up part was really easy because i had a Samsung, it automatically connect but i don't know how it works with non-Samsung phones.
These are excellent ear buds. The battery life is excellent and they pair up with my Samsung Note 9 perfectly

Literally stopped working 3 days after. Ear buds keeps buzzing or it would connect and play nothing (the song plays on phone but no sound through the buds). Total waste of $130 dollars. Find something else

These buds are awesome. I work 10 hour shifts in a very loud factory. In my position, were allowed music. So when I got these I was super excited. They cancel.out pretty much all machine noise and the sound is so clear it's amazing. I love how well they fit in my ear too. They're extremely comfortable for my entire shift. I charge them during my lunch break and they charge so fast they last the whole shift with no problem. If you're on the fence I say go for it. They're pretty much amazing.

The left earphone was broken like someone stepped on it and tried to glue it back together. I couldnt figure out what the cracking popping noise my left ear was making until I looked closely and noticed the poor attempt at a repair. I cant imagine they would come like this from the factory. Also this isn't the first time I've been delivered an item sold as new but clearly used.
Husband loves them
Great product!

I got one set for me and one for my husband.  I couldn't be happier!  I have RA in my hands and cannot hold my cell phone for long (about 1 minute max).  I put the buds in my ears and go about my day.  There is no echo effect that I always had with wired buds.  If I get a phone call, I just tap and I'm connected and can still do other things on my phone while I'm talking.  Wish I'd found these earlier!

They sound great and they work seamlessly with a samsung device. The case allows for recharging just like the Airpods but unlike the airpods the Galaxy Buds are actually comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

ReviewTitle: Decent Wireless Headphone Solution. Horrible Customer Service Policies
ReviewBody:
Bought these and was quite happy with the easy use, pairing, and functions within. Prior to the event causing me to contact customer service, I would have rated these at 4 stars.

About a month after purchasing these, I was on a hike in some mountainous trails in Colorado. While placing the charging pill, with the earbuds inside, in my pocket, the pill slipped an hit the ground. When the pill is ever dropped, the headphones go flying 3+ ft. Well both the headphones and charging case fell into rock crevices around us. We were able to find the charging case and one headphone, but unable to find the other. What we recovered still work, pair, and charge just fine (just with one headphone). I tried to contact Samsung Support on multiple occasions to see about getting a replacement bud for the one I lost. SURPRISE: Samsung refused to work me on getting a replacement. I was told that there was no way to get (and I even asked specifically about purchasing one) a replacement. I couldn't send them what I have, then pay the difference (as I'm sure they can refurbish mine and/or provide me a refurbished bud and just pair it with mine). No options, simply told "You have to buy another pair". For a device that essentially explodes into its pieces when dropped from 3 feet, being unable to request or replace an individual component seems like a money-grabbing business policy instead of working with customers willing to pay for the missing piece.

Right earbud sound is distorted if used alone. Together works ok most of the time,  audio is also distorted with other end hearing loud sucking and tapping noise. Really annoying. 2nd pairwith same problem. Tried the manufacturer warranty, they gave me the run around, waited for 2 weeks to hear back from them, but lost the unit before I could continue. Gave them another try because I loved the way the fit,  extremely comfortable imo. This replacement will be my 3rd set. Wish me luck,  will update
Sound is great and the connection to my iphone 7 is great too.
I love them

So far, these buds have been really great.  Well worth the money in my opinion and I never have to adjust them while running.  The only issue I've had is that I had to reset them one time because they would not stay connected to my devices.  Apparently this is a common issue as there are quite a few posts about it online.
Very nice to listen to music , but phone call quality is bad ,muffked goes in and out.

These are so amazing they sound good dont fall out. They are super small but the only thing is they are a little uncomfortable but once you find your fit of earwings and eartips then they become amazing
I hav no real dislikes ...jus wish a lil more base ....otherwise I love em

ReviewTitle: Never liked airbud till these came along.
ReviewBody:
Man oh man, did these take me by surprise, let me say straight up they Actually sound very Good, i'd rate the sound response and quality as follows:
Treble- 10
Bass - 7.8 [not surprised but they are good thou, not perfect but they are buds so maybe it's perfect based on price and technological limitations]
Mids/Vocals - 9 [damn right]

So here's some quick pros n cons while i'm here;

Pros:
- easy to pair and the App is very intuitive
- the carrying case is perfectly sized and if you been reading online or watching videos you know the S10 line can charge it via the case wirelessly and it uses USB C!!! lol so nice
- Like i mentioned before the sound is pretty good, i paid 120bucks and i'm not mad, i spent way more for less quality in the past.

Cons - sound quality for all i know could be better, i just based it as good in comparison to all the other non popular buds out there.
- it works seamlessly with Samsung devices but not with apple, little glitches here and there but nothing major. just shows either apple don't like buds or samsung purposely made them to glitch with apple.... both parties suck IMO....

that's all for now [05/24/2019] i'll update if something happens or i discover something. as for now, they get my vote of approval [for droid users anyways] apple users stick to your Airpods, why even try it when it will glitch from time to time more often than not?

~Peace~

ReviewTitle: The best earbuds for the sizes.
ReviewBody: I've used many wireless earbuds,  but Samsung Galaxy buds are the best for its battery life, sound quality,  and design.

Clear lag with videos. I read that doesn't happen with Samsung devices.
For audio only it's OK.
Listen to music

I love them! They fit in my ear perfect but also have different fins for your ear and different tips for the inside. After pairing them as soon as you open the case they connect to your phone and then when you're done you put them in the case can you shut it in the automatically turn off and disconnect. For functionality they are the best headphones have bought. You're not going to get any super bass out of these but they sound great

ReviewTitle: Music? Sure. Phonecalls? Sorry, didn't catch that.
ReviewBody:
Great for music. Horrible for phone calls so don't bother. Last update supposedly improved call quality but it's still unusable.

I actually can't believe how many good reviews these get.

I was a little disappointed after using it for a month. Sometimes the sounds glitches while I am listening to the music even when my phone is in my pocket. I even tried to reset it twice and still have the same issues. Hopefully an update will fix this issues.
The battery life is great. I love all the features. The best part is setting the buds up and how easy and smooth to pair with my S9 plus. The buds sounds better than the wired AKG buds that came with S9 Plus. They are pretty small and fits my ears but they are not very comfortable after listening to the music for an hour or two. You will feel that the buds are in your ears.

I have been using bluetooth headphones at work for a few years but they have always been the ones that have a wire connecting one headphone to the other. I wanted to go completely wireless so I decided to give these a try. When they stay connected, the audio quality is pretty good. The biggest problem I have is that the left one keeps losing it's connection. I also wanted to use these while cutting grass. They will not stay connected and keep cutting in and out. A friend of mine has a pair of these and he says his does the same thing. For the price, I am not impressed.
Love, love, love these! The sound quality is amazing. Better than any earphones/ear buds I've ever tried.
Small than air pods. Good sound.

I really like these ear buds. I had Jabra Elite Actives before this and they were great but had an uncomfortable fit so I decided to try the Galaxy Buds. The only negatives are 1. the environmental audio does not work very well. The sounds aren't clear and it often stops randomly, 2. the function to auto pause when you remove a bud doesn't work consistently, and 3. I really wish these were waterproof and more active focused.

I received these today and I have to say that I wish they were a little louder.  When I listen to music, I wanna go deaf.  I'm not kidding.

That being said, the sound quality really depends upon your source.  I listen to just about any type of music (no rap, no country, no jazz).  So I fired up a few different genres and tried different settings with all of them.  Keep in mind that the bitrate makes a huge difference.

A few bits of music I listened to with these headphone:

1.  Judge Jules Creamfields - 2000 - Old school trance - This sounds great but it wasn't loud enough.  This is Trance Energy and I like it loud.  Sound quality for this oldy was pretty damned good, just wish it was louder.

2.  Hans Zimmer - Da Vinci Code - Chevaliers De Sangreal - FLAC format.  The song gives me the chills but the bass was slightly washed out and the highs were absent.  Also, it wasn't loud enough for me.  DAMN!  This song is a great song to test a sound system with and these earbuds were a 5/10.  So unfortunate.

3.  Simple Minds Live - FLAC format -  Just not loud enough.  Could use a little help with the highs as well.  The lyrics were drowned out by the music.  Disappointed with this one.

4.  Van Halen - Runnin With the Devil - Cuz I love David Lee Roth.  This is a 3.43mb MP3.  Everything sounds great with this song.  My only gripe... VOLUME.  I wanna hear Diamond Dave SCREAM but that's not happening with these.

5.  The Church - Reptile - My only complaint...  I'm not deaf yet.  Okay...  The bass was a little dull but not terrible.

6.  The Police - Synchronicity II because it's bad ass.  Sound is a bit washed out on this 6.07mb MP3 but it's okay.

7.  Grateful Dead - Sugaree 1977 live - It's about as loud as you'd want for this song... eh... maybe not.  It's a little washed out but what do you want from a 1977 recording?  Okay so I realized for this song I was on Bass Boost.  Taking off of Bass Boost and putting the head phones into Dynamic mode makes a HUGE difference (No longer washed out).  Still could be louder though.

8.  David Bowie - Heroes -  Sounds okay - The Man Who Sold the Word sounds about the same.  Two of my favorites from Bowie.

9.  Spiritualized - Ladies and Gentlemen We are floating in Space - Never heard of Spiritualized?  This is a great band to test out new headphones with.  Such a complex song.  The dynamic mode works for this song and sounds great.  Bass boost mode isn't too shabby either.

10.  Pink Floyd - Sorrow (Pulse) - It's my favorite post Waters song; might even be my favorite Pink Floyd song ever.  Dynamic mode is best but it needs to be louder.  Guitar solo at the end of the song needs to make me deaf and it wasn't happening with these.  :(  Overall, the sound was pretty damned good for this recording.  Anyway, I'm sure this isn't the song you wanted me to review so let me review TIME (DSOM Studio version)...  This sounds absolutely amazing but for some reason, the headphones keep cutting in and out.  (I'm writing this review real-time.  I wonder if the earbuds are overheating, it's getting annoying?)  *Update an hour later and it's no longer cutting in and out (Sounds amazing just wish it was louder).

11.  Echo & The Bunnymen - People are Strange (Doors Cover).  Who does the Doors better than the Doors?  Echo...  This song sounds great.  Only gripe?  You guessed it, I'm not deaf yet.

12.  ColdPlay - A Rush Of Blood To the Head - Live - This sounds absolutely phenomenal.  Even the volume was loud enough.  Vocals are crystal clear, music is perfect...  Everything is excellent.  Dynamic Mode.  I had to listen to another one of these from the same live show to see if it was still perfect.  Politik - Sounds is absolutely amazing.  Blew me away.  If every song I've reviewed was as crisp and clear as these, I'd given a 10 star review.  WOW!

13.  Radio Head - Creep - not bad, not as loud and crisp as the Cold Play I just listen to but it's good.  Needs to be louder.

14.  Darude (Trance) - Finland - Old School Trance Energy - Sound is pretty good.  Just wish the highs were a little higher and crisper.  Overall I'd give this a 6/10. Tried different modes but Dynamic Mode sounds best.

15.  Bon Jovi - Livin' On a Prayer - Crisp good sound.  Greatest hits...  Sounds great, bass could be a little better but the highs are high and the dynamic range is pretty good.  Same thing for Wanted Dead or Alive.  Nice sound, you won't be disappointed.

16.  U2 - The Unforgettable Fire - Sounds kinda dull so I tried another U2 song from a much newer album... Achtung Baby - Love is Blindness.  Sounded much better but still, there's an awful lot of bass in this song and I think the highs and lows are getting lost.  Who's Gonna Ride Your Wild Horses Sounds better but still, the bass is a bit washed out.

17.  Sir Paul - Uncle Albert / Admiral Halsey - This sounded just fine.  Dynamic mode and Bass boost mode although dynamic was a bit more... dynamic (It expanded the highs a bit and got rid of the slight muffle).

18.  Metallica - Master of Puppets - So unsatisfying.  This is the remastered version on spotify.  Sounds great but this needs to be LOUD and it's not.  Same with, Enter Sandman.  Ride The Lightning - NOT LOUD ENOUGH.  WTF.  This needs to be much louder.  Even the live version was not loud enough, however, sounded pretty damn good.  "One" Live sounds pretty damn good.

That's all for now.  I reviewed a bunch of various genres in real time.  Here's the thing.  I find that the recording and bit rates are going to have a major factor with whether you can appreciate these or not.  Since I'm not an audiophile, I'd have to say that you'll experience similar disappointment with any headphone that's not geared for a specific type of music.

Overall, I'd have to say these are a 3.5 out of 5.  They need a little work.  I'm listening for a few hours now and I'm at 70%.  of a 95% charge.  That's not too shabby.

I had a phone call which wasn't a great experience.  The person on the other end asked if I was on a speaker phone.  I asked if I was coming in clear and they said, "Yes but it sounds like I'm on speaker".  The caller wasn't as clear as my 4yr old Plantronics earpiece either.

I'll come back in a few days and give another review.  This is my first day with them.
The sound quality for the buds are good but it could be better or, on my opinion, could use a little bit more bass. But overall they are still good headphones.

ReviewTitle: HORRIBLE... BRING BACK THE 2018 ICON X
ReviewBody: I had the 2018 Icons and I had to return them to Samsung.. Still awaiting my refund back from them. .2 months later.. These buds are not as good as the 2018 version

I wanted so bad to like these buds, but they are average at best, and have some problems. Two of the best features are the ability to wear either bud singularly, and be able to answer calls. (JLAB Air only allow calls from the right bud). And secondly, the fit. Between the 3 different size bud cushions, and the 2 different size fins, I was able to find a fit that was secure, and that I would have no problem wearing all day! Most other features are average, but about the same as other brand, cheaper buds (i.e. sound quality, battery life, quick pairing, charging case, etc.). The final straw for me was that the buds would lose connection when my phone was in my pocket, and I was outside walking. After researching, this is a common problem, and a complete deal breaker for me, because I use buds a lot when walking / working outdoors, and can not keep my phone in my hand! I have several different brand sub $60 ear buds, and not one of them has this problem! Because I have experienced less than stellar product support from Samsung with my Gear S3 Frontier watch battery life (a whole different problem with Samsung - Google it if interested), I didn't dare keep these beyond the return policy hoping for a fix! I caught myself accepting "average" performance from these buds because I wanted them to be good, but finally realized that if I was going to accept average performance, why do it for $149, when the JLAB Air buds are as good, and $100 cheaper!
Worth the price. Better than I expected!

It's hard to get them in and it takes some practice. Other than that, they're pretty good. The quality is better than AirPods but I feel like AirPods just go in way easier and you don't feel them as much. The Ambient sound feature is pretty good but it doesn't work that well. I'll give an update in a week.
Love my samsung accessories
Best in-ear buds or pods... superior sound quAlity, just love these whatever I m doing... would recommend over airpods everytime....
very bad mic. the caller can't hear....

I just got mine today, and I'm blown away by sound quality, and how they fit tightly in the ears without irritating it(and my ears are easily  irritated usually). I have two noise cancelling headphones from Bose, and the sound quality is very similar, although it is not noise cancelling, which I knew purchasing this.

ReviewTitle: Solid purchase for the Galaxy user.
ReviewBody:
Got these with my S10+ as a promotion. So far, these have exceeded my expectations.

Pros
- The pairing is flawless and as a person who understands technology, it is magical.
- Battery life has been great.
- The ability to use each individually is fantastic.
- The range: When I first got these, I popped them in and took the dog for a walk. It felt light every time my body got in the way they cutout. As of right now, I cannot replicate that. What I did do was lay my phone down in the farthest corner of my home and walk to the other side. Through 5 walls and many appliances, I was still able to pause and play music with no cut outs.
- Looks, these don't look like ear rings like the Air Pods.

Cons
- The sound quality is not bad but it is a little more treble focused than bass, even with the equalizer on. With there were custom EQ settings (this could be added later).
- The app is kind of hard to get too... Not that big of a deal
- No battery (good) battery indicator for the case (wish I had % left).
- Ambient noise works to a degree but still could use tweaks.

I carry these bad boys everywhere because it's so easy to just pop one in and listen to music or a podcast anywhere. They are hardly noticeable and have not fallen out of my ears yet. Pick these up if you have a Galaxy phone. These are sweet.

Let me start with; I was an Apple fan for over a decade. I've owned everything from iPods, to Apple Watches to the iPhone X. I still think they are great products. However, I switched to Samsung about 6 months ago. Why? Well, I don't want to paint myself into any corners and with the ease of trading in phones I figured I'd give Samsung a try in case I was missing anything.

Boy, was I missing things. IMO, Samsung is just far easier to set up. Samsung has more apps and abilities for me personally. Samsung is just overall better in nearly all facets of this game.

Now, on to these ear buds. In summary...I love them. They are as close to perfect as anything you'll ever buy under $200. (I paid $129). The fit is great. The sound quality is fantastic. I don't consider myself a sound snob, but these are clear and loud. I have seen some reviews complaining about the loudness, but I think these people didn't realize that you can adjust the loudness settings via the app. And how great is it that as soon as I opened up the case they found and paired with my Samsung Galaxy Note 9? How great was it that I was able to open my laptop and see that my ear buds were an option without having to do anything? I mow the lawn with these. I work out with these. I sit at my desk and listen to music while at work with these. If you're considering these or the Jabra's or Apple Earpods...just get the Samsung. You won't regret it.

Finally, a Samsung Tws that the ambient noise works 100% of the time.  The sound 🔉 is great!  The fit is great!  No issues at all,  a first because I currently own 5 sets off tws and this is 1st tine I have  been totally satisfied
Don't sound as great as my beatsx but good enough

I truelly Loved these things. They actually did what they said, I was driving to another state about 7h I had them in my ears and they did well. Unfortunately someone stole them from me so my $130 is gone.

ReviewTitle: Great buds for music, but poor call quality
ReviewBody:
- Excellent ear buds if I don't have to make any calls. As with many other users on Samsung forum, sound quality is good locally, but the other person on a call hears pops/static/garbage. (Users report this problem remains even after reset & exchange for new pair!)

As a user of AirPods, Nuheara IQBuds, and Sony WH-1000XM3s, I am now using these as my daily drivers with good sound on “Dynamic” mode in the Equalizer within the Galaxy Wearable app. Sound quality isn't as good as my WH-1000XM3s, but these are certainly more discreet and appropriate for one-bud driving and work.

- Initially upon pairing with my Note 9 and testing with my favorite testing song (you have one, right?) the volume was simply too low. I tried everything but couldn't get it to go to more than maybe 50% volume even though the system said they were maxed.
LOW VOLUME FIX: Had to go into Android “developer settings,” check “Disable Absolute Volume” and reboot… only then was the volume fixed. Pairing with iPad Pro 11 and iPhone X had no volume issues and good sound.

- Good overall balance between price and quality.  On the Dynamic setting, sound is similar to Apple airPods.  AirPods can sound artificially “processed,” which is not the case in the Galaxy Buds.

- Although these aren't actively noise blocking, the design blocks enough that people will have to shout for you to hear them.  For the sound blocking to be effective (and to have good bass) you must rotate the buds after you place the tip in your ear to put them in the correct position in the ear canal.  Rotate counter-clockwise for the optimal fit.

- We tested call quality and microphone quality by calling my teenage daughter's phone. She said my airPods sounded like I was talking through a bag, and Galaxy Buds sounded clear. Good enough!!

- We expected ambient sound control similar to Sony WH-1000 series or Nuheara IQBuds, but Galaxy Buds controls were primitive and less effective by comparison.  Ambient sounds coming in are mixed in but sound tinny… not a big issue for me, but the Sony WH-1000Mx3 win the prize here with ambient sounds mixed in that sound natural with “focus on voice” settings that actually work, unlike the same setting for these Galaxy Buds, which seemed to have very little effect.

- Ambient sound is only needed when both earbuds are in, so the option is greyed out if only one is in.  [NOW FIXED: There's a software issue with ambient sound where if you only use one bud after having both in, ambient sound controls cannot be turned back on even if you then place both in your ears.]

- Volume control can be configured with long-press on the left (volume down) and long-press on the right (volume up).  If you only use one bud at a time, this doesn’t work of course. Interestingly, volume appears to be independent of the Android's media volume setting (i.e., you could max media volume on your phone and then turn it up even louder with the earbuds)

- Battery life is good… can easily get full day alternating left/right, and battery percentage shown in Galaxy Wearable app is often visible.  You cannot see the case’s charge except in 1/3 increments.  When the case is unplugged, open the case and then close it again.  The front LED will show green, yellow, and red for rough charge left in the case.  Using both earbuds all day should theoretically be possible since there should be 2+ charges in the case, providing 18 hours of play (17 hours in my tests) before everything dies. Like the Nuheara IQBuds, you can't turn things “off” when charging in the case, so eventually things will likely run out even if you're not using them.  Definitely use a higher amp base charger to charge the case quickly.

- Size is easily as good as airPods for the case slipping into a pants pocket. However, the slick non-textured case surface means it could slip out of my pocket while seated or lying down.

- Can locate a lost bud though Galaxy Wearable app, but just as with iOS and airPods, you cannot locate the base (which you'll recall likes to fall out of pocket due to its slippery surface)

- The Galaxy Buds reads notifications?  Yay! Right? We expected functionality similar to free Android app “Out Loud” by hillman apps, which can read your text messages or Facebook messages or other notifications out loud. Sadly, the Galaxy Wearable provided only very basic functionality, only reading app name and no details.  (So instead of reading the full text message, it says only “Messenger.”) Not very useful.

- Overall… I've been waiting for someone to come along with something better than the Apple airPods, and I've always been disappointed that no one could beat the airPods -- until now. I'm now using these every day. Many of the issues above can be resolved with firmware/software updates, so I'm more than pleased with the capabilities and quality in this (early but related to consumer) state.

ReviewTitle: Great if you never have your phone in pocket.
ReviewBody: I liked everything about these except the constant choppy audio if my phone was in my pocket. Wireless is convenient and all, but if they can't stay connected what's the point? On a galaxy s8

ReviewTitle: Best Earbuds for Music! Not Good for Calls
ReviewBody:
I've tried a lot of earbuds and have returned all of them because they weren't comfortable. These earbuds are the only pair that fit nicely in my ears and don't hurt them. I love them! Sounds quality is good enough for me, I'm no music snob but it all sounds great. Sound cancellation is good, sometimes I don't even know someone is next to me until they tap me on the shoulder.

Took off 1 star for bad call quality for phone calls. Person on other end has hard time hearing me. I don't use it often for calls, but this is something I noticed. May be important to someone who uses this for phonecalls often.

For music, it is excellent, I use it with S10; been using samsung phone(s) for the past 15 years.
Less then 1 star for calls... 10 out of 10 folks told me that my voice is muffled.  This day and age, am stunned how Samsung missed the mark.
Family uses apple airpods and they love them for call quality (but has weak bass).

I am absolutely impressed with Samsung Galaxy Buds! For starters they are sound tuned by AKG and they are completely wireless with no attachments.  Excellent performance for all sorts of moderate exercise like jumping, sprinting, walking and even weight lifting. I cannot express how meaningful and detraction-free these earbuds truly are!  Secondly, I can easily charge my Galaxy earbuds with ease  and fast on the "spot" by just place the earbuds in charging case on place case on rear of my Samsung Galaxy S10+ device! One of the slight disadvantage of the earbud is it does not have active noise- cancellation, despite not be equipped it still does a pretty good job keeping most extra noise out. Lastly, the earbuds has all day battery life, where I could actually get through about a full week without charge.
I absolutely love these. They meet every expectation I had and more. I couldn't ask for better.

I was reading all these o star reviews and honestly I cannot understand tham.  Truth is sound quality is not the best as they do lack good deep bass but the sound overall is good! Noise cancelation is good if you fit them properly in your ear. For those complaining about the low volume it can be configured via the application. Pairing and configuration was relatively straight forward. The touch buttons will take a while to get used to them. The lack of actual buttons if a drawback. Phone calls are loud and clear on both sides of the line.  And I get no interruptions even walking far from my phone. The design is a plus and during workout they stay in place with no issues.
Really like these and by and large it is a good fit for the ear. Doesnt easily fall out like most

Original: I use them with my Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge, and the sound is perfect, but it has audio delay respecting videos and games, etc. So I can't use them for these activities.

Edit: Some weeks after I bought them, they started to work greatly with my Samsung s6 edge. Still, with other devices not-samsung they have delay of at least 1 sec.

i love the galaxy buds. It is convenient, small and long battery life. If you use only one it can take one to two days without charging it. It is comfortable when you wear it on your sleep. ReviewTitle: Love the sound & firm fit in ear.
ReviewBody: Like everything about these.

I am a huge Samsung fan and the moment I found out about these I started my research. Before purchasing these about a week ago, I owned the JLab Audio JBuds Air for almost a year. They didn't break or anything, but it was definitely time for something more in line with what I wanted.
I purchased these for $100 at T Mobile along with my Galaxy Note 10 (it was $30 off since I was buying the phone the same day)...I got them in back because I want to be discrete when I am wearing them, plus it matched my phone lol.
I love that they have wireless AND wired charing capabilities and that there is an app (the standard Galaxy Wear app) that allows you to change the settings like what happens when you press the touchpad and sound quality. What I also love about these that the JLab Audio JBuds Air didn't have is independent use of each bud!! I love that I can use the right without the left and vise versa. I also like the LED lights to represent battery life and the light beeps to indicate they are on and connected. I am so used to headphones having the verbal "Power On", "Earbuds joined" and "Bluetooth connected" spoken to you that the beeps almost made me think it wasn't working (LOL)...
Overall, I have only had them a week and notice a huge difference from my last true wireless headphones. I don't get ear fatigue if I have them in longer than a few hours, they aren't huge and bulky in-ear (they fit like a glove), I trust that when they are in; they're in, the battery life of the buds and the case is good (plus I can charge it with my phone if  I am in a bind!), they don't cut out with my phone in my pocket and they dont slip and slide when Im all sweaty!

Ok, I'll make this review short and sweet:

PROS: Great sound quality, very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time, the wireless charging case is pretty cool (just set it on one of those charging plates), pairs up VERY quickly with my iPhone, and obviously the fact that it's wireless. I can blow dry my hair and get ready in the morning listening to music without having to worry about wires.

CONS: The only con to me is that the volume could be a little bit louder. I was able to somewhat fix the issue by going to the EQ controls on Spotify and switching it to "Acoustic". The EQ controls of the iPhone itself don't help with anything, but on Spotify it did make it a little louder.

I love these earbuds, as an iPhone user I couldn't be happier (the airpods are freaking ugly with the weird stem coming out of it) -  I am EXTREMELY happy with my Galaxy Buds, definitely recommend them.

ReviewTitle: FINALLY!!! An affordable set of wireless buds!!!
ReviewBody: I had been waiting for a long time to find buds I didnt have to drop $300 on.  I grabbed these as soon as I could and so far I'm really happy with them.  Listening to metal or rap sounds nice, loud and clear.  As some others have said, I think the ambient sound feature can be improved a bit.  Highly recommend these!  Thanks samsung!  Using them on a Note 9.

The Samsung Buds are definitely a big upgrade from the Samsung Gear Icon X being as I now have both. The sound quality in my opinion is of clear quality, although I would like more volume. These buds fit much more comfortable than the last version as they are not near as bulky, they also come with different sizes of ear pieces. I'm still trying to figure out all of the new features besides being able to wirelessly charge and ambient mode is great though there are still connections issues because of the sensors. The battery life is definitely a big improvement, the charge lasts a good 8hrs plus after the battery is depleted from the buds you can put them back in their case for an additional charge without having to plug them in. Last but not least the bluetooth connectivity reaches a pretty good distance before disconnecting from device, It took me a bit of time to figure out how to pair my device because there was no installation guide since Samsung has chosen to go green. All in all the Samsung Buds are well worth the value for what you pay.

I wear mine while working out and they stay in nicely without wiggling their way out!
I had trouble initially getting them to sync with my Samsung phone, using the Galaxy Wearable app, but after a 20 minute chat conversation with Samsung Customer Service (where they first told me the problem was with my phone :/) we determined the earbuds needed to be tapped "on".  Once that was done, it was seamless!
So far so good, Samsung!

I could not get these to work.  I spent all afternoon on the phone with Samsung support and then another hour with Amazon. My earbuds were each registering with my bluetooth as different devices.  They were obviously different versions of firmware because when I connected the app with 1 of the earbuds, it said I needed to upgrade my software for the device. But it wouldn't let me unless both earbuds were connected.  The other one didn't require the upgrade. I made sure my S10 had all the current software. I uninstalled the app, removed the earbuds each one from my bluetooth, rebooted my phone so many times that I could do it in my sleep. I googled this issue and it seems this is a big problem.  Reddit also has a long discussion about this issue.  I liked the size and the look of these. But unfortunately they had to be returned. They were useless.

ReviewTitle: Brilliant design!  Amazing sound and easy to use/maintain in variety of activities/ conditions.
ReviewBody: Samsung hit a home run with these buds. Great snug yet comfortable fit and don't fall out after months of use in a variety of activities and exercise. Great noise cancelling for buds when mowing grass and on airplane. Not complete noise cancellation, but close when playing music. Exceptional crisp sound, best I have heard on any buds. Would be nice to have a little more bass, but better than any buds I have tried, probably need larger headset to get more bass. Love auto play music option when place in ears. Never need to turn on or off, automatically turns on when place in ear and off when place in case. Very innovative case, easy to open yet firmly closes to keep from accidentally opening. Wireless charging in small case minimizes burden of charging and gradual green/yellow/red light helps warn battery level to avoid surprise loss of battery power.  Samsung deserves some type of tech award, these buds are brilliantly designed and worth the price. Highly recommended!

Then I started getting software updates and dutifully updated the buds and that is when it went down hill.  First of all I lost connectivity to the left bud, got it back after I let it sit overnight and then during an important phone call, both buds lost connection.  I had to scramble for a pair of wired headphones and hope the person didn't notice I was completely off line.  That has been very disappointing.

I have hit their support site, but there isn't alot of help there.

Ok so I have a little experience with earbuds now, and here's the deal. I owned a pair of Jabra elite 65t's and so I'm kinda compairing. Samsung's sound is pretty good, I been listening for the last 5 hours at a somewhat elevated volume. The left one lasted longer at 25% right one 15%. The signal kinda got fuzzy once or twice but quickly corrected itself. I had to change the eartip and piece that fits into my ear to the larger one that made the sound much better. I don't like the touch pad on the earbuds as it makes it too easy to pause the music accidentally. Downloaded the app for earbuds from Google play that helps. Oh, and when you turn it up loud the treble seems just a bit too high the music is not even. It has good bass to me. But honestly Jabra elite are awesome the only issue was they just slightly too big for my ear and after awhile uncomfortable but the sound is amazing even without the eq. But still I feel like I'm settling with the galaxies. It's like driving a Camry after driving a Lexus ehh! It'll do.
