ReviewTitle: Wish they would fix the bugs
ReviewBody: Had these for 2 months and had them replaced 4 times due to the fact that the person I was talking to couldn't hear me over the sound distortion on their end then I finally returned them and got my money back

I got these Galaxy Buds to use with my iPhone, because Airpods unfortunately don't fit my ears.

I was quite impressed as I unwrapped the beautiful looking box. The design of the packaging, the charging case and the buds themselves is excellent. Pairing even with a non-Samsung phone is quick and easy, and putting the buds in is intuitive. I was pretty happy with my new purchase so far. They look and feel great.

However, once I started playing some music through them is when the disappointment hit. These buds (at least the specific ones I received) are completely unable to reproduce bass. Sounds in the highs and mids are decently represented, even higher bass notes sound pretty good, but once you get to the lowest frequencies, there's just nothing. I tried the various accessories to improve the fit but nothing improved the frequency response. Even the various cheap wired earbuds I have do way better reproducing the full spectrum of music. I don't know why some people are raving about the sound quality of these things. Did I get dud buds? Anyway, I will be returning them and hoping for a better sounding product with equally good design to come along some day.
Falls out and person on otherside can't hear clearly.

ReviewTitle: they work for a month, don't trust warranty
ReviewBody:
Wish i had just returned them to Amazon....

After a month the right earbud lost 80% volume. Look it up its an issue. I added the app, updated firmware, did everything on the forums and youtube to correct the right earbud. Let the wife have at it on her Iphone, my Pixel 3, everything thrown at them.

So instead of just returning them we went to Samsung, sent in for warranty instead of Amazon and now they have not sent any replacement for several weeks. I got one month of use. I sent them in to Samsung for warranty and now I guess i have to fight for the replacement set??? I have no earbuds working or not now.

 I would say its been a horrible experience with both the product and the manufacturer, don't buy Samsung Buds.

First, I had to go online for setup instructions as the documentation was all in another language (I'm assuming Uruguay as that is what the outside packaging reflects - even though U.S. is advertised here on Amazon).

ReviewTitle: Quality sound with lots of cool features
ReviewBody:
I thought this was just abother Bluetooth ear buds, until I started exploring. After I paired the buds to my galaxy s10, it opened up tons of features. There are several smart options, like single touch for play or pause, double touch, triple touch and press&hold. I am really loving it. Sound quality is amazing. And the range of these buds are pretty awesome. Bluetooth connection is very strong, I did not have any signal drops until now. I love that I can accept phone call with a tap, and hang up the call with another tap. Battery life is very good. And the addon battery on the case is pretty awesome.

Bottom line is Galaxy Buds are very comfortable, amazing sound, and tons of great features.

I would recommend the galaxy buds to friends and family.

Cons:

ReviewTitle: These can only get better with time, but I'm impressed
ReviewBody: I got these only after selling the free white ones I got when I bought my S10+. They are very comfortable in the ear and I was suprised by the sound quality. The battery life is great and they are very responsive. As soon as you open the case they connect to your phone. One thing I didn't like however was that the controls for things besides music are a bit confusing. It takes some time to get used to. I've hung up on people too many times when I meant to answer the call. Oh well. The noise cancellation is decent, I would imagine it being better if I switched to the larger buds. Finally, I don't like leaving the ambient sound on, as it's distracting when I'm listening to stuff but I like the feature where you can touch the buds and ambient sound temporarily activates. Unfortunately, this feature can only be activated at the expense of volume controls. If they can find a way to incorporate both of those controls at the same time I'll be very happy. Otherwise the price is way better than comparable true wireless earphones, and they seem to be much more compact and comfortable. I would definitely recommend these.

I have only used one of the buds for phone calls.  Works perfect and once you put the correct size ear piece on, it fits perfectly, and I have small ears and wear glasses. Still trying to learn how to use them, but they work for what I wanted them for right now.
I have a pair of ear buds that are bluetooth but have a wire that goes between them, these have replaced those.

I've been using my buds for 2 weeks now and very happy with them. They're an adjustment but I love the seamless bluetooth connection. I'm still getting use to them but love that they're small. The sound quality is great. I also enjoy the option for turning on ambient sound. Keeps me involved and distant at the same time. I am a Samsung junkie and these pods are a great addition!!

ReviewTitle: Good product, I think in the future, it will improve the latency in gaming.
ReviewBody:
First try I like it, only thing is there a 2 sec or so lateness in gaming not good. I had wire earphones since ever. The only thing im gonna use this is when im working or have to walk. I still recommend using wire for example on vacations, in the car or even when your lying down.

ReviewTitle: Solid entry price for wireless earbud!
ReviewBody:
Was really excited for the announcement of this product and after solid use for everyday use for 2 weeks I can come up with a decent conclusion for those on the edge to purchase. At 130$ it is definitely a good price comparable to say the AirPods at 160$. I have used this earbud on both apple and android devices (my Samsung S7) and the sound is noticeably different. It sounds slightly better on my S7 than my iPad. But regardless connecting to either device was simple and it works flawlessly. In terms of lag or latency there is no lag at all or if any it's very minimal. On my S7 both YouTube and Media apps such as Twitch, spotify, and streaming services work well and has no lag. For my iPad however, the YouTube has a significant audio delay when watching video. The lips do not sync with the audio and can be quite a bother. But that was the only issue I has with Apps, as for any other streaming media apps it worked fine and without latency.
For battery, I was really impressed. It truly lived up to the 6hr battery life. The buds worked independently and that means you can use one and keep the other in the case to extend uses. Both the L and R earbud can be used like this and makes it nice compared to some where only one is functional when the other is not in use. For connectivity, I always found that if I was using my s7 it would remember the device and pick back up when I open the case. It was different for my iPad, where I had to manually go to settings and select the buds to connect via bluetooth. Not a dealbreaker as it only took maybe 10s at most to connect but it may take 1 or 2 tries.
In terms of sound quality, it is average. Sound by AKG works well but it is nothing extraordinary. Bass is mediocre & a bit flat imo but the buds works well in all other areas. Also at times I can hear a slight hissing/white noise but I noticed if I didn't use the dynamic setting in the Galaxy wearable app (only for android) it went away. So I just listen to the buds without any enhancements as my ears are sensitive and rather not hear the white noise. For ambient sound it is a nice feature to have (once again I was only get it able to work via the app for android) but it's quite gimmicky. I found you can hear people talking but it tends to pick up on loud sharp noises. I use these in the gym and would often hear it pick up weights sliding/dropping/or equipment moving around and it picks these sound up and makes them very sharp and loud, like high pitch and often hurt my eyes. So I don't even use this feature in the gym and just prefer a touch to pause and remove a bud.
There are many pros and cons, but one particular con I had was with using these outdoor. I noticed that leaving my phone in my pocket and simply walking outside often made the buds stutter. It's not even slight but can hiccup pretty badly. Using it indoors however I don't have this problem and can keep my phone maybe a good 30ft without stuttering. Overall, a solid price earbud works well but sound is average. If you are looking for sound best to consider putting a few more bucks into higher entry earbuds. These are my opinion and coming from use based on ShureSE215 & SE31sound wise.

I bought these after reading the reviews and was looking forward to using them. These things cut out when my S9+ is in my pocket just 2 feet away. They are unusable. I updated the firmware, unpared, repared, deleted the app, reinstalled the app. Nothing works. These things are over priced hot garbage. I returned them. The $50 pair of Tozos I bought a couple months ago are better than these.

I'm so frustrated, I was so excited to finally get these, but now I'm extremely disappointed and am about to return them. ReviewTitle: They are great, but my ears are too small for the wing tips.
ReviewBody: I just got these Galaxy Buds yesterday. They're actually great! For the size and what they are, I think audio sounds good. They provide pretty good noise cancellation and the ambient sound feature works decently well. They connected quickly to my Galaxy S9+. Also connected to my Windows 10 laptop without much fuss. I do have a problem, though. I had to switch the ear tips out to the smallest ones, which fit me great - my issue lies with the wing tips. I have pretty small ears. The medium wing tips aaaaalmost fit, they keep the earbud super secure in my ear, except the wing tip tends to dig into that fold in my ear and makes them extremely sore after wearing for only 10-15 minutes. Think of how it feels to wear on-ear headphones for hours at a time - that's how my ears feel after 10-15 minutes. The Buds come with wing tips that are completely flat, but I find they don't stay in my ears nearly as well without some kind of wing. At one point, with the flat "wings," my Wearables app thought I only had one Bud in because they were slowly slipping out of my ear. I'm really bummed about this. I don't fault Samsung because it's a personal problem, I just have very small ears, but it makes me sad because I love these things otherwise. I haven't decided whether I'll return them or not, but I probably will.

ReviewTitle: Low Volume, frequent cut outs, poor microphone
ReviewBody: The pair of Samsung Galaxy Buds that I received are very disappointing.  They frequently cut out when playing music for no apparent reason. The volume is set very low at the factory and the only way to increase it is through the phone.  I do not like to max out the volume on the phone, but have no other choice except to do that when listening in a noisy environment such as on the street.  They do not cancel out noise very well. I have tried different ear bud tips and none seem to seal well enough to block out the noise. The microphone is not very good either. The person on the other end of the call thought I had my hand over the microphone. They could hear me, but barely.  I called Samsung and explained what I was experiencing and they said I got a defective pair and that I should call Amazon and ask for a replacement pair sent out.  That pair is on the way.  I hope all of the issues mentioned above will be resolved with the new pair.  We shall see.  I will update this review once I get the new pair and try them for a spell.  If things do not change, they will go back to Amazon for a refund.  I will go back to my $50 pair that sound better, do not cut out as frequently, and make better calls.  The only drawback to them over the Samsung is the battery life is shorter, about half as long. 5/24 Update:  The replacement pair had fewer problems. but still cut out when playing music, so they were returned and I get a refund.  I will go back to my $50 Ikanzis and I have ordered another pair so I can have longer listening time. When one pair needs to be charged, I will simply use the other pair.  Even though I bought two pair, their total cost is less than one pair of Samsungs.

Buyer beware.  I bought these buds from amazon in May 2019. They’re supposed to be the US version.  I started having problems with the right Bud after the 30 return period.  I contacted amazon who put me in touch with Samsung USA.  When I read of the serial number, they told me it was the international version and their warranty didn’t apply.  I bought and paid for the US version and got an international version.  No Samsung USA one year warranty against defects.  Im trying to get Samsung international to replace or fix them.  I’m NEVER buying electronics from Amazon.  I’ve spent over an hour on the phone with multiple people  trying to get help.  It’s worth going to bestbuy, target etc to buy electronics

Ambient noise, doesn’t. Though, when walking with them, you do listen and feel the steps, and it takes time to adjust. Same goes with the buds overall. But again, I would recommend because of the quality and price match.

ReviewTitle: Great sound, but poor microphone - cannot use for calls
ReviewBody:
The Galaxy Buds offer a very easy pairing experience, even for non-Samsung phones. I had to install an app on my Pixel 3 XL, which then prompted me to install another plugin (could be better). Still, this took overall just about a minute.

The audio quality is great, although turning off ambient noise made it considerably worse. I don't know why that is, but leaving ambient noise on and setting its volume to zero left me with great sound.

The reason why I'm giving the Buds 2 stars, and why I'll ultimately return them, is the quality of the microphone. I simply cannot use them for calls, either on my Pixel 3 XL (regular phone call or Skype) or on my Surface Book (and Skype). While I have no problem hearing the other person, they can barely hear me. This is not an issue with the signal quality, as I don't have the problem with AirPods or via USB-C headphones with microphone.

I don't have huge demands on the microphones: it's obvious that one shouldn't use them to record a podcast. But having a conversation on a call is not a cutting edge feature and I'm completely perplexed why the microphone is so poor that this is not feasible. I initially thought I might just have a defect pair of Buds, but googling the issue specifically returned a number of reviews raising the same issue.

It's really a shame: they are otherwise well worth the money. But making calls isn't exactly a fringe use of headphones like these...

ReviewTitle: Best In-Ear Headphones I've Ever Owned
ReviewBody:
I'm a bit of an audiophile. Bought many different types of headphones, headsets, in-ear, over-ear, bluetooth, etc. I've always struggled to find something that would stay in my ears while I worked out. I had never had headphones that could accomplish this, at some point the sweat and motion would gradually make the headphone in my ear loose.

I bought these with the intention of returning them if they fell out while I ran. They did not. I was also surprised by the quality of the sound -- sometimes they do go in and out depending on phone distance and whether something's blocking it.

The call quality is also good -- my wife had immediate surprise when I talked to her on the phone with them as it seemed extremely clear on the other side.

I'd highly recommend buying these.

I was hesitant at first of purchasing the Samsung Galaxy Buds because of all the hype, but then I seen all the positive reviews and decided to get them. I AM TRUELY ENJOYING these earbuds and how they sound at work in noisy environments. The clarity in the vocals and the pretty punchy base definitely delivers your money's worth and I cannot say this enough times "BETTER THAN THE GEAR ICONX'S"!!!!

ReviewTitle: What I like about Earbuds and needed improvements!
ReviewBody: Try all the Eartips for the best sound and seal (Beside seal, Earbuds block most Passive Noise at medium to high volume). These earbuds seal in your ear very well. Try all the Wingtips for a secure fit. After 1st trying the Earbuds, sound so in my ears was overwhelming, after fitting the Eartips and using them for a couple of days, felt a ton better. I like how it says msgs for msgs and whose calling. I want to see these improvements. A Multi-Function Button (To answer/hang up calls, access Alexa, Google, or Siri etc.), 12hrs. Earbuds battery life w/ 4 recharges in case.

ReviewTitle: Great Sound and Met All My Expectations
ReviewBody: The Samsung Buds were everything I expected.  I needed to learn though which ear buds were the right fit (three sizes included) for my ears.  Once I found the right fit, I had deep bass and great mid level sound. Initial pairing though is a little clumsy since the setup instructions don't give a clear step by step. Once paired though, they quickly connect to my Samsung Galaxy phone. I've also been able to pair them with my Windows laptops.

ReviewTitle: Great overall, but not great for phone calls.
ReviewBody:
The sound quality on these is quite good! The battery life is phenomenal, and they often last me nearly the entire duration of my 8 hour work shift. They're also very convenient to charge in the case, and they charge quickly, so you can get right back to listening. They fit comfortably (the wings took a few days to get used to. They used to hurt my ears a little bit, but now that I've grown accustomed, I don't notice it at all), and I've never worried that they'll fall out when I have the wings on.

My one complaint. Phone calls. When talking with people, I've had lots of complaints about me sounding pretty quiet and the background noise being really loud. If you're outside while on the phone, the mic picks up even the slightest breeze. It can make it pretty dofficult to communicate. It's not so bad if you're in a room without any background noise, but if you're in public or outside at all, it becomes a problem.

Other than that, they've been really great!

ReviewTitle: No giant things hanging out of my ears.
ReviewBody: Excited to be able to get rid of these weird air pods.

Yes, I did own Airpods. For a while. Before I sold it back. Wasn't worth it. The sound on the Airpods were good, but the bass wasn't deep enough for me, and plus I could hear what was going on outside. Not good for commute. These things are awesome. And the bass is deep too and the sound is clear. Perfect for heavy metal! The battery life is awesome, the touchpad is the thing I need to get used to but so far. These Buds are perfect. Sound perfect. Looks perfect, and goes perfect with my phone and style of music too. Go for these. And it wirelessly charges too? Bonus. ReviewTitle: They are ok but sometimes crackle/lose connection with can kill the mood
ReviewBody: This earbuds are nice, but they lose connection/crackle offen when I am outside and sometimes inside not sure what causing it but with if it has Bluetooth 5 like it says then this shouldn't happen..I have a Samsung Galaxy S9+ so I don't think it my phone... These earbuds work fine when listening indoors at a gym or something but whenever I try to work out outside the connection instantly becomes choppy to the point that I can't actually listen to anything.  These earbuds are highly susceptible to interference from radio waves or whatever else is broadcasting strong signals outdoors.  I would only recommend these earbuds if you plan on using them exclusively indoors and not while trying to exercise outdoors.

ReviewTitle: An excellent, well-rounded pair of earbuds
ReviewBody:
Just to get some stuff out of the way, I'm using these with my Galaxy S8+, and I typically only use headphones for like an hour at a time, so I cant speak to the long term use battery life.

I have tried many bluetooth earbuds, both wired and true wireless, and these take the cake. I guess what surprised me the most is that these earbuds are unsurprising? They do everything they say they will do, and they do it fairly well.

Sound quality: Good, completely satisfactory, but not amazing. Which is fine considering their size and weight. Pretty flat frequency response, but the bass can be nice and punchy if you get it fitted right.

Battery life: Excellent, never had a problem or even come close to draining the battery. But like I said, my longest typical use is a 1 hour workout. Wireless charging is excellent, but not insanely snappy. Perfect for tossing your earbuds on your desk when you go to bed and picking them up in the morning.

Fit: Amazing. Never even comes close to coming out, better than any other headphones I've ever used, wired or not! Very comfortable and light, never caused me any problems, even during heavy running.

My personal favorite category, VIDEO PLAYBACK. I have hated every true wireless earbud I've tried because of awful latency between the video playback and the audio. These earbuds have practically no noticeable latency! It's awesome. However, I have been told that non-Samsung devices tend to have mixed results with this.

Durability: So far, so good! I have sweated thoroughly with these on, and dropped them a good couple times (the case too) and they seem to be fine. If you drop them, there is a 90% chance that the lid will open and the earbuds will fly out, but this doesn't seem to cause too much damage.

And the rub, software: Not great. Yet. It works, but I have encountered an irritating issue. Like many earbuds, these have a volume level separate from your phone's volume. This can only be easily changed if you set the touchpads on each earbud to adjust their volume. Which means you cant use the touchpads for other things like the ambient sound mode or to summon your voice assistant. Software could definitely be better.

If you have any sound quality issues, my suggestion is to play around with the phone and headset volumes. I personally crank up the earbuds all the way, then adjust listening volume with the phone.

All in all, these have satisfied a very picky person who hated all the other true wireless earbuds he tried.

ReviewTitle: Samsung Galaxy Buds - the good and the bad
ReviewBody: Over the years, I've purchased more Bluetooth headphones than I want to count. With the Samsung Galaxy Buds, I can finally listen to music with zero wind noise when I'm outside. My music sounds incredible, and the app has plenty of options for adjusting the sound. They fit securely in my ears, regardless of how active I am. Noise cancellation is fantastic. Wireless charging is so convenient. HOWEVER, I have a Samsung Galaxy S10 phone, and the Samsung Galaxy Buds are useless for voice calls. I can hear fine, but every person I've been on a call with has said my voice is garbled - regardless of whether I'm in a quiet room or in my car. Suggested troubleshooting tips have not corrected the problem. And for the price, that's a huge disappointment.
Love these long battery life!! Very easy pairing(set up)!

I've had these now for about a week.  Here's the pros and cons.
 - Great fit.  They fit nice and snug and don't feel at all like they want to come loose.  I've had many other nice (wired) earbuds, and some that come with different ear hole cups.  None have been large enough to fit snug.  The large size cups and rings on the Galaxy buds fit perfect.
- Sound quality is good.  Not great, but good.
- The charging case is nice and works well.
- Battery life seems good.
- Bluetooth performance is poor, and I'm talking about range, not sound.  I have an S9, and this phone works great with my gear wearable and my car stereo via bluetooth.  I normally have my phone in my back pocket, and the buds do not work well at all with it there.  In my front pocket its better, but if I turn my torso at all in either direction, the sound cuts out and gets choppy right away.  These two factors alone are enough for me to wish I hadn't spent the money on these.  I should have waited another year for version 2.  The phone simply needs to be too close to the buds for them to work well.

These things are superb. They sound nice, and they are simply fun to have.
- Very secure in your ear - they do not fall out.  Ever.  They are also very comfortable, even to sleep in.
- Super easy to pair Bluetooth.  Seamless.
- Each earbud is independent - you can use either L or R by themselves if you wish, and you can switch on-the-go.  No hassle.
- No stupid LEDs blinking all over the place
- Very pleasant audio cues - no talking like other annoying earbuds I own
- Neat features, like they automatically pause when you take them out of your ear.  Just tap to re-start.
- After two months of heavy use, I have never had a battery use all of its charge during use.
- The charging case is nice and simple.

ReviewTitle: I heard that someone lost a white one in the snow. Oopsie.
ReviewBody: I love how comfortable these are and I have small ear canals. They charge easily in their case at least a couple of times. I can use only one of I want to and leave the other in the case. They pair easily and automatically.
Great sound, phone calls not the greatest if outside.

ReviewTitle: Comfort and fit are the best out of all True Wireless earbuds.
ReviewBody: So before we continue know that I am comparing these to (Bose, Jabra, Raycons, and Tranya T3. So comfort and fit a solid 10! These fit and feel perfect! I can watch movies for hours and experience no ear fatigue. The Bose fit nice and are comfortable but unfortunately look ridiculous on your ears. I still think airpods look worse however the Bose are comfortable. Next Jabra's are nice however I did experience ear fatigue even with the smallest earpiece. Raycons looked and felt great however I could not get them to connect so they suck! Next the tranya T3 are a solid 9 on comfort and style. Now sound here the buds get a 8 from me. Bose are a 10, Jabra's get a 9 and Tranya T3 are at a 7 because the Bass is amazing! However the sound as not as clear at Samsungs buds. Battery life is also a plus. Today as I write this review I lost my left earbud for about 10 minutes! I had no idea where it was however with the find my buds app I was able to find it on the floor near my chair! I was so happy I was able to find it before leaving work. I hope this review helps. Remember these sound great and are the smallest and most comfortable earbuds currently on the market.
The environmental sounds get into my calls. I love them for listening to anything, but microphone is bad at canceling ambient noise.
Very good ear wireless ear bud to use with my Samsung S7!  Works very good with good sound wireless phone calls or listening to music.

If you have a great need for these, I'm sorry because you will be getting sucked into the newest timed release fad - Next year they will have 8 hour of battery, the following year 10 hours, then 12 hours, then 14 hours, then 16... Phone disk space all over again. The sound is meh. The highs are VERY bright while the medium & bass are almost non-existent.

Pros:
Touch is cool
Wireless charging is awesome and works with my Note 10's powershare

Cons:
Price - Is very expensive (expect massive price drops in the coming years as technology becomes mainstream)
Battery life - Will be on timed releases for the next decade
Sound - Very Bright (equalizer does nothing) i.e. no bass
Not compatible with aftermarket foam tips as they won't fit in the case if you add them

If you absolutely need to have these great! But be aware you will be tempted to upgrade every year as they time release the battery life. Also the sound is VERY VERY lacking. I returned and got a cheaper alternative that sounds better and was $80 cheaper.

If you are looking for an alternative consider getting TOZO T10 Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Earbuds
As expected
Great earbuds

ReviewTitle: The buds are cool but they started to buzz a little

ReviewBody:
Sound: Average, like a pair of wired AKG headphones that come with the older Galaxy phones. Better than my wired earpods.

Fit: Decent, At first my ears somewhat hurt at the end of the day. However that went away pretty quickly and I was wearing them for a very long time. They fit well enough to run around and not have to worry about them coming out, there are also different sizes included in the package.

Controls: Good, these can be updated by Samsung so they can get better if needed. However currently (June 16 2019) they are pretty good. Different amounts of taps do different things, holding down can do whatever you select off of the Galaxy Buds app such as ambient sound.

Battery life: Amazing, I doubt you will hear the low battery tone very often. I still can't remember what it sounds like. The case holds around 1.5 charges extra.

ReviewTitle: The best choice that I made!!!

I've had Sony, I've had Bose, I've had Jabra, these Samsung Galaxy Buds are the best truly wireless earbuds on the market right now. ReviewTitle: Refurbished! Would have been nice to know!

Just received these today to find out that they are refurbished. Not bothersome by itself.  However, nowhere on the seller's product page did it mention that these are refurbished. Fits great, long battery life. Excellent sound quality. Best value for the price imo

ReviewTitle: Long battery life and excellent sound
ReviewBody:
Having several pairs of headphones and earbuds, these Samsung Galaxy buds are a welcome change. I've always had an issue with earbuds being able to stay in my ears, and these do very nicely, even providing several different size tips to swap out.

On sound quality, these have perhaps have one of the best that I've heard, even provided with an equalizer via the app. I like that I can change the touch pad via the app to use as a volume control. If there was one drawback, it's that the touch pad is not customizable enough.

The size is just right in that they are small enough to not be too noticeable  and to stay in comfortably. I use these at work while programming and I've used these while mowing the lawn. They keep the sounds out with the excellent noise cancellation.

I've listened to these for an entire 8 hour work day, stuck them in the charging case and then was able to get an additional time out of them when I got home.  Long battery life is another excellent feature of these. They also pair well with just about any device with Bluetooth. I've paired them to two different PCs and my Android phone.

If you are looking for an excellent, affordable pair of truly wireless earbuds, I highly recommend these.

I received these Galaxy Buds as part of a review program not affiliated with Amazon.com

So, i should say that Im a bargin shopper. Prior to the galaxy buds, I've bought 3 other wireless headphones, jlabs ($55), and 2 other chinese brands ($35 and $45). I like tech and am a semi audiophile, but not gonna spend money i dont have, just to own it. I happened to get these galaxy buds as a promotion for s10 phone, otherwise I'd probably would have waited. Anyways, super excited about recieving the most expensive headphones I'd ever own. Finally got them a few days ago, and I gotta say, kinda underwhelmed.

I like the fit, the weight, and design, they seem to fit very snug for workouts and running. They case is sleek, charges the battery, all the good stuff you'd expect from a $100 plus headphones. My problem with the buds is the sound quality... I mean, it's not bad, but its got great either. I expect good, but these are... ok.
Beside that the ambient noise feature seems tinny, not sure how its supposed to sound, but the noise is so distorted I usually got to take them out to clearly hear anything. Still i guess you can hear cars honk at you or other loud noises, but it's not a feature i see myself using very much.

Other than that not too much connection issues, easy to pair, pretty to look at, super awesome when they come for free. If I were to pay for them, I'd say about $75 to $90, higher than usual only because of the samsung namebrand. Lotta flash, some substance.

If you're looking for decent wireless earbuds the $55 jlabs actually sound great, they come with earbud fins that make all the difference, the sound is lush (for $55), hardly any connection issues. (Drops for a sec every once and a while, depending on movement or ambient interference

ReviewTitle: Does NOT Stay in Ear, Uncomfortable
ReviewBody:
The sound quality on these is okay but not as good as I'd expect for expensive earbuds. The noise cancellation is weak. I'm not a sound snob though, so I probably would have kept these buds had they been more comfortable.

I have small ears, and they were simply too big. After a while, my ears would ache from the pressure on the upper section of my ear (where the soft piece sits). I tried both the hook and non-hook style, and both hurt.

The final kicker was the first time I used these I took my dog for a walk. Mind you, it was not a run, so no real bouncing. At one point, I jogged to cross a street, and my left bud fell out. I noticed within a block, retraced my steps, and found it, but that should never happen. I can't afford to lose a $160 pair of buds. These are supposed to stay put, and they didn't in my ears. I can't even imagine running with them.

I sent them back. These were not a win for me.

ReviewTitle: Make sure you use correct buds and wings
ReviewBody: Noise cancellation and ambient sound both work well. Battery life is good as long as you have the charging case.

ReviewTitle: I bought those for my wife and she feel
ReviewBody: Very good!!!

I'm an iPhone user, and I will most likely purchase the Beats Powerbeats Pro's next month. But I wanted to give the Galaxy Buds a shot because they cost half as much at retail and feature two other features that the Pro's do not. (Small charging case and wireless charging.)

I should say from the start that I have been using the Beats Powerbeats3's for 15 months now so I'm not going to really accept anything that doesn't sound as good if not better than those headphones. Sadly, the Galaxy Buds to my ears cannot compete with Powerbeats3's, however I do enjoy their sound greater than the AirPods which I briefly owned.

Pros

* Sound better than AirPods to my ears.
* Tiny charging case is easy to carry in your front pocket.
* 3 different silicone tips and wings means you will find the right fit and feature excellent noise isolation.
* Wireless charging. (This is awesome!!!)
* USB-C (Better than MicroUSB)
* Easy to update the software without Galaxy Wearable App. (Need to have a PC though.)
* Very small profile and don't stick out of your ears. Very comfortable!
* Excellent consistent bluetooth connection.
* Excellent touch controls. (Make sure you update the software before using the first time.)

Cons

* No iOS Galaxy Wearable App means you lose out on A LOT. (Ambient mode, EQ settings, Find My Buds, and most importantly, the ability to change touch controls to 'volume with a long press'. (Why didn't Samsung just make this the default action instead of a personal assistant???)
* Sound quality is very good but not great IMO. Certainly not on the level of my Powerbeats3's. Did my best to play with different EQ's in the iOS Music app but nothing could hide the weaknesses. Probably just fine for the price and truly wireless at this point but don't expect amazing IMO.

If you are debating between this and the AirPods, I would seriously consider the Galaxy Buds, even if you have an iPhone. Now I can't say if the mics will be just as good as the AirPods for phone calls. But that aside, I'm confident the sound and fit of the Galaxy Buds are superior to AirPods. They weren't good enough for me but I think they are an excellent choice for many others. And compared to the new AirPods with the wireless charging case, they are $70 less at retail.
Amazing stuff!

One of the buds will not connect, their forums are littered with people asking about how to fix this. Samsung will not warranty. I'd recommend getting a cheaper pair of true-wireless earbuds until samsung can step their game up...
Been looking for the earbuds everywhere finally found them on Amazon i love them
Los mejores audífonos que he tenido.

ReviewTitle: Great choice, especially for galaxy owners
ReviewBody: I purchased these and the jlab air buds. After a few hours of comparisons and a full workout in each, I am sticking with the galaxy buds. The sound quality is better, more clarity and depth, but a little less bass. The ambient noise feature is unique, but nice and I'll have to play around with it. These were much more comfortable for longer wear than the jlabs. Both stayed in place well, but these do not stick out as much. That made them feel more secure and I touched them less. The touch pad is intuitive, but sensitive. I stopped my music a few times on accident. I pair these with a galaxy s8, and the galaxy wear app provides additional controls and EQ settings that are nice. Glad I spent a little extra to try them. However, the jlab air buds are a quality product, especially if you don't own a Samsung phone. Attached photos show relative size difference between the galaxy buds and jlab air buds. Galaxy has smaller bud and smaller case and wireless charging.

I have always struggled with ear buds fitting securely and comfortably. These fit exceptionally well right out of the box. They do not take a lot of finagling or cramming into the ear canal. I simply popped them in, gave them a slight twist and they are secured. I have had numerous very sweaty and intense workouts and they don't fall out. From time to time, they may get a little loose, but I simply readjust and they stay put for hours again. I am extremely impressed by the comfort of these as well. They only con is that they aren't very good at noise cancellation. Otherwise, these were a great investment and I would definitely recommend. Also, voice quality during telephone calls I am told is decent. It's better when I am in the house though versus driving in the car and have all the additional background noise I am told.

I have to be careful how I move about because they are just not secure. I am hesitant in using them when working out for fear of losing one. I'm a runner (female, fairly small), and after being totally fed up with headphones that just do not stay in (wired or otherwise), I was on a mission to find some headphones that would stay in my ears.  I tried some Yurbuds, and they stayed in ok but still needed occasional adjustments...and wires annoy me.  I have Jaybird X4's which I absolutely love - they sound amazing AND stay in...but they block out so much ambient sound that they feel unsafe to use, which helped me decide that I needed something truly wireless so I could use it in only one ear and still hear traffic approaching when I run.  So I tried some $50 airpod-ish knockoffs, which worked but fell out of my ears constantly.  Then I tried some Plantronics Backbeat Fit 3100s, and they worked great for talking on the phone, and they stayed in my ears, but music sounded terrible - like I was listening to it through a few paper towels (and I'm not that picky!)...I had to return them.  So then I tried these Samsung Buds, and I am impressed.  I just took them for a long run, and after an hour of a fairly intense workout, I did not need to adjust them a single time.  They do not budge, and they sound great!

ReviewTitle: Very good headphones, not for everyone
ReviewBody: I was really looking forward to these headphones when I purchased them, I really like what Samsung has done with these and Amazon offered the best shipping times on what seemed like was always selling out. They were extremely great, when they would fit in my ear. This is most likely a personal problem with my own ear other than anything else but they would not stay in my left ear no matter what wing tip or size I tried! I always had a problem with in ear buds but with this it was so much more apparent. I would definitely recommend to others but in the end I returned them due to this issue.
The Sound to listen to music is too low,  but great sound for calls

I've been using bluetooth ear buds for over 5 years. I have shelled out collectively close to $1,000 and tried all the major brands. While my overall experience has been pretty positive, my individual experience with each has been a combination of highs and lows. That is until I tried the Samsung Galaxy Buds. On paper, the features for these things looked pretty amazing - 6 hour playtime with an additional 7 hours stored in the case, wireless charging, automatic pairing when the case is opened, touch controls, I mean, what's not to like? Then I actually put them in my ears and started my workout. This was going to be the real test. When using earbuds, the single most important feature is the fit, because if the bud doesn't conform to your ear properly and create a tight seal, the sound will be washed and the base nonexistent. The way the buds came out of the package did not form that seal for me, but the additional tips and ear stabilizers gave me more options. After switching out the stock setup, I was pleased to find that I was able to achieve that seal, and let me tell you, the sound is impressive. I'm fairly certain the base was the best I've experienced of any buds I've owned. As far as my workout went, the Galaxy Buds didn't move a millimeter. Not when I was rowing, not when I was deadlifting, and not when I was slamming battle ropes. I can't honestly say I've successfully put any other bud through my workout routine without getting at least some movement, which ultimately broke the seal and ruined the sound. I think the Galaxy Buds passed this test for two reasons. First, the stabilizers keep the outer part of the bud firmly in place, and don't allow any space for them to move. Second, the bud itself is almost flush with the ear, so there isn't much projecting outward to create the leverage needed for wobble. Another awesome feature is the ambient sound option. When ambient sound is turned on, you can actually hear the outside world in addition to your music. It's actually quite mind boggling when you use it. I'm assuming it uses the mic that picks up your voice during phone calls to receive external sound and pipe it through the buds with your music. I'm so happy with the performance of the Samsung Galaxy Buds that I keep an additional pair charged in my car to wear when I work.

ReviewTitle: Don't update these to the latest firmware
ReviewBody: I had an original pair of galaxy buds that I used for a couple weeks then I updated them and they were a lot louder out of one of the ears. Then I got them replaced through amazon and used those for about a week until I decided to update them and see if they would work after updating, thinking that it was only a problem with the other pair. After the update I tested them and they did the same thing that the first pair did. Bottom line is that these are good earbuds, but something with the update makes these $130 earbuds turn into something that has the same problems as $1 earbuds. I only gave these a two star rating because they were decent when they worked good and because of amazon's exceptional return policy.

I have been using the Samsung Galaxy Buds for a month now and overall I am very satisfied with what Samsung delivered! When I received my Buds, they were completely dead and I was kind of bummed out I could not pop them in immediately. I don't know if they all come like this, but it was not really a big deal as they were charged up and ready to go in about 20-30 minutes! After charging them I put them in and was immediately blown away by the fit, sound and overall ease of use. Before receiving my Buds I was concerned about the fit, but these things stay in like no other earbud I have ever used and I assume that with the interchangeable fins and tips the fit will be perfect for everyone! My initial reaction to the sound was ok I guess, but after using them for a month with different genres of music I am a very happy customer! The highs are crisp and the lows are low, I changed the EQ a few times but found that dynamic sound mode to be the best overall for all types of music. The Buds are great for work, play, sport or any situation, I use them when I mountain bike, while mowing, at work and in the car! The only negative which really is not bad, is the ambient sound mode. While it works as advertised, if you have your music turned up you will still have to pause your music to conversate. However even at the loudest music volume you can hear things around you which is the point I suppose. Overall I am super happy with the Galaxy buds and their performance in all the situations I have used them, I would and have told many people they need some buds in their life immediately!

ReviewTitle: Okay, but nowhere near worth the money
ReviewBody:
I got my Galaxy Buds for free when I preordered my S10 (and that promotion played a big part in me preordering).

I really really want to like them, but at the end of the day the only pros are: great battery life, and they're truly wireless.

You can read in other reviews about a lot of their shortcomings, mostly all that are just nitpicky, but these really do have some MAJOR flaws:
-When walking around outside the connection quality is terrible most of the time. It breaks up and the buds get out of sync every step or two.
-Call quality is so bad that people always ask me to stop using them so they can hear me
-The most recent software update essentially destroyed my pair. They don't connect correctly anymore, and they have to send me a replacement (Samsungs customer service has been terrible. Best case scenario the replacement will arrive in 3 weeks). I've read online about a lot of people having the same issue and having to get replacements.

If they were $40 I'd say these are worth it to get over the problems, but $130+ is outrageous.

ReviewTitle: Perfect Wireless Earbuds... for MY needs
ReviewBody:
After a 4 month journey of trying to find the perfect wireless earbuds, I'm pleased to say the Galaxy Buds are perfect for my day to day needs.

Pros
 - very discreet earbuds. I like how they don't stick out of your ears like the Air Pods for example.

- If you have a Samsung phone, there is an App where you can adjust the sound profile. Though I personally didn't hear a huge difference, you can also adjust the ambient noise where it allows you to hear the environment around you. This was a huge plus for me, and it works very well.

- the travel case is small, and discreet as well. Doesn't leave a big buldge in your pocket or anything. I never found myself running out of battery on my earbuds on any day. I can wear my earbuds up to 3 hours at a time at %30-50 volume.

- sound quality is above average. at this price point, I didn't have Godly like expectations where I would be getting Sennheiser True Wireless like sound stage. Those earbuds cost more than double, so let's be realistic here people.

-you CAN wear one earbud at a time if you would like, regardless if it's the left or right earbud. Doesn't matter. I didn't realize how much this mattered to me until I used it for a longer period of time. In comparison, the Jabra Elite can only wear one earbud if it's the RIGHT earbud. The left cannot play music alone. That was a huge deal breaker for me, as for you.. you can decide if that matters. When you take out the earbud when wearing both, music does not pause on the other one you're wearing it and vice versa. When you're just wearing one earbud and decide to put in the second one, music continues playing and it's a smooth transition.

- can be charged wirelessly, on a s10/s10+. I didn't use this feature much, but it's cool knowing they it's there. It charges much slower on your phone vs a direct wired connection

Cons:

- this is not a deal breaker for me, but it may be for you. It's not water resistant. I think it can only take an x amount of sweat, but you don't wanna get these drenched in water. These are not advertised as workout headphones so I'm personally completely fine with it. I have a separate earbuds for that scenario.

-though the case is small, everytime I dropped it my earbuds always fly out of the case. I wish it didn't open that easily with drops. So don't drop your earbuds in the case

- to my surprise, I haven't used it much for phone calls. But from what I heard from other YouTube reviewers, they say call quality is terrible in noisy environments. Callers have a hard time hearing you, so try to be in a quiet environment if possible.

- the earbuds have gestures to pause/skip tracks, answer and ignore calls. I used mine primarily for music. one thing I noticed, which might POSSIBLY be a user error on my end.. but every now and then the Buds don't register my touches. Example. When I double tap to skip track, sometimes it registers only 1 tap and the song pauses. Minor annoyance, but something to be aware of. I think you have to hit the earbuds perfectly rather than just the edge of your finger. another thing I noticed is if you're listening to music and you skip a few tracks on your music Playlist, each time you hit double tap I feel like the earbuds are getting pushed deeper and deeper into my ear canal, and it's discomforting. I wish in the future maybe they do a swipe feature as a gesture to skip and go back to a track rather than the double/triple tap.

Everything else is worse. But most importantly... hot damn is the connection terrible. You'd think that upgrade bluetooth version, it'd have better connectivity but NOPE. I can't be like 2 meters away from the bluetooth source or the music starts getting all choppy. In the case of my PS Vita, I can't even go half a meter away! Where my IconX worked PERFECTLY fine.

I regret buying these. I really do. Please don't buy these. Save yourself the trouble.

ReviewTitle: Microphone has really bad quality half of the time
ReviewBody:
The buds are very comfy, and they have good sound quality. However I'm experiencing one major issue with them, and after looking online it looks as if many people are experiencing the same issue - sometimes the microphone is very bad. People tell me that they can't hear me, and it only works well when I'm indoor and it's very quiet.

Another issue that happens mostly in Whatsapp Calls and Voice Conference apps (Zoom, WebEx etc) is that the earpieces are not in sync, so you hear 'double', and I haven't seem to be able to work around this issue so far with any device I've used. For some reason when playing music this does not happen.

Other than that (which is a big deal unless you really don't need the microphone) they're great.

ReviewTitle: Works pretty good. but the volume is on the low side.
ReviewBody:
I had the first gen Samsung buds that came out years ago compare to that this current gen is light years better. I also had the Sony WI-1000X, which was my daily driver for over a year now; so the pro and con is more of comparison with the Sony than with anything else.

Pros:
Price
Battery
Size
Light weight
Big name Brand
Good battery connection with the case.

Cons:
The buds randomly lose sync even with the latest firmware.
The buds will lose connection when covered up. (wanted to listen to music with a headphone; while listening audio book with the buds. The left side buds works but the right side always gives out)
The volume gets higher if you have both of them on, but as soon as you take the right buds out, it drops?!
And the overall volume is low, about mid range versus other headphone or earbuds.
The Sony WI-1000X have ANC, but with only 2 hours of battery. The galaxy bud have no ANC but the battery is 3X more. And the Galaxy buds is also almost 1/3 of it's price. So in comparison is much better than the old Sony buds I had.
Great product.  Much better than my Apple Airpods.

Cons:

My biggest issue with these buds has been call quality. They are absolutely horrendous!  The microphone muffled your voice, all the while picking up every little sound around you. I have found improved performance indoors, but absolutely useless outdoors and in noisy environments like airports. Totally defeats the purpose of why I bough them for.

If you are looking for good buds for listening to your favorite tunes, then these are a good choice. If you’re like me and are also needing to use them for calls, I do not recommend them.

ReviewTitle: Finally a Worthy Wireless from Samsung
ReviewBody: These earbuds are excellent, easy pairing with Samsung S8+ ,small but block out surrounding noises. The audio features on android still work, so you can use you advanced settings and things like concert hall ,to be amp etc.The notifications go though and state what they are ,"messages, etc" and they are small so they actually fit into my ear.I had trouble with the Jabra Elites 65 falling out so I returned them and bought  these.Much better fit and the Galaxy wearable app lets you switch easily between your watch and earbuds on control panel. Wireless charging is cool ,very happy with these.

ReviewTitle: I like everything about this headphones
ReviewBody: Excellent headphones

ReviewTitle: Not Durable: Lasted less than 6 months
ReviewBody: I received a pair as a promo for pre-ordering the Samsung Galaxy S10. Loved the buds in the beginning and sold my Bose Soundsport Free earbuds.  However, after about 5 months the right earbud stopped working or charging. A search found that many others had this issue. Samsung support was no help. Glad I didn't purchase these. I'm not sure if an update caused them to stop working or not.

I can't express how frustrating it is to use these things. The sound quality is good, the passthrough to hear the outside world is decent... Providing you have direct, unobstructed view of your phone from less than three feet away. If I put my phone in my pocket I start getting audio disruption. If I put my phone on the table in front of me and then try to knit--disrupted signal!! Yes, my aluminum knitting needles apparently are enough to disrupt the connection on these things. I can't even count on getting uninterrupted audio while holding my phone *in my hand* when I walk. The mic is also garbage, something I was embarrassed to discover while attempting to conduct a business call. I've attempted all of the recommended troubleshooting techniques and it's never improved. I'm so annoyed at the quality for the price of these things. Unless you plan on using these purely to connect to your phone as it sits on a desk next to you while you do nothing but sit still, avoid these like the plague.

These sound great!  Noise cancelling is ok, not as good as some of the other wired solutions, but pretty dang good.  The touch is simple to use and I like that I can have each ear do a different action.
Love everything but the ambient mode gear icon ambient mode was better
Simply amazing.

ReviewTitle: They are not compatible w iPhone and PC’s
ReviewBody:
Update: I believe the Pc compatibility issue derived from the fact I am using Windows 10. According to what I have been able to find you would have to be using Windows 8 or an earlier version to have compatibility with the Galaxy Ear Buds via your PC Bluetooth connection.

Let’s start with the fact there is no compatibility to a PC via Bluetooth. Regardless if your PC is Bluetooth ready, these may may not pair. They didn’t work with my brand new Dell Latitude 5290 running Windows 10. Hence, if you travel with a laptop or use it to listen to music while working you may be plain out of luck.
Second issue is if you want to use these with an IPhone you may want to reconsider this. I did get sound from them and they did pair. However, there is no supporting app I’m in the apple App Store which means you can’t update firmware unless you go to a store and have them do it. That was Samsung’s work around for this issue. Also all you can do is listen and talk without any of the so called features.

ReviewTitle: Good sound quality and value!  Better than Airpods IMO
ReviewBody: Loved the earbuds.  Perfect for the gym.

Sound quality is great, however there are a few things that are making me return these.

The main thing is these don't stay in my ears at all, no matter which fins and inserts I use. Next, the fact that you can't customize all of the touch gestures is extremely annoying. These two problems led to me trying to push them further into my ear and constantly pausing my music.  I don't have good luck with these type of earbuds fitting properly. I need to use over the ear headphones apparently, I'll try airpods but I'm not holding out too much hope.

Battery life is not great compared to cheaper options I've tried either.

Also, if you are buying these for the ambient sound feature like I did, then maybe keep looking. It didn't work for me at all. Even with voice focus, it only picked up the loudest noises (dropping weights, and gym screamers). My wife who was 3 feet in front of me talking was muted by my music, so any conversation with someone who spoke quietly or had a higher voice was imperceptible unless I was violating their personal space.

I love that they charge with Qi or USB-C. The case is very nice and I don't notice it too much in my pocket.

Bought these out of impulse and can say i'm pretty impressed.

Pros:
1. Excellent sound(for stereo), for ear-pods. I mostly listen to rock and metal, quite satisfied with the sound, the bass mostly.
2. Battery lasts long enough without using the cradle. about 5+ hours at full volume without recharge.
3. Cradle is small enough for carrying in your pocket, about the same volume as Apple airpods.
4. They don't have noise canceling, but the tight seal they form while wearing them seem like they do. Just turn the volume up and you're good to go.

Cons(all of these have pretty simple solutions):
1. Battery doesn't last long enough, would trade a slightly bigger cradle for more than 7 hours of extra battery. (just being picky).
2. The low volume default setting was off-putting at first but managed to solved it.
3. Cradle material feels slightly fragile and cheap, as if i drop them a couple of times, it will crack.

I own QC35, QC20, MDR7506. Tested WH1000XM3, QC35 II. For being a quite small piece of electronic, they do pack a punch. just enough for my taste. Since i like to travel light, they will perfectly substitute my QC20s (hate the wires and the big noise canceling brick) for now.

EDIT 1: A Month In: Work great still, battery lasts as long as its intended. BUT, it bugs me when they are connected to my galaxy S9+ and i open my pc and the connection changes to my pc. I open the blutooth settings, manually disconect the earbuds from the pc and manually conect them to my phone again. WITHIN SECONDS they reconect to my pc again...rinse and repeat till im fed up and have to remove them entirely from my pc. Turning off the pc bluetooth is not an option since i have other devices conected to it. Happens when im in the car too, i start the radio and they instantly disconnect from my phone. Setting the car radio to audio only doesnt seem to fix it.

This is hands down the most comfortable Earbuds I have ever owned. No ear fatigue what so ever and comes with 3 sets of tips for the best possible fit. For something this small, I didn't expect the sound quality to be that great, however its the opposite. Audio quality is one of the best in its category and features a built in equalizer to customization. I can hear the highs and lows very well even when on a call in a noisy environment. Wireless charging case is a great added feature even a quick 10 mins of charging gives me about 40 mins of musics. If you have a Samsung Galaxy S10 variants, you can use the PowerShare feature to charge the case. Love the Find My Earbuds feature which send out an audible sound to direct you to it location(they do want you to find them). Ambient sound to hear your surrounding. Hear your Notifications and customizable touchpad. Samsung has done a great job with these Earbuds and is definitely a must buy if your are in the market for one as they work with Android, iOS and other bluetooth devices.

I'm writing this review for anyone who is thinking of using these headphones with an iPhone. Airpods don't fit in my ears so I needed an alternative. I read that Galaxy buds will work with an iPhone, although you will miss out on some features like Ambient Noise mode, but I was fine with that. I also own a Pixel for work so I knew I could always update the Galaxy buds using that phone.

In general, the headphones are fine. No connectivity issues, they fit well, everything seems to be in working order. Connected to my Pixel, listened to some music, played around with the equalizer in the galaxy bud app, the sound was good for wireless earbuds. Then I connect to my iPhone and start listening to Spotify. The sound was awful. Super loud, tinny  treble, a constant static-y sound in the background, awful sound mixing, overall way too quiet even at max volume. I tried playing around with the equalizer in Spotify and that improved things a bit, but it was still far worse than when listening on an Android device, even without and changes to the equalizer. Obviously whatever audio drivers are installed on the headphones don't work with apple products. I will be returning these if I can.

Never had ear buds like this and I was a little apprehensive at first, but I am glad I made the purchase. All I had to do was charge them when I got them, and pop them in my ears. They linked up to my phone instantly with no issue and I kinda like how you can tap them to get to a new song or pause too. I have only charged them two times since I got them.

I did encounter one flaw.. one day after being in a hot car when I popped them in my ears I heard a slight buzz. I turned them off and heard it again after going back on.  I googled the issue and it seems to happen from time to time...I am guessing it was from the heat.  After going home and taking them out they were fine and I never heard it again.
Estas brutales ,su sonido funciones y comodidad.
Could not use iphone with ear buds. At least not mine. But good sound for music.

ReviewBody: Should have gone with Airpods. More than half my calls the other participants can't hear what I am saying. I'm told it's choppy and distant. The sound quality is fine on calls so long as there isn't a lot ambient noise. Music quality isn't great and you don't get full volume with a Google Pixel 2 (which is a phone problem I believe, but a problem nonetheless). I can barely hear music or podcasts if even a slight breeze kicks up. Definitely would not buy again and wish I had returned them in time.

They should really make ear hooks for these. No matter the size of the wing tip or in ear tips, they always gradually move out my ear. ESPECIALLY my right ear. The Icon X 2018 I believe sounded way better but hurt my ears so bad with the wing tips.

ReviewBody: The sound quality is good cuts out frequently do not get too far from the bluetooth connection leaving the room is too far in my small house... the case needs to be charged frequently even with minimal use.

When I spend over 100 dollars on a pair of headphones, I expect them to work properly, right out of the box.  First my left earbud was dead, now my right earbud can't deliver any audio out of its speaker.  I'm currently running my left earbud's battery into the ground with the intention to re-pair (lol) both earbuds at the same time.  I'm hoping this works and I don't have to drop another 100+ on the Jabra 65t.  This is unacceptable.

ReviewTitle: Does NOT work with Chrome OS
ReviewBody:
They fit well and sound great on my Google Pixel 2 XL phone. But be aware that they will pair with a device only through the Samsung Gear app -- which is why they will NOT work with my Pixel Slate tablet. Although the Slate is a Chrome OS that runs (most) Android apps fine, Google Play tells me that it is not compatible with the Samsung Gear app. When I try to pair the Buds to the Slate directly through the Bluetooth menu, I just see the word "connecting..." cycling endlessly.

A chat with Samsung support confirms that the Buds will connect only through the app, and that there are no plans to make the app compatible with Chrome OS.
My GF loves them.
Reliable, and good quality for the price.

This product is good for music, watching a movie, on YouTube. But NOT good for phone calls. People would always say they couldn't understand what I was saying, distorted. So would not recommend for phone calls ONLY for listening

ReviewTitle: the sound is low and the case is very fragile
ReviewBody: the sound is very low

ReviewTitle: These are great when paired with a Galaxy phone.
ReviewBody:
As a Galaxy phone owner I pulled the trigger on these despite reading some complaints and I am happy to report these are great ear buds. They are very comfortable, the sound is good once you use the right settings, and the battery life is great.

One thing I want to say is that I honestly believe many of the complaints about poor volume and Bass are due to operator error by not using the right settings on your phone. Low volume is easily fixed by enabling "media volume sync" on your phone. As for the bass, I use the Samsung music app. Once I enabled the Dolby Atmos feature it gave my music much richer sound and deeper bass. So the pro tip is use the equalizer on your phone not the buds. Also using the right sized rubber bud fittings is key to good sound. If these aren't in your ear enough just push them in a bit, the difference in sound quality is huge.

One complaint I do have is the ambient noise feature. It amplifies everything a little too much. A light breeze that would normally not be noticeable will sound like constant wind whistling in your ears with the ambient noise feature on. Its very annoying so I leave it disabled.

Other than that these are great buds. I strongly recommend them for Samsung Galaxy phone owners. I have had ZERO connectivity or dropped connection issues that others reported with non Galaxy phones.
Compared to other similar products these are the most comfortable and that’s the most important factor

Overall, I'm definitely pleased with the purchase. Sound quality is beyond expectations and the pairing with my Galaxy S10 is flawless. If the mic was more functional for phone conversations this would for sure be a 5 star review. The mic is definitely the weak point. The mic is functional as long as you're in a quiet space - just don't rely on it and don't buy these if your use case is mostly phone calls.

I use these to play music during my commute to and from work - the noise cancellation and sound quality make them perfect for that function. They're comfortable and provide a more than serviceable musical depth.

At first I was worried about bluetooth stability and audio delay as mention on these reviews. However, with the new update, Samsung has greatly improved its bluetooth connection. Before I had random audio cutout occasionally especially outside but now it is rare to encounter that issue!
Muy bueno la calidad de sonido es increíble como Samsung lo sabe Aser son muy buenos los auriculares realy good and increíble sound like Samsung does it's productos thia earbuds are great

Well looks like I have a new daily pair of headphones. Quality beats out my airpods by far. If you had the previous gen headphones get these they are by far better and the feel amazing in your ear compared to every headphone I've owned.

ReviewTitle: Not a bad attempt, but suffers from some serious flaws.
ReviewBody:
Update 04/06/19: After a 5 mile run today I have chosen to return these. I have used them several times over the past week. When they work they are nice, they work fine if I use them at work or around the house, but if I'm running or hiking they de-sync from each other and stutter CONSTANTLY. They are completely unusable and infuriating. They have been updated by Samsung, but still the connection problems persist. Hopefully Samsung can fix these problems in the future, but until then I'm not happy about paying top shelf prices for a beta test. I'm going back to my $20 Chinese earbuds that actually WORK.

I received my Galaxy Buds last Friday the 29th. I was excited to receive them as  I use earbuds often when working out or just walking around and the $20 set of Chinese earbuds I had been using worked reasonably well but I wanted to splurge a little on some really nice truly wireless earbuds.

Initial thoughts:

Aesthetically they are very nice, they don't hang out of your ears, really it just looks like you are wearing earplugs or something. They fit comfortably in the ears, they come with a variety of rubber parts of various sizes so you can really dial in the fit. Most importantly they sort of "lock in" to your ears. That is a feature that I cannot live without. There's nothing I hate more than earbuds falling out when you are just getting into a run.

I used them around the house over the weekend. Buds in, phone sitting on my desk or sometimes in my pocket and they worked fine. The sound is decent. I'm no audiophile but I've used good earbuds and bad ones and these definitely fall into the good category. The app is great, the charging case is convenient and easy to use, and the ambient sound "enhancement" works surprisingly well.

Now for the downside:

I took the Buds out for a little hike today, nothing serious. Phone in my pocket. At first they worked fine, but as the hike went on they started cutting out intermittently. Sometimes one, sometimes the other, sometimes they were out of sync with each other. I tried disconnecting them, turning bluetooth on and off, even messing with audio settings. I tried holding the phone, putting it in a different pocket, no matter what I tried it would only help the problem for a few seconds at most. By the time I was nearing the end of the trail the earbuds were almost unusable cutting out and stuttering constantly.

I had a similar problem with a pair of the Chinese bluetooth earbuds and I had to return them for a replacement, but now the current pair I have work flawlessly. I'll try the Galaxy Buds again and update my review, but if this continues and the connectivity is really worse than a $20 pair of earbuds I can't recommend these to anyone.
These are awesome,  great for working and walking.  No complaints from people I'm talking to when using them for phone calls.  Music is not amazing but it's good.
Great set of earphones

Wanted to like these badly. Had just returned Air Pods because I have an Android phone and am generally not a fan about Apple products. Loved that these charge via USB C (like all my other devices). They were also comfortable, looked reasonably good, had solid sound quality.

Unfortunately the audio dropped out constantly during my commute walking in a major city. This happened even after updating the software. Any time I put my phone in my pocket and simply wanted to walk with music playing (including tracks that were downloaded to my device) the audio was choppy and cut out constantly. This rendered them useless and so I had to return them.
They stay in your ears well, they sound great, they are way cheaper than most wireless earbuds out there. Love them!

ReviewTitle: Sounds great but connection cut out
ReviewBody: I really enjoyed the galaxy buds when I first got them but after a day of using them it sounded like they were cutting out. Both buds would randomly cut out in the middle of a song and would continue for about 2 minutes until I turned off the buds and reconnected them. I also have a galaxy watch, so I wonder if the simultaneous connection of my phone to my buds and watch may have caused the bad connection. The buds themselves also could've been faulty. Either way I just returned them because it was too big of a problem too soon after I bought them. Otherwise comfort and sound were great. Really disappointed I couldn't keep them.

ReviewTitle: terribly quiet, hard to keep clean
ReviewBody: These are, by far, the hardest to clean earphones I've ever had. They're in-ear, which means that they cause your ears to produce more ear wax than usual and all that earwax gets stuck in a non-removable filter that protects the speakers, making headphone sound terribly and extremely quet.
Right side wouldn't charge or connect.  Left side was very static.

ReviewTitle: Very comfortable and great sounding earbuds.
ReviewBody: Music and voice quality are great for the size of these earbuds. I have no trouble with them falling out of my ears while jogging and exercising.  When used during calls, people have no problem hearing me clearly.  Can't beat the price for the quality.

This is my first set of wireless headphones. I got them with a bundle package for preordering the Samaung Galaxy Note 10+5G. These headphones are amazing! They sound great and fit well in my ears, no falling out and so far no ear fatigue. The wireless charging is a great feature. The different colors are a bonus and I'm so glad they came out with the silver ones that match the Aura Glow! I highly recommend this set if it's your first time getting wireless headphones.

I love them. Works perfect for day to day life. Minnesota is starting hands free law while driving Aug 1st. It's also nice you can wear only one if you want to and the other will stay off. I would recommend to others.

If you want these for phone conversations, get something else. I returned skullcandy Indy for these (skullcandy Indy's dropped bluetooth about every 10 minutes), and the mic quality of these is a 1 out of 10. Everything else seems ok. Only had em a few days.

ReviewTitle: Audio dropouts on two pairs, disappointing product
ReviewBody: Constant audio drop outs. Connected to my Galaxy S9+ and they work perfectly unless I want to put my phone in my pocket.  Then the ear buds are basically useless. I updated everything, worked with Samsung support, exchanged them for a second pair, no improvement. I've used several other types of Bluetooth headsets/ear buds with this phone and never had anything close to this problem. What a pitiful showing on Samsung's part.

Easy to pair, sound is awesome, noise cancelling is great too, if you are listening to something you cannot really hear anything from outside. They perfectly fit my ears (I didn't have to use any of the extra eartips). I have a galaxy S10, and an iPad and the earbuds work great with both! I have to give it a little longer to try the battery life, but so far so good!

ReviewTitle: Terrible streaming from Gear S3 watch
ReviewBody: This is my 3rd set of wireless earbuds (the other two were in the $30 range) and by far the worst. Pretty disappointed considering the price disparity. My main reason for having wireless buds is for listening to Spotify streaming my gear s3 while jogging so I can leave my bulky Note 9 at home. These headphones were useless for that. They constantly cut out to the point I just run home to get my phone & stay aggravated the entire run. I verified everything was updated with the most current software, so that's not the issue. I didn't have this problem in the past so ordered a pair of cheap ones (Dudios, fyi) and haven't had an issue since. Definitely returning these Samsung buds. Terrible product if you're planning to stream from your watch.
I use to play fortnite good sound quality

The fit of the earbuds is suprisingly very good ... right out of the box.  Didn't have the fiddle with the different rubber pieces.  The buds require an samsung wearable app to connect with.  Now the app is supposed to allow notifications, but I'm finding it causes the play back to pause and then resume.  My other earphone dinged for me.  I've read this may be an android 10 compatiability issue ... either way, that side of the product is less than awesome (and required to function).

The sound quality is fine for me ... however I do hear echos in play back from time to time or delay from one earpud to the other.  For what I'm using them for, they work fine.  I enjoy not having the cord on my neck from my old phones ... it would grab and pull one bud out.

After using Bose Sound Sport True wireless, I must say the sound quality of the Samsung buds is not great. However they are very comfortable and will stay in your ear. Battery life is good. They work very will with my Samsung Galaxy Note 8 but the touch volume feature is not available when paired with my iphone 7.

Pros:
-seamless connectivity with my Note 9 running One UI
-Wireless charging
-Small form factor
-No "master bud" trait (where one bud is dominant, and if it dies the other one can't be used)

Not really a con, the sound quality is better than the airpods (first gen at this time), but not quite as rich as the Bose Sound Sports.  But the Bose make me feel like I'm wearing satellite dishes, and I haven't finished playing with my eq setting for the Samsung's yet.

Edit: After about a week of tweaking eq settings and trying different ear-tips and wings, these buds sound just as good as the Bose' if not better.

I lost my first pair of these in an uber about three days after getting them and immediately purchased another pair, even at the $100 price point - they are by far the most comfortable wireless earbuds I've owned. They are not too big or too hard, and also feel very secure in my ears. The sound is very clear, and the controls are easy to use. I appreciate the chime sound they make when you put them in your ears.
